111321111111111111.content:
“All right, we will go around for now,” replied Jane, much to Lilies’ delight. Mara on the other hand, judging from her shocked expression, was not as thrilled from this outcome.

“Shouldn't we follow our best lead … ,” Mara began to chide, before being interrupted from a swift finger to her mouth.

“Keyword Mara, for now,” Jane reiterated. “We will check the safer way first, and if we don't find her there we can always try that direction next.”

“But what if this slime king captured her, she might be in serious danger,” Mara countered.

“All the more reason to not head the same direction she did if she got captured. If she got caught the path is mostly likely a booby trapped,” defended Jane. “ I know you want to help find the girl, but you cant act with such reckless abandon.”

“I guess thats true,” Mara conceited in a low tone. She hadn't really thought about the risk of rushing in, as she was more focused on finding the lost sister then their own safety. Realizing how inexperienced she must have sounded to Jane, she started to feel a bit self conscious.

This internal conflict went unnoticed by Jane, who was busy trying to map out their new path. Making a completely safe path through the woods was challenging, as she could only get small bits of the forrest’s layout from limited information that Lily knew. The slime girl knew that the other path lead straight towards the king’s lair which they would try to avoid for now. She also provided more good insight about some deadly predators that lurked to the East and some more of those addictive trees to the South. It would seem the only direction to head towards was a northern path, so on that note they started to head out.

A couple strides later they could no longer see the blue shimmering lake through the heavy tree line. Said tree line also prevented much light from reaching the bottom layer of the woods, creating a creepy tone to the path. The eerie atmosphere was only enhanced by the small amount of creatures that lived in this part of the woods, only running into a family of squirrels that enamored Lily for a couple minutes. Mara went back to asking Jane about her own past adventures, partially trying to ignore the ominous environment but also wanting to improve her own skills from hearing about Jane’s past experiences.

That all changed when the group heard a loud scream in the distance. Jane, ready for trouble as ever, quickly drew her weapons out and started scanning the area. Lily on the other hand, quickly turned back into a puddle of slime out of fear of what was going on.

“Was that Astra?” Mara exclaimed, dripping with worry. Astra seemed tough enough to be able to survive on the woods by herself, but maybe she ran into this slime king or something even deadly.

“No, her house was back that way,” assured Jane, who was pointing her thumb behind them. “The scream seemed to have come from up ahead.”

“Then what are we waiting for,” Mara exclaimed, gathering out her own equipment. After pulling out her staff she started to run to the origin of the scream.

“Mara wait,” Jane yelled, but it was already too late. The elf girl was already yards ahead of the group, much to Jane’s dismay. She knew Mara was the type of person who would rush to others aid, but out here that can easily lead to danger if you are not careful. With a sigh she turned to the small pond that was her other companion and started poking it with one of the ends of her bow. “Come on Lily, we have to go make sure she doesn't get into trouble.”

A good distance ahead of them, Mara continued her fast pace in the jungle. While normally she would not be so rash in her decisions, she was too distracted out of concern for the woman in question. Not only that but a nagging worry in her head was starting to get more vocal. Jane seemed like a such a hardened adventurer, while she had never been on an adventure before. The elf’s mind started to betray her with thoughts of Jane wanting to leave the inexperienced girl, as she would just weight the mighty rogue down. Mara wanted to prove to the Jane, she could be a capable assist to her quest.

After some running, Mara could hear a faint cry for help nearby. The voice seemed to be coming from around the next bend, pushing the girl to increase her speed. After turning around the corner….

1113211111111111111.content:
As Mara rounded the corner, she could finally see where the sounds had been coming from. Just ahead of her laid a passed out girl, who seemed to have collapsed mid way through a bush. The upper part of her body was the only part only visible to elf, giving not a lot of information about the girl in question.

The fallen woman seemed to be wearing commoner’s clothes though a little torn, suggesting she was from one of the towns nearby. There were no weapons nearby, so unless they were still hidden in the bush, it seemed unlikely that they were an adventurer of some kind. Besides the Emerald hair the woman was striking, she seemed to be a typical villager. None of that mattered to Mara of course, who quickly went to try to shake the girl from her slumber.

“Hey Hey, miss are you okay?” babbled the elf, hoping she wasn't too late to save the girl. After a couple shakes, fear was starting to creep in Mara as she was yet to get any type of response from the victim. Deciding she couldn't put it off any longer, she went for the girls hands to check for any sort of pulse.

As soon as Mara was about to touch the girl, life seemed to spring back into the body as Mara found her arms quickly locked by two strong hands. Before she could even react, the elf found herself being pulled into the bush that the girl was partially laying in. As the mage quickly found herself being detained by roots, she was having second thoughts about being so impatient. After a few seconds, Mara was in the center of whatever she was just pulled into. She proceeded to get holstered up, bound in a star shaped form, giving her a better view of the situation of hand.

The first detail she noticed was the victim, or more accurately her captor, staring at her full of glee, like a little girl who just found a new toy. Now after getting a better look at her it was clear that she was no mere villager, as her skin was completely lime green. Not only that, but now that her lower half was no longer obstructed by the bush, it was clear that her lower body was the bush. Despite her bizarre features, the creature was absolutely gorgeous, with striking dark green eyes, smooth skin, and ample breasts. Mara got so memorized from checking the creature out, she didn't notice the girl start to move towards her.

“Well well well, looks like I found a perfect toy for me to play with” the creature seductively stated, as she slowly approached the elf. As she advanced towards Mara, parts of the bush started to flow towards the creature. The mass of bush slowly started to transform into a human shaped bottom half for the creature. It would seem the creature took way too much mass to form her new lower half as it was very thick, though this could have easily been intentional.

Realizing that the situation was quickly getting out of hand, Mara was about to scream for help but was interrupted by the bush girl gagging her with what looked like a berry. Mara tried to force it out with her tongue, but the berry grew vines to latch itself to her face. A couple seconds after the berry gag secured itself, it started pumping out gas down her throat. After a few hits of the gas Mara was starting to have a hard time concentrating.

“Where are my manors I haven't even told you my name. My name is Rose,” the monster stated, growing a few roses in her outfit as if to make a point. “You my dear are a lucky girl indeed, you get to be my new pet!”

Mara could barely hear what Rose was saying at this point as the second effect of the gas was activating. A strong desire was inching all over her body which desperately needed release. Since she was completely bound at this point however, all she could do was moan in frustration and give a pleading look to her capture.

“Dam that was fast,” boasted Rose, as she examined Mara, “ My newest batch is definitely a huge success so far.” She began to start groping Mara’s body to size her up, only continuing to torment the poor girl.

“Please….” Mara tried to mumble though the gag. At this point she wasn't even asking to be let go, she just needed release from all this lust.

“Be patient my dear we will have our fun,” reassured Rose. “As long as you follow my instructions and please me you will get rewarded. Your assets are still a little small for my taste however, we will have to fix that when we get to my place. Maybe we can make a fun game out of it pet, would you like that?”

Mara nodded her head , earning her a reward by Rose’s skilled finger work. Euphoria overwhelmed the mage for a couple seconds, who let out a mini spasm form the release of all that pressure. The relief was short lived sadly, as Rose quickly removed her fingers while the gas continued to be pumped. Soon Mara was back to groaning in frustration.

“Already so greedy pet,” Rose teased, as her body shifted into a more mobile form. “Follow my commands and there is more where that came from. Let us get out of here pet, when we get to my place the real fun can begin.”

111321111111112.content:
Dawn filtered in through the forest canopy, shining a radiant orange into the bedroom's easternmost window. Mara, as the elf she was, awoke first. The restful night's sleep came as a pleasant change of pace from the past week or so of uncertainty. Warmth filled her whole self. Though the origin of this warmth soon revealed itself as a soft tummy pressed against her back.

Jane's sawing snore only confirmed Mara's suspicions. The rogue began spooning her some time during the night. Not surprising, considering Astra only owned a single bed. A gentle smile spread across her lips, and after brushing a stand of crimson hair from her face, the elf craned her neck back to see the slumbering rogue. Jane's bobbed, raven hair lay in a tousled mess across most of her face, but Mara still saw the slight trickle of drool along the human woman's pillowy lips.

In fact, Mara enjoyed the embrace. Her new friend's company assured them both of a comfortable rest. Yet, Mara's smile faded as thoughts of the trials ahead sank in. The lair of the Lipomancer was renowned as dangerous. This would likely be the last bed they slept in for some time. Clearing her throat, Mara gently shook the arm Jane draped across the elf's chest.

“Bwuh?” Jane groggily shifted, rubbing her eyes sleepily. After wrinkling her nose, she realised her position and scrambled over in bed. “My bad, Mara,” the rogue grumbled and ran her fingers through her hair. Jane slid off the other side of the bed, wiggling her toes as she stretched.

“You know, you are quite cute when you sleep,” Mara mused, rising to her own side of the bed. She quickly tied up her hair in a ponytail. “Do you think Astra is awake yet?”

Jane shrugged lightly and pulled on her leathers. “Don't know. She did promise to help us,” Jane said, fastening her utility belt. Mara tied up her tunic, and with a wave of her hand, her enchanted staff slowly glided across the room into her waiting hand. Jane opened the room's door with a creak, and inhaled the scent of a hearty breakfast. “Mmm, seems she's expecting us. Last one there gets to clean up the dishes!” Jane laughed and dashed toward the living and dining area.

Three steaming plates lay set at the modest, wood table. Each carried abundant servings of crispy bacon, cheesy eggs, and buttery toast. A small bowl of freshly-picked berries accompanied each plate. Jane licked her lips as a low growl gurgled up from the depths of her paunch. She heard a rumbling reply film behind as Mara entered the main room.

“Glad to hear you've brought your appetites,” Astra beamed as she entered from the kitchen. “I may not fight as well as you two, but I cook as well as I build.” While drying her hands on a dish towel, the hostess motioned for them to sit. Jane eagerly zipped into the closest chair, flashing Mara a mischievous grin. The mage curled her lips to the side, faced into the kitchen, and conjured an unseen servant to tackle the small mound of dirty pots and pans. “Oh! How thoughtful, thank you.” Astra bowed her head before joining Jane at the table.

“No need to thank me, Miss Astra,” Mara lifted her chin in feigned grandeur, “we ought to set out soon after we dine. Any expedience only aids in our quest.” With that said, another growl rose from her plush middle, and Mara hurried to her seat in embarrassment.

The trio ate quietly, and the unseen servant finished tidying up the dishes and even dusted the hall by the time they were ready to depart. With rations packed, they set out into the mid-morning light. Thankfully the forest remained cool beneath the shaded canopy. As they traveled they each shared tales from their childhoods, but by noon, they came upon a broad clearing.

“Here,” Astra paused and reached into her backpack, “I hoped to use these if I ever found my sister out here, but I think they will serve you better.” From within, the guide produced a pair of amulets on chains, each crafted in the shape of a simple face. Mara smiled and accepted the gift, but Jane, ever the skeptic, placed a gloved hand on the elf's forearm before she could raise it over her head.

“What are these?” Jane asked as she dangled the amulet before her. Astra smiled warmly.

“Sending Stones. If you grasp it and imagine the face of whomever wears the twin amulet, you may send them one message of up to thirty words,” she explained. Resting a hand on her hip, she stretched forth her other strong arm and pointed across the clearing. “Beyond the tree-line you'll find an entrance surrounded by pools of that lovely sap,” she mentioned with more than a little bitterness in her voice. A light slap to her flabby middle emphasised her point. “Don't worry, some of that special fruit was mixed in with the berries, you haven't anything to fear.”

Jane nodded and looped the chain over her head, letting the amulet fall to her chest. “We can't thank you enough, Astra.” Jane extended a hand toward their guide.

“Find my sister,” the buxom builder replied, clapping her palm into a firm handshake, “that's all the thanks I need.”

“May the forest protect us,” Mara spoke with bowed head, “All of us.” Her silvery eyes met Astra's, and with that the two left their guide and struck out into the clearing.

Aside from breaking a sweat frustratingly early, the pair made good time teaching the second tree-line. That is, until they were ambushed.

“Seize them!” A dozen men and women in bronze boar masks descended upon the hapless adventurers. Whirling about, Jane drew her daggers and widened her stance, sending her belly wobbling just slightly. However, the duo's increased girth didn't slow them down enough to be subdued easily.

“Begone, vile fiends!” Mara shouted and slammed her staff into the ground, blasting back four of the assailants. One crashed into a tree, crumpling into a heap.

Jane wasted no time in engaging several others, slashing her dagger across one arm, and burying the second into another cultist's thigh. The masked man howled and fell back as the others converged. “That all you got, freaks?!” She snarled. Even with the women's impressive skill, the number of foes proved too much. One of the masked women at the rear brought out a blowgun and fired a dart at Mara's back.

“Yowch!” She squeaked, hopping up. Jane rushed to her friend's side, arms wide defensively. Mara dropped a hand to Jane's shoulder, trying to steady herself. “Jane… I--” but before she finished, Mara collapsed to the grassy forest floor. Jane stood over her friend, uncertain what to do next.

111322222.content:
Mara was barely aware of anything around her other than the deep, black void of unconsciousness. Slowly, she began to hear something creeping into the fuzzy darkness of her perception. Her mind fumbled, grasping at the noise in order to identify it like a blind man might do with an object he’s unfamiliar with. Cutting… clawing… scraping?

Mara forced her eyes open, even though they desperately desired not to. Most of her reluctance to awaken was likely due to the overwhelming sense of fatigue that now filled her body for some reason, but perhaps she was afraid she’d find out just where that scraping was coming from. Unfortunately, once her eyes adjusted to the dim light from a candle on the nearby table, the first thing she saw was this fear becoming realized right before her.

Across the room sat a man, a large, hunched man leaning over something he held in his clutches. The figure was obscured both by the shadows of the corner he sat in and his choice of attire. The scraping thing across the room was draped in a long, dark overcoat, covered in stitching and mildew showing the obvious signs of aging and abuse the garment had been through. The hat that it wore shrouding its faced hadn't fared much better, the brim littered with holes and the basket so beaten and worn that it was difficult for Mara to identify it as a top hat, much like those the nobility sometimes were keen to wear around these parts. As the man looked up at the elf, however, she could immediately tell his clothes were perhaps the least frightening aspect of him.

“Oh, you are awake then,” He said, his voice gravelly and course, sounding almost more like a hand sifting through broken glass than natural speech, “I was wondering when you might do that, but I cannot blame you after the things you have been through.”

The thing across the room leaned forward now, further into the light, and Mara saw what looked like a canine of sorts. After a few more moments, she was able to identify this particular form of animal man as a hyena, though much like his clothes and voice, his body seemed… off somehow. His fur looked patchy and musty, almost more so than his jacket, and even from what she could see that wasn't covered with clothing it looked like there was something wrong with how that fur settled on him. His pelt appeared lumpy and misshapen, as though he was afflicted with some kind of disease. Then there were his eyes, his strange, blue eyes. The more she looked at them, the more they seemed… odd somehow, as though they were askew, or perhaps slightly too large or too small.

“What is wrong with you then girl?” It muttered before leaning back into the shadows, cloaking himself once again in shade, “Can you not talk, or has your tongue become as swollen with fat as the rest of you?”

“F-Fat…?” Mara whispered, pushing herself up from the bed she was lying on. Oddly, she found it harder than it normally would have been, reminding her of the mornings she would wake up at the inn at Little Silverhorne, when she was captured and ballooning with new weight each passing day.

“Yes, fat…” The hyena said, a wide grin peeling across its lips, “How does it feel little elf? So different, I am sure. You elves are always such tiny creatures. Not you though, no, no, not you…” It chuckled, the laughter reminding Mara of an out-of-tune harp her parents had owned once long ago.

“N-No… no! This can’t be happening...” Mara said as she finally pulled her bulky body into a sitting position, flabby belly rolls spilling over her lap from a tear in her dress. The elf then drew her attention away from her stomach and the scraping man, noticing for the first time the large mirror that spanned the wall across from her, almost from the corner to the door. The same kind of mirror that was in the “fattest woman” room. Seeing her whole body now, Mara’s heart sunk, realizing that the tubby elf mage in the mirror was almost unrecognizable. While the poor elf might have passed as chubby before arriving at the fairgrounds, she was now undeniably fat, obese even, “I was already so fat before! How could I get so HUGE!” She cried, grabbing at the exposed flesh of her stomach and wincing as how soft and heavy it felt in her plump fingers.

“Frightening,” The hyena said, his grin only widening, “Yes, I am sure that is one way it feels. Very, very frightening. Changes like this can be so frightening, can they not? Especially when they are so hard to reverse… the change becomes almost permanent even. The more and more you fatten, the harder and harder it is to stop, and it is very frightening. Unfortunate for you then, I feel. You have only just begun your change. After all, you can still move.”

Mara let go of her stomach and looked back at the man across the room, “Don’t say that… Why would you say that? You’re the one who did this? You're responsible for this spell?”

The thing chuckled again before returning his attention to what he held in his paws. Mara could now see that it looked like a wooden board of some sort, and that the man was carving something into it with its claws, “Mmmmm, yes. I suppose you could say that, yes.”

“But… how does that make sense?” Mara said, remembering what she had experienced before she had passed out, “There was a woman’s voice… a horrible scream, it all seemed like it was… like it was some kind of ghost,” Mara frowned as she looked at the stone floor, recalling her teachings from when she was being trained at the mage academy, “Necromancy. You’re a necromancer.” She said, the thought of such forbidden things sending chills through her as though her veins were flowing with ice water.

“Is that how it appeared to you, silly little elf?” The man said, laughing even more to himself as he continued to carve, “I can assure you I am no necromancer. It is not within my nature to perform such wretched things. Not things like that, at least.”

This explanation only made Mara’s skin crawl even more, “But then… how?” she asked, her voice barely a whisper but growing louder as she remembered her friend, "And what about Jane? Where is she?!"

The hyena looked away from his plank and directly into her eyes, and Mara couldn’t help but break eye contact immediately with him, the brief glance they shared enough to make her regret even asking him, “Foolish, dumb, little elf. Why would I ever tell you that? Maybe you should ask me another question, do you not think?”

“W-What question…?” Mara whimpered, her eyes fixated on the floor where they would not meet with anything too horrendous.

“’Why?’”

Mara thought to herself for a moment, before parroting the man, “Why?”

“Why not?” He said, smiling, and for a moment Mara was less afraid of the hyena than she was frustrated with it, “Why should you be thin instead of fat? Is there something wrong with it?”

“Yes!” She snapped, glaring at the hyena’s boots, its footwear just as disheveled as the rest of him, “Normally not… sure, but it’s wrong when I don’t want to be fat. It’s wrong when I become so fat I can barely move my body! When I’m so heavy that it starts to weaken my health! So yes, it’s wrong!”

Setting aside his carving, the hyena stood up, his movements stiff and forced as he shambled towards Mara slowly, “Only because you do not understand…” He said as he drew nearer and nearer to the terrified elf.

“Stay b-back!” Mara said, pushing her fat ass across the bed and away from the shuffling hyena man, only too aware of how much her bulk made her sink into the plush mattress as the rolls of fat on her back pressed against the wall behind her. The elf mage screamed as she realized she was cornered by the still-approaching figure before her, every monstrous detail of his body only growing clearer as he filled her vision. The mage pulled herself together fast however, survival instincts taking over as she murmured an incantation and her fingers tingled, flames leaping alive in her palms to enshroud her chubby hands, “Come any closer you horrible bastard and I’ll turn you into a stinking pile of ash and rags!”

The hyena let out even more of that filthy, broken laughter again, but he obeyed, stopping just before the large bed the elf was curled up on, “Ah yes… magic. I had almost forgotten that, it complicates things does it not? There is no need for violence. I merely wish to enlighten you, fool elf. It would make what your body must endure less miserable if your mind knew why it must be such…”

“No, you're going to listen to me now!” Mara hissed at her captor, the flames only growing brighter in her palms, “And I am not going to gain another inch of fat, how’s that for ‘enlightenment’?!”

The mage had been forced to use her powers in combat before, but she had been lucky enough to never find herself in a situation necessitating her to kill someone. Now though, it seemed as though there were no other options, but Mara gave the animal man one last chance, “Please… You do NOT want to tempt me, let me and my friend out of here now or I will force my own way out, especially if that means going through you to do it.”

The hyena grinned and shook its head, “I am sorry, but I will not let you leave.” He said, “As I told you before however, I can make everything very muc-“

Mara wasted no more time, worried that if she continued to let him talk, the hyena would try and attack her. The flames she held in her palms roared higher into the air before she flung them towards her captor, the spot where he was standing immediately becoming consumed in a tremendous fireball. Mara shouted in shock as her own blast threw her heavy body against the wall, causing the planks to creak as she slid down them and fell against the bed. She panted heavily now as she watched the flames burn, the already powerful and destructive spell having drained her even more than it normally would thanks to the effect all the burdensome fat had on her body.

As the flames and smoke cleared however, Mara realized that the only remains of the hyena seemed to be a round scorch mark on the floor, “Wait…” She said, sliding off the bed and getting shakily to her feet, “The spell wasn’t that strong… it's not supposed to be like that!“

As soon as she had stood up, she looked towards the corner where the hyena’s chair was and saw him leaping up and reaching for her neck. Her screams of terror and surprise died in her throat as the hyena wrapped his clawed fingers tightly about it, his paws leathery and rough as they squeezed against her windpipe, “Look at me.” He growled, as though forcing the words from his mouth.

Mara knew she shouldn’t, that she had to ignore his commands, but as she refused the hyena’s grip tightened and she complied. As she looked into the thing’s horrible, piercing gaze, she saw not the blue, relatively normal irises she had glimpsed before. Instead the ones that leered back at her were huge, distended far more than any man or beast’s she’d ever seen and the pupil within them dilated to a ridiculous degree. The color of its eyes not blue but a raw, vibrant purple now. As Mara continued to look into those strange, violet pits she could feel all thought slowly leave her besides the dull and ever-present terror that the hyena’s presence seemed to fill her with.

“You will listen to me, elf girl,” It hissed softly to her, his tight, strangling grip loosening. Instead those strange, horrible rough paws began to stroke Mara’s fat cheeks, “And you will not use your magic again… do you understand now?”

“P-Please…” Mara whispered, unable to look away from the creature’s gaze, “Please… just let go of me…”

“I already have,” The hyena said, smiling as he held up his hands. Mara gasped as she tore her eyes free from his, panting heavily as she caught her breath and fell back onto the bed, “Good… You will behave now I hope? I do not wish to be cruel like that, but I was left with no other option...”

Mara returned her eyes to the floor again, but nodded in compliance.

“Yes, very good,” the Hyena said, smiling as he once more sat down in the chair across the room.

“Are you going to tell me why the hell you’re doing all this then?” Mara said, rubbing her throat.

The hyena was already back to his carving, the scraping sound once more filling the room, before he answered, “No… I will not. That information is not useful to you in your current situation little elf. No, instead I will tell you something you will find much more helpful. Why you should want to do this… and why it is in your best interests…”

Mara glanced up at the hyena, seeing that his face was once more obscured by the brim of his hat, “I really doubt there’s anything you can say that would make me, or anyone agree with that. What could you possibly say that would make me want to become a giant ball of lard?!”

“Because the goddess wills it…” the hyena continued, its voice suddenly sounding like it was filled with what Mara could only assume was something close to adoration, “The goddess desires all to be this way, all to be like what you will become. You should take pride that you are fulfilling an ideal that my kin and I cannot.”

“That is of little comfort to me, you wretched man…” Mara spat at him, “What kind of goddess would something as terrible as you worship anyways? One of death? Of madness? Of chaos?”

“Of life…” The hyena said, grinning, “Of all that lives, and all that is beautiful about life. Tell me, my dear elf, even one as stupid as you has heard of Lady Yewthorn, yes?”

“I… I have, yes,” Mara said, frowning a little, “She’s just a boogeyman though. A silly tale told to scare young children from straying into the woods… and to warn those who are too gluttonous of attracting her attentions…”

“Yes...” The man nodded, “For she desires life. More you means more life. More fat means more you, does it not?”

Mara sat still for a moment, not fully understanding what she was being told by this strange monster, “But she’s just a dumb fairy tale! This… all of this is just nonsense!”

“Not everyone calls her that, of course. She has many, many names, though none are the true one. The closest your kind can come, perhaps, is a common one used in the east, Y'go-Shg they cal-“

“I don’t care!” Mara said, holding up her hands, “Whatever designs you or your ‘goddess’, or whoever have for me… there’s no way you’ll ever be able to convince me to go along with them!”

The hyena licked its lips just then, its pale tongue’s color bringing back ill memories of the creature’s violet eyes.

“The Lipomancer, then.”

“The… The Lipomancer?” Mara said, shivering as she once more felt an unpleasant rush of discomfort from this thing’s words, “What’s that?”

“Do not play stupid with me girl…” The monster growled, anger, or something like it, filling his voice, “You do not need to pretend for that, we both know. We both know as well that you and the rogue seek the Lipomancer, his lair, his treasure.”

“Wait... How could you tell that she was a rogue?” Mara said, looking up at the man across the room.

The hyena man only chuckled before he continued, “If you would not listen before, then listen to me now elf girl. I want the same as you. I want to see the Lipomancer for myself. To seek an audience with a powerful sorcerer such as he however, I need something to offer.”

Mara felt like she knew where this was going, but asked anyways, “And what would that be?”

“Two very fat, very foolish young women. So here is my bargain, stupid elf: Play along with my plan, the goddess’s plan, and once it is through the two of you will be delivered safely and soundly into the very heart of the Lipomancer’s stronghold. Do you agree?”

“Again, why would I agree to something like that? You’re asking me if I’ll agree to not only let you fatten me up until I literally can’t move, but to let you do the same to somebody else. That’s insane!”

“Very well…” The hyena said as he stood up once again, still holding the carving he was working on in his paws. The creature growled softly to himself as he spun the plank about in his claws before he glanced at Mara, long enough so that she could catch another glimpse at those unnerving eyes, “I can ask the other girl as well, if you agree… in any case, I can see that you need more time… to consider. I will let you think, girl, but please do think. You may not be able to choose if you wish to gain or not, but you can choose if it will be easy for you and your friend… or decidedly forced.”

The elf girl wanted to say something, wanted to further voice her objections to her captivity or ask the man questions, but she found her words caught in her throat. She sighed in defeat and slumped back on the bed, causing it to creak and groan as the hyena left the room, locking the door behind him. Mara stared at the ceiling as she laid in the bed, trying to think her current dilemmas over, trying to think of a way out of this place. She could only try however, as her thoughts were shattered by a loud thudding coming from the other side of the mirror, and Mara knew it could only be the hyena hammering that damnable plank above its frame. The mage could only catch a glimpse of the sign as the hyena was twirling it about earlier, but it was enough for her to see what it said, her stomach sinking as she merely thought of the words:

“Fattest Elf”
1113222221.title: "Enlightened"

She waits for an opportunity to show itself, at least getting one night's sleep.
11132222211.content:
Jane gripped her head in her hand, fingers rubbing her temple and her boots scraping against the floor as she woke up. She groaned as she uneasily pulled herself into a sitting position, her mind tumbling with memories she’d have rather forgotten as her now fat belly poured over her lap. She gripped the large, rounded orb, grunting in shame as she hefted and dropped it only to feel it jiggle. Looking up at the entrance to the room though, she was momentarily filled with hope as she remembered Mara’s attempt to rescue her, but found that hope immediately dashed when she saw the door was once again closed, and most likely locked. Jane could find no trace of the elf girl anywhere.

“Gods, how could I have let this happen…?” She hissed at herself, pudgy fingers continuously rubbing across and massaging her fat, tender gut as the rogue was beginning to realize just how much more of it there was. She forced herself to stop, pulling her hands away, the tubby girl hoping it would delay her understanding of how fat she had become and of how much she had screwed up her journey already, “I’m such a moron… shit! You’re going up against a guy called ‘The Lipomancer’, you should have realized a room marked ‘fattest woman’ would be a godsdamned trap!”

The rogue cringed as her eyes wandered over to the large “mirror” across the room from her, and the reflection that looked back. All that weight the thief had gained while stuffing herself at the inn had been bad enough, but that was nothing compared to what Jane had been through now. She was a complete and utter porker at this point, almost 800 pounds of blubber sitting on her fat, fleshy ass that spread over the cold stone floor while her heavy, sagging gut did the same before her. Sitting atop the avalanche of fat that was now her belly were her breasts, still managing to remain round and shapely even as they sunk into her soft belly rolls and strained the simple black bra she wore. The rogue lifted her arms up to her face, her breath quickening with shock as she saw not only how much fat hung and wobbled from them, but also at the sight of her sausage-like fingers; the plump digits seeming barely able to grasp a lock picking set at this point, let alone handle them with the finesse she had trained years to earn. This thought also brought Jane’s mind to her thighs now, and while much of them were obscured by her immense belly, she knew by the look of the fat rolls swaddling her legs that they must be huge… there was no way she’d ever be able to run or sneak like she used to.

“How could you let this happen Jane!” She thought to herself, clenching her teeth as she struggled to hold back tears, “You might have figured putting on some pounds was a risk with this mission, but to be put out of the game so early? You’ll never be able to lose all this weight! You’ll never be able to pull off another heist ever again! You’re a whale, a completely useless, lardass WHALE and you’ll be stuck like that for the rest of your life! Then again, maybe you deserve it for fucking everything up as quickly as you did, for what your stupidity cost not just you, but Mara too…”

Where was the elf girl now? Captured just like her? Jane tried not to think about it and instead ground her teeth hard against each other. Her rage at herself welled up through the tears in her eyes and a roar bubbling up her throat before she let out a scream roiling with her loathing and despair. She clenched one of her fists in frustration, raising it only to strike it uselessly against the floor, pain smacking through her chubby hand as she heard something rattling on the nearby table.

Sniffling a bit and wiping the tears from her plump cheeks with flabby arms, the rogue forced herself to stand, unable to ignore how much effort such an easy task took now. She wobbled a bit on her feet, gut swaying as she found her balance, and looked over to the table curiously. What she saw made her heart sink, but didn’t surprise her.

Lying on the table were piles and piles of sweets and desserts, each large platter of food seemingly calculated to hold as many fattening and unhealthy treats as could fit upon them. Whole cakes sat stacked atop one another, mounds of éclairs and cookies rolled over each other to create mountains of junk food, and cupcakes and sweet tarts were arranged in monolithic pyramids that made their number uncountable. There was so much food that the surface of the large dining room table could barely be seen beneath it all, save for one spot cleared in front of the sole, sturdily built chair that was seated before it. As Jane looked closer, she saw the space was occupied only by a plate with a single cake slice and fork lying plunged atop it, and a note that merely said, “Eat.”

Jane suddenly felt cold as sweat began to roll across the curves of her obese body, unable to look at the food in disgust but at the same time slowly becoming aware of the hunger that was starting to fill her fat, gluttonous belly. Even though she was already massively, morbidly obese at this point, it seemed clear that somebody wanted Jane to get even fatter, a thought that made her feel sick in her guts. The rogue once more remembered the words “fattest woman” that hung outside of her room, and realized that whoever or whatever had trapped her here, it was taking those words very seriously.

“But why should you be so appalled?” She thought now as she glanced at the food, “Why does it matter Jane? It does not, does it?”

“I guess not,” Jane mumbled to herself quietly as she lumbered closer to the chair.

“You’re already so fat anyways, are you not? One bite is not going to matter.”

“One bite…” Jane sighed as she pulled the chair out and sat down on it, her almost bare buttocks spilling over the seat and causing it to creak beneath her weight.

“You deserve it anyways, do you not? For getting into such a mess, for what you let happen to your friend? Yes, you deserve a bite or two, maybe a cake, maybe all of it you fat hog…”

“M-Maybe…” Jane whimpered as she picked up the fork and scooped a chunk of cake past her plump lips, “Maybe all of it…”





Mara laid in her bed, but she didn’t sleep at first, her mind was too busy for that. The events at the fair, the things the hyena had told her, and the reasons behind their captivity all swirled through her thoughts like a maelstrom. She tossed and turned on the mattress, not because it was uncomfortable but simply because she was too plagued by the anxiety and despair brought on by her predicament.

As she curled herself up for what felt like the hundredth time that night, Mara was beginning to think of something else with a little more hope behind it: An escape plan. The door looked sturdy enough, but Mara felt she could break it down anyways, especially with a spell or two. She would likely need to do the same for Jane’s room as well though, which could be dangerous, but there was likely no way she’d be able to go for the keys again. Still, the elf was getting tired and perhaps it might be a good idea to rest. She’d need all the energy she could get if she was going to make a break for it, especially if she was going to use magic to do so…
11132222211.title: First Night at the Freak Show... or the Last?

choices: "I-I suppose..."
"No! You're lying!"
111322222112.content:
The fat elf girl eyed the door, weighing up her options, but soon came to the decision that trying to run now would be pointless. She was already tired from her previous use of magic, and then there was that hyena... Mara shuddered at the thought of that mangy mutt with his piercing, horrible eyes.

Mara shook her head to clear the image of the abomination, sending her fat cheeks wobbling, "No, I need to rest and wait… tonight's not the right time," Mara thought, easing her large bulk into the huge bed and feeling suddenly tired, "And anyways…" she thought "This bed is comfortable... and big…" and with that Mara drifted asleep in her huge bed, not bothering to lie under the covers, the tatters of her clothes the only things covering her blubbery form.

Meanwhile Jane was not getting a bit of rest herself, the rogue far too busy gorging herself upon the mountains of food in her room. She piled morsel after decadent morsel into her mouth, her mind screaming with bliss, "Its all so good! …And you’re a fat hog anyway, may as well enjoy it…"

These mental taunts and rationalizations flooded Jane’s mind as she gave into her gluttony, a reassuring chorus amongst the symphony of slurps, gulps, and occasional belches while she stuffed her greedy face. Jane was already making an impressive dent in the mountain of food and it was showing. The food even seemed to fatten her as she ate, but with the depression she was in, the now obese rogue could only barely take notice of it, and even then Jane's mind only taunted her telling her she deserved this. Jane was slowly filling out the large chair, causing it to creak and groan as she shifted her massive bulk and swung her fat arms to grab food.

Unknown to Jane, through the mirror two blue eyes watched as the rogue gorged herself, a sinister smile on the hyena’s face as he observed Jane’s “dinner” and her subsequent growth He shook his head as he took stock of what remained of the woman’s clothing, her bra barely covering her breasts, and he panties hardly evident as they were consumed between her ballooning ass cheeks.

“Now now, that just will not do…” He sighed as he lightly scraped a claw against the glass, right over the image of the slowly bloating but unaware woman behind it, “You must remain… decent, if we are to draw a crowd… I will need to get you a new wardrobe my dear...”

Usually the rogue’s senses, honed over years of sneaking past guards and skulking through shadows, would have easily alerted her to the hyena man’s presence, even behind the two-way mirror. What a shame then that those senses were dulled by distraction and indulgence as Jane crammed another moist cream-stuffed éclair past plump, drool-soaked lips.

"Now… just the elf…" The hyena croaked as the rogue continued her feast, a single tear rolling down her fat cheek.

Mara woke up and felt... off. She sat up with great effort and struggled out of bed so she could stand up in front of the mirror, "No, there's no way…" Mara said in denial, inspecting her obese form from all angles, "Damn!" Mara exclaimed seeing why she felt strange.

Overnight she had somehow grown fatter.

"How is that possible?!" Mara yelled, lifting her large belly which looked fifty pounds heavier, "How do I avoid becoming an immobile sacrifice for that deranged dog if so much as sleeping makes me fat!?" Mara yelled, hardly able to believe that she was even fatter. The mage looked herself up and down, her stomach a sea of fat hanging over her crotch and rumbling from hunger, "…can't think of eating," Mara said through gritted teeth, continuing her inspection.

Mara's arms had fat hanging off of them, something that might no doubt make moving her arms swiftly, and by extension spellcasting, a challenge. Her thighs rubbed as she turned and her butt was a wobbling mess. She was most drawn to her breasts though, which sat atop her stomach and were more than twice the size of her head, "Well, I guess I don't mind these extra womanly curves..." She muttered, pushing her tits together and enjoying the size of them, "…no Mara, don't think like that!" She told herself, releasing her breasts and letting them wobble.

She turned around, feeling much more momentum thanks to her added weight: She couldn’t be sure of course, but if she had to guess, she must have already been just over six hundred and fifty pounds. She didn’t have long to ponder her weight though, for as soon as she turned around she was terrified to see the hyena sitting in the corner once again. Mara jumped back a bit in fear, but regained her composure.

"Like your new curves then?" He mocked, seeming to choke as he forced the words to pass his disfigured lips.

"No! What did you do?" Mara demanded.

"I told you, you can agree to help me and I help you, or you refuse to assist in my cause and things get uncomfortable for you and your friend." He replied.

"I won't agree to help you but don't you dare hurt Jane," Mara said, sounding more desperate than she intended.

"Heheheh…" he chuckled, the laughter sounding more like a sound of pain, "Your friend has already decided... and she is being quite helpful…" The hyena smiled, showing yellow teeth.

"S-She wouldn't…" Mara said, shocked at what he was implying.

"She has, so I ask again…. Will you help?"
111322222112.title: Wasting Time and Swelling Waists

She beats the food, gotta find a way out!
1113222221122.content:
"No! You're lying!" Mara said, shaking her head in disbelief, causing her large stomach to wobble and shake vigorously, "Jane wouldn't do that! She'd be looking for a way out!" Mara argued, terrified her friend had agreed to this vile creature’s plan.

"Do you not get it little elf?!" The hyena growled angrily, locking his eyes with Mara's, “Your friend worked out that you would end up too fat to fit through the castle gates at the rate that you have grown so far! So when I promised a safe way in she knew it was the only chance for both of you…" The hyena said, moving closer to Mara, the clearer lighting only emphasizing his terrifying features.

"Jane wouldn't let you make her an immobile blob, how would we even move to the treasure let alone leave?" Mara argued, bewildered by the thought that the hyena honestly believed his plan made sense.

"I have had enough, little elf," The hyena growled, putting one filthy claw under one of Mara's many chins, "I gave you plenty of time to accept my… offer... but you refuse time and time again. You will eat until you are the true embodiment of beauty… because you have three days to gain as much weight on that little figure of yours as possible," The hyena said, giving a vicious grin, clearly aware he had won.

"And why would I do that?" Mara asked with a gulp, afraid of the mangled creature’s response.

"Because at the end of the third day, I will see which of you two is bigger… and the thinnest one will have their weight doubled."

Mara froze, now knowing she had no choice but to become this deranged creature's blob of a sacrifice.

The hyena hobbled towards the door and turned to say, "You may want to eat up, she is much bigger than you already," And with that the door locked shut. Mara became painfully aware of the mountainous breakfast on the table behind her and her giant stomach gave a growl.

"What do I do?" Mara thought, panicking, "If I don't gain enough weight I'm unlikely to be able to move, but if I do gain enough weight Jane will get so fat she can't move. We have to leave before that mutt can make us immobile... but maybe not before breakfast…" She thought, her mind becoming slightly hazed, overcome by a gluttonous desire to demolish the pile of food that lay before her.
