112111222121.content:
Jane placed the bowl on the table and growled beneath her breath. That bitch of a witch would pay for this. Jane rose from the wooden chair with a little more difficulty than when she sat down, and rested a hand on her marginally bigger belly. Although she still bore a primarily pear-shaped physique, this batch of soup added more bulk to her middle than to her bottom. If she wasn't careful, she could easily turn apple-shaped and lose her center of balance. Then she'd never be able to fight Nasha.

A squeaky sneeze sounded outside, and Jane shuffled to the window, slowly growing accustomed to her growing bulk. Jane wiped her sleeve across the dusty pane and peered through the circle of clean glass. It was her! The supposed witch was home, and from what Jane could see, she didn't look to be a very tough opponent. The witch was young, far younger than the title might suggest. The woman couldn't have been a day over thirty, and she slunk toward the door in her form-fitting black robe. For one who serves the Sitharli, she was awfully slender. Odd. Once the witch was out of sight of the window, Jane tiptoed behind the door and waited. With a creak it slowly opened, and the young woman glided into her home, yawning softly.

Jane wasted no time in pouncing on the small, thin woman, utilizing her new girth to pin the witch to the floor. Having been tackled from behind, the woman shrieked in panic before the rogue could bash a nearby candelabra across the back of her head. With the single blow, she was down and out. Jane sighed and grunted to her feet. Time to work quickly. Jane reached into her pouch and removed her climbing rope, eyes darting between the unconscious witch and the chair beside the cauldron. Interrogation time! She gripped the rope tight and made her way toward the prone recluse.

*****

"Ah, you're awake. Good," Jane grinned as she sat across from the bound witch. The woman in black wriggled and struggled, but could not break free from Jane's deft knots. The witch's blue eyes met Jane's gaze, and she wrinkled her nose. Jane could only smirk and gestured to her plump body. "As you can see, I was a little hungry and sampled some of your soup. It was delicious, but I think it might be a little fattening." The witch kept her mouth shut and just stared. Jane cleared her throat and stirred the cauldron with a wooden ladle. "I have questions." Silence. "This can go two ways: you spill it, or I help you fill out that dress some more. Understand?" The rogue rang the ladle against the cauldron's side for good measure.

"I would never betray the great and powerful Sitharli!" The witch spat on Jane's boot, and the rogue scowled back. She nodded in acknowledgment and rose from her seat, moving to a nearby workbench. The witch went wide-eyed and started thrashing her feet against the chair legs to no avail.

"Well, at least now I know you can talk, so I won't feel so bad about this next part," Jane collected a leather strap with a ring at its center, a long canvas tube, and a funnel. The tube looked like a miniature fire hose, and Jane quickly stuck the funnel into one end of it, and approached the witch's face with the leather strap. The captive kept her mouth tightly shut, and so Jane opened up with a heavy right hook to the side of her head, dazing the bound woman enough to loosen her jaw. In that instant Jane slipped the ring into the witch's mouth and fastened the leather behind her head, effectively keeping her mouth opened. She groaned in frustration, but before she could belt out a real scream, Jane stuck the other end of the tube into the metal ring, leaving the end atop the witch's tongue.

"Last chance, lady." Jane stirred the cauldron with one hand and held aloft the funnel with the other. A wicked grin spread across the rogue's soft cheeks, and the thin witch scowled, shaking her head in defiance. "Wrong choice. Bottom's up!" Jane ladled a few ounces of the thick, warm stew into the funnel, and watched as it slid down into the slim woman's mouth. Sputtering and coughing, she tried her hardest not to swallow, but it was swallow or choke, so the stew soon found its way down her esophagus. A muffled scream rose in her throat, but was soon cut off by the oncoming soup. One ladle down, and Jane lowered the funnel. "Still feel like resisting? I have a lot more soup to go," Jane chuckled viciously, "and you still look hungry."

Another shake of the head and a scowl, and Jane shrugged before scooping more soup down the funnel, this time two ladles full. At this point, the changes were becoming visible. The witch's form-fitting black robes were getting a little snug all over, but particularly around her middle. The black fabric was incrementally smoothing out the creases as a small paunch began to form on her waistline. Her petite bosom was also pressing into the dress, forming a bridge of fabric between her breasts as they went up a cup size from their original A's. Overall she looked to have gained about five pounds. Strangely, there was hardly any change to the woman's butt or thighs. She must be a natural apple shape. Well, it was her decision to keep it coming!

"Mmm, tasty! You're one hell of a cook, lady! But something tells me this wasn't your dinner, huh?" Jane pulled the tube out of her mouth and grabbed the witch by the jaw, leaning in close. "Talk or I swear I'll feed you until you can't walk!" The witch went wide-eyed and shook her head. "You think your master is scarier than me? We've just gotten started!" Jane pulled off the funnel and stuck the far end of the tube directly into the cauldron. She took the witch's side and held it in front of her own mouth. "This is your final warning." The witch simply looked away. Jane scoffed and put the tube into her mouth, sucking in to begin siphoning the soup. Once the negative pressure began, the soup started traveling down the length of the canvas tube. Jane pulled the tube out of her mouth and popped it into the witch's just as the soup reached the end, causing it to stream down the bound woman's throat. She swallowed hard, tears welling in her eyes as she stared blankly into space. With the faster siphoning, the changes came about quicker as well. The witch's body began ballooning out all over. Her bust pushed against her robes, swelling from B's to C's. Her belly stretched out another few inches, straining the fabric of her robes to the limit. The witch's arms barely fluffed up, still not visible within the confines of her sleeves. Her thighs nor butt changed in the least, and she began to look five months pregnant with the fattening soup!

A low whimper escaped her lips between swallows, but Jane only crossed her arms. "You can end this whenever you want. Just nod your head." The witch, however, did not obey. And still, the fattening formula flowed down her throat. At last her robes could no longer contain her growing girth and they burst down the middle from neck to navel, letting her bountiful bust and belly billow free. The tanned flesh of her trio of fleshy globes shone slick with sweat in the afternoon light, and each was heavily encased in fat. Her belly was both swollen and soft, like a basketball covered in pizza dough. Jane grimaced at the damage she had already done to the woman, and lifted the tube out of the cauldron. Once the remainder within drained into the witch's throat, she pulled the empty tube free. The flushed, fattened woman panted heavily as Jane removed the leather strap and ring.

The changes, however, were still not complete. The woman's breasts continued to swell forth, now resting atop the fluffy, soup-filled belly like two wineskins fit to burst. They easily filled a DD cup now and her exposed, pink areola were puffy like small pink saucers. Her belly's growth slowed now, changing the contents from liquid to fat. It didn't quite flatten out as much as soften and droop, the overhang of her tummy flesh now resting atop her slender thighs. Between her chest and tummy she must have packed on another thirty pounds. The disproportion of her fat was surreal, and Jane reached out to touch the product of her torture. Her fingers sunk into the soft belly, but the witch hissed at her.

"Don't touch me!" Immediately, the rogue retracted her hand, looking over the woman tied to the chair.

"Talk. I'm feeling merciful, but if you don't tell me what I need to know, I swear I will not stop until every last drop of that cauldron is in your stomach. And you still have more than half left." Jane sat back in her own chair and folded her arms across her soft chest, feeling her arms rest atop a pronounced tummy of her own. It wasn't nearly as bloated as the witch's, but it was still not the toned abs she was used to.

"All right... you win." The witch hung her head, whimpering softly. "What is it you want to know."

Jane sat upright and shifted her weight in her seat. "I want to go back to normal." Her eyes narrowed as she stared at the witch, and the woman across from her let out a maddened giggle. "What's so funny?" The rogue maintained her stern expression.

"You can't go back to normal! You can only grow bigger and bigger!" She finally raised her head and glared wickedly at Jane. "That is both our fates now. The soup is a concentrated form of the enchanted ooze my mistress infested you with!" A wide grin flashed across her face, and the witch cackled again. "You will only grow larger and larger until the master, the sacred Sitharli deems you worthy!"

"You crazy freak!" She back-handed the woman and drew the dagger from her forearm, holding it to the woman's throat. "What good are you to me alive?" This seemed to sink in, and the witch gasped.

"Wait! Wait! Okay!" She sighed and Jane only jabbed the dagger harder against her throat, drawing a drop of blood. "I can't make you normal, but I can stop the growing! There! In my alchemy kit! Drink the pink vial!" Jane looked over and saw the vial. Can she trust the witch?

Maria strolls along a dirt path, not really sure where she's going. There's been no dragon threatening any kingdoms, no royalty that needs rescuing, no artifact to retrieve, and nothing to stab with her longsword... Nothing to do, as of late. She'd enjoy this "vacation," but it's a bit hard to relax when you know that you have absolutely no income.

She sighs. It'll be another day full of aimless wandering... At least she picked a nice place to wander, though. She found herself by a riverbed, lined with cherry trees in blossom and numerous wildflowers. Even a warrior could appreciate such beauty and serenity.

Her stomach growls, at that moment; she's hungry. It growls once more; very hungry. She places a paw on her flat stomach. "Yeah, yeah, I know..." she says to herself. "I guess it's lunchtime..."

She meanders over to a tree, takes the rucksack from her back, and places it on the ground. She begins to rummage through the bag, both feet on the ground and her shapely rear dancing side-to-side in the air as her tail flicks up and down.

She stops "dancing," though, after she realizes that she's got absolutely no food. "Well, that's just super." She frowns. "Absolutely nothing... Dammit."

She's going to go hungry, it seems. She picks up her bag, and returns to her travels. She's certainly not going to find anything here.

121.content:
The orange vixen trudges down the dirt road, her mood darkened by hunger.

"I could've sworn I had an apple or something in my bag..." she said to nobody in particular. "Did somebody steal it?"

Maria freezes. She did remember bumping into some elf kid when she was in town the other day. She dropped her bag, and everything fell out of it... The kid helped pick everything up, but apparently he kept something of hers...

"That little bastard!" She is furious. "Nobody steals from me! If I find him, I'll... I'll..." Maria sighs, as her anger subsides. Her anger never lasts long, especially not when kindled against a child. "I'll forgive him... He did look pretty hungry, I guess..."

Her stomach gurgles. "But I'm hungry, too..."

"Ma'am? Who are you talking to?" A man walks into view. "I hear you talking, quite loudly, and yet I don't see anybody with you..."

"Oh... Nobody..." Maria says, embarrassed. "I was just talking to myself... I must look quite odd."

He's a very plain man: Brown hair, brown eyes, brown shirt, brown shoes... And pants. He's wearing pants, too; they're gray, though. He's got a sack slung over his right shoulder, and a half-eaten pear in his left hand.

"No, no... It's not that odd. It sure looks odd, but it's not." The vixen's eyes fall on the half-eaten pear in the man's hand, and her stomach rumbles once more. "So, I hear you're hungry, now? I've got some pears in the bag, if you'd like."

"No, no, I'm fine, really..." She was lying, obviously, but didn't see fit to impose herself on a stranger.

"Oh, it's fine. I've got plenty. And I heard you say you were hungry."

"Well, if you insist... Thank you."

They both sit down against a thick tree to the side of the road. The man opens his bag, takes out a few pears, and places them in Maria's paws; she accepts them graciously.

It looks like she's getting lunch, after all.

They strike up a conversation as the vixen eats her pears. They exchange names (his name is Isaac, by the way), and stories.

He tells her about the pear orchard he owns... And that's it. Isaac isn't a very exciting man.

She tells him about her "profession" as a warrior, and how she hasn't been doing much lately.

"I'm sorry to hear that," Isaac says.

"It wouldn't be so bad... Except, you know, no money..." Maria says. "I'm beginning to consider abandoning this job... For what, though, I'm not sure."

"You probably don't have to do that... At least, not if you don't want to. I think I might have a 'lead' for you..."

"Really?" Maria asks, her interest piqued.

"Yeah. I've been hearing stories, lately, about this cave..."

"A cave?"

"Yeah, a cave. It's full of monsters and traps, but also full of treasure. You might check that out; if nothing else, you might salvage something that'll at least fetch enough coin to feed you 'til your next job."

"That sounds good. Where is it?"

"It's... Somewhere around here. People are a bit vague about that. You might look around the base of the mountain..." Isaac gestures toward a mountain 500 yards away. "I hope that helps."

"It does, it does. Thank you, Isaac; for the pears, and the information." Maria rises from her sitting position, stretches, and heads toward the mountain.

"Wait, wait... Before you go, you might as well take another pear."

"Thank you."

"Good luck."

Maria accepts the pear and continues on her way. Isaac stays behind, eating a pear.

"She's a nice girl..." Isaac says to himself, between mouthfuls of pear. "I hope he doesn't give her much trouble..."

12133.content:
Maria was lost, hopelessly lost. After making a few foolish decisions of what track to follow to get her back to the main road, she soon found herself even deeper in the woods, in an area that was ruled by flora. By now her hunger was returning, the snack she had earlier only helping to quench it for a while.

The fox never felt so helpless in her life. She felt like crying, even though she told herself to take deep breath and remain calm. But how could she if she was doomed to wonder the forest untill she succumbed to starvation and exposure? She quickly wiped away a tear that threatened to spill from her eye and soile her fur.

She was about to give up all hope, to throw her pack down, crawl up against a tree and weep like a cub when she heard the soothing sound of running water and someone singing a happy tune. Maria was overjoyed.

She followed the sound, running through bushes and over uneven earth. The sweet sound grew louder and louder. She finally came to a stop when she reached a clearing. The river wasn't very large, more like very large stream, fed by a rumbling waterfall.

It was there that Maria found the creature that was singing the sweet song; he was tall, at least six feet, and well-built with grey fur and a white underbelly. The water soaked his fur as he stood under the waterfall bathing himself, completely nude.

Near him was a backpack. A large axe leaned against it, gleaming in the sun. From the look of these items, Maria could easily determine that he was a barbarian-wolf.

The wolf turned and his bright yellow eyes spotted Maria staring at him. He didn't shy away, in fact he tainted the fox by turning and swaying his rump, saying: "Got a nice view from there, m'lady?"

Maria frowned at the wolf's rudeness. He was a barbarian, that was for sure. But she wasn't about to be chased away by a brute's obscene manners.

She steped forth boldly. "Can you help me? I'm lost and I need to get back to the..." She was going to say 'main road', but that would have left her back at square one. Instead she continued with, "I mean to a cave. I need to find a cave in the mountains. You wouldn't know where I could find it perhaps?"

He turned and flashed Maria, stepping out from under the waterfall. He shooked his body like a dog, water droplets flying everywhere.

"Going to the cave of the Lipomancer, I see. Well, I do know where it is, but it's gonna cost ya." He tucked at his scrotum to emphasize what the 'price' was.

Maria groaned in frustration; she didn't have time for this folly. "Listen here, tramp," the fox said coldly, taking a new approach to her situation, "I don't have time for this. I'm starving over here. Now, you either tell or go to hell!"

"Okay, okay," the wolf said, raising his paws in defense, but he was still grinning like some sort of stupid jester, "I was just toying with you."

Maria snorted. "You better be."

"By the way, names Rouge," he said, pulling up his breeches.

"Maria," the fox said, feeling that it was only polite to reveal her name as well.

Rouge looked towards the sky suddenly. "Getting dark," he said.

Maria then noticed that he was right. She must have been lost for hours in the forest.

1222.content:
A spacious clearing by the base of a cliff. The smell had come from this direction, but there didn't seem to be anything there; the clearing was empty, for the most part, save for a wide, flat stone in the center, reminiscent of a stage, encircled by a number of strange cup-like stones.

"I don't see anythi-" Maria began; she stopped speaking, though, when she looked a little bit to the left of the clearing and saw the largest oak tree she had ever seen.

"What... What is this?" Maria asked (rhetorically, of course) as she stepped toward the leviathan arbor to give it a closer look.

The tree was enormous; fifty times taller than the average oak, and fifty times as wide. Its numerous boughs were as trees themselves, and from their "boughs," among an ocean of green, hung acorns the size of pumpkins. How something this large could possibly exist... Boggling, to the mind!

Maria stood in amazement, forgetting her hunger in her awe, looking up and down this wonder of nature.

An enormous acorn fell to the ground moments later with a mighty thud, jarring Maria and returning her attention to the world... And her hunger. She stared at the acorn for a second or two, before picking it up.

The acorn was quite heavy; twice as heavy as a pumpkin would be. "I wonder how it tastes?" Maria lifted it to her mouth, and attempted to wrap her vulpine muzzle around the nut, but found the acorn's curvature and uncharacteristic solidness made it difficult to penetrate. She lowered the nut back to the ground, and grumbled; she wouldn't be eating that.

Only three feet away from the undefeated acorn was another acorn, dropped by the tree long before Maria arrived. She went to examine it, and found that it had a chunk missing from it.

"Something managed to bite it?" She figured it was a wild hog of some sort.

"I wonder if the hog is still around?" Maria began to circle the oak's perimeter, having long forgotten the scent that brought her here. However, it sprang back to her mind when she'd made it a quarter-way around the tree; she'd found its source.

A gargantuan bee hive, hidden within a massive hollow in the tree's side; the hungry vixen had smelled honey.

"Oh, my!" she said, astonished once more. She peered inside the gaping mouth and into the cavernous hive.

The hive appeared to occupy nearly half of the oak's trunk. Its walls were tiled neatly with large, hexagonal honeycombs, all dripping with golden honey. The honey poured like lazy waterfalls down the hive's sides, from farther up than the vixen could see, and pooled at the bottom, nearly 10 feet into the ground below the tree, forming a reservoir of the sweet substance; an edge, of which, was right by the entrance.

Of particular note, however, was something Maria did not see: The residents. The hive was conspicuously devoid of the expected honeybees. None were to be found crawling along the walls, nor were there any to be found buzzing around outside. What kind of bees would build a hive like this? What kind of bees would just leave it?

"How odd..." The vixen wanted to get a closer look inside, but paused. Maria was certain the bees were nowhere around, but she was wary of the hive anyway. What if the bees came back? They'd be pretty angry if they came home to find a stranger had invaded their home, and Maria did not want to meet angry bees.

Still, it'd be a shame to pass up the chance to get any of that honey; she was hungry, after all...

Maria decided to dip a paw into the honey reservoir. She pulled it out, and gave it a lick; this honey was exceptionally sweet, and wondrously smooth! She continued to lick her sticky paw, until the honey was all gone. She licked around her muzzle to get any that she'd left behind, and giggled.

"That's good..."

The vixen certainly wasn't leaving, now... She'd found her lunch. Or, rather, dinner; the sun had begun to set.

"Hmmmm... My paw's getting sticky..." Maria said. "If I keep gettin' in there with it, the honey's gonna dry and leave it all crusty..."

She wiped her mildly-sticky paw on her sleeve. "Now what?"

She thought about the pig that was supposed to be around here somewhere... And how pigs ate...

"I guess I could just lean in there and slurp some of the honey up... But... Eating like a pig is embarrassing," Maria bemoaned.

Having found the right spot, she thrust her muzzle into the honey reservoir and began to suck up as much of the delicious honey as she could. Her rear-end began to "dance," much as it had earlier, swishing left and right, up and down, as her tail wagged back and forth. Every minute or so, she'd raise her muzzle and gasp for air, giggle giddily while honey dripped from her muzzle into her cleavage, and return her lips to the reservoir.

After twenty minutes of engorging herself on honey, Maria was still going, hungry as ever. Her belly, which by all accounts should be stretched taut and near-to-bursting, had actually become a bit softer, as had the rest of her body. Her ass, still dancing, now jiggled and bounced a bit as she swayed, becoming thicker as time went by. Her hips, voluptuous and full in the first place, had become even fuller, and added a bit more momentum to her "dance." Indeed, this honey seemed to metabolize very quickly, turning almost-instantly into fat on the orange vixen's frame. She hadn't noticed herself becoming heavier, though; she was only paying attention to her hunger and the sweet, sweet honey right in front of her.

Her arms had become flabby, jiggling as they grasped whatever surface they could for leverage, and a second chin had begun to develop under her muzzle. Her body, overall, was becoming thicker; she had to have gained 50 pounds since she started eating the honey.

After a while she raised her muzzle up from the reservoir. Something was troubling her...

Despite her bulk, though, she had no apparent difficulty standing. She felt herself up, a bit; just as soft and squishy as she remembered, but not quite as sensitive. She weaved around numerous trees, coming closer and closer to the wonderful smell...

But found herself stuck between the trunks of two rather close oak trees, her belly wedged tight. "Oh, dear..." But, her mind wandered from her predicament when she looked up; she'd found the source of the delicious scent.

She had happened upon a gathering of 20 muscular male foxes, huddled around a long wooden table. On top of the table were the delicacies she'd smelled: Heaping bowls of mashed potatoes, each with an equally-generous pot of rich, well-seasoned gravy; an assortment of wagon-wheel sized pies of varying flavors; a platter piled high with buttered cobs of corn; at least 10 stuffed turkeys; a plate of thick, well-done steaks, just the way Maria liked them; and a bowl of strawberries with a smaller bowl full of melted chocolate beside it.

But these were not the "main attraction;" no, that was in the center of the table: An enormous roasted pig, golden-brown and dripping with a variety of thick sauces and glaze, lying belly-down in a pan with an apple in its mouth. Maria's mouth would have been watering...

... Were not all of the foxes' eyes on her. She was feeling quite self-conscious; she hadn't expected that anybody would see her like this, fat and nude. She blushed through her fur as she tried to avert her gaze from the staring foxes; it wouldn't be nearly so bad if they weren't so handsome!

One of the males, one covered in gray fur, rose from the table, approaching her. He was, for the most part, naked himself, just like all of the other males, save for a loincloth.

"I... I'm sorry..." the orange vixen stammered, wracked with embarrassment.

"For what?" the muscular male answered, "You are the guest of honor, Maria! Why should you be sorry at your own feast?" All of the foxes cheered.

"You... You know my name?"

"Of course! We've been expecting you! Now, come. ... I am Kervos, by the way."

"Oh! It's nice to meet you, Kervos... I'm... A bit stuck..."

"Ah, of course." Kervos raised his claw, and snapped, beckoning forth four of the other males: One red, one white, one green, and one brown, all stood at attention. "If you will, men... Please 'escort' Miss Maria to her seat."

"Of course!" they exclaimed in unison, eagerly taking position around Maria. The green and white foxes took their place on either side of the large vixen's expansive white-furred belly, lifting it from underneath, while the other two took their place behind Maria, each placing their paws squarely on her buttocks, and pushing. Honestly, Maria was quite enjoying the attention; she hadn't been touched in quite some time, especially not by such fine specimens of virility and masculinity, all paying undivided attention and using the utmost care to move her. With a *pop!*, she sprang from between the trees, jiggling wildly and being cradled by ten strong, vulpine arms. She was still blushing, but not as embarrassed.

"Yes. Would you like us to feed you?"

The vixen purred. "That would be nice."

Kervos snapped his fingers, and all of the males rose, each grasping one of the dishes, save for the pig in the center, and bringing them forward to the hungry vixen.

"Open wide, if you will."

"Oh..." the vixen moaned in ecstasy; they were, perhaps, the best she'd ever eaten, creamy and fluffy in a way she'd never had the pleasure to taste. The male put this bowl and spoon aside, and placed his own paws on Maria's doughy gut, which had grown slightly larger, and began to knead it.

The process continued, with different dishes; as they were depleted, the tod would either join the others in their reverent massage, perhaps using a special oil, or return to the table for another dish. 12332212121211.content:
After lunch, Maria had found herself hungry sooner than she'd thought, and soon nibbled away the rest of the food. She knew she should be training, or something, to make sure she could keep winning... But honestly, she felt better than ever! Stronger, faster, more dexterous... Talk about a good night's sleep!

"Hells, maybe the bed is magic," she chuckled, sitting down on it. "Magically damn comfortable, for sure."

After thinking about this for a few moments, she flopped backwards onto it. 'If this really is magic, I want as much of its effect as I can get! Whatever do between meals from now on, I'm doing it in bed!' She resolved.

Leather armour couldn't have been the most comfortable thing to sleep in, but Maria must've managed, for she was woken by a buzz sometime later.

"I don't feel the need to say anything clever to you, so off you go," the voice added.

Maria shrugged and left. Fair enough. There was something slightly different about the arena, this time. Or rather, something different in it- an audience. There were perhaps a dozen beings in all, a drop in a bucket when it came to the number of seats, but they appeared to be there willingly.

There were half a dozen who were obviously servants in the castle, judging by their state of dress, two young noble ladies, if their posh clothes were any indication, and four floating orbs she recognized as scrying orbs. Was she being watched from afar now?

Her opponent, a stocky bear, seemed rather dazed herself by the prospect of being watched in action. It was several seconds before she realized Maria was running at her full-speed, and she didn't have time to react before a fist slammed into her face, shattering her nose in a spray of blood.

Deciding to put on a bit of a show for the audience, Maria kneeled on the bear's back and twisted her arm behind her, making her roar in pain. Pulling up a little more, she heard a satisfying snap, and the bear whimpered.

Maria stood up and kicked her opponent in the ribs. "C'mon then, honey-humper. You've got one good arm. Come get me!"

She strolled out to the center of the arena and leaned on the table, grazing casually.

The bear levered herself up, panting, gathered herself, and charged towards Maria, one arm dangling uselessly at her side. More than anything, it was the humiliation that drove her on.

Maria drew her sword, but did not attack, instead dodging the bear's clumsy swipes, once even smacking her ass with the flat of her blade. "Good thing there are no hills, here! You'd trip over your own feet!"

After a minute, she let the bear take a swipe at her, bent backwards to avoid it, and then propelled her upper half violently forward like a loaded trebuchet. With her forehead, she smashed the bear's jaw, rattling and loosening several teeth. Grinning, she watched the bear spit blood and teeth. Before she could try and attack again, Maria swiftly kicked out her knee, and the bear sprawled helplessly on the ground, panting, defeated.

Raising her sword, the vixen rammed it home in the bear's heart. She expired with a wet gurgle.

The source of the clapping this time was visible, coming from the slaves, and the two noble ladies nodded their approval.

Maria grinned, bowed, and stomped on the bear's stomach. Her sword came shooting up, and she snatched it by the handle, flourished it, and sheathed it. Battle won, she dug into her feast.
12332212121211.title: Suppertime Slam!

choices: Someone asks for Maria to come see them.
She starts drawing- ahem- a WIDER audience.
123322121212111.content:
After devouring her supper, Maria retired to the welcome embrace of her bed, gladly changing into silky undergarments before flopping in. Unbeknownst to her, it was not the bed that worked magically through the night, but the food she had so readily shown her gullet, increasing her mass in more than one way.

When she awoke, again to the sound of a buzzer, she jumped out of bed feeling, in her own words, "Fucking fantastic!" There was a bit more bounce in her step for good reason. Her stomach was now slightly rounded, even empty, sporting a soft layer of fat over her muscles.

However, eager for a breakfast brawl, Maria paid no heed to her body other than to admire the strength she felt waiting to be used. She strapped on her armour and sword and rushed out the door, salivating already.

The muscular tiger she faced across the arena seemed to have some speech prepared. "I will slay you, wicked vixen, and the light of my god will shine through-"

"Shut your religious claptrap and let's fight, fatty!" She challenged, running full-on towards him with her sword hanging by her side and her tongue hanging out of her mouth.

The tiger paused in his quick stride towards the table, looking down and poking himself uncertainly. "I am not fat..." he said, hurt.

Like Maria herself, her words carried more weight than she thought. She hopped up onto the table, avoiding the food, and then flung herself off, cackling manically.

The tiger looked up just in time to watch Maria's fist enter his field of vision and just as quickly trim it in half as it smashed his eye with a crunch and a 'pop!'. He fell back, screaming, and tripped over his own tail.

Maria gave him no quarter, dropping onto his chest on her knees, none-too-gently, and working at his ribs. One-by-one she cracked his ribs, the sounds audible even over his quickly-wheezy and quieting screams. She must've punctured a lung at least once, for he began to foam blood at the mouth. Doubling her fists, she raised them far behind her head, like she was going to scratch her back, and then brought them down on the tiger's nose like a hammer. Blood flew everywhere as it shattered.

The tiger finally went silent, his breathing becoming even shallower as the blackness took the rest of his vision.

"Another victim of self-esteem issues!" Maria declared to the arena at large. "Be proud of who you are!"

"Yeah! Mad Maria!" Someone in the audience cheered, whooping. This got the rest of the audience, a dozen beings, clapping as well.

The sound wasn't spectacular in the large amphitheater, but to "Mad" Maria, it was the sweetest music. She bowed, grinning widely, immensely pleased. Hopping up onto the table with a omelet clutched in her hands, she yelled "Thank you! This is for you, fans!" And she crammed it whole into her mouth, only a little messily.

With the taste of food now influencing her anew, the vixen scrambled down to the ground to stuff her face. What an adventure this was turning out to be!
123322121212111.title: Breakfast Brawl!

1233221212121112.content:
Even by her next breakfast, by which time Maria looked lightly pregnant, in terms of body shape, the vixen couldn't help but notice she was beginning to draw a wider audience. Where yesterday morning, she had seen a dozen audience members, today, as she prepared to throw down with a chubby elf, she counted twice that, and a half-dozen scrying orbs, to boot. And who knew how many- or whom- was watching those transmissions on the other end?

The elf, as they squared off, hadn't lost any of her speed, jabbing and weaving her dagger with hard-to-follow speed. Maria was on the defensive, keeping away from the sharp object. Despite the distance advantage her sword would give her, she didn't yet have it drawn, already growing to relish the brutally fulfilling feel of bashing some skulls with her bare hands.

When the elf misstepped, Maria grabbed her arm, and exerting her strength, bent it at the elbow completely the wrong way. The elf screamed and her fingers went dead, releasing the dagger. Maria delivered a downright fierce uppercut to the elf's jaw, dazing her, then released her and drove an elbow into her chest, knocking the wind out of her and causing her to fall.

Picking up the dagger while the elf wheezed and tried to get some semblance of her higher brain functions working, Maria strode over to her and drove it down through the top of her skull, ensuring she never would.

Grinning and waving at her cheering audience, she glutted herself proudly.

By suppertime, the audience had another half-dozen members, and after Maria had dispatched of her opponent by denting their skull until they stopped moving and breathing, she ate and looked over just who was looking over her.

Many members were more monstrous beings- a couple of werewolves, some Cyclopes, ogres, lamias. One section- being studiously avoided by everyone else- seemed populated by the reanimated- ghouls, mummies, wights. A plump bunny in black sat in the middle of them all; Maria knew a necromancer when she saw one. Were they enjoying it too, she wondered? Or were they just her entourage? Regardless, the werewolves and unnaturally attractive succubae and incubi were enjoying it. Odd that they coexisted peacefully with the human nobles who had gathered.

But they all loved her, and that was all that mattered. She blew them bloody kisses, bowed, and flexed. She had since forgotten why she'd come here, or indeed that she was beneath a castle; she lived to perform in the Ample Amphitheater now, and she supposed she would die in it, hopefully in a blaze of gory glory. Maybe for one day before that, be a Champion.

At lunchtime the next day, at least as many as last night had come to see the almost-chubby champ-in-the-making lay the smack down on her opponent. Quite literally, a particularly strong backhand had spun their head around so fast their neck snapped. More than one mother would go home and tell her children that it really could happen, if they acted up.

The cheering for her was louder than ever, finally a respectable rumble in the arena, unmistakable. "Tell your friends!" Maria yelled triumphantly. "Bring your families! And send me your enemies!"

She gazed upon her adoring fans, noting most of the nobles, if they did not share similar colours or insignias, shared similar figures- portly, plush, signs of wealth and affluence. That they would come to see her honored her. Nobles were notoriously picky; they could get the best of everything. So their increasing presence would seem to indicate she was increasingly the best! Inspiring, indeed.

12332212121211121.content:
Drunk with victory, Maria stumbled back into her quarters with a sway and tumble as she crashed down onto her godly bed, the impact creating a slight jiggle amongst her softer areas. With her mouth hanging open, Maria was knocked out and began to dream of battle and blood lust, two of her favorite things.

Meanwhile, in a dark and foreboding tower at the top of the mysterious castle that Maria was currently residing in, a meeting between a hooded figure and a scrying orb was taking place.

“She is the greatest combatant I have ever seen enter the Ample Ampitheater! With each opponent she vanquishes her thirst for blood grows! Will you not give me permission to have her compete in my name? I shall pay you handsomely, if you so choose to relinquish Maria to me...” said the orb.

The hooded figure's eyes stayed on the ground, seemingly looking for the answer upon his floor. But then the hood moved up, and the figure spoke with a commanding tone that one would expect to hear from a royal king.

“Maria is mine and mine only. I should have guessed the purpose of this meeting before you even mentioned it to me. None of you 'lords' shall lay a hand upon her!”

All the lights (the few it had) in the tower suddenly went dim at the last shout from the hooded figure, the force of it even dimming the scrying orb slightly.

It took a moment before the orb spoke again, as the lord peering from inside was trying desperately to not soil his undergarments. “I can see that you do not wish to negotiate.....However, I wish to propose a deal with you, Lipomancer.”

At the mention of his supposed name, the Lipomancer lifted his head with interest. “Speak of this deal then, before I lose my steadily declining patience...”

“OK, here it is. I will send some of my own combatants to your castle to fight with Maria. If my combatants win, Maria will be mine to do with as I wish.”

“And if Maria wins”, replied the Lipomancer in a mocking tone, “you shall deliver to me five hundred sacks of pure gold coins, straight from your own personal safe.”

“I agree with your terms-”

“Hold on there, I'm not finished yet.” interrupted the Lipomancer. “You will also deliver to me twenty of your most beautiful harem maidens. And also be sure to pack larger clothing with them.”

The orb tried again to speak. “I agree with your terms. But these will only come to pass if Maria-”

“Blah blah, yadda yadda, I understand! Now leave my castle! Go! GO!” The orb hurriedly sped out the window of the tower back to wherever its user lived.

The Lipomancer watched as the quickly shrinking orb sped off into the distance, body bouncing as he chuckled to himself.

“Fool. Your deal,” said the Lipomancer, “is doomed.”


* * *



Morning came, and with it a yawn of contentedness from a drowsy Maria. She rubbed her eyes as magical light shone into her room, illuminating her vast closet and expertly decorated scroll shelf.

“Yep, today is gonna be a good freakin' day.” said Maria as she hefted herself off her bed with more bounce than usual. (A good portion of that bounce being supplied from her expanded rear.) As she stood Maria pulled off one more satisfying stretch that made her slight pot belly push out, and let her arms swoosh down with a loud sigh.

“Good morning, Maria. Today's breakfast battle will be a particularly special one.” said the voice of Maria's mystery host. “Instead of the usual one on one kind of fight, you will be pitched against multiple opponents all at once.”

A barbaric grin planted itself on Maria's rounded face, and she fist pumped the air in excitement.

“There is one more thing Maria.” As the host said this, a green beam of energy materialized from the floor in front of Maria. In the middle of said beam there was a floating ring. Maria instinctively grabbed it without waiting for instructions and studied the ring.

“This is the ring of Voregar the Ever-Eating. It has abilities that could be useful to you in the coming fight.

It was a metallic gray/white color and had a lustrous shine to it. She turned the ring over in her hand and saw that there was what appeared to be a creature of some kind with its mouth gaping wide open. In the center of the mouth was an emerald.

Maria slipped it on her ring finger, but it got stuck half-way. “Ummm....its a little tight.”

The ring suddenly grew to go fully around her thick fingers. She held her hand out in front of her to admire how it looked on her.

“Its very....fitting. Why are you suddenly giving away magical stuff to me anyways? And besides, I don't need stinking magic to help me win!”

“Do not worry Maria. I have the utmost faith in your physical abilities. I just want to see the look on Dorin's face when he sees you....Uhm...”

Maria raised a furred eyebrow at this statement. “See me do what exactly?”

“Nothing. Absolutely nothing. I was getting caught up in a different matter. Now, get armored up! I can't begin the fight without you up in the theater first!”

Maria did as he told, and chose the same black leather armor for the fight, which, unusually, was fitting a bit snugger then usual. “I must be getting some muscles!” shouted Maria as she attempted to flex her arms, but she only succeeded in jiggling her fatty upper arms.


* * *



Maria now stood at the far end of the theater, bobbing her head to the rythmic chant of her expertly gained title.

“Mad Maria! Mad Maria! Mad Maria!” Almost all of the spectators were chanting her name. The few that weren't were some scrying orbs and a full lot of zombies that were falling apart even as they spectated the theater.

A grinding sound at the opposite end of the theater alerted Maria and the crowd of spectators to the arrival of her opponent, who appeared to be a hunch-backed figure in a purple cloak.

“Is this a joke?! Am I really fighting an old geezer here!” said Maria, which was followed by a cacophony of laughs and chuckles from the chubby vulpine.

A table arose from the middle of the theater stacked from end to end with...pastries! Pastries of all kinds were arranged on the table, with the centerpiece being a grand six layered caramel chocolate cake almost as tall as Maria.

She stood and drooled at the cake, just now noticing the groans coming from her belly.

“Ohhhhhhh.......Wow that looks damn good...” She struggled to take her eyes of the cake and focus on her enemy, but eventually managed to do so.

She glared at her enemy, ready to pounce at any given second, when the unthinkable happened.
12332212121211121.title: A Gift from the Host (Prologue to the fight.)

choices: The next battle, Maria gets a new partner as a surprise.
Maria is plagued with a fever from poison the gnome had hidden in his clothes.
123322121212111211.content:
In a flash, the cloak covering the supposed old man was tossed aside to reveal...

Five gnomes!

Five gnomes, standing on top of each other, each as rotund as a small beach ball and about 3 feet tall. They all jumped off each other in a professional manner, obviously having done the maneuver before.

“Gnome Force Five, go!” yelled the portliest gnome, a male with a bright red beard. He pulled out two 'short' swords from his sides as he charged at Maria, the other four gnomes following.

A malicious grin appeared on Maria's face. “Oh hell, this is gonna be fucking fun!” She charged at the gnomes with as much vigor as a bull in a jewelry store, her sharp teeth gleaming and sword pointed in front of her.

Two gnomes coming from the left attempted to distract Maria as the leader and other two gnomes charged forward. But Maria, a cunning vulpine, predicted what they were going to do. As they were all closing in on her, she dropped down quickly to see the gnomes all collide into one another. She took this moment to lop the head off one of the gnomes and kick the leader back a couple of feet.

She quickly got up again and blocked a strike from a female gnome with messy black hair. “You'll pay for that you bitch!” yelled the little gnome, referring to her headless comrade. Maria just laughed and kicked the gnomes sword out of her hand, then punted her across the arena in a comedic fashion. The gnomes head found itself impaled onto one of the guard spikes in front of the audience.

A tired looking ogre looked at the lifeless body, tore it from the spike and swiftly devoured it with no emotion. Maria couldn't help but chuckle at that little spectacle.

She quickly brought her attention back to the fight, now with only three gnomes remaining. She quickly dodged a jab from one gnomes shortened polearm, and cleaved in two with her bloody sword. She picked up the blade part of it, and gutted the gnome trying to sneak up behind her.

She looked back at the gnome that had the polearm to see that he was running away.

“Oh no you don't!” Maria picked up the gutted gnome and tossed him at the fleeing gnome. The body made contact, and both gnomes made contact with the spiked wall, a sickening crunch resounding through the theater.

Maria chuckled and looked to the last gnome, the red bearded leader. He was struggling to get up from the ground, for he had broken a leg from Maria's kick. He spat out blood, and leaned on one of his shortswords.

“You...you are a...monster! No one...has ever beaten us before....” Maria was now slowly walking towards the wounded gnome. “My friends...all slaughtered....by you...” Maria licked her lips, the sliver ring she wore now glowing unnaturally.

“I shall...defeat you, devil, no matter how-ungh!” Maria had grasped the gnome by his neck, bringing him up to her hungry gaze, her eyes glowing an eery green.

“Enough talk. I'm hungry.”

And with that, Maria brought the gnomes head into her mouth, and began shoving the rest of his body into her awaiting stomach. The gnome struggled, his feet kicking out and muffled yells coming from inside Maria's throat.

She pushed down on his body with her paws, throat bulging out to accommodate the gnomes girth. His tiny legs were next to disappear down Maria's gullet, followed by his small feet. Once the gnome had all gone down, Maria re-hinged her jaw and let out a hearty belch.

“Mmm, I never would have thought gnome tasted so good.” said Maria as she placed a hand on her burgeoning belly, feeling the movement from her opponent inside. She then waddled over to the table covered in pastries and proceeded to indulge in her winnings, hunger still gripping her stomach.

***

The door slammed shut behind her, Maria let out one of largest and loudest belches she had ever heard from herself. She then fondled her overstuffed belly, which by now was quite huge. Amazingly, Maria had eaten almost all the pastries on the table along with half of the caramel chocolate cake, even with a whole gnome inside her giant belly.

She slowly waddled to her comfortable bed, taking care to sit down carefully on it, one hand holding her bloated belly and the other steadying her descent.


“Ohhh my god......I have never felt so full....uhhhh....” Maria grimaced as a groan came from her stomach, followed by a couple of loud gurgles.

“So.....sleepy.....” whispered Maria as her eyes closed and she passed into her dreams, where blood rained and battle was constant.

And the Lipomancer watched, a broad smile across his face. He had one the bet of course. He was never wrong with these types of things. He turned to look at Dorin, who had actually come in person this time.

“A deals a deal. Give me the gold and the maidens, now.” Dorin hesitantly handed over ten bags full of gold coins. “The maidens are being put into your holding cells at this very moment, Lipomancer.”

The Lipomancer laughed deeply, his head rising and falling. “Good, good. I will see to it that they are properly cared for...” said the Lipomancer. “Leave me now, Dorin, and sulk in your failure.”

Dorin did as he was told, and shut the door as he left.

“Maria...you are destined for greatness...I am sure of it.” The lights in the tower darkened, and the Lipomancer went into a deep, dark sleep.
