1241111112311112221.content:
Although she was currently famished just from the sight of food spread across the table, Maria began to grab plateful after plateful of edible cuisine, obviously intent on having her fill. However, now that she was going to be a member of Nobility, she began to eat more carefully, in an attempt to not look like a filthy slob, consuming forkful after forkful of what appeared to be pancakes coated in maple syrup.

Looking away for a moment, Maria noticed how fast and clean Roul was eating, not having a single crumb land on his regal clothing, making the plumping vixen feel like an amateur some. However, her hunger didn't deter her, only pushing her harder to satisfy her hunger. But as she ate more and more of the delicacies, Maria could feel her plump belly bulge out ever so slightly with each swallowed mouthful of food, making her dress feel just an itsy bit tighter around her abdomen underneath the blue day gown.

After all, Maria somewhat had this feeling that eventually, she was going to become too full to continue eating. Besides, this whole entire feast felt alien to her, since she never had eaten so much until recently. And yet, she couldn't help but rub her slowly expanding stomach with a free hand, feeling it become just a little more taut with each mouthful swallow. Eventually though....
1241111112311112221.title: First Course As Nobility

choices: Maria decides to search for Roul all by herself.
She decides to ask Aimée & Aveline for aid...
Actually, she ran into someone completely different instead....
12411111123111122212.content:
As though out of sheer luck, Maria was able to finish off the entire breakfast course, her belly poking out in a distended manner, tight as a drum. However, due to her stomach fully stuffed state, she had to gently lean herself back a little to relieve the pressure on her bloated abdomen. Of course, Maria felt like one wrong move could rip the seams of her blue daygown at any moment, hearing the subtle creaking of stitches and cloth slowly stretching to accommodate her current physical status.

Turning her head to look over Roul, Maria could see that the plump vulpine noble appeared to be fine as a fiddle, which Maria could suspect that Roul had a lot of experience when to binging oneself to their stomach's absolute limit. Maria could only acknowledge that she had to definitely work on her stomach capacity, declaring it as a "Work-In-Progress". Noticing his lover's current state, Roul spoke with concern and asked, "Maria? Are you alright, ma chérie?"

"Ugh! A little. I guess I'm still fairly new to this whole lifestyle, Roul. I... I think I need some for my body to digest all that food." Maria calmly replied, as she could hear her stomach gurgling, doing it's best to digest the edible delicacies she has consumed. Fortunately, Roul understood what his potential wife was saying, where he answered, "I understand, Maria. Let me know when you are ready and able."

From there, Roul stood up from his chair, gave her a tender kiss on the cheek, then left the spacious Dining Room, where only one could speculate as to what lessons he had in mind for Maria when it came to the life of Nobility. Now the only one off in the room, Maria began to slowly doze off, putting her plump paw-like hands on her distended belly, closing her eyes, and took what one would call a nap.

---------------------------------------------

What could only be assumed to be an hour or two later, Maria surely began to awaken from her short slumber. The first she noticed was that her belly softer now, along with the rest of her body. Although she could not see it, but her chin was a little more chubby than previously, beginning it's subtle progression into a fat double chin on her neck. However, as she then stood up from the chair, Maria noticed that she had a little more heft in her physique. More specifically, in her breasts, belly, hips, waist, butt, and legs.

"God, how much did I actually eat anyway?" Maria though to herself, putting one plump paw-like hand on her plumper abdomen, feeling just how soft it had become from digesting all of that food during breakfast. However, she couldn't help but feel a curious about her new weight, but also a little excited as well, not sure why she had such excitement toward something awkward as feeling herself getting fatter.

Unsure of where he went, Maria left the Dining Room to comfort Roul, despite how vast his manor was. She could either go and search for Roul by herself, or maybe.....she could find Aimée and Aveline, maybe they would now where to find the blubbery vulpine noble....
12411111123111122212.title: Stuffed To The Brim

choices: "Currently in the Ballroom. I believe he wants to dance with you."
"Actually in the Study Room. He's been waiting patiently for you."
To be honest, Aimée said that Roul's in a another room instead.....
124111111231111222122.content:
At first, she attempted to find Roul all by herself, waddling up and down the hallways of the 3-story manor estate, searching for any sign of the plump vulpine's, whether said presence came in the form of an open door to another room, hearing Roul's voice nearby, or almost anything out of the ordinary. Although, despite the effort in her search, Maria had no luck in finding the tubby nobleman.

"*Sigh* Come on, Roul. Where the hell are you?" She thought to herself, putting her plump paw-like hands on her padded waist and hips out of slight frustration, obviously unsure as to where Roul's current location within the mansion. After all, she was inexperienced as to the overall layout of Roul's home, so she was unsure as to whether there was a hidden room he had built into the manor's construction, or simply in a different room right in plain sight this whole time.

But as she looked around the main lobby near the grand staircase for any signs of Roul's passing, Maria then noticed a nearby door opening outwards, where the two rotund raccoon maidens, Aimée and Aveline, exited out of the wide doorway, cleaning utensils in hand, tending to the well keep of their master's humble abode. "Maybe they might know where Roul is...." Maria thought, having a hopeful smirk on her slightly plump snout.

From there, Maria approached the two corpulent maids, noticing that she now has a swaying in her waist and hips with each waddling step. Then, as she drew closer toward Aimée and Aveline, Maria gathered their attention and asked, "I apologize if I'm interrupting you two, but do you know where Roul is? I am having a rather difficult time finding him." Obviously eager to aid their master's guest and potential wife, Aimée spoke up first and replied, "Oh, it's rather simple, Mademoiselle Maria, Maître Roul is....."
124111111231111222122.title: Seeking The Help of Maids

choices: Was inside the Ballroom by himself, waiting patiently for Maria.
Was inside the Ballroom with a younger fatter vixen. Could this be Céline?
Actually, Roul was there, and he wasn't alone....
1241111112311112221221.content:
"....currently in the Ballroom as we speak. I believe he wants to share a dance with you, mademoiselle." Aimée explained, giving Maria a sense of relief, as she then replied, "Oh thank goodness.....Wait a minute, this manor has a Ballroom?" Obviously giggling at their master's guest at the way she reacted, , Aveline then spoke toward Maria and answered, "Why yes, Mademoiselle Maria. Maître Roul has a vast Ballroom built within the manor, for leisurely and entertainment purposes, of course. It is mostly used for galas and ballroom dancing."

Although she was initially surprised that Roul's massive home had an actual ballroom built within the manor's itself, Maria couldn't help but somewhat blush in the process. After all, hearing that Roul wanted to share a dance with her.... It sounded like something out of a romantic fairytale like Cinderella or Sleeping Beauty, where the plump vulpine nobleman was her "Prince Charming" of sorts.

Then, Aveline turned to face her equally rotund cousin, gently handing the cleaning utensils to Aimée, where she then spoke in their native language and said, "Un instant, cher cousin . Je dois montrer Madame Maria , où la salle de bal est situé . (One moment, dear cousin. I need to show Madame Maria where the Ballroom is located.)" From there, Aimée nodded in agreement, speaking in the same foreign tongue as her cousin and replied, "Pas de problème, Aveline . Après tout, elle est assez nouveau en ce qui concerne la navigation dans la maison de notre Maître .(No problem, Aveline. After all, she is fairly new when it comes to navigating through our Master's home.)"

In response, Aveline let out a feminine giggle and answered, "Tellement vrai , tellement vrai. (So true, so true.)" From there, Aveline then focused her attention on her master's female guest and said, "Follow me if you will, Mademoiselle Maria. I will show you where the Ballroom is." Seeing as how she still didn't fully know her way around the vast estate, Maria decided to follow Aveline to where the Ballroom was located, staying close behind the corpulent raccoon maid.

However, along the way, Aveline then spoke toward Maria as they waddled their way down the large hallways and said, "Master Roul has taken a liking to you, mademoiselle. You must be honored with such a privilege." "Yes, well....I guess it is sort of a big deal, huh?" Maria responded, obviously blushing a little, feeling like it's almost a weird but very thrilling fantasy, her inner childhood jumping with joy on knowing what it's like to be treated like a fairy tale princess. That is, if said fairy tale princess was required to be fattened up like Hansel and Gretel.

"Why of course it's a "big deal", mademoiselle! After all, Maître Roul would not treat you with such generosity if he had no affection towards you, and Aimée and I can see he clearly shows much affection when he laid his eyes upon you." Aveline replied, fully aware of the blooming romance occurring between Maria and Roul, becoming positively vocal about such a romantic relationship.

Though Maria knew one thing for certain: She knew that Aveline was right, she was having such romantic feelings toward the blubbery vulpine noble. Maria couldn't deny that fact anymore than the reason why she originally came to Sulvale in the first place. Letting out a sigh of defeat, Maria then spoke toward Aveline and said, "*Sigh* ......I know, you're right, Aveline; I do have feelings toward Roul, romantic feelings. It's just that.....I want our relationship to be, you know, fully developed, as if we were meant for each other, not a relationship where he only loves me because of my physical beauty and appearance, but then abandons me for another woman outright entirely. I deeply apologize if I offended your opinion of Roul, but....I just wanted to let somebody understand from my perspective."

Keenly listening on every word that Maria said to her, Aveline clearly understood what the tubby vixen was explaining, as the rotund raccoon maid then spoke up and answered, "It's quite alright, mademoiselle. I clearly understand what you mean by a fully developed relationship. After all, you and Maître (Master) Roul want a romance that is meaningful. To prove that you are both made for each other. These are truly the passionate feelings of compassion and true love."

"But it's not just that, Aveline. I'm....I'm also worried about meeting Roul's parents and family given. I mean, they're basically the closest equivalent to royalty in his homeland, and I'm deeply concerned about being treated like, well.....an outsider, a foreigner." Maria continued, feeling like she was confessing her sins to a priest in a cathedral, only Aveline wasn't neither an actual priest or an actual nun.

However, Aveline stopped at a set of large, stained glass double doors, where the obese raccoon maid then turned around to face Maria and answered, "Then fear not, Mademoiselle Maria. Roul's parents are quite the wise and understandable Nobles. After all, they've given me, my cousin, and a few of our siblings a place to call home, and treated us like members of their family. Surely, they would understand Maître Roul's passionate romantic feelings for you."

"I didn't know you had more family members besides your cousin Aimée. May I ask what your siblings are like?" Maria curiously asked, but Aveline then spoke up and answered, "....Maybe for another time, perhaps. But right now, you have a romantic dance with Maître Roul to attend to. The Ballroom is on the other side of these doors, mademoiselle. Profitez de votre danse, ma dame !(Enjoy your dance, my lady!)"

And with her guidance fulfilled, Aveline waddled back down the hallway, returning to Aimée and leaving Maria by the doors leading into the Ballroom. Although she was thankful for Aveline's assistance with such a trivial matter, she had to actually be sure that Roul was actually inside the Ballroom. Approaching the stained glass double doors, Maria turned the knobs on both doors, opening them both in unison, revealing that Roul.....

choices: Céline had a heart-to-heart talk with Maria.
Céline began to ask Maria what she was like before meeting Roul.
Actually, let's see what Roul is doing, shall we?
12411111123111122212212.content:
Upon entering the Ballroom, Maria couldn't help but stare in awe toward the sheer vast size of the manor's Ballroom. The floor was covered with tiles of smooth limestone the size of carriages, each tile laced in these regal and intricate designs upon the floor. In the center, Maria witnessed a large crystal chandelier hung high above the Ballroom.

Looking to her right, she laid eyes upon an elaborate stage-floor, covered with brass decor and built with hardwood spruce. In one of the corners, Maria noticed a collection of large circular tables with equally large chairs, each spread out across the tiled floor, as if the Ballroom was also a place for gathering an audience.

But then, Maria began to hear Roul's voice echo throughout the Ballroom, where she ten turned to her left toward the source of the echo, using her vulpine ears to focus in on the source. And there he was, sitting at one of the tables near the corner of the room that was the furthest from her current location in the Ballroom.

However, it was there that the rotund properly-dressed vixen then began to notice something peculiar: Roul appeared to be having a conversation with someone. Judging from her appearance, Maria could clearly tell that the unknown person was an anthropomorphic fox, a rather obese one for sure. From there, as she carefully set the dress down on the bed, Aimée spoke to Maria once more and replied, "Oui (Yes), Mademoiselle. After all, your updated size requires a new dress to be worn upon your beautiful form." The comment made Maria blush a little more, just as the rotund raccoon maiden then grabbed a larger set of purple silk bra and panties, since she could easily notice that the current undergarments Maria was wearing were becoming quite skin tight squeezing slightly on the vixens now larger breasts and buttcheeks.

Then, after stripping Maria of the tight bra and panties, Aimée then proceeded to help Maria put on the larger lingerie, feeling relieved to have some breathing room. "Well, at least I don't feel so constricted in that bra anymore." Maria complied, letting out a deep exhaled breath out of physical relief. "Indeed, mademoiselle Maria. Now then, let's see if we can get you properly dressed, shall we?" Aimée replied, as she carried the crimson dress over to where Maria stood, inserting the fatter vixen into the dress legs first. From there, Aimée pulled the dress upwards, putting each arm into the puffy short sleeves of the gown. Finally, the obese raccoon maid then closed the back of the dress, sealing Maria inside the regal daygown.

Next, Aimée pulled a pair of red ruby heeled shoes, which are easily large enough to fit onto Maria's plump furry feet comfortably, as she inserted one foot at a time into both of the expensive and fancy footwear. With that done, Maria approached the nearby vanity and applied red lipstick onto her slightly plumper lips, just as Aimée unexpectedly applied pink eyeshadow upon Maria's upper eyelids. Of course, this only added a bit more feminine beauty to the vixen's appearance, just as she turned around to look at her reflection in a full-body mirror, noticing how attractive she was, despite how fat she had recently become.

"Come along now, mademoiselle. Maître (Master) Roul is waiting for us by the Grand Staircase." Aimée said, carrying several of Maria's already packed suitcases in tow, as the corpulent raccoon maid waddled out the door, down the wide hallway, and toward the Grand Staircase adjacent to the Main Lobby. Maria followed not too far behind herself, feeling her blubbery frame now having a more jiggling sway with each step. By the time they made it to the Grand Staircase......

1241111112311112221221211122122.content:
Upon reaching halfway down the Grand Staircase, Maria could easily see that both Roul and his rotund sister Céline were already wide awake and properly dressed, waiting patiently for the fattened vulpine, as Maria precariously waddled down the expensive flight of stairs, with Aimée willingly guiding the statuesque vixen. However, it also appeared that Aveline was preoccupied with carrying several bags of luggage into an exquisite carriage parked at the front main entrance of Roul's 3-Story Manor, making sure that her Master and Mistress were adequately stocked on clothing and other necessities.

Of, course, both Roul and Céline eventually became aware of the rounded vulpine's presence, as they turned around to gaze upon Maria while she descended the Grand Staircase. "Ah, there she is! La vixen de sommeil (The sleeping vixen) is finally wide awake!" Céline said, greeting Maria with a mildly teasing tone. From there, as Maria inevitably reached the Main Lobby floor, Roul eagerly approached her, gently held her plump left paw-like hand, and then kissed her hand as he said, "Good morning, Mon beau renard (my beautiful fox). Did you sleep well?"

Obviously, Maria couldn't help but blush from such a romantic yet flirtatious greeting by the plump fox she was gradually falling in love with. However, she soon regained her normal composure and replied, "Why yes, I did, Roul. Thank you for asking." From there, Maria then took notice of the large and elegant 6 horse-drawn carriage waiting outside, where she then spoke toward Roul and asked, "...I take it that the carriage is going to take us to this "Airship" you spoke of yesterday?" "Pourquoi oui, mon cher (Why yes indeed, my dear)! I see that you're still assez perspicace (quite perceptive) as always, ma chérie." Roul answered, easily aware of Maria's keen sense of perception, obviously honed from years of experience as an Adventurer.

Shortly after greeting one another, Roul affectionately guided Maria out of his Manor estate and towards the luxurious carriage awaiting them,with Céline following closely behind, despite her rotund bulk and girth. Upon approaching the carriage, both Aimée and Aveline simultaneously opened both doors on the carriage's left side, thus allowing the 3 corpulent foxes to enter with ease. Being the kind and caring gentleman that he was, Roul allowed Maria to enter the carriage first, as she carefully ascended into the carriage interior. To her surprise, the carriage was much more spacious than she had originally anticipated, just as she was then accompanied by Céline, who sat opposite of her within the carriage. Finally, Roul eventually entered the carriage himself, where he then sat beside Maria within the carriage, as Aimée and Aveline then closed the doors and locked them, then proceeded to the front of the carriage, and take up the reins to control the 6 horses, ordering them to move forward, thus pulling the carriage in the process.

----------

Eventually, after 2 to 3 hours of traveling by carriage, they eventually arrived at their destination: The flying Airship known as "The Maiden's Wings", which was currently docked at a recently built Airship Port. "Well, there she is, mademoiselle Maria: Les ailes de la jeune fille (The Maiden's Wings)." Roul said, gazing out of the left window, prompting Maria to look out the same window as well, which caused her to have a reaction of shock and awe upon her plump vulpine snout, seeing the massive floating ship with her own two eyes. After all, even though she has seen massive Man-O-War ships before, Maria had truly never experienced witnessing such an unimaginable feat before: A flying ship.

Upon arriving at the Airship Port, Aimée and Aveline then unlocked the carriage doors to allow Maria, Roul, and Céline to proceed toward the Maiden's Wings. Roul was the first to exit the carriage, where he then assisted in allowing Maria to exit afterwards, since he was raised to use chivalry wherever he goes, while Céline was assisted by Aimée and Aveline. From there, once she was now on solid ground, Maria gazed upward towards The Maiden's Wings, completely astonished from how such a massive ship was capable of flight. "Impressive, is she not, ma chérie?" Roul said, causing Maria to be snapped out of her astonished stupor, where she then gazed at the bloated vulpine nobleman and replied, "...I'm sorry, Roul. Its just that I... Wow, I...I still can't believe that ship is floating in the air like that."

"*chuckle* Fret not, mademoiselle. This Airship is but a taste of what you will see at La Principauté des Monarques (The Principality of Monarchs)." Roul explained, where he then held Maria's plump right paw-like hand and gently guided her toward The Maiden's Wings, where they would enter the ship and embark on their to Roul and Céline's homeland, The Principality of Monarchs. However, before they could even advance any further, the group encountered a rotund male wolf steward, who kept record of anyone who proceeded into The Maiden's Wings via ledger booklet. However, judging from some of his snug attire, Maria could easily tell that the lupine steward was also from The Principality of Monarchs as well, just as she then heard him speak in his native tongue as he said, "Et qui pourriez-vous être, Monsieur (And who might you be, sir)?"

So, in response to his fellow countryman, Roul spoke toward him in his native tongue and answered, "Je m'appelle Roul Couture et je suis membre de House Couture. Sûrement, vous avez dû nous attendre, bon monsieur? (My name is Roul Couture, and I am a member of House Couture. Surely, you must have been expecting us, good sir)?" Shortly after that, the fat wolf steward scrolled through his ledger for confirmation that Roul and the others were on the list. Fortunately for the group, they were, as the obese lupine then gestured for them to enter The Maiden's Wings, waddling into the interior of the ship heading towards...

125.content:
Maria continues on her way, mood darkened by hunger. The lovely scenery surrounding her has become far less lovely through no fault of its own; the world always seems emptier when one has an empty stomach... For Maria, anyway. She stopped and sighed.

"Why didn't I pack any food? How can I forget food?" Maria asked herself. The orange vixen cursed her short-sightedness; she knew she was at least ten miles from the nearest town or village, and she certainly wasn't counting on finding anything on the way... But, oh well. Nothing to do but to soldier on. Maria trudges onward.

A few hundred yards later, though, she smells... Something. As a fox, she is somewhat more perceptive of such things as scents and sounds, She stops dead in her tracks to catch a deeper whiff of that "something," raising her muzzle skyward and inhaling deeply. Her nostrils flared a bit as she ascertained where the scent was coming from... In a few more moments, she'd be able to ascertain not just where it was, but also what it was...

"I smell..."
125.title: Scent of Adventure!  ...  Or Something

choices: James takes Maria to his den.
The 'intruder' shows up...
1251.content:
"... Another fox?" Maria asked, rhetorically. She took one more whiff, and caught the unmistakable scent of...

"A male fox," the vixen said aloud. She wasn't sure what to make of this. It was always nice to find a fellow fox. However, she was a bit uneasy about encountering a male fox, especially during this season, where they tended to be a bit... "Excitable." She'd be, more-or-less, alone with this male, and she wasn't sure if she'd be able to thwart any unwelcome advances...

Still, in this situation, Maria decided it'd be a better idea to find him before he found her. Obviously, if she was close enough to smell him, he was close enough to smell her. Getting the drop on him would stop any sort of ambush he could plan, and Maria could avoid some not-quite-welcome sexual penetration (at least take her out to dinner first; then she'd talk). She could smell where he was; it was only a matter of walking over there.

She departed from the trail and embarked into the wooded area on her left, tip-toeing through the brush quietly. Only fifteen feet in --much closer than expected-- she found the individual in question, crouching in a bush with his back to her. He was a svelte, similarly-colored fox, albeit a tad a brighter, wearing a light brown tunic with gray linen pants with a hole in the back for his bushy, white-tipped tail. The only weapon he had on him seemed to be a dagger that he'd strapped to his back loosely. He was staring ahead intently, completely engrossed by... Actually, it didn't really look like he was watching anything in particular.

Maria rolled her eyes; this was child's play. She simply plucked the dagger from the fox's back, rendering completely unarmed. The male fox yelped in surprise.

"Gah!" he cried as he sprung to his feet and turned around to meet his would-be assailant. He wasn't expecting another fox. "Who... Who are you?"

"Better question: Who are you?" Maria retorted, holding the male's dagger in her right hand to show him that she had control, here.

"I... Mean no harm, Miss... I-I'm James."

"Huh. So, what the hell are you hiding in the bushes with a dagger for?"

"I'd heard someone approach... I thought it was an intruder..." he eyed his dagger in the vixen's hand. "I was simply defending my home..."

"Okay..." Maria relaxed a bit, but not fully. He didn't seem to be very threatening, even if he was half a foot taller than she was. He was reasonably handsome, fairly mild... But she certainly wasn't giving him his dagger back.

"Please, Miss... I mean no harm. Especially not to a lovely vixen such as yourself..." James's tail swished a bit as he uttered the last sentence.

"Was I the intruder?"

"I don't think so... The 'intruder' had much heavier footsteps. I couldn't smell it, though..."

"Hmmm..." Maria sensed an opportunity, here. "I suppose I could take care of your problem... For a fee."

"You will? That would be wonderful."

Maria's stomach growled quite audibly at that moment. "... Sorry." Maria blushed a bit.

"Oh, no worries. You sound hungry, Miss... Would you like to follow me home? I can get you something to eat."

Maria's ears perked a bit at the mention of food. "That would be lovely, James. I'm Maria, by the way."

"Right, Maria... Let's get you fed, then we can discuss payment. Come this way, lovely lady..."

"Uh, right, James..." The fox was becoming just a bit enamored with Maria, and she wasn't quite sure she was comfortable with that... Still, a job's a job, and food is food. And there could be worse individuals to pursue her; all in all, James seemed to be a sweet guy... Well, from what little she knew about him, anyway. Either way, she wasn't worried about him; Maria was convinced that, if James became "rape-y," she could easily dispatch him.

James led Maria through the woods, weaving in between trees and bushes, until they came to a hillside...
1251.title: Finding a Fox

choices: "Adjourn to the living room to rest up before 'business?'"
"Discuss payment for dispatching the 'intruder?'"
12511.content:
"Well, here we are, Maria..." James said as he led Maria around the hill until they came to an opening framing a locked door. "Home, sweet home."

James produced a key from his pocket and inserted it into the lock, opening the door. "Welcome to my humble abode. After you, Miss."

The orange vixen obliged, steeping through the door and into James's den. Her foot-paws were greeted by smooth hardwood flooring, which was always nice.

"Lovely flooring, James," Maria said.

"Thank you. I've built this place myself... I haven't been here long."

She certainly didn't expect it; usually, a person living as a hermit, in a cave, no less, wouldn't bother with such things. However, James didn't seem to be your average cave-hermit; he'd put a lot of effort into turning his dwelling into a proper home. The second "civilized" touch Maria noted was the walls; James had not been content to leave them as dirt, so he'd fashioned a proper plaster wall, forming a perfect right angle with the floor, as well as the ceiling, which was also plaster, eight feet from the ground. The walls were covered in a tasteful red-and-white striped wallpaper, which gave a "stately" look to the place. They walked a bit farther inside, and James shut the door behind them. Maria remained wary, but not overtly paranoid.

They first came upon the "living" area of the den, a twelve-foot-by-nine-foot chamber lined with empty shelves, save for a few books scattered around them. A fireplace stood in the center of the long, right-most wall from the two, complete with a hearth and a tiny pot hanging from a spit inside. It wasn't lit, of course. Beyond the hearth was an ovular red carpet, surrounded by two armchairs to either side of a loveseat facing the hearth. They were comprised mainly of wood, with light-blue cushions covering the seats and backs. An end-table flanked the loveseat on both of its sides. It looked fairly cozy, to be sure; but Maria wasn't sure why James would even need so much seating...

A rising staircase was embedded in the wall opposite Maria and James, leading, obviously, to an upper floor. James wasn't taking "the tour" in that direction, though.

An open doorway in the left wall led into a ten-foot-by-ten-foot dining area, housing a dark-wood table surround by eight dark-wood chairs. There wasn't much to this room, but it did look like a nice place to eat. Another open doorway on the facing the living area door led into a kitchen and pantry. There wasn't much to this room besides a counter, a wood-burning stove... And several shelves lined with dry ingredients and cookware to the right of the room. James opened a small door on the left wall to reveal a "refrigeration" room, where enchanted crystals kept food at sufficiently-cold temperatures. He stepped inside to retrieve a medium-sized ham, which he placed in a pan and slid into the oven, which apparently contained more enchanted crystals that heated the food.

"It makes cooking so much easier," said James contentedly.

"Where did you get all of these crystals, James?"

"Before I moved in here, I took the liberty of purchasing them at the market in Welsengard. It was an 'Enchanted Curios' stall that piqued my interest... I also have some 'Lighting' crystals that I've yet to install."

"Interesting."

"And... Done!" James opened the oven and pulled out the ham, which was hot and steaming.

"Wow! It's... Finished?"

"Yes. Lunch is served, Maria." He took the pan and laid it on the table in the dining area. "Take a seat anywhere you like." Maria removed the sword from her back and lowered her shapely ass onto a chair facing the kitchen, watching as James escaped into the kitchen and emerged with two plates, two forks and a knife. He set a fork and plate before Maria, one fork and plate before himself at an adjacent chair to the vixen on the right side of the table and inserted the knife right into the ham. He sawed off a thick, slightly-fatty slice and placed it on Maria's plate, and then sliced off a substantially thinner piece for himself.

Maria wasted no time in tearing into her meal, the first substantial one she'd had in a couple days. She wasn't very ladylike, simply using the fork to lift the entire piece of meat to her face and ate it as if were a kebab, simply biting it and tearing off pieces. It was delicious; the fat had a sort of "nutty" flavor to it, and of course the meat was good, too. James smiled pleasantly as he watched her eat, only picking at his own piece of ham himself.

"I see you enjoy my 'cooking,' Maria," he said pleasantly.

"Mmm-hmm!" Maria uttered enthusiastically through a mouthful of pork.

"That's good to hear."

In moments, Maria finished her slice. She looked down at her empty plate; she was quite surprised that she'd eaten so quickly... And that she was still hungry. Before Maria could open her mouth to ask for another slice, James stood up to saw off another, even thicker slice, and placed it right onto Maria's plate.

"Oh! Uh, thank you."

"Of course, Maria."

She tore into this piece with as much enthusiasm as the last, and finished it just as quickly. James continued to dish her more slices of ham each time she finished the last, until the ham was gone. Luckily by that time, Maria's hunger was sated, leaving her to massage her slightly-distended belly which was peaking out from underneath her leather chest-plate, a modest white-furred dome with a shallow navel just below the center. Maria licked her lips and moaned contentedly, thoroughly satisfied by a meal for the first time in months.

"Are you full, Maria?" James asked as he cleared the table.

"Oh, my, yes!" Maria responded enthusiastically. She'd completely dropped all pretenses of being a "cold, hard warrior," and was now playing the role of "food-drunk house-guest."

James chuckled. "Excellent, Maria. Now that lunch is over, shall we..."
12511.title: James's Den

choices: "Good luck, Maria!"
"Wait, I'm coming with you..."
125111.content:
"... Adjourn to the living room to rest up before 'business?' I'm sure it'd be a good idea to let things digest before we work out any agreement," James said.

"Hmmm?.. Oh, yes. That sounds wonderful," Maria said hazily. She raised herself from her seat with her right paw, cradling her belly with the left, and stood, waiting for James's cue to take a seat in front of the fireplace.

"Alright; you go on over and get comfortable. I'll be with you in a moment, after I finish clearing the table."

Maria strolled over to the loveseat in the living room, leaving her sword behind in the dining room. She took the rightmost cushion, letting herself sink in as she admired the softness of cushion.

"Ooooooooh..." Maria moaned as she rubbed her gut with both paws. "So comfy..."

James appeared from the dining room moments later and made his way over to the fireplace. He deposited a few logs inside and lit them with a bit of flint. After stoking the flaming logs with a poker, he took the armchair to the right of Maria. "Ah, much better..." James shimmied a bit in his chair, and relaxed.

"This is such a comfortable loveseat..."

"Indeed, it is. You're more than welcome to put your feet up on the other cushion."

Maria decided to take him up on his offer and swung her legs up onto the loveseat. She wriggled her dainty vulpine toes as she settled herself into the loveseat, lying on her back and sighing contentedly.

"You have a lovely home, James."

"Thank you, Maria. So... Tell me about yourself."

"I hail from the town of Remgard; I was born and raised there... When I turned eighteen, I decided to leave and become a warrior so that I could see more of the world."

James nodded. "I see."

"There really hasn't been much for me to do, lately, though..." Maria admitted.

"I'm sorry to hear that, Maria."

"Jobs have been few and far between..." Maria shook her head. "Bah, I shouldn't be troubling you with my problems, James. I'm sorry."

"It's quite alright. So, where have you been?"

"In all honesty... Nowhere. It's been three years since I left my village, and all I've seen are forests, more forests, a couple of towns... And exactly one fortress. It wasn't even a very impressive fortress, either... No spikes, or a lava moat, or cannons... Just a one-story gray-brick building. There wasn't even anything inside..." Maria laughed. "Nothing! No chests, no tables, no chairs, no shelves... I wasn't sure if the previous warlord had moved out or if everything was just stolen... Anyway. I haven't explored nearly as much as I thought I would. I don't know why, exactly. I became a warrior to do just that, but I've never been given a reason to actually go anywhere..."

"I see... You know, Maria, I used to be an adventurer, too, a couple years back."

"Really, James?"

"Yes; I was a mage, though." James snapped his fingers, calling into existence a lone flame. He held it for a few seconds, after which it extinguished itself just as suddenly as it had appeared. "It didn't take long for me to realize I wasn't cut out for that life, though... I never liked traveling, much, and I never found pleasant company with any other adventurers I'd meet. So, after about a year of exploring, I just sort of... Quit."

"Wait... If you've got magic... Why do you need me to help you with this?"

"I don't have much magic... I can toss fireballs and freeze things, but I never got much farther than that," James said, shaking his head. "Why do you ask? Have you changed your mind?"

"No, no... Just curious, James," Maria said as softly as she could; she was afraid she'd offended him. "I didn't think a mage would need to hire a warrior for something as trivial as dispatching an 'unwanted guest,' even if that 'guest' turned out to be an ogre, or something..."

"True enough, Maria... But I don't think my meager spells could take care of something like an ogre. So, I will still require you. And even if I was capable of taking care of this myself, it's still nice to have company..." James smiled warmly at Maria, and Maria nodded back. "So, shall we discuss payment, as long as we're on the subject?"

Maria shook her head. "... Eh, you don't have to pay me..." she said before stifling a yawn.

"Really, Maria? That would be quite generous of you."

"It's fine. You've been very kind, so far, and I'd say that after I slay whatever troubles you, dinner and a place to stay the night will be ample compensation."

"Of course, Maria. I'd be happy to host you for tonight." James smiled. "You could even stay longer, if you'd like..."

"No... I couldn't impose upon you any longer than a night. In the morning, I'll be on my way, looking for something to do... I appreciate the offer, though."

James nodded, and a strange look came over his face. "You know, Maria... I might know of something you could do."

"Yes, James?"

"There's a cave somewhere north of here, across the river. It's probably full of monsters... And treasure."

"Hmmm."

"I don't know much about it, though... I'd gladly show you the way to it, though."

"That sounds wonderful. Thank you, James." Well, it looks like she'd finally lined something up: A bit of good old-fashioned dungeon-crawling.

"I don't suppose... That I could tag along?"

"You... Want to 'tag along,' James?"

"If it's a problem, I won't..."

"No, it's no problem. I just didn't think you'd want to go somewhere like that."

"Normally, no. But I suppose I'm feeling a bit of a residual 'itch' from my adventuring days. I can brush up on a few spells, and hopefully prove myself useful to a pretty vixen such as yourself..."

Maria nodded. It was always a good idea to have a mage around. And if nothing else, James would probably be pleasant company.

"Sure, you can come along."

"Thank you, Maria. I've been a bit lonely, as of late, and it would be wonderful to accompany a lovely vixen..." James was laying it on a bit thick with the flattery; it wasn't very strong flattery, as you can see, but still tangible enough to leave Maria the slightest bit uncomfortable.

It wasn't that she thought he'd "take advantage" of her, if given the chance. It was just that he seemed just a bit too "nice" to someone he barely knew. She certainly wouldn't be telling him what a "handsome fox" and "charming man" he was after knowing him for all of two hours... But, alas, some of her discomfort came from the fact that she wasn't sure she had much reason, herself, to withhold such flattery, nor did she understand exactly why she should be uncomfortable with the attentions of a sweet fox that genuinely seemed to like her and that, truth be told, she found herself attracted to. It was admirable of him to have offered her this hospitality, especially after she'd basically held him at dagger-point earlier. Even after such an incident, he trusted her enough to let her into his home...

She wouldn't even mind if he wanted to "do" anything with her...

Maria subconsciously shuddered as she stopped that train of thought dead in its tracks. Yes, he was a nice guy; yes, she trusted him somewhat... But it was far too soon to pursue a relationship. She wouldn't be adverse to such a relationship, but she decided that she shouldn't be considering such things in the heat of a sort of "mini-crush."

"So, I guess I should start looking for your 'intruder,' James," Maria said, dismissing herself from the mental debate she was having with herself.

"If you feel that you're ready, Maria."

"I am."

They both rose from their seats. Maria strolled over to the front door as James strolled into the dining room.

"Don't forget your sword, Maria," James said as he reappeared with Maria's weapon in hand.

"Oh; thank you, James."

James unlocked the door and held it open for her. She walked through it and turned to wave goodbye to James before she wandered off back into the woods to hunt James's beast.

James opened his mouth to speak...
125111.title: Rest and Relaxation

choices: Let's just address this now, before we go any farther...
No, don't say anything; awkward sexual tension is fun!
1251112.content:
"Wait, I'm coming with you..." James said as he stepped through the door himself and closed it behind him.

"Coming with me?" Maria asked. "You don't have to."

"I suppose, but I want to come along anyway. At the very least, I can take you to where I heard the 'intruder' last, and maybe get a bit of training in before our expedition, tomorrow. Do you not want me along?"

"No, it's fine if you come along, James," the orange vixen said. "I'd love for you to come with me. Just show me the way."

"Very well. Follow me..." James walks straight ahead, past Maria and into the forest. Maria follows close behind, silent. They weave between trees and climb over fallen logs for nearly an hour, until...

"Wait..." James says. The red-orange fox raises his muzzle into the air and sniffs a couple of times. "I... Smell something."

Maria follows suit, raising her own muzzle into the air, sniffing once while James looks on... And cringing as she catches a pungent aroma. James can't help but smile at the orange vixen's over-reaction. "Eeeeeeeeeeugh..."

"What do you think that is?"

"I have no idea... I've never smelled anything like it..."

A few thuds sound amongst the trees as an unseen creature lumbers about.

"I think we've found it, Maria..."

Within moments, the beast lumbers into view, revealing itself to be an enormous gray ogre. Standing over nine feet tall and at least 15 feet around its waist, it dwarfed Maria and James's heights of 4'5 and 4'11, respectively, and easily outweighed them at a magnitude of over ten times the vulpine duo's combined weight. It held a heavy, spiked club in its right hand, and a bulging burlap sack in its left, leaving no hand free to adjust its sagging fur loincloth. It looked from side to side, not seeing the two foxes before it; it seemed to smell them, though, as its nostrils flared wildly.

"Where..." it said.

"I've never seen an ogre before..." Maria remarked. "Are they usually this... Big?"

"They're certainly this tall, Maria... But I've never heard of one being this huge. True, they've never been renowned for under-eating, but... They don't get this fat."

The ogre slammed its club into the ground, the impact shaking the ground around it. It roared before fixing its eyes on Maria and James.

"FOXES!" it bellowed. "I MAKE YOU INTO BOOTS!"

It charged forward, club raised above its head. The lumbering oaf simply tripped itself, though, falling flat on its face as the vulpine duo stepped to the side. Now prone, Maria decided to take this opportunity to strike it in the back of the neck. She rose her sword high into the air and brought it down with all the force she could muster, severing the ogre's head from its body and ending the fight before it had even begun. A stream of verdant lifeblood flowed from the stump of its neck, covering the ground around the fallen ogre.

"That... Was anti-climactic," Maria said dryly as she sheathed her sword..

"That was amazing, Maria! So skilled, so swift!" James said exuberantly as he beamed at Maria, and Maria returned an awkward smile.

"Uh... Thank you." Maria rubbed the back of her own neck, blushing a bit at James's praise. "I... I wasn't that amazing..."

"Oh, but you were! You ended that beast before it could even swing once!"

"Right... Say, we should probably take that bag back to your house, James," the orange vixen said, pointing at the burlap sack in the ogre's lifeless hand. "It might contain something valuable."

"Of course, Maria. You can have whatever is in that bag; you've earned it, magnificent warrior!"

Maria simply nodded as she looked away; James was trying far too hard to be nice. It was getting hard for her to remain completely casual around him... She sighed.
1251112.title: Hunting Together

choices: They arrive at James's den an hour later.
Well, something's got to go wrong...  Monster attack from nowhere!
12511121.content:
"James?"

"Yes, Maria?"

"I get the feeling that you're... Attracted to me." Maria turned around and strolled a few paces.

"I suppose I am, Maria..." James admitted as he eyed the vixen's swaying ass. "Why wouldn't I be? You're a very lovely vixen."

The orange vixen turned her head to the side so that she could look at him. "Yes, James; you've told me that..." Maria said, perhaps a bit more brusquely then she'd have liked it to sound. "You've told me how lovely I am a few times, already."

"I'm... I'm sorry, Maria..." he said. James hung his head, feeling the sting of an apparent incoming rejection.

"Don't be sorry, James... I do appreciate your many, many compliments... It's just that-"

"... I'm making you uncomfortable... I'm sorry; I'll stop. You can still stay the night, if you wish."

"I'd still love to stay the night at your place, James. (Also, don't interrupt me...) And, yes, you are making me a bit uncomfortable... But not in the way you'd think."

"Oh?"

"James, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't the least bit attracted to you... You're a handsome fox..."

"Thank you."

"And you're sweet-as-can-be..."

"Thank you."

"... But you're far too... Hmmm..." Maria paused for a moment, looking for the words to say. "You're too subtle, and you're too unsubtle."

"I don't know what you mean, Maria."

"It's been obvious to me that you've been trying to be subtle... You've made no 'advances,' said nothing remotely sexual... And yet it's obvious that you want to."

"But, Maria-"

"Now, now... You're far too polite to ever do something like that, I know. So, instead, you heap praise and whatever kindness you can spare upon me, hoping that that will be a big enough 'hint.'"

"True enough, I suppose... You're... Quite good at this, Maria. You... See right through me..." James looked a bit uncomfortable.

Maria shrugged. "Call it a woman's intuition, I guess. Anyway... You don't want to be too forward, you don't want to impose yourself upon me... Which is refreshing, up to a point..."

"Right..."

"You don't want to 'make the first move.' You want me to do that..."

"Y-yes..."

"And normally, I wouldn't. But you know what, James?" Maria stepped around the ogre's corpse, coming right up next to James. "For you, I'll make an exception." Maria stroked the side of James's face gently with her left paw before giving him a quick peck on the cheek, making him blush. "It's not a very big first move, but hopefully it gets the point across."

"Th-thank you, Maria..." James whispered.

Maria winked at him and stepped away. "Now, the next few moves are yours, James." The orange vixen wiggled her hips and swished her brown-tipped tail.

"Of course, Maria." James slung the ogre's burlap sack over his left shoulder and came up beside Maria. He wrapped his right arm around Maria's shoulders and started to take the first step home.

"Good boy..." Maria said coyly. "But I was thinking a bit... Lower." With her right hand, she grabbed James's arm and guided it down her body, placing it right above her supple right buttock. "That's what I was thinking..." She threw her left arm over his waist and laid her head on James's shoulder, sighing contentedly.

"... Wow..." he said, eliciting a giggle from "his" vixen. He never thought his reserved nature and general mildness would ever get him this far so quickly. And truth be told, neither did Maria. They'd only met today, being perfect strangers not four hours ago. Relationships weren't supposed to form like this... And yet, one just did. There was just something about James... Something she couldn't put her finger on... Just something that felt so "right." Was this what you'd call "true love?"

"No, I'd better not go that far, yet..." Maria thought to herself, smiling. "What I'm doing now is 'risky,' but going that far is just dangerous... Let's just see where the next few days take us..."

The new couple set off for James's house, side by side...
12511121.title: Getting it Out in the Open

choices: "I suppose so.  I am pretty hungry."
"No, dinner can wait; looking inside of the bag shouldn't take that long."
125111211.content:
After an hour traversing the route they'd taken to the ogre, the vulpine duo arrived back at James's den. The sun threatened to set on them, but they knew that they still had an hour of daylight left. Not that it mattered much; James's home didn't have any windows, and they didn't really plan on spending much longer outside than they needed to.

"Well, we're home, Maria," James said, nuzzling the vixen's left cheek. "Let's head inside."

"Let's," Maria responded, returning James's nuzzle.

James produced the same brass key from earlier, approached the door and opened it. Maria entered first as she had before, followed closely by James and his burlap sack. Both foxes strolled over to the loveseat; James gestured toward it, inviting Maria to take a seat. After gingerly placing the sack on the floor nearby, James took his place beside Maria. They both leaned into each other, sighing and watching the fire in the fireplace that James had neglected to extinguish before they left.

The tranquility was broken, though, by Maria's gurgling stomach. She blushed as James ran his paw up and down her belly, still only mildly-distended from her generous lunch earlier.

"Are you hungry, love?" James teased. "I guess I should start making dinner. What would you like?"

"Hmmmm... Dinner sounds good. However, I'm also a bit curious about what's in the sack we brought back."

"I suppose I'm just a bit curious, too. Don't you want dinner first, though?"
125111211.title: The Evening Ahead...

choices: A fat, pink-furred vixen.  She's unconscious, tied-up, and naked...
A variety of objects:  Clothes, pouches, bedding...  And two ring-boxes.
1251112112.content:
"No, dinner can wait; looking inside of the bag shouldn't take that long," Maria said.

"If that's what you want," James said, reaching for the burlap sack beside the loveseat. He carried it onto the rug in front of them. "So, do you want to do the honors?"

"Gladly." Maria took hold of the bag and dragged it closer to the both of them. "It's much heavier than it looks..."

"Indeed; I have no idea what could possibly be in there. It didn't make a sound all the way over here. It can't be gold."

"Well, I guess we'll see what's in there right now, then."

Maria undid the draw-string at the top and opened the sack wide, revealing...
1251112112.title: In the Sack

choices: The rings flash; they're enchanted, of course.  Why wouldn't they be?
"Maria!  Dinner's ready!"
12511121122.content:
A pile of various objects, collapsing in on itself without the structure provided by the bag's walls.

"... What?' Maria asked rhetorically as her eyes took in the random assortment of things. "Where had that ogre been?"

"Hmmm... My best guess is that it managed to surprise a passing carriage and looted it..."

"Makes sense, I guess. Although one would think a carriage would have forethought to hire guards..."

"Either way, I think we can enjoy this for what it is, valuable or not..." James rummaged through the pile and took out a horrendously-rumpled Tyrolean hat with a broken red feather. He patted it for a moment, relieving the blue felt of its multitude of dents and pockmarks, and placed it atop his head, right between his ears. "I seem to have found a new hat."

Maria giggled at the remark and fished through the pile to find a hat of her own, coming up with a dented silver tiara. Placing both hands on opposite sides, she attempted to bend it back into shape, but failed. She shrugged, and placed it on her head anyway. "So have I," she said. James chuckled.

"Let's take a moment to spread this out, shall we?" James said. With both of his hands he pushed various objects around the red rug, only stopping when he was satisfied that he'd revealed everything that the bag had hid. Maria and James took a moment to see exactly what was in the bag.

To the left, farthest away, was a pair of black pants, clearly for a male, folded up surprisingly neatly; they looked a bit too large for James, though. To the right of that laid a another Tyrolean hat, this one made of green felt with white feather. James replaced the blue one on his head with this new green one. "I've found another hat," James said.

"I see," Maria said, giggling. "Such a lovely hat."

To the right was a mid-sized, gray leather pouch, bulging with unknown contents. "Now, what could be in there?" James asked, reaching for it. He picked it up and placed it between him and Maria, opening it to reveal that it was full of gold nuggets. "Oh!" they gasped in unison, each pulling out nuggets and examining them, confirming that they were, indeed, real. There had to be at least seven pounds of gold in there!

The couple quickly snatched up another pouch from the spread, a similarly-sized brown leather pouch, opening it to reveal somewhat less valuable contents: A variety of seed-bags, all unmarked but full of seeds. "I guess I could start a garden," James mused.

They shrugged and continued scanning the pile as they were; they'd open any more pouches as they'd come to them. They saw a set of blue satin lingerie, accompanying a similar nightgown which Maria picked up and pressed against her body. "Just a moment, James; I'm going to slip into something a bit more... Comfortable." James watched excitedly as Maria slipped out of her leather bodice, blue tunic and leather leggings, revealing Maria's own white-cotton lingerie, a well-filled bra but no panties.

"Do you like what you see, hon?" she said in a sultry manner, running her hands up and down her bare fur, especially spending time along her inner thighs. James nodded silently, eyes wide and mouth agape. Maria giggled. "I thought you would. Unfortunately, it all has to go away now..." Maria took the blue satin nightgown and pulled it over her head, letting it fall into place past her shoulders. It was quite a bit roomier than she'd thought it would be, hanging loosely around her ample bosom and shoulders. She was a bit disappointed to find that it didn't have a hole for her tail, though. She'd have to make one later. For now, though, she just lifted the gown to let her tail out spring out, and dropped it back down to let it hang on her bushy tail. "I've never owned a proper nightie..." she said as her tail wagged. "Still, though... I think I prefer to sleep nude." She flashed James a devilish grin; James blushed and took off his hat and placed it on his lap, hoping to conceal his burgeoning erection.

Maria sat back down on the loveseat, a bit closer to James than she was before. They continued looking through everything, but it seemed that they'd already seen everything that was remotely interesting. There were a few more Tyrolean hats (whoever the ogre had ambushed had some sort of fetish for them, it seemed), a few rolls of fabric, mostly woolen with only one roll of silk, another nightgown, a couple of tunics, a red leather pouch full of silverware ("Nice; I think we can make use of this."), a blue leather pouch full of spools of thread and sewing needles, a tiny bag full of silver coins ("43... 44... 45... 46 silver coins."), a pair of clean, red flannel comforters ("Ooooooooh... Soft."), a pink tablecloth, and a large, black leather pouch.

"Last pouch..." said James.

"Good; I'm getting hungry." Maria's stomach growled noisily.

"I know, love." James opened the bag and found a variety of magical paraphernalia. "Wow!"

He began to pull out a number of differently-colored potions, none of them labeled, what appeared to be a wand, a few pouches filled with "ingredients" such as nightshade powder and poison oak leaves, a couple of spellbooks ("These should be quite useful."), and a crystal ball.

The only object that had not been examined yet was a small white bag in the center of the rug. "Alright, love; this is the last thing here," James said.

"I'll get it," Maria said. She stood up and strutted over to the bag, and bent down to pick it up, intentionally shooting James a peek at her bare, supple ass. She grinned as she looked back at the fox, and raised her tail for good measure.

"Oh, my..." he gasped. Maria giggled. Satisfied with her display, she picked up the bag and returned to the loveseat.

"Alright, hon; open it."

"O-okay..." James did as he was told, reaching into the bag and pulling out a little velvet box. "Wait; there's another..." With his other hand, he retrieved the second box, holding one in each hand. With his thumbs, he opened each... And within each sat a sparkling diamond ring, one studded with rubies and other with sapphires. "I believe these are yours, love."

Maria was speechless, dazzled by the two rings in front of her. They seemed to shine with a light all their own. They certainly didn't look like any other rings she'd ever seen... No, these were far more beautiful. After a moment of stunned silence, James took Maria's left paw and slid the ruby-studded ring onto her ring finger.

"Oh, James... It fits perfectly!" she cried, as if he'd bought her these rings.

"Now, now... There's another one," he said as he took Maria's right paw and slid the first ring's brother onto her other ring finger. Maria held her hands before her, eyes darting from left to right, taking in the splendor of the two rings. She took her hands and brought them to her chest, sighing contentedly; she couldn't believe these were hers.

"They're... They're beautiful, James..." she gasped. James opened his arms and embraced Maria. She kissed him tenderly on his lips, and James blushed.

They sat silently for eight minutes, enjoying each-others touch... Until Maria's growling stomach broke the silence.

"I'm sorry..." Maria said.

"It's alright, love. Now's as good a time as any for dinner," James said, stroking her cheek. "I'll go get it started. You wait here."

"Okay, James."

He left the room, taking the red leather pouch and the pink tablecloth with him, leaving Maria on the loveseat. She kicked up her feet and laid down, waiting patiently for dinner. She gazed lovingly down at her new rings, admiring all of the gems embedded in the gold...
12511121122.title: A Bag Full of Random

choices: Dinnertime!
Well, the rings aren't quite done yet...
125111211221.content:
Minutes passed as the fire flickered in the fireplace and the vixen's stomach growled. Maria was as hungry as ever, to be sure, but she could ignore that; she was content. A hot meal would be forthcoming, and the day had delivered to her many things: A new adventure, a new boyfriend, a (possibly permanent) place to sleep, a bounty of treasure, and... These rings. These beautiful, beautiful rings...

The fox gave a quavering sigh as she held her hands aloft, angling each of the baubles at the firelight so that they could sparkle, shimmer and shine. Maria was quite enamored with her new "toys." She'd never owned anything nearly as glamorous (and presumably valuable) as the jewelry embracing her fingers and never believed that she ever could. How on earth could an ogre come across something like these? Could it even possibly know their worth?

… And who was dumb enough to travel through the woods without a bodyguard? “Shoulda hired me...” the vixen murmured. It occurred to her, for one fleeting moment, that these rings weren't really hers, but rather the stolen property of the poor, simple soul whom the ogre preyed upon, and felt the slightest bit guilty. Only a passing thought, though; it was quickly reasoned and rationalized away.

”I doubt the owner of all of these things is even still alive... Losing something outside of the borders of civilization means it belongs to the person who finds it... And I found it... And if they want it back, than they can just come take it.” All these thoughts flowed through her head as she lazily flipped her wrists at the dying fire. The rings sparkled, as they had all night, and Maria knew they were hers.

Among the sparkling of the ruby ring, a brief flash shone out, like a signal light calling to a distant ship. It startled Maria, not enough for her to rise from the loveseat, but enough to remove her from her dreamy haze. Both her eyes, wide open, fixed themselves upon the red stone, waiting for another unnatural flash. Moments passed without a sign of life, and the vixen began to wonder if she had simply imagined the flash, or if it was a simple trick of the light.

“I guess... It was nothing,” she simply stated. She halfheartedly held the suspect ring to the fire, trying to catch some light on the bauble. It had been slowly dying over the evening's progression; it would be mere coals in less than an hour. The fox sighed as she realized she'd have to get up to kindle the fading flame. It wasn't as if she would have any trouble doing so, but... She was so cozy.

As she shifted her body to rise from her spot, the ruby flashed again, more vividly than it had the last time. Maria jumped a bit, realizing she hadn't imagined the earlier flash; there was something “off” about the ring...

Her eyes would have remained fixed on the gemstone, but they were drawn to the fireplace. The dying flame she was about to rekindle had sprung back to life, crackling away without any sort of fuel. What was this?

“James..?” Maria called out, worry in her voice. “James?”

Moments later, he appeared in the dining room doorway, spoon in hand. “Yes, love?”

“James, do you... Is there anything... Magical, about your fireplace?”

“Aside from the positively-enchanting glow it casts on the room, no. It's just an ordinary fireplace.” James cocked his head at the vixen. What sort of question was that? Was she playing some sort of game?

“The fire was dying... And it sprung back to life...” Maria could tell that the fox wasn't quite taking her seriously; she'd be infuriated if she weren't so uneasy. “It did! Just look in the fireplace; the fire's been burning for hours! It shouldn't still be this bright!”

“Right, that's true...” James admitted. “It shouldn't still be this bright, but... Why would that bother you?”

Maria was getting just the slightest bit frustrated. “I'm... The fire was... Dying...” The vixen paused, frowning at the wall behind James as the confused fox stood watching her.

“Maria, are you alright?”

“Yes, I'm alright... I'm not crazy! It's...” The vixen stopped mid-sentence as the gears began turning in her head. “The rings!”

“The... Rings?”

“Yes, yes! The ruby was flashing! It flashed once, and then a few minutes later, it flashed again when I was about to rekindle the fire!”

“Flashing?”

“It flashed! James, I...” Maria gave herself a moment to calm down. “The ring flashed as I held it toward the fire, right as I was getting up.”

“I see...” James crossed his arms, unsure of what to make of all of this.

“... You don't believe me, do you? James, please...” Her voice quavered, betraying frustration and hurt. “Why don't you believe me..?”

James sighed. “I... I believe you, Maria. Please, calm down... You don't need to be upset.”

“You don't believe me. James... It was the ring.” She held the ruby ring to the firelight, trying to make it flash again. She wasn't even worried about the ring anymore. She just wanted to prove to James that she wasn't making this up. More than anything in the world, more than anything ever, she just wanted the fox to believe her.

The red stone sparkled pleasantly, as it had all night, but stayed otherwise inert. Tears formed in the vixen's eyes. “I must look like a fool...” she stammered.

“Maria!” James dropped the spoon and rushed to the vixen's side to comfort her. “Maria, it's okay, sweetheart... Everything is alright...” He threw his arms around Maria and nuzzled her cheek. “Maria, please don't cry... There's nothing to be upset about...”

“You're... You're right, James. You're absolutely right. I'm... I'm sorry.” She sniffled as she laid her face on James's shoulder. “I'm so sorry...”

“There's nothing to be sorry about, Maria. Nothing at all. I'm sorry that I made you cry...” James took the vixen's paw in his own, smiling. Maria returned his smile, and sighed.

“It's okay...”

“Now, feeling better?”

“Y-yeah. I... I don't know what happened. I was... I was worried.” The vixen held her rings aloft as if to emphasize the source of her worry. “I swear, the ruby...”

The sapphire ring, which had been quiet all this time, flashed twice. The two foxes froze as their eyes focused on the blue stone.

“James! The sapphire..!” Maria said. “Did you see that?”

“I... I did.”

They stared in silence at the sapphire before James spoke again.

“They're... They're probably enchanted, I guess. I'll have to look at them tomorrow.” Maria simply nodded in return. “In the meantime, you should probably take them off.”

“Yeah... I...” Maria gave the rings one last appraisal. She didn't want to take them off...

… But she wasn't a hobbit. She knew it was the best thing she could do, and complied shortly, placing the rings back into their boxes.

The vixen's stomach growled, bringing her attention to a hunger that had been silently building over the “ordeal.”

“... Is dinner ready yet?” she said quietly as she smiled weakly at James.

“Yes, it's almost ready. Just a few more moments.” He rose from the loveseat, pulling Maria up with him and gently leading her toward the dining room.

“All you need to do is sit down.”
125111211221.title: An Enchanted Evening

choices: Let's follow them, shall we?
An inopportune knock at the door catches the pair's attention.
1251112112211.content:
James pulled out a seat for Maria, which the vixen wasted no time in filling. It had been a full day, and she was eager for a proper, home-cooked dinner. She waited patiently as James began to set the table, some of the loot from today's haul finding its way into the dining room. He set to work draping the pink tablecloth over the dark oaken table, tugging it at its ends to relieve it of any wrinkles, and fetched two sets of the pilfered silverware. He placed one fork, knife and spoon in front of the waiting vixen, and beside her place at the table he set more cutlery; presumably for himself. He disappeared into the kitchen for a moment, and reappeared with a couple of empty plates which he set between the silverware. Disappearing a second time, he returned with a candlestick and accompanying candle.

"I figured it would be nice to dine by candlelight, hm?" James said.

"Yes, that sounds nice..." Maria answered flatly. While she certainly wouldn't mind eating dinner by candlelight, she was frankly more concerned with eating dinner at all to care about the lighting situation. She smiled sheepishly at James as her stomach rumbled. He chuckled.

"Don't worry, dear, it's coming..." He plopped the pewter candlestick at the edge of the table, slid the candle into place, and with a flick of the wrist and a snap of his fingers beside the wick, a small flame had been called forth to cast its light. The fox left without a word as the vixen looked on intently, hoping he would come back with what she so desperately desired.

Her hopes were answered moments later as James returned with one of the largest roasted chickens she'd ever seen, golden-brown and steaming, held aloft on a silver platter with a carving knife through its breast like Excalibur in the stone. The fox placed it mere inches from Maria's plate, watching with amusement as the vixen became transfixed on the bird before her. He left her with the meal's main course and returned to the kitchen, retrieving a bowl of mashed potatoes and a loaf of bread, and brought it back to the dimly-lit dining room to find the vixen already pulling away a drumstick from the chicken. James shot her a playful "disapproving" glare and the vixen shrank back into her seat as he tutted. "Now, now, Maria... Where are your manners?"

"I suppose I left them by the fireplace with my armor and sword..."

"Well, it's alright, dear; you needn't wait any longer." James placed the rest of the meal beside the chicken and set to work freeing the chicken leg the vixen had already started on from its meaty prison. With a bit of knifework and a tug, it came loose, and the reynard gingerly placed it on the vixen's plate. A little more knifework yielded a thigh; without needing to be asked, it too, was placed on Maria's plate. A heaping spoonful of mashed potatoes soon joined the meat, with a couple of slices from the loaf of bread rounding out the ensemble. The vixen salivated, staring at her plate like she'd not eaten in weeks.

"Please, dig in. I wouldn't want to keep you waiting any longer."

Maria, not needing to be told twice, immediately picked up the drumstick and bit into it. It was incredibly fatty; perhaps the fattiest chicken she'd ever eaten... And yet, absolutely delicious. The copious fat complemented the meat, melding together to make each bite rich and moist. The vixen even noted a certain sweetness about the flesh; odd, but not unwelcome. In only a minute flat, she was left gripping a greasy bone. She set upon the chicken's thigh, next; also incredibly fatty, also very delicious. She deigned to use her fork and knife for this bit of meat, taking one in each paw and quickly sawing the thigh apart, shoveling each bit of chicken into her eager maw as it was liberated. Soon, she was left with yet another bone.

"James, this is wonderful chi- James?" Maria looked up to find herself alone in the dining room; the reynard was neither serving nor seated next to her.

"Yes, Maria?" James called from the kitchen. He appeared a moment later gripping a pair of goblets and a bottle of wine. "Sorry; I'd just realized I'd forgotten our beverages." He set one pewter goblet beside the vixen and immediately began filling it, the wine bottle having been uncorked in the kitchen. He sauntered over to his own seat and did the same for his place, finally sitting down in front of his own plate, which he'd filled before leaving.

"Ah," he sighed, lifting his goblet to his lips and taking a sip. The vixen figured she should follow suit, and did so. The wine was very mild; not necessarily the best she'd had, but it did its job just fine, washing down the meat and warming her chest a bit as it slid down her throat.

"Thank you, James," she said quietly as she placed her goblet back down on the table. "The chicken was good, by the way."

James picked up his own chicken thigh and bit into it. "Hmm. A bit fatty," he stated, as he made the same discovery the vixen had only minutes ago.

"Just a bit... Where did that chicken come from, by the way? I've never seen one so large." The vixen hoped she might start up a bit of dinner conversation; although she'd rather be eating than talking, it seemed just plain wrong to allow silence between the two foxes who'd become romantically involved.

"Little Silverhorne, apparently. I picked it up at the market when I bought my crystals. The merchant practically gave it away, too; I only paid a couple silver for it."

"Really?"

"Yeah. He seemed like a jolly fellow; looked like one, too. Silverhorne must be doing well to produce chickens and merchants like that."

"They must."

"Would you like some more, Maria? Your plate is empty."

Maria looked down; apparently, it was empty. She'd devoured her serving without having noticed. "Sure, James."

The reynard carved a generous slab of meat from the chicken and placed it on her plate, which Maria immediately set upon as James returned to his seat. He looked on in interest as the vixen began sawing off bits of flesh and popping them into her mouth... Before she lost patience and just picked up the entire slab of chicken in both paws, bringing it to her face and ravenously tearing away a hunk with her teeth. She chewed, swallowed, and went back for another hunks... She immediately halted, though, as she realized she was being watched. Her face flushed as she gingerly placed the meat back on her plate.

"I- Uh... I was-" she stammered.

"No, it's fine! It's fine, it's fine. You're hungry, and it's just the two of us, after all. Please, continue."

Maria looked back down at her plate in shame as she picked up her silverware again to resume eating. What on earth had gotten into her? She'd NEVER do something like that!.. Not in front of a date, anyway... She slowly began cutting up her piece of chicken as she stammered out some awkward dinner conversation.

"So... Um, James. How did you get- Oh, James, I'm sorry. That was so rude, and-"

"It's perfectly fine, Maria. I'm not upset, and I want you to eat your fill however you please," James interrupted. "Go on."

"Well..." The vixen brought her slab of chicken back to her muzzle as she eyed James cautiously. "If... If you're sure..." She resumed eating like a wild animal, meat disappearing down her throat at an alarming pace, only sparing the bones.

James simply smiled, getting up to carve Maria another generous portion before returning to his seat to watch the show.



"Thank you for dinner, James..."

"You're quite welcome, Maria..."

Twenty minutes found the pair still sitting at the table with a pile of bones, an empty bowl and a loaf of bread which had vanished between then and now, with only the wine having survived the vixen's glut. James loving stroked the vixen's taut, distended belly, her nightgown lifted to expose it as the vixen leaned back in her chair, utterly satisfied. She was positively stuffed, fuller than she'd been in years. She placed her own paw on the white-furred dome, a bit shocked to feel the damage she'd done... Maria easily avoided his crushing blow, which send grass and dirt flying everywhere. From the corner of her she saw James running down the hill like the wind, like the coward he was; but Maria didn't expect him to help her in this fight. She was alone.

She dodged yet again as he came up with a anger-fueled side swipe. "Stand still!" he barked, frustrated. But Maria was trying to get around the brute, to reach his back and drive her sword into it. If only she had a spear; the stabbing would have been much more easier then.

She was finally able to catch him unaware and delever a swip with her long short at his upper leg. It went deep, but the wolf only grunted with pain. It would take much more than that to bring him down.

Maria danced with the barbariqn down the hill, avoiding his crushing blows with ease. He began to breath heavily; Kovan was getting tired, a good sign for Maria.

She drove her sword forward.

Now was her chance to finish him, to drive her sword through hid back and straight into his heart, but his neck was unprotected, though, and Maria thought to herself: "Why kill him like that when I could make the victory more fun?"

When the blow was only inches away, the wolf's right paw, which was covered in a steel glove, lashed out and caught Maria's sword with a loud KLANG.

The fox stood dumbfounded. The sword did go through the glove and cut the paw underneath, but it was not very deep.
