"I don't know about humans, but this stuff isn't to my tastes. Still edible, though."

"I don't care if it doesn't taste the best. It's food."

Richard ran to the wall directly opposite the door and started scraping off handfuls of goop and bolting them down. Before long, he'd made a hole big enough to climb through.

"You know, I can see two ways to get through here. We could either navigate the maze, which would take longer and might result in us running into traps. On the other hand, given your obvious hunger, and the fact this stuff doesn't seem to be filling you up very quickly, you could just eat a series of holes through the walls until we get to the other side of the maze."
1331112.title: They dodge a trap or two and enter a large room.

choices: Wait.
Try to find a way around the wall, try to find Richard on the other side?
13311121.content:
Johanna never liked mazes. She always thought that they were just silly puzzles, meaningless to most, and even more meaningless to a warrior like her. She always thought they required more sheer dumb luck than actual thought and planning to solve, and as they went deeper and deeper into this vast labyrinth she felt it was even more true now.

Every time they came to a branching path or a crossroads she couldn’t help but to be filled with anxiety. What if they were choosing the wrong way? How would she remember where she was going? What if they were just running about in circles? Hours were starting to pass by, and she was beginning to reconsider just having her and Richard eat their way through when she turned yet another corner and noticed something ahead of them. As the two drew closer, it became more apparent that it was a pedestal, and as they got close enough to see that the walls curved about it, forming a small, circular courtyard of sorts, they both saw quite clearly what lay on top.

The stone pedestal rose up to their midsections (Or Richard’s midsection at least, Johanna was quite a bit taller), and upon it sat a pristine, white porcelain plate. Yet, atop of that was what really drew their attention: A beautifully arranged and decadently prepared stuffed turkey, larger than even Johanna had seen in her barbarian homeland. Both of their stomachs growled eagerly as they caught sight of the meal.

“This…” Johanna said hesitantly, the pudgy wolfess licking her lips as she drooled slightly, “Is obviously a trap… we… we should just turn around and head the other way. Come on Richard…”

She turned to look at her companion, ears perking as she saw that nobody was standing beside her.

“…yelp?”

She turned her attention to the pedestal as she heard the sound of ravenous eating and saw her rogue friend gnawing away at the turkey, not even bothering to use his hands to assist in his consumption. She stood there momentarily, mouth agape, before growling viciously, still drooling with her own hunger.

“Richard! You get your stupid hide back here before you get us both…!”

Just then she noticed that the circular jelly walls of the “room” the turkey and Richard were in began to extend, seemingly growing into a wall between the two adventurers. Johanna ran towards her companion, but was too late as she bounced off of the newly formed barrier and landed on her plush ass. She growled even more viciously as she pulled her axe from its harness and slammed it into the wall, intending to cut her way through. Unfortunately the wall seemed much thicker and the blow she delivered to it barely even managed to make a dent. Even worse, the jelly comprising the wall almost instantly regenerated. Richard was now sealed off from her.

“Dammit!” She roared, swinging again and again at the blockade with her mighty axe, but to no avail. Eventually she just gave up, panting and grunting, and simply sat on the floor. Maybe if she had been as thin as she was earlier she’d have the energy to cut through…

Johanna sighed as she looked at the floor, letting her axe free from her grip, letting it clatter against the floor. She hated mazes.
13311121.title: The Bad Thing about Mazes…

choices: Keep moving forward, this is an obvious trap and a distraction.
Head towards the soup room and investigate. Only an idiot would fall for it.
133111212.content:
Johanna was still catching her breath as she sat there, trying to figure out what to do. She could just eat her way through, but that’s what this damn maze wanted. Eating any of this maze, for any reason as far as the wolfess was concerned, was a last ditch option. It was something she didn’t want to try right now, and if she was fast enough, she wouldn’t have to.

She got up, picked her axe back up to sling it over her back, and ran back down the path they came from. This time though, she turned down a different path, using her sense of direction to try and maneuver through the maze and back around to the other side of the turkey room and to Richard. She was fairly certain the she was heading in the right direction, but with such devious things as labyrinths, she could never be completely sure.

She turned this way and that, running quickly, quite aware that it was far more taxing than it used to be. She tried to ignore her newfound burdens though, keeping her mind on her companion and his expedient rescue. Her train of thought was soon interrupted however when she came to a crossroads in the maze.

She knew that she had to keep moving forward to reach Richard, but her keen lupine nose couldn’t help but pick up the amazing scent that was currently wafting down the left path. She stopped in the middle of the crossroads and looked in the scents direction, seeing a similar pedestal to the one from before. She knew this one didn’t hold a turkey though, and her nose was proved right when she saw a rather large bowl carefully perched upon the pillar, filled to the brim with hot soup.

Oddly enough, she couldn’t identify just what it was, and although it smelled like meat, she couldn’t be too sure. Whatever it was though, it smelled heavenly and made her drool once again, almost irresistible.

Almost.

But her mind returned to Richard, something that gave her even more motivation to ignore this obvious trap. Just as she was about to continue straight through the intersection though, she caught sight of something scattered about the soup room that made her rethink her choice. They appeared to be small bones, fresh with gnawed meat still clinging to them, possibly belonging to a chicken…

Or a turkey.
133111212.title: Pavlov’s Wolf

choices: He responds
He does something else
1331112121.content:
Sprinting past the obvious trap, Johanna continued through the maze until she was too exhausted to move. She sat down to catch her breath. When she stood back up, she was greeted by a figure off in the distance.

"Richard!? Is that you?" She called. She approached the figure and realized it was a hooded man. "Who are you?" She questioned, preparing for a attack. The hooded man just laughed in responce. Before Johanna could respond, she felt something grab her from behind. Struggling to break free from its iron grip, the thing then took a chunk of the wall next to them and forced it down her throat. Pain shot through her already stuffed belly as it was stretched even more. Johanna tried to resist as much as possible, but only exhausted herself. The hooded figure's hands started to glow and Johanna felt not as full. Looking down, her eyes laid upon her mammoth stomach. It sagged way past her knees and stuck outward 5 more feet then it did yesterday. The process of force feeding carried on for 10 more minutes, and when the thing dropped her, she was HUGE. Her stomach stuck out 3 meters, her limbs were as thick as a tree, and four chins rested on her face.

The next thing she knew, Johanna was in some castle-like place. She tried looking around but couldn't move her head much. See that she was alone, she started bawling her eyes out. Her days of adventuring were over; Her family would reject a blob like her. Suddenly, a door opened behind her. "Hey!" She screamed. Then something crawled ontop of her gut. It was the hooded man. A smile crept across his face (but Johanna couldn't see it) "Why are you doing this?!?" She said.
1331112121.title: Keep moving forward, this is an obvious trap an...

choices: Drink the soup.
1331112122.content:
Hesitantly, Johanna walked down the hallway leading to the soup, extremely wary of the bowl, yet too worried about Richard to pass up any leads to his location within the maze. She figured that as long as she kept her guard up and ignored the smell entirely, that it shouldn’t be a problem. Her willpower was like a solid rock, and the wondrous aroma a persistent ocean: As long as she didn’t dawdle it wouldn’t be able to wear her down in such a short time.

She was about halfway there when her self-control became more comparable to a salt-lick.

Her pace quickened, the dangerously inviting scent filling her nose now, using it to effortlessly ensnare its lupine owner. By the time she reached the podium that the bowl of soup was situated upon, drool dripped from her mouth and her tail was wagging uncontrollably behind her already cushier rump. She was lucky to still have the foresight to slow her pace as she neared the room, otherwise she would have simply crashed into the pedestal and its contents.

She stood there, licking her lips as she looked down at the soup, the bones scattered about her boots all but forgotten. It looked almost as inviting as it smelled, the surface smooth and glassy, a dark red it seemed, reminding Johanna almost of an alluring pair of lips. Even though soft wisps of steam wafted up from the bowl, hinting at the comforting warmth of its contents, she could still see her canine features reflected atop it. Somehow she looked even more beautiful than the last time she had seen her reflection, hell, she couldn’t even recall the last time she had seen herself. Maybe she hadn’t seen it before at all? It sounded ridiculous, but that was the only explanation her mind could reach, not even once realizing that it could have been some wicked glamor.

She leaned over the bowl, placing both of her paws on each side of the pedestal and gripping it firmly. As she drew her snout even nearer, the incredible scent grew even more fantastic. Her senses were already filled with ecstasy, just imagine how it would taste!

She lowered her snout, her reflection drawing closer to the soup’s surface as if to meet her in a kiss, and knew that she had little choice…
1331112122.title: Getting Sidetracked

choices: Right
Left
13311121221.content:
Johanna lowered her lips to the soup, using all remaining self control to simply not shove her muzzle into the stew and immediately pig out.

As soon as the first drops hit her lips however, all reason for restraint seemed to evaporate into thin air like a mirage, a meaningless illusion. The taste had to have been the highlight of her entire life! Everything just had to have lead to this unparalleled excellence that she now found pouring down her eager throat. If she had to describe the taste, she would fail. The only way to come even close was to say that it was the best of every soup that had ever met her taste buds: She could pick out savory beef, sweet corn, and the creamy richness of tomato, amongst countless others! She was so lost by the exquisite joy splashing across her tongue that she failed to hear the gelatin walls of the maze closing off all entrances to the room

And the warmth! By the gods, it was so welcome! She suddenly realized how cold the maze was, and how much she needed this hot, heavy feeling in her belly. It was beyond comfortable…

She just couldn’t stop herself from consuming the stuff, she couldn’t even think of stopping. And it seemed that the soup didn’t want itself to stop either. The bowl, already large to begin with, seemed as though it wasn’t emptying in the slightest, even though Johanna seemed to have drank gallons of the stuff already. Yet this oddity was only a passing thought in Johanna’s brain, just barely noticed between the indulgent pleasures that the delicious substance was giving her.

Even more unnoticed was just how full she was getting. Well, not full exactly, as her belly seemingly continued to stretch and stretch below her, but fuller. Her stomach bulged like an overripe fruit, wobbling grotesquely as it filled with more of the wicked stew and stuck out below her leather top, causing it to ride up closer and closer to her breasts. Speaking of her leathers, if she was more aware of herself right now they would have felt far tighter than even moments before. She might have even noticed the still thin yet increasing layer of flab now spreading about her body.

It wouldn’t have mattered anyways. Nothing mattered but keeping the flow of soup going down her gullet and into her endless, gluttonous belly. It was a marvel that she didn’t drown in the stuff with how voraciously she was eating, but that was the only sign of some kind of intelligence from the barbarian wolfess, for her mind was in another place entirely now. Her thoughts were lost in a heavenly sea of delight, a road of endless happiness.

Yet there was something far down that path, hidden in the deepest parts of her brain, nagging at her. A choice…? Or a crossroads?
13311121221.title: Liquid Paradise

choices: Johanna awakens, but in the last place she would have expected...
While the barbarian sleeps Richard finds himself hopelessly lost!
133111212211.content:
Johannaâ€™s thoughts were lost in a fugue of the most absolute and purest pleasure she had ever felt. She would have never, in her wildest dreams, have imagined that paradise wasnâ€™t a place you were sent to for achieving a warriorâ€™s death, nor was it a state of mind obtainable through patience and enlightenment, but instead it was tangible, reachable, and so very delicious. Sure, even in her current state the wolfess had realized that there were other things to life than guzzling the bottomless concoction before her, but that was a long time ago, and everything else seemed so far awayâ€¦

Even if she could push aside her complacent happiness , even if she had remembered who Richard was, and even if she desired to rescue him it would be useless. While the wolfess may have lost track of how long she had been indulging her gluttony, but the reality of it was she had been gulping warm, fattening soup for nearly three days straight now, and such things can be exceedingly unforgiving on oneâ€™s body. By this point she couldnâ€™t even get to her feet, let alone walk, due to how enormously obese she had become from the enchanted stew. Yet still she didnâ€™t noticeâ€¦ couldnâ€™t notice, not while there was broth still left within the bowl.

Quite unfortunately for her however said bowl had a ways to go before it was completely empty, but Johanna didnâ€™t seem to mind one bit. She also didnâ€™t seem to notice that, now that her arms had become completely and uselessly enveloped by fat, the soup had been assisting the barbarian in its consumption. Despite the fact that the basin was far from her mouth now, balanced perfectly between her massive breasts, the soup still flowed to her mouth, the mixture cascading up her multitude of chins like a preternatural waterfall. If Johanna had been in the right mind she might have recognized this devious enchantment for what it was, but then again she might have been far more concerned with her lack of mobility, or for that matter, decency.

Her leather armor had been torn to pieces the day she was hooked and what undergarments she had were ripped apart not long after by her slowly growing bulk. Her breasts now sagged atop her belly, each one bloated immensely and crowned by a plumpened nipple. Likewise, there was no longer anything to cover her rear, leaving the crack that separated each rounded, fattened buttock clearly and shamelessly visible. If Johanna had been focused enough to care, however, she might have been at least somewhat grateful for the fact that at the very least all of her wasnâ€™t completely visible. Her crotch may not have been covered by clothing any longer, yet it still lay hidden from view beneath her massively soup-engorged belly along with the pillar the bowl had originally rested on, now crushed beneath her flabby paunch. Despite all of these dramatic changes to her body, Johanna remained blissfully ignorant, though that wasn't to last longâ€¦

Even in her uninhibited, intoxicated state, Johanna couldnâ€™t help but notice as the last remaining drops of the intoxicating soup rolled up her chins and past her plump lips, and for the first time in three days, thought of something other than filling her gut. Unsurprisingly, after having been awake days on end and having a belly filled to capacity with warm, heavy soup, that first thought was of sleep. The massive, immobile lupineâ€™s eyelids slowly fell closed as she drifted off almost immediately into a deep doze.



         Johanna slept on, her slumber deep enough to last for a long while, and her snoring loud enough to make the gelatin walls around her quiver and quake. Drool and slobber dripped past her lips unrestrained besides when she occasionally and instinctively licked them clean. Between snores she could be seen smiling, or heard moaning, lost in a dream and unable to notice the immense changes she had undergone nor the visitor that now approached herâ€¦

Such merciful ignorance would not last forever though, and as he walked around the slumbering, helpless wolfess, the robed figure examining her mountainous body, the owner of the dungeon knew as much. The Lipomancer ran his fingers through her fur, unable to stop a grin from spreading across his shrouded face, imagining the moment she would awaken and relishing it. Heâ€™d enjoy watching her panic as she tried in vain to lift her flabby arms and reach the ground with her legs, only stopping when she finally gave into her fate.

He had big plans for his new captive, but even as he tenderly rubbed her flabby rolls he let her sleep, allowing her to enjoy a last moment of peace before she began her new life in the lair of the Lipomancerâ€¦
133111212211.title: Never Enough Soup for a Hungry Wolfess

choices: Sit back and let the feeding continue in order to avoid straining herself
Find some way to resist...
1331112122111.content:
Johanna shook her head groggily, sniffling a bit, eyes blinded by a bright white light. She shivered a little as she awoke, realizing that wherever she was it was much too cold, but also recognizing it as a chill she had not felt in quite some time: The cold bite of deep winter winds. Her eyes widened as she suddenly understood what this meant; that not only was she outside of that abysmal maze and the dungeon itself, but also in a place she hadn't been in years.

She found herself in her home village to the far north, and she felt comfy and at peace as her fellow wolves surrounded her. To her utter shock, but not unpleasantly so, they welcomed and praised her! They gave her gifts and showered her with affection and glory, as though she were a long lost hero returning from distant lands. She didn't realize how odd this situation felt, but instead she herself felt odd' as though she were different, bigger than how she normally felt. Was she taller, perhaps? Did it symbolize her larger-than-life status amongst the townsfolk?

It didn't matter now, as all the wolves were cheering at her, and her heart soared with elation, pure happiness filling her very being! She smiled proudly as they chanted her name, patted and rubbed her firmly with paws begging for a chance to feel the triumphant barbarian wolfess for themselves, and, most pleasing of all, brought forth platter upon platter of warm and wondrously scented food. She drooled, not even having to lift a finger as delicious gifts of tribute were brought to her lips and fed to her tenderly with care and reverence. Cakes! Pies! Cream! And meat, so much delicious, savory meat was fed to her as the wolfess hungrily devoured it all with little thought, moaning softly as she indulged herself in her glorious reward.

'Reward for what though'?' She caught herself thinking, but pushed such thoughts away. There were vague memories of traps and perils and the promise of riches, and this served as a suitable enough explanation to her. Clearly she had brought back wealth and renown to her once humble home and been praised for it, hailed as a champion! And even... forgiven?

Now she found herself actively fighting to ignore her thoughts as she consumed her gifts more voraciously, not caring at all as she spilled crumbs, juices, and chunks down her chin as the villagers feeding her struggled to keep up. Soon she did not even care what was brought before her mouth as she mindlessly ate like a starved beast, trying to distract herself, trying to forget her painful thoughts and just eat and be happy. She was doing well too, that is at least, until she was brought something that she could not ignore, that brought her back out of her fugue in an instant:

A piping hot bowl of dark red soup that was laid before her.

'What...?' The lupine barbarianess gasped uneasily as she caught sight of the familiar steaming stew, her mind filling with disturbing memories as a terrible realization began to dawn upon her.

'No'' She whimpered, starting to comprehend how helpless she felt, how foolish she'd been as she looked at the wolf people who surrounded her, 'N-No' please' take it away!'

But the men and women of her village did not obey, instead grinning wildly as they all gazed at her and chanted in unison, 'Eat! Eat! Eat! EAT!'

Johanna whined in protest, trying to object to their demands, but finding that all that came out of her lips were panicked, almost strained gasps and pants. She tried to avoid looking too closely at the steaming hot soup as it rested in front of her, afraid of what she knew she would see, but once she caught a glimpse out of the corner of her eye, she was transfixed. What she saw inside of the bowl made her howl in horror and dismay.

Staring back into the wolf's face was the reflection of what she at first believed to be a different woman. Her furry cheeks were rounded and even sagging slightly with fat, her lips plump and lustrously wet with drool, and the remains of meals hastily and sloppily consumed dripped messily down her many chins. No, it wasn't another wolf whose face was reflected in that dark, liquid mirror at all, no matter how much Johanna wished for it to be.

The wolfess cried out in shock, trying to push the bowl away herself, but finding that her arms would not even move. As she looked down, still grunting and gasping for breath, she noticed that not only was she completely naked, but that the bowl of stew was resting between greatly bloated breasts and atop a disturbingly immense stomach that spilled onto the ground in front of her and obstructed her sight. As she looked over what parts of her body she could, she soon realized that she couldn't move her arms at all simply because they were too heavy and swollen with fat. Even as she tried to take this all in, her breathing growing even more stressed and heavy from her increasing terror, the villagers continued to chant, sounding more eager now, growing impatient.

'EAT! EAT! EAT!'

She tried to look away from them all, tried to shake her head in denial as her heart pounded ever faster, but was distraught when she realized that she was far too obese to do even that, the many rolls of blubber that was now her 'neck' restricting all but the slightest of movements. As such, she could see all too well what was happening as the soup resting on her heaving, gelatinous belly began to squirm and then rise. The wolf's eyes widened in terror and recognition as the soup began to form into a thin tentacle that moved towards her lips, and she shut them firmly as it prodded at them, seeking entry as the crowd's chanting grew feverish and fanatic.

But then Johanna noticed something even more terrible as she heard their shouts, realizing that not only were their cheers changing in tone, but wording as well: 'Eat us! Eat us! Eat US!

As they shouted this bizarre mantra, Johanna's near constant fright was momentarily replaced by stunned confusion. She started to wonder just what was going on, for the first time trying to apply logic to this increasingly strange situation, when she noticed that all the villagers' pelts were turning a deep dark red. The wolf woman tried to push her feet against the ground, trying to flee but failing to even stand, gasping as her former kin began to melt into puddles of hot, frothing stew and swiftly oozed their way towards her immobilized form.

Johanna tried her best to keep her lips sealed shut, but as the new tendrils of soup from the former crowd joined the liquid from the bowl she found she could do little to stop what was now a torrent of soup pushing its way effortlessly down her throat.

Overcome with terror, Johanna's breathing quickened and strained even more against both her vast girth and swelling panic, her heart racing dangerously as she tried to think of a way out of this horrifying mess. With the immense amount of thick, creamy stew that was flowing inside her, it wasn't long before her gut began to grow painfully taut, despite its ridiculous size. She had to think of something soon, but what could she do when she was helpless to even lift a paw to save herself?
1331112122111.title: Homecoming

choices: Pleasant surroundings with lavish decorations...?
A dark, grimy, filthy cell...
13311121221112.content:
Johanna could do little to stop herself from panicking in her current situation; hell, she could barely even move! But as the pain in her already tremendously swollen gut grew, she knew that she needed to do SOMETHING fast or else she might pop like a big, fat wolfy balloon.

The mass of hot, delicious soup was unending, mercilessly continuing to gush and flow past her lips even as her fat gut grew firm and heavy. Even as she was forced to devour the first wave of townsfolk, more and more gathered around her only to melt into broth as well, joining their companions in filling the barbarian's belly. The bloating wolf woman squeezed her eyes shut tight as she tried to focus through the growing discomfort, her mind flooding with almost as many frantic thoughts as there were villagers flooding into her maw. Johanna whined as she attempted to move her paws in any way she could, but found that all she was able to use them for was gripping her now painfully distended stomach. Her efforts to close her mouth were fruitless as well, though she didn't expect it to do much good against the unrelenting tide of soup anyways.

Thus the wolf woman did the only possible thing she could think of at this point: Simply try to stop swallowing the stuff. Johanna took a deep breath and gagged as hard as she could against the insistent flow of stew, and though at first she was less than successful, she continued to try. The Barbarian was putting as much strength as she could into coughing up the fattening fluid before it brought her to an untimely end. Yet as she continued to struggle she started to panic even more, her vision beginning to cloud from the effort and strain of an action that seemed so simple. Even as she managed to stop the flow of soup, the hot, rich liquid sputtering and spilling from her lips, her vision began to fade until it dimmed completely to black. Suddenly she could feel her breathing quickening, her eyes snapping open as she found herself in...
13311121221112.title: Breaking Free, but Not in the Way She Thought...

choices: Try to get some information out of her.
Perhaps she can be convinced to help Johanna escape?
133111212211121.content:
A heavy groan escaped Johanna's plump lips as she slowly came to. Her vision was still fuzzy at first, but judging by the warmer temperature she could already tell she was no longer in her homeland. She was beginning to think, to immense relief, that all of that was just a horrible nightmare she was now free of. Unfortunately for her she was starting to realize that the reality preceding such a dream wasn't much better.

As her eyesight adjusted various decorations and furnishings came into view; plush couches, silken drapes, shelves stocked with row upon row of books, and the dim candelabras that cast a flickering light across the room all seemed to suggest that she now found herself in some kind of parlor. The decor might have been a bit different, but as she noticed a sculpture of heavyset panda girl sitting on one of the tables across from her it only confirmed what she knew: She was still probably stuck in that bizarre and fattening dungeon.

Yet despite the sophisticated nature of her surroundings, there was something else unsettling about the place besides the obvious. Perhaps it was the poor lighting, or the subtle signs of age shown by a cobweb here or there, but whatever it was made the wolf girl feel uneasy. Remembering that she still hadn't found Richard yet, she decided that it might be best if she get a move on.

Getting to her feet, the wolf woman... realized... wasn't going to be easy.

Or possible.

"What...?" She grunted past soft but heaving pants.

As Johanna looked down past her fat-swaddled neck, she saw only her tremendous belly before her, a vast sea of exposed white fur. Her mouth hung open as her panting increased and she looked about the room.

"Oh no... how could I forget...?!"

She whimpered as she grabbed her belly in her pudgy paws, grimacing in dismay as they sunk into it. She wasn't as nearly as fat as she had become in her dream, but she was still pretty damn big, and still immobile. She had, perhaps foolishly, hoped that her stupid mistake and thus the resulting gain were all part of the dream as well.

"No, no, no, nooo..." She whined, "How could I have been so dumb! Huff... I should have known, I shouldn't have trusted such strange food!"

"But that's the best kind..." a feminine voice whispered into the wolfess's ear from behind, "Much more interesting, wouldn't you say...?"

Johanna gasped sharply, instinctively trying to look at the owner of the voice and finding it to be as useless as it was in the dream. Unable to turn her neck or body much all she could do was ask, "Who are you...?"

"Hm, who am I? Droll, boring, I already know who I am... Now who YOU are is infinitely more fascinating," the voice muttered before Johanna felt a cold, gloved hand grope one of her mammoth and exposed buttocks.

The tremendously obese barbarian let out a surprised and thick yelp, a warm blush filling her face as she was grabbed, "You let go of me fiend! Huff... grrr... I swear I will chop that hand off!" She growled, losing the fierceness in her voice almost instantly as the woman's hand remained firmly grasping her rump, squeezing it and lifting the cheek. The wolfess's ears drooped as she realized she had no way of enforcing her threat at such a large size, her spirits falling even further as she felt how much this person's grip sunk into her pudge.

"Relax please, you're distracting me," The voice responded flatly as she let go of Johanna, causing the fat buttock to bounce, "Mmm, yes, as I thought, quite heavy. Excellent accumulation. Soup is as effective as I had hoped."

Johanna's ears perked straight back up, "...Soup? You are the one who made the soup? Hrf... Are you the owner of this place?"

"Ha. No, no, just a chef. Best chef," The voice said with pride, the first hint of emotion Johanna had noticed from her, "I think of recipes, mixing the culinary and the arcane," She stated before Johanna felt two hands placed firmly upon the rolls of her back and a soft warmth in between, "Oof! Odor potent. Subject must have been in state of ingestion for days before Master had her moved."

"Wait a minute..." The wolfess said as her expression soured, "Did you just say that I stink...?"

"Yes, most definitely," The voiced replied without hesitation, and Johanna could feel her warm nose sniffing at her again, "Mmmhm, it is to be expected. Accumulation of adipose tissue in such extensive quantities will increase sweat production. Doubtful you would have chance to wash or even have the thought cross your mind, the effects of the soup would of course be too enthralling. Along with that, and other factors of you body's-"

"Alright, I get it!" Johanna grunted, rolling her eyes, "Do you always use so many words when you insult people?"

"Mmm, not insult, simple facts," The voice said, "Stench is considered to be offensive to most, but I don't mind. Used to it. You get accustomed when working with the Master's subjects so much."

A chill ran through Johanna's massive body as she looked around the room, the only thing she could do really besides talk to... well, whoever this person was, "The one who owns this place... And by the gods, there are others who suffer this way? Urf... Does your master have a lot of... 'subjects'...?"

"Oh my yes... yes, very many..." The woman said, her hands leaving their spots on Johanna's back, "So many have come here and so many never leave. They all serve him when they stay, they have to. But the ones he doesn't want..." Her voice seemed to grow subtly giddy as she moved to Johanna's side, yet still out of her sight, "I get the majority of those for experiments."

Johanna didn't like the sound of that at all, "Am I one of your 'experiments'...?"

The woman chuckled, a brisk and restrained sound, "No. Sad, but no. If you were you would not be here of course. The Master wants to see you personally. I believe he might have bigger plans for you. Sorry for the pun..."

The wolfess frowned, but had more things to worry about than bad jokes, like why this lady was now sliding her hand in between one of the thick rolls of her belly "Whatever, then if I am not your experiment then why all this poking and prodding...?"

The lady squeezed the fleshy roll a few times at various points before answering the wolf woman, "If you were experiment I would conduct much further testing, shame I cannot though, you have beautiful distribution for lupine, robust physicality too. But no, not experiment per se, but must see how effective my soup was. First time tampering with edible polymorphic liquid, have to see if it retained metabolic and gastronomic effects. Obvious it still affects willpower and mind well from first sight of you."

"Yeah, well maybe you shouldn't have made that junk so tasty..." Johanna grumbled, the woman next to her now poking the wolfess's tremendous gut with something solid and stick-like, mumbling thoughtfully as Johanna's bulk jiggled.

While the situation Johanna found herself in was still pretty frightening, she felt more annoyed and confused than anything now, probably thanks to getting over the initial shock of her gain and the insistent examinations of this odd woman. There still wasn't much for her to do in her current state but sit around and be poked and grabbed, yet now that her mind had cleared a little she figured there might be some way to use this stranger's talkative and inquisitive nature to her advantage...
133111212211121.title: Fat Wolf's Reservations and Clinical Observations

choices: "Vocalizations doesn't sound TOO bad... right?"
"Uhhhggh... Libido I guess..?"
1331112122111211.content:
Just one more poke from her mysterious examiner's instrument was needed to pull Johanna from her thoughts. As her fatty belly rolls jiggled once more, Johanna figured that the best course of action was to ask the inquisitive woman some questions of her own, "So... This person you call Master... who is he, exactly?"

The voice let forth a thoughtful hum as she once more grabbed at Johanna's belly, now apparently testing its pliability with her own gloved hands instead of relying upon her stick, "The Master? Hm, yes him. I wonder if I can say? I don't see why not I suppose, I mean you will be seeing him for yourself soon anyways, won't you? Well maybe not him exactly. That much maybe I shouldn't say, no that wouldn't be prudennt. No not at all, not at all!"

"Oh gods, would just shut up and talk to me!" Johanna growled, leaning back and sinking into her rolls of flab as she shifted her weight.

"Contradiction? Disappointing, incredibly so." The woman sighed as she ceased her prodding and walked further around Johanna's side, "I expected more intelligence, even from one so physical and brutish."

Johanna scowled at the remark, but she restrained herself from showing more vocal objections. She could argue with this woman all she wanted, but it'd just what precious time she had, "Alright... Give me a straight answer... please. I want to know who you are working for, and who owns this dungeon."

"Mmm... First of all, not dungeon. Dungeon is different area of Master's citadel. You are in his castle." The woman said before finally strolling into view. Johanna wasn't surprised to see that the heretofore unseen woman was a horse girl, as Bitemarsh was full of a variety of anthropomorphic animal species. Likewise she wasn't surprised by her attire because, while strange being that the white uniform with gold buttons and trim looked like a mix between a chef's outfit and an alchemist or scientist's garb, it suited what Johanna had already gathered about the woman's interests. What was somewhat odd was the girl's fur color, a light blue that was complimented somewhat by the darker sapphire locks that fell mainly to one side of her face, the deep color giving her otherwise messy hair a strange elegance. Also bizarre was the woman's size as for whatever reason Johanna had assumed anybody working in this place who had a hand in creating such fattening food and traps would have at least been a little chubby. Instead the young horse girl was actually quite thin. Beyond the woman's hips being somewhat wider than usual, there were no signs of her having any excess fat. Johanna gulped a bit when she realized the girl had noticed her looking her over, but the woman only continued with her analysis of the helpless wolfess, "Yes. Clear now subject was completely unconscious until first clear communication, soup is remarkably effective at rendering subject comatose for great lengths of time. Perhaps too effective?" She paused to whisper to herself, "Regardless of Master's wishes, may require follow-up examinations to ascertain subject's current sleeping patterns as well as to determine levels of lethargy."

The wolfess could only grit her teeth as she heard the horse's reply, stifling a growl deep in her throat, "Please... I NEED to know what is going on here... I need to know who your master is and I NEED to find my friend!"

The horse girl stopped in her tracks as Johanna spoke, and for a moment Johanna's hopes soared, "Finally! Now she'll give me some damn answers!" She thought before the girl leaped onto her huge, fat-swollen gut, causing the wolfess to yelp and her many layers of fat to ripple and quake, "H-Hey! What the hell do you think you're doing?!"

The horse woman grunted as she landed on the morbidly obese barbarian's shaking gut, trying desperately to keep herself from rolling off as the jarring movement subsided. She then looked up at the wolf girl's face, a determined gleam in her eye as she grabbed pawfuls of Johanna's bare belly and scaled it like a climber might scale a cliff face, "Hold on! Hold still!" The equine huffed as she climbed over Johanna's gut, "And keep talking, if you would! Don't stop!"

"W-What...?! You're crazy!" Johanna groaned as her belly continued to be jostled by the horse's movements, the wolf still incredibly uncomfortable with her body's newly fattened proportions, "Stop this! Get off of me you maniac, right now! YIPE!" The wolfess barked suddenly as the horse girl finally reached her chest, grabbing hold of one of her bloated breasts for purchase. Johanna could barely choke back a moan as the girl's hand gripped her fat mammary momentarily before she continued to climb, apparently not even noticing the awkward grope."Godsdamn, paws off creep!" Johanna hissed, blushing deeply and glancing away from the horse girl as she finally reached her face.

"Hmm? I said keep talking!" The horse sighed before removing her gloves and then grabbing Johanna's cheeks in each of her paws, causing her to bark once more in astonishment, "I must see you in action!"

"What the fuck are you-Mmph!" Johanna growled before her voice was muffled by the sudden intrusion of the girls fingers in her mouth, the horse grabbing her pudgy lips and cheek in her paws.

"Yes! So perfect... such exquisite features." The woman mumbled to herself as she tugged at Johanna's lips, the barbarian glaring at the horse the whole time, "Perfect lupine physiology, a prime specimen if I'd ever seen one, perhaps finest! Definitely better than most canine samples I've seen. What are you doing wolf? I said keep talking!"

Johanna growled, a bit of drool dribbling past the corner of her lips as the horse continued to tug them. Her words were obviously muffled, but still discernible, "If you don't take those godsdammned paws out of my mouth I'll bite them in half!"

The horse girl blinked, poking around the inside of Johanna's cheek just a bit more before pulling her hands from the wolf girl's mouth, "Apologies. But procedures necessary of course. Needed to examine facial structure and expression in relation to your recent... acquisitions. Only time for a few more tests until the Master sees you anyways."

"Ughh... Can I at least ask what KIND of tests?" Johanna sighed.

"Idea! Even better idea!" The horse girl said, seeming to smirk at her own thoughts, "I will let subject decide which she would like. Need results but not sure which to gather. Need to understand the effects the soup and resulting weight accumulation have had upon subjects vocalizations or... well, libido."

Johanna looked more than a little puzzled at these choices, especially the latter, "Err... what."

"Do not waste time with more questions, choose!"
1331112122111211.title: Prodding the Fatty and Getting Some Answers

choices: Johanna tries to attack it with brute force!
Johanna tries to distract it so that they can sneak by...
133112.content:
Standing before them, partially hidden by darkness, was a creature so bizarre, it caught both of the seasoned adventurers by surprise. It at first simply looked to be a stack of food, everything from various meats, to bread, and even several varieties of baked confections. Yet, on closer examination, they saw that not only was the pile gigantic, it also seemed to be arranged into the form of a giant man, towering above them in defiance of logic and gravity. And that's when it moved...

The two were both startled by the sudden animation of something so inanimate that they both let out sounds of surprise, Richard a yell, and Johanna, a terrified yelp.

It was a mistake that they would soon regret as the monster seemed to hear them, turning to face them. The food golem quickly began to stomp towards them, tilting back the giant turkey comprising its "head" and letting out a bellowing roar....
133112.title: The Feast Golem

choices: She tries to attack it once more, deciding to smash the thing to pieces!
She asks for Richard's advice.
1331121.content:
Johanna sighed as she looked at the behemoth, hefting her axe up with both paws. She really didn't want to fight, especially not after the whole fudge trap, but it seemed as thought there were no other way around.

"Stay back Richard!" She shouted, "I think I can take care of this walking larder..."

With that she ran at the lumbering golem, lifting her axe high into the air to deliver a blow straight into its head. She grinned, shouting out with victorious joy as she cleaved the turkey at the top of the beast in two, each half falling to the floor. She turned about to face her partner, who seemed to be in awe of her skil, eyes wide and mouth agape.

"See? No big deal... Dinner is ser-" But before she could issue a cheesy one-liner, she was knocked into a wall with immense force.

Clumsily getting to her feet, the muscular wolfess shook her head, clearing it just in time to jump out of the way as the headless construct charged her. She realized that her partner wasn't amazed, Richard had been terrified by the monsters resilience. She should have figured that wouldn't work, but she seemed to be having a bad day when it came to this common sense stuff, as her swollen gut could attest.
1331121.title: That was easy.... right?

choices: The golem is back for seconds!
What lies in the room beyond the door?
13311211.content:
The golem certainly didn't seem to consider decapitation a serious impairment, but Johanna wondered how it would take to amputation, one piece at a time.

She readied her axe as the massive meal monster charged once more. Johanna couldn't help but notice it smelled much better than any other monster she'd fought. It smelled of fresh deer roasting on a spit, warm bread straight from the oven, fish practically swimming again in butter...

With a small smirk, Johanna sidestepped as the creature lunged for her, swinging her axe into and through the golem's thigh. With a roar and a squelchy crash, the creature tumbled over in two pieces, fruit filling leaking from the severed stumps. Johanna didn't know whether this was its lifeblood, or if she'd cut though a pie or two, but didn't spare herself the time to think about it now.

With a triumphant laugh, she brought her axe down again, severing one of the golem's arms. The creature tried to rise, only to fall over helplessly with a roar of anger. Johanna calmly walked around to its other arm, almost casually cutting off its other leg as she walked by. More fruit fillings spilled out, creating a sticky puddle not unlike blood.

Johanna paused, axe raised over her head, and smirked. "Stick this in your oven and bake it, fruitcake."

She sent the axe on its way down, and severed the golem's remaining arm. Not quite content to stop there, Johanna brought down her axe again and again, smashing the golem into its requisite pieces and clumps of food. Then even these she crushed, whether under her footpaws or with the head of her axe. Fruits, meats, and vegetables squelched between her footpaws, getting them dirty and sticky, but this wasn't anything new to the bare-footed barbarian.

When the once-fearsome construct had been reduced to something resembling wet oatmeal, Johanna hefted her axe onto her shoulder again and said "Right, then. Let's go, Richard."

Richard, having had regained his composure by this time, smiled and said "Guess you could call it creamed' corn'."

Johanna chuckled and nodded. "That's a good one, I'll give you that."

"Or smashed potatoes," Richard said again.

Johanna laughed a little less this time. "Yes, very good. Let's go."

But Richard wasn't quite finished yet. "You certainly shut his piehole. Stomped his grapes.Sliced and diced him. Ah, but that's the way the cookie crumbles, no? You have to break a few eggs to-"

"I'm going to shut YOUR cakehole if you don't move it..." Johanna growled, glaring at Richard.

"Eep! Yes ma'am!" Richard squeaked, scuttling to the door on the far side of the room.

Johanna smiled inwardly and followed, confident she could handle any half-baked ideas this dungeon could throw at her.
13311211.title: Feeling crumby?

choices: "-I'm so FAT!"
"-I'm so hungry!"
133112111.content:
Richard laid a hand o the door handle, only to be suddenly frozen in place. Not only was the handle itself a trap, but the squelching sounds had resumed.

Johanna spun around to see the golem rising again. Though it didn't seem to be able to reform completely, it was still sliding towards them at a remarkable pace, considering its pasty (or was that pastry?) complexion.

"Now would be a good time to open that door, Richard," Johanna said, readying her axe again.

When Richard didn't move or reply, Johanna spared a moment to look over and see his frozen form. She swore and tried to push him aside, to no avail. He was fixed firmly to the handle, her only escape from the room. She looked round again to see the golem almost on top of her.

Johanna jumped away again, swinging her axe. It sliced through the golem, splattering some of him onto the floor, but otherwise having no ill effects. The creature roared with annoyance, but kept moving forward.

To her surprise, Johanna found the golem was completely ignoring her now, heading right for the helpless Richard. She didn't know what it could possibly do to him in such a semi-solid state, but she wasn't about to let it try anything funny.

But as she readied her axe again and approached the mushy monster, an unseen tentacle tripped her up. She fell forward, her axe clattering away across the floor. Before she could spring up, more of the monster's tentacles crept across her, surprisingly strong, pinning her to the floor. It had been a trap all along! Richard was the bait, and she had fallen for it.

Johanna struggled against her bonds, snarling angrily "Oh THIS is some bull-"

Another thick tentacle had crept up on the edges of her peripheral vision and now forced itself into her gaping maw. She tried to close her mouth against the flow, but to no avail. It was simply too strong.

Johanna soon forgot completely about escaping as the flavor hit her. It was everything good she'd ever tasted made better, all at the same time, yet each flavor distinct. She had never thought they could blend together so smoothly... What had she been doing all her life? Not eating, certainly... and that was just wrong...

The golem's magic forced a change upon Johanna's body. Converting its mass directly into calories, it sped up her metabolism to inhuman speeds. Her stomach emptied of the golem's mush and the fudge from before, spreading them thickly throughout her body.

Richard watched, horrified, yet strangely fascinated, as Johanna's lithe frame swelled.

Her arms added layers of thickness, swelling like sausages, and coming to resemble them, as well.

Her thighs thickened and rounded, growing steadily closer together until they touched, squishing against one another slightly.

Her stomach was not spared, rising out of her shirt like the soft dough it resembled, creating love-handles to rest on her widening, curvaceous hips.

Her rump, though they could not see it, "bubbled" outwards, two globular spheres pressing against her pants, stretching them until they creaked.

Johanna's bust grew, too, increasing from a not unimpressive size to a state of weightiness sure to be the envy of many women and grab the attention of many men, while still remaining reasonable.

Finally, the golem had stuffed the last of itself into the bloated barbarian, leaving her with only a wonderful taste in her mouth. Johanna soon came back to her senses, and she sat up groggily.

Or rather, tried to. Her stomach rolled and squished against her thighs and bust, preventing her from sitting up straight. This action made her already dangerously strained shirt creak in protest. Her arm jiggled just a little as she raised a hand to rub her forehead.

"Ugh, what was-" Johanna groaned, stopping as she saw what had happened. She blinked once, twice.

Then she screamed. "Oh my GODS-"
133112111.title: Johanna's food fight.

choices: She walks into a fully stocked banuet hall ripe for the eatting
The room is filled with more Food Golems!
1331121112.content: Richard was freed from the spell when the golem was no longer a threat, he quickly ran to Johanna's bloated form "Johanna are you alright?" he asked the wolfess. Johanna looked at him and then rubbed her soft belly "I'm so hungry!" she moaned as Richard helped her to her feet, taking a bit to stand as she fought to find her center of gravity. They both turned as they soon heard a loud creaking noise, as the door at the end of the hall slowly opened. The smells of a banquet hall now filled the small tunnel causing Johanna's mouth to quickly water as her belly gave a loud growl of hunger "Johanna I think we should get out of here...." Richard's protests went unheard as the wolfess quickly waddled threw the doorway.
1331121112.title: "-I'm so hungry!"

choices: One Bite… just one!
It’s time to get the hell out of this room!
13311211121.content:
Richard cursed under his breath as Johanna waddled through the wide doorway into the delicious smelling room ahead. He was beginning to see a pattern here: It was almost as if every trap in this bizarre dungeon was designed specifically to increase intruder’s waistlines. The rogue had encountered many traps in his career of plundering and burgling, but nothing as odd as that! And now the pulverized golem that had forced itself down his companion’s throat, still making itself a threat even after its defeat.

Richard was brought out of his contemplation by a delighted yelp from Johanna, and he ran through the doors to check on his companion. What he saw on the other side astonished him. The room was absolutely enormous! Cavernous even! Yet most of the room seemed to be reserved for four very long banquet tables, each one simply overflowing with various kinds of foods. Richard couldn’t help but notice that almost everything seemed to be fattening: Most of it was just meats, bread, and sweets with little to no vegetables or fruits to be found.

Other than the tables and the elaborate, sparkling gold chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, the stone floored and walled room seemed to be rather barren, with no windows or decorations to be seen. The only other feature was the exit with sat at the intersection of two grand, sweeping staircases at the other end of the room.

The rogue once more tried to focus, looking about the banquet hall for Johanna, yet she was nowhere to be seen. He started to call out her name, moving further into the room until a loud, deep bout of laughter stopped him dead in his tracks. He looked up at the balcony that lay between the staircases and caught sight of a rather tall, slender figure donning a black robe with gold trim, its face hidden within the shadows of its cowl.

“I see you interlopers have found your way to one of my dining halls!” Called out a smug, masculine voice, “One of many, and not the grandest perhaps, but it should suit your needs just fine… Consider yourselves no longer intruders, but my guests, if you’d please. Go ahead, help yourselves!”

Richard looked up at the menacing figure and snarled, “You must be the owner of this strange place then? You talk of needs, but it seems to be that there’s more than enough food for an army, let alone two adventurers, wouldn’t you?”

The man chuckled, shaking his head, “Oh yes, it may seem to be an overwhelming amount of food, but that’s the wonderful thing about this feast… it’s just so delicious. I believe your companion understands…” The cloaked figure pointed a gloved hand at one of the tables and Richard followed it to see Johanna, madly stuffing her muzzle with meat pies.

“Now then…” The figure continued, now pointing towards Richard, the human feeling a slight but nagging sensation of hunger sprout up within him as he did so, “I must attend to some other things, but I do hope that you be a polite guest rogue… I’d be offended if you didn’t try at least some of the food…”

The man chuckled before walking through the exit, and as he did so, the large wooden doors behind Richard slammed shut by themselves. The rogue walked toward Johanna slowly, unable to help himself from eying all of the scrumptious looking food…
13311211121.title: Invited to Dinner

choices: A section of  floor.
The seam on her trousers.
133112111212.content:
With great effort, Richard managed to pry his attention away from the food and approach the feasting warrior. "Johanna!" he cried. "We've got to get out of this room!"

Johanna merely grunted at him and continued tearing her way through an enormous, glistening ham. Richard placed his hand on her shoulder and quickly pulled it away. She was hot! Her metabolism had to be operating at unheard-on speeds, burning away the food almost as soon as it entered her belly. Most of it, anyway. She was still getting bigger, slowly -- too slowly for him to quite see it, but when he turned away for a minute, examing the room for possible escape routes, and then turned back, he could see a definite change.

"Johanna," he pleaded. "We have to go, now, while you still can!"

She swatted him away and buried her face in a vast tureen of pasta, slurping it down in huge, ravenous gulps. She simply couldn't stop herself, Richard realized. The food was obviously enchanted. Ironically, perhaps their encounter with the food golem had been a blessing in disguise; if she hadn't had her metabolism supercharged, she surely would have exploded by now, at the rate she was shoveling it in. But how long would that last? And just how big would she be before it ended? He had a sudden image of himself struggling to roll her from room to room, crushing monsters beneath her. Rogues weren't supposed to do the heavy lifting!

"Johanna," he said for the third time. Maybe he could play on her pride in her warrior's physique, or what was left of it. "Stop eating! You're getting fat!"

"Ridic'lous," Johanna belched, spraying bits of sausage and meatballs across the half-eaten platter of meat. "'m in the best shape of my life."

Biggest shape of your life, maybe, Richard thought crossly. But he had to admit, if he hadn't seen it himself he would never have believed a woman could gain so much weight in a single sitting. Gripped in the twin madness of magical compulsion and insatiable hunger, there was no way Johanna would listen to a thing he said.

She devoured every last bit of meat, licking the silver platter until it shone, then tossing it behind her, forgotten, and pulled a basket of steaming buns dripping with sugar and cinnamon towards herself. Perhaps -- he wasn't quite sure, but just maybe -- yes, her growth seemed to be slowing. The powerful burn had run its course. But the enchantment still held her in its grip, and her frenzied glutting continued unabated. Already, even under the soft pot belly her stomach was noticeably distended. How much time did he have? Ten minutes? Five? Even as he dithered, she guzzled a pitcher of honey. A slab of roast beef. A loaf of bread longer than he was tall.

He caught a glimpse of his face in the mirrorlike surface of the platter which lay at his feet. The suave rogue was gone. He looked frantic, helpless, like a man completely out of ideas--

The platter!

If she won't believe me, Richard realized, I'll just have to show her. He grabbed the platter, leapt up onto the table in one smooth bound, and slammed it down in front of Johanna just as she was reaching for the last slice of a triple-chocolate pineapple fudge cake.

"'Best shape of your life', huh? Take a look at this!"

Startled, Johanna looked. It wasn't pretty. Her cheeks bulged with cake, crumbs spilled from her mouth, and-- and--

At first she thought it was some kind of funhouse mirror. Her face wasn't that round -- her breasts weren't that big -- and down there, half-hidden by the table -- it was impossible! Her stomach was flat, it has always been flat -- what were though round curves doing there?

"Impossible," she said. "No, it's an illusion, it's got to be--"

Once more the spell began to take hold, but that brief interruption was all Richard needed. He launched himself at her, knocking her chair over and stunning her against the stone floor, and began to haul her away bodily. She was heavy! Even when they'd entered the dungeon, she'd been a muscular woman, and now, with all that fat -- it was a miracle he didn't have a heart attack as he hauled her up the stairs. Finally, he managed to drag the bloated warrior through the exit just as she was coming to. His last view of the room -- before he slammed the door shut on those seductive aromas -- was the table Johanna had been seated at. Amid the piles of untouched food, there was a large area of devastation, bones, and empty dishes. It looked like it had been hit by a meteor.

Yeah, he thought snidely. A big, fat, furry meteor.

Johanna blinked. She sat up with difficulty. "What happened? Last thing I remember I was fighting a food golem... and then I ... I was so hungry... and I had this bizarre dream..."

"That was no dream."

"What?" The warrior looked down at herself. "WHAT?"

"I don't suppose you saved any room for breakfast."

"I'LL KILL 'IM!" Johanna roared. "I'LL KILL THE MISERABLE SON OF A BITCH! Do you know how many sit-ups it took to get those abs and now this-- this -- look at this!"

"I'm looking. Bit like a furry pillow, isn't it? And say, where's my thanks for saving your bacon?"

"Come on," the warrior snarled, getting to her feet with some difficulty. "We're gonna find whoever's setting these traps, and then I'll personally--"

"Sit on him?"

"Grr."

Johanna took one a step, and then gasped. Something had just given way beneath her!

What was it?
133112111212.title: Cravings and Compulsions

choices: Try picking the lock on the big one.
Play it safe and take the smaller door on the left.
1331121112122.content:
The sound was loud, unmistakable, and mortifying.

Johanna stopped right in her tracks, still as a statue. Richard stopped as well, looking to find the source of the noise, the loud sound of tearing fabric. As soon as he did, however, he quickly averted his gaze, his cheeks growing warm as he held his gloved hand to his face to hold back a snicker.

“Ah… Johanna….?”

“I. Know.” She growled between clenched teeth.

Richard pulled his hand into a fist, coughing into it as the situation became quite awkward for the two of them. He immediately turned away from her, whistling an unassuming tune as he continued to contain his amusement.

“It’s okay, I’m not looking!” He called over to her, biting his lip as he smiled.

As soon as she heard this, her paws moved straight for her thighs, searching for where the leather pants had so unceremoniously failed her. She moved her paws up towards her rear hesitantly, fearing the worst had come to past and realizing that it had. Somehow, her once sturdy leather armor had torn right at the seat of her pants, straight up the middle from crotch to tail. She began to blush as well, much harder and for different reasons than Richard. She never blushed before. She didn’t like it.

“Everything alright?” Richard asked, turning to look over his shoulder.

Johanna jumped, cupping her nearly exposed, blubbery rumpcheeks in her paws, “WAIT! STOP, DON’T TURN AROUND!” She shrieked in sheer panic.

As Richard obeyed respectfully, she realized what she was feeling just now. While her ass wasn’t completely exposed, a leather thong standing between it and total indecency, in its current state it was still incredibly shameful. She squeezed her pudgy cheeks carefully, whimpering as she felt how much they yielded and squished. She really was… pillowy…

She frowned, “Richard… It… okay if you walk in front from now on…?”

Richard only nodded, “Mmhm…” He replied before suddenly bursting into peals of laughter.

“What the hell is wrong with you!?” Johanna raged, bearing her fangs at the rogue.

“I’m… I’m sorry…” He gasped, still giggling as he doubled over to catch his breath, “But… it’s just… don’t you find it funny that all of this seems to be happening to you? And then this… I mean, come on, talk about a bad day, right?”

Johanna glared at him scathingly, clearly not amused.

Richard grimaced sharply, “Right, right…” He said, snickering a bit still, “Yeah, I’ll go…”

Richard took the lead, freely smiling now as the barbarian couldn’t see his face. Johanna followed behind, though not too closely, held back by a combination of her newly acquired weight slowing her pace and the shame she still felt after such a humiliating incident.

They walked for quite a while it seemed, no noticeable features to define the hallway they now found themselves in besides the many number of torches lining the walls and the way in which the hall seemed to be getting wider and wider the further they travelled. Finally it stopped widening up ahead where a large door spanned the width of the tunnel, a much smaller door located in the wall on their left just before it.

Richard stopped several feet before the doors, turning back to look at Johanna who also stopped a fair distance away.
“I bet the big one’s probably locked, if dungeon crawling has taught me anything. I bet I could probably pick it, but after all we’ve been through already, it’ll probably be pretty risky.”

Johanna frowned at him wearily, “I don’t see you outgrowing your clothes…”

“Alright, after all that you've been through, better?”

“Yes,” She said, smirking as she drew closer to the doors.

“So which shall it be then?”
1331121112122.title: Riiiiiiip!

choices: It worked! The door opens, revealing the hall beyond it.
It failed! A trap door opens beneath the duo!
13311211121221.content:
“You think you can?” Johanna asked, crossing her slightly doughy arms.

“Think I can wha?” Richard asked.

“Pick the lock!”

“Oh! Johanna, please...” He grinned, cracking his gloved knuckles, “I’ve broken into palaces! Museums! Orphanages!”

“Orphanages…?” She asked, raising her eyebrow at him.

“Uhm… I meant… look, it was a rough time for me, okay? I mean you’d think those kids have it rough, but have you seen how much money goes into tho-“

“RICHARD, JUST PICK THE GODS DAMNED THING!” She roared.

“Alright, fine!” He said, backing away from her and reaching for his toolbelt.

Johanna sighed and, not liking the feeling of a slight cave breeze on her posterior, walked over to the wall to sit against it. Meanwhile Richard was busy looking through a leather wrap full of lockpicking implements, selecting a rather large set to get the job done. As he stood before the door however, he couldn’t help but to examine the engravings carved right into its iron surface and be disturbed by them.

The entire door seemed to be covered with the intricate designs, all but one of them showing massively obese creatures. They were man and beast alike, most seemingly female, all chained together, and all bowing to the lone, thin figure standing in the center. It was the same menacing robed man the two of them had seen taunting them in the dining hall not too long ago. At the very top of the dreary scene was a long plate spanning the entire face of the door from left to right, engraved with imposing letters reading:

“The Master’s Way”


Richard tore himself from his observations with a visible shiver, now only looking at the door to find the lock, located right beneath the robed figure’s feet. He immediately began to fumble with the tumblers, seeking to find the mechanism’s weaknesses.

Johanna groaned, “Do you usually take this long?”

“Just have to find… the right spot…” Richard muttered.

“I don’t think it’s work-“

“GOT IT!” Richard shouted, the mechanism unlocking rather loudly as Johanna yelped in excitement.

The podgy wolfess leapt to her feet, padding over to Richard as he let go of the picks and looked up at the large door.

Both of them heard a rather loud mechanical noise, a lot like gears spinning and chains pulling, before…
13311211121221.title: The Perils and Pitfalls of Lockpicking

choices: Something to pull Johanna out with.
Something to block the flow of the pipes with.
133112111212212.content:
Johanna’s ears perked up, her canine senses telling her that something was terribly wrong. All of the racket from the machinery should have been coming from the door in front of them, or maybe the walls to the side, not the floor directly benea-

But before she could come to realize just what this meant, a large trap door spanning the width of the hallway fell open! The barbarian could only howl as she plummeted into the pit and to the floor below.

Richard was once more a bit luckier, as in a purely instinctual reaction, he grabbed tightly to his lockpicking tools that were still jammed into the door’s lock. It was a miracle they didn’t break (Considering that it seemed like he went through at least half a dozen lockpicks a day), but he wasn’t exactly thinking of that as he held onto them for dear life. He tried to look back to see what had become of his partner, but he was too afraid of falling to his own doom.

“Johanna? Are you alright?!” He called out to her, clenching his teeth as he tried to maintain his grip.

“I’m fine! It was kind of a long fall!” She called back, “But I think it might have been… cushioned a little…”

She tried mumbling the last line, but Richard heard her all the same, “I’m not in the best of positions right now myself, but you said cushioned? Was it by your fa-“

“No! It was… um, by all these… bones down here! Yeah, pit’s full of ‘em it looks like.”

It was a bit dark at the bottom of the hole, but not too dark to be unable to see that it was quite empty, oddly enough. Usually with these things there were a bunch of dead guys at the bottom, but she was sure Richard wasn’t buying it anyways. She temporarily forgot about her own shame though when she looked up and saw her partner dangling above her.

“Hey Richard, you know you can drop down, right?” She yelled up at him.

“What are you talking about?!” He shouted, his feet dangling in the air.

“There’s a ledge right below you, you great idiot!”

The rogue carefully turned to look over his shoulder, indeed seeing a narrow ledge just below his feet. He shook his head at his own foolishness, grunting as he let go of the lockpicking tools and fell to his feet. The shelf he now found himself on seemed to go around the perimeter of the pit, though was only about two feet wide. Protruding from the middle of each side, however, were stone gargoyles that jutted out over the hole, perfect for Richard to crawl onto to get a good view of the floor.

Johanna wasn’t pleased to see him peeking his head over the gargoyle however, grinning at her, “So where exactly are these skeletons?”

“I never said skeletons, I said bones,” She grunted, looking about the room for an exit and pressing against the walls.
“Right and where are those exactly?”

Johanna opened her mouth to protest, but before she could more loud, mechanical noises could be heard, this time all around her. She looked about frantically, mouth agape in terror, half-expecting the walls to slide in and smash her into paste or something.

Instead though, golden streams of goo erupted from the mouths of all four gargoyles and began to cascade down into the pit. Johanna gasped as the sticky liquid touched her boots, pulling one of them into the air as strands of the stuff clung to it. Her noise almost instantly picked up on the overwhelmingly sweet aroma.

“This is… honey?!” She frowned, a puzzled expression forming on her snout.

“Is it really that surprising?” Richard replied, looking at the gargoyle he was now perched on, “It’s quite a lot like that whole fudge trap, isn’t it? The ‘Drink or you die’ bit I mean… You know I was hoping stuff like this would be a lot more creative, besides the fact that they seem to be meant to fatten rather than kill. I guess that part’s different from what you usually see…”

Johanna let out a frustrated sigh as she continued to press at the walls, looking for a switch of some kind and ignoring her fellow adventurer for the most part, “Yeah, it’s like the fudge trap, except there’s no way out!”

The wolf was beginning to panic, as even though the room she had become trapped in wasn’t that small, the honey gushing into it from four different sources had already made a fair bit of progress in filling it. The gooey stuff was now past the height of her knees, and rising rapidly.

“Richard, think of something!”

Startled, Richard almost fell from his perch before retreating back to the ledge. He pulled out his backpack and rummaged through it, looking for…
133112111212212.title: The REAL Perils and Pitfalls of Lockpicking

choices: An intellectual challenge.
A big angry monster.
1331121112122121.content:
"Hold on, Johanna!" Richard cried, frantically digging through his pack. "I've got a rope in here somewhere!'

"Somewhere?"

"Yes -- I know I had one a while ago, let's see, here's the healing potions, here's that magic flute, here's the regular flute... hmm..."

"Richard!"

"I swear it's in here! Until then, you'll just have to drink!"

Johanna groaned and bent down. The honey was lapping at the underside of her gut now, and the last thing she wanted to do was stuff more food into there. But, she reflected, getting fat beats dying anyday.

She guzzled greedily, swallowing quart after quart of sticky golden honey in a series of gigantic, desperate swallows. She doubled and redoubled her efforts, but the honey kept rising. It was up to her chin now. Now she had to stand on tip-toe. And now it was over her head.

Richard seized the rope triumphantly. "Got it, Jo!" He tossed the coil over the edge, keeping a firm grip on the other end -- and was shocked when he felt it go slack almost at once.

"Jo?"

He looked over the edge. The honey was rapidly rising to meet the gargoyles. The end of the rope trailed into the yellow surface. Jo was nowhere to be seen.

"Jo!"

There was nothing to be done. She was gone. All he could do was save himself. He tossed a coil of rope up, looping it over a wall torch on the second attempt, and pulled himself out of the pit, honey sucking at his heels. He sunk onto the flagstones, watching as the golden lake brimmed over the edge of the pit and stopped, as if some hidden pressure mechanism had been triggered.

"Poor Jo," Richard sighed. "I'll tell everyone you died heroically. And, hell. I'll tell you you stayed thin to the end."

Suddenly, there was a great globbering splut from the pit, and something surfaced. At first, Richard thought it was a monster. Then, he realized the truth.

"Johanna!"

She lay in a dead man's float, even more bloated than she had been a few minutes ago, her eyes glazed in every sense of the world -- but alive.

"Johanna, you made it!"

She belched, a few yellowish bubbles drifting upward. "Never... eating honey... again."

"Thank the gods you're all right! I thought -- that is, I thought I was trapped here. Now, er... if you could just lie there for another couple of minutes..."

"What are you doing?"

"I have to stand somewhere while I finish up with this lock," Richard said, carefully climbing onto the sticky, round hill of Johanna's belly. "Sorry! Don't move, okay?"

Johanna hiccupped. Richard lost his footing as the mass beneath him twitched, and he slid down one slippery flank into the honey.

"Glub! Hey!"

"Oops."

Second time being the charm, Richard eventually managed to get through the lock, and on the other side of the door, the adventurers discovered--
1331121112122121.title: Hi, honey, I'm home.

choices: Johanna lands in a large room where a obese dragon is sleeping near treasure...
Reader's choice
13311211121221211.content:
… What appeared to be a rather large room that was empty. Almost completely bare save for other side of the room that had a large, extravagant door that had a large impish monster with large hands and a rather goofy face.

Not having the extra bulk his compatriot, Richard was easily able to pull himself from the deep pit of honey that had caused his wolf travel companion to add a few more pounds to her frame. Speaking of which…

“Hey! Give me a hand here!” Johanna sputtered as she futilely tried to pull herself from the pit, but even with her originally impressive muscles, they weren’t strong enough to free her from the gooey pit.

“One sec Jo,” Richard sighed as he turned around and grabbed hold of his rather sticky companion’s paw. Oddly enough, thanks to the sticky honey that covered both of them, he was able to retain his footing and grip on the wolf-woman, and pull her from the honey… Even if she was dragged across the floor with a large trail of honey left in her wake.

“Ugh, this is disgusting,” Johanna grumbled as she lifted up her leather top slightly to get some of the honey out from underneath it. “I got honey in places I didn’t even know I had!”

“Tell me about it,” Richard grumbled as he ran a hand through his hair and shook his hand to get a good amount of honey out of it. “I’m not that big of a fan of honey…”

Richard would’ve continued but he noticed that Johanna was now licking her right arm, getting the honey out of her fur. “I thought you said that you weren’t going to eat honey again?”

“Hey, I’m not gonna walk around with honey on me,” Johanna replied after she gulped down a mouthful of honey. “‘Sides, it’d be a waste…”

A few minutes full of clothes changing and licking later, the two heroes stood in the large room, with Richard dressed in a spare set of clothes and Johanna still wearing her ever tightening clothes and leather armor. With Richard in front of her and her form not entirely covered in honey anymore (there were a few places that she couldn’t reach, places she’d rather not clean with Richard in the room), she got a look at her frame.

Her leather top was barely able to contain the massive furry orbs that she called her breasts, with the two mammaries peaking out from underneath it and resting atop of her now bulbous gut – Her six pack had disappeared a little bit ago, but she missed not seeing that dome. She could feel that her thighs were so think that she could feel them squish against each other as she stood there behind Richard, she didn’t even want to imagine what the damage was for her behind, but she could feel from the breeze she felt that her butt had ripped her pants even further and even her tail seemed to be a bit thicker too…

“Well, nowhere else to go but forward,” Richard said, breaking the barbarian wolfess’s assessment of her figure.

“Uh, right… So, what’s with that door? Think you can pick that one too?”

Richard was silent as walked towards the door, putting a little bit of distance between him and Johanna, and just as he was about to place a hand on the door…

“STOP!”

Both Johanna and Richard jumped as the imp on the door came to life, its arms stretching over its head, the imp then narrowed its glowing eyes at the pair in front of him. “Ye who dares to pass the room of death must answer me these questions three, if the other side you wish to see!”

“That sounds familiar somehow…” Richard mumbled under his breath.

“Great, no one said there’d be a pop quiz,” Johanna muttered with a roll of her eyes. “We should just smash it and walk right through.”

“Remember what happened whenever you didn’t think?” Richard stated as he tapped a few times on Johanna’s gut. “Look, I’ll answer the questions myself and you just copy my answers, okay?”

“Fine,” Johanna grumbled as she slapped Richard’s hand from her gut.

Richard walked up to the door’s imp and cleared his throat, “Ask your questions door keeper, I’m not afraid!”

“What... is your name?”

“I am Richard of the rouges.”

“What... is your quest?”

“To seek the treasure of this castle of the Lipomancer.”

“What… Is your favorite color?”

“Uh… Red?”

“Right, off you go,” The imp stated before he faded back into the door, and the door opened up in front of Richard.

“Wow, that was easy,” Johanna muttered as Richard walked through the doors.

“See you on the other side!” Richard replied as the doors closed behind him.

And once the doors closed, the imp emerged from the doors and stared at the plump Johanna. “…”

Johanna smirked as she stepped forward…

“STOP!”

Johanna rolled her hand around as the imp recited his speech that he gave to Richard, “Ye who dares to pass the room of death must answer me these questions three, if the other side you wish to see!”
