“Bring it on, stonehead,” Johanna laughed as she placed her hands on her meaty waist. “I’m not afraid of your questions!”

“What… Is your name?”

“Johanna of the wolfess barbarians!”

“What… Is your quest?”

“I’m after the Lipomancer and his treasure!”

“What… Is the capital of Acedia?”

Just as Johanna was about to answer, she stopped short and blinked, “Wait, I don’t know that!”

It was then that the floor beneath Johanna’s feet just disappeared, and the weighty wolfess fell into the vast darkness that was underneath with her howling in fear and surprise. The imp merely cackled as the floor reappeared in front of him. “Hehehehehe… I love my job… Wonder where the pit leads this time though?”
13311211121221211.title: Answer Me These Questions Three

choices: "Ahhh, the Arcane Machine..."
"Hmmm, the Reliquary of Ooze..."
133112111212212112.content:
With a loud thud, the door sealed shut behind Richard, leaving him alone in the next room. As the only light source here seemed to be from the formerly open door, he fumbled about his pack before pulling free a torch, thankfully untouched by the honey he had been submerged in. He quickly lit the thing using years of accumulated torch-lighting experience.

“Ah! That’s better,” He said, scratching his chin habitually as he looked about the area. Unfortunately he still couldn't make out too much, even with the aid of his torch. The room was simply too big it seemed, and even as he walked forwards there wasn't much else to see besides the floor an ceiling.

“What sort of trickery is this now?” The rogue wondered out loud, “Some sort of hex to make the room impossible to navigate perhaps… Or maybe mind games, is that it!” He shouted as he waved the torch about in every direction and spinning wildly in an attempt to find anything that could be used as a landmark and slamming his head right into a stone wall as he did so.

“Godsdammit! What wassat?!” He grunted through gritted teeth as he rubbed his bruised forehead, his from lessening once he spotted a torch held upon the newly discovered wall. Instinctively, and perhaps recklessly, he brought his own lit torch to it, igniting the sconce with shared flame and making it just a bit easier to see in the dark.

“And that’s better too, I guess…” He muttered to himself before his eyes looked to his left further down the wall just in time to see the next torch light spontaneously by itself, followed by the one after it. As Richard turned to look, it seemed every torch on both sides of the room were bursting to life through some kind of magical chain reaction, fully illuminating it from wall to wall, “I take that back: Much, much better!”

The rogue’s delight soon turned to awe as he looked down the length of the room, finding that it was actually an enormous hallway, one not only quite wide, but so long that he couldn't even make out then end, even as the torches continued to ignite in the far distance. It was, by and far, the largest corridor the rogue had ever seen, lined on both sides by many, many torches and doors. “By Sol-Ra’s light! Isn't this incredible Johanna?”

The human rogue turned to look back behind him, “Johanna?”

A cold chill ran up Richard’s spine. It shouldn't have taken nearly this long for the chubby wolfess to answer the door guardian’s questions, even if she was one to favor brawn over wit most of time, “You’ll be through the door any minute now, right Jo’?”

But the only response Richard received was the soft echo of his own voice.



Richard’s question didn't fall upon deaf ears however, and while the one who had heard him knew the answer, it was nowhere near whom the rogue was expecting. This was because Johanna was now far away from her companion and growing even farther still as slid down a chute leading deeper and deeper into the bowels of the castle.

Another had heard however, just as he now saw the tubby wolf woman as she slid howling down the watery stone shaft. He waved a gnarled and trembling hand over his scrying glass as a closer view of the terrified adventurer appeared beneath its curved surface.

“Marvellous…” The Lipomancer’s rattling breath wheezed, “She’s going further and further down the wrong way… You’re on the fast track now my dear…” He hissed, his claw-like nails caressing the crystal globe, “And there’s no hope for you at the end of it… You will give in to your gluttonous nature just as those before you... And then, you will be mine!”

The robed figure bent over the globe suddenly, one hand splayed over the surface of the table as the other rose before his cowl. Loud, retching coughs filled the dark room as he shook and gasped, but it passed just as quickly as it began, “But while the outcome is certain, the journey is still to be written… What will it be then wolf? The Wretched Larder perhaps? …maybe the dragon’s den? No… She is past those already…” He whispered, tapping the scrying glass, “She’s going all the way to the bottom, but where…?”
133112111212212112.title: What Lies Ahead?

choices: Have a quick snack, a rest, and maybe some belly rubs.
Forget about rest, keep going, it's to risky.
1332.content:
The wolfess started to eat the fudge while Richard worked on the puzzle.

"Maybe we Slide it this way, no.., the other way, damn it! I hate slider puzzles!"

"Damn it Richard!" Johanna said, raising her fudge covered snout, "Its been almost twenty minutes, and you still haven’t finished! This fudge is almost to my neck, and I cant stop eating it!"

After she said this, she buried her head back into the fudge, lapping it up, mouthful after mouthful, the warm chocolate goodness seeping down her throat.

"Almost...Got it!" Richard exclaimed, looking behind him, he saw that Johanna was still eating the fudge, her tail wagging.

"Umm, Johanna?" he walked aver and tapped her on the shoulder, she spun around and almost hit him in the face, she swallowed her mouthful and glared at him.

"What's going on? We are drowning in here, and you're interrupting me!", she then noticed the door opening, she tried to sit up, but had some trouble due to a bellyful of thick, heavy fudge.After a quick giggle from Richard, and a snarl from Johanna, he helped her up and they started to walk down the corridor.

As they walked, Johanna looked down at her body. To her horror, the tight leather shirt that covered her whole chest had risen, and now a bloated belly was clearly showing. She looked at her hands, they were all pudgy, and her thighs were fat too. It looked like she had gained almost fifty pounds, and somehow all of this had happened in less than half an hour. She was very surprised, and angry.

Suddenly, a loud groaning noise echoed from somewhere in the cave, it took a few moments for the two adventurers to realize that it was Johanna’s stomach.

“Well, it looks like someone has a hungry tummy, yes?” Richard grinned, rubbing her stomach. Johanna felt strange, almost drawn to it she wanted him to keep doing it.

“Should we have a snack, and maybe get some sleep, or should we keep going on?" He asked.

Johanna wanted to stay and eat, and maybe get a few more belly rubs, but she knew that they had to keep going. They could get attacked by something, and if what happened back there was just the beginning, she did not want to
see what would happen if they stayed.

Her stomach groaned again, and Richard looked at her, and started to rub her belly again.

"So what will it be, fearless leader, rest, or more adventuring?”
1332.title: He solved the puzzle in half an hour

choices: Nothing happened, they're safe, and it's just time to get a move on.
There's a large monster barreling down the hall. To arms!
13321.content:
"Maybe we can stop and rest for a bit. Just for a moment mind you." Johanna added, trying to maintain her facade of anger as she fought off a food coma. She leaned against a nearby wall and slumped to the ground, her large, fudge filled belly wobbling out in front of her. Richard sat down next to her and whipped out his pack. Inside he had a few sets of dry rations, enough to last for about a week of solid adventuring.

Keeping one of the pouches for himself, he tossed another to Johanna, landing it square on top of her swollen belly which sloshed noisily as the fudge shifted around inside.

"Ohhhh....." the wolfess moaned. "Careful there. I'm packed so tight I think I'll explode."

She placed a furry paw on one side, wincing at the pressure. Now that the adrenaline from the danger had worn off, she had rapidly become aware of just how full she was.

"So, when are you due?" chuckled Richard, earning a growl from Johanna in response, which quickly changed to a whimper as it made her gut jiggle heavily.

"Here, let me help." offered the rogue. "You probably swallowed a lot of air when you were lapping up the fudge. I know a thing or two that might help alleviate the pressure."

The wolfess wanted to protest, but the odd desire to have her belly rubbed killed the words in her throat. She tensed a little as Richard pushed a hand in on either side of her stomach, bracing for the uncomfortable rise in pressure that would follow. None came. Instead, Johanna let out large belch and the pressure level dropped dramatically, her belly receding a few inches.

"There we go. I knew there had to be a gas pocket in there somewhere." Richard said smiling.

"Looks like I'm not completely useless now doesn't it?"

Johanna smirked. "Yeah, yeah, just keep rubbing and we'll see."

Rogues are known for deft fingers, and Richard was no exception. He slowly caressed every inch of Johanna's swollen middle, touching key points that seemed to cause any pain the wolf girl experienced to evaporate straight into the air. Johanna merely laid back against the wall, her eyes closed, enjoying every minute of the massage. Richard smiled, enjoying his work just as much as she did.

"You know, you look really cute when you're all bloated and helpless."

Normally, Johanna would have beaten up anyone that called her cute, let alone "bloated and helpless", but she didn't care right now. She was so full and tired, and right now seemed like a great time to just drift off to sleep....



---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------



"Hey Johanna? I hate to interrupt your sleep, but you might wanna wake up about now." Richard's voice roused the wolfess from her slumber. She bolted upright, reaching for her weapon and prepared for danger.
13321.title: Rubs and Relaxation

choices: Take the right path!
Take the left path!
133211.content:
As Johanna stood holding her axe, her belly jiggling from her sudden movements, Richard couldn't help but let out a laugh.

"Relax oh brave warrior of the North!" He said, smiling as he grabbed his pack, "I didn't mean to startle you, I just figured we should get going! Nothing ventured, nothing gained, y'know?"

"Oh, well yeah, I knew that..." Johanna said, nervously chuckling as she lowered her axe. "You're right though, we should probably..."

She was suddenly interrupted by her stomach grumbling.

"...really?" Richard asked smugly.

"What's THAT supposed to mean you puny jackass!"

"Nothing I guess! You have been out for quite a bit I suppose, so it wouldn't hurt too much if you ate one of your meals..."

Richard looked up at his partner, speechless as he witnessed her tearing apart the paper containing her ration and stuffing her snout.

As soon as she was done, she tossed the wrapper away and let out a small, satisfied belch, "Okay, let's go!"

They got their packs and gear together and mad their way down the tunnel, soon coming to a fork in the cave system. Nothing distinguished either path as far as either of them could tell, even with Johanna's keen canine senses.
133211.title: Richard's Ready to Go, but Johanna's Still Hungry

choices: Head into the Forest?
Walk back into the Field of Flowers to rest?
1332111.content:
"Perhaps we should go left?" Richard suggests, pointing down the left tunnel.

"Then we shall go right!" Johanna exclaims, walking off in said direction.
Richard rolls his eyes and follows after. After what seems like forever, the duo reach a large, dimly lit portion of the cave. Upon further inspection, the lighting was actually coming from plant life! Strange trees and flowers surrounded the two adventurers as they wandered aimlessly down the path.

Richard looks to his right, and he could swear he saw one of the trees move! "Johanna?!" he asked, nudging her side and gesturing into the woods.

"What now?" she asked irritably, looking off into the Forest.

"I saw something moving, should we check it out?" Richard inquired. Looking back, was a calm, quiet field of flowers. Just looking at them seemed to be relaxing. What if something was active in the Forest? It could be a threat later if they didn't check it out now.


What will they do?
1332111.title: Taking the Right Path.

choices: was now addicted to this Syrup. She couldn't find it in her to fight back!
was now struggling with the vines. Richard needed to do something fast!
13321111.content:
Johanna sighed. "Alright, we'll go check out your little Forest Friend," she muttered, waddling off into the mysterious woods with Richard in tow.

"Hey, you think anything lives here?" Richard asked, rubbing a hand over the bark of a tree, "Besides the Plants, of course."

"Richard, this is a Forest, inside a cave, and we recently triggered a Fudge Trap. Gotta figure anything is possible." the Wolfess replied, hacking at the plants in her way angrily. A sort of whistling sound was heard through the leaves and bushes as soon as she destroyed some vines that blocked the trail. A golden brown, viscous liquid was pouring out of them. It was sticky, like honey, but smelled nothing like Honey. "What is this stuff?" Johanna asked as Richard picked up a piece of the vine.

"Not entirely sure. Syrup of some sort?" Richard suggested, sniffing the stump of the vine that oozed the liquid.

"Whatever they are, if they get in my way, I cut them down."

"I don't know if that's the best course of action, milady," Richard replied, throwing the Vine down.

As if to prove him right, the trees began to shake as seven vines lowered themselves from the branches.

"Umm, Richard?" Johanna called, looking over her shoulder.

Richard readied his weapons as a Vine shot forth. Instead of targeting Richard, however, the Vines seemed to be "focused" on Johanna. Perhaps in anger for cutting down part of the trees. Four of the vines wrapped around Johanna's arms and legs, and with considerable force, pulled her limbs away from one another, rendering her in a spread-eagle position. She wiggled her fingers in a vain attempt to do something as the other three positioned themselves near her head.

"I think they're going to rip me apart!!" Johanna panicked, as her theory was disproven when two vines began trying to pry her mouth open. She resisted as much as she possibly could, to no avail as they forced open her jaw and slid into her mouth. The third vine wrapped around her muzzle to prevent escape.

Instead of "ripping her apart"...

The Vines began pouring that odd Syrup from their tips, filling Johanna's cheeks relatively quickly. She had no choice but to swallow to prevent an overflow, or worse. Trapped in an ordeal similar to the Fudge Trap. This time there was no puzzle to stop the problem. Strangely, another vine lowered itself from the leaves above and moved towards Johanna's bulging belly. As the syrup filled her, she looked down to notice her stomach was wobbling as she both packed on pounds and was inflated with the Syrupy Goodness.

The lone vine began stroking her gut, almost affectionately, almost like it wanted to be her friend. This one's tip began glowing...

Richard stood by and watched on with an odd mixture of harmless curiosity and mortal terror.

He could either cut down the vines, which may enrage them, and cause them to target him, or he could allow them to do as they pleased with Johanna, potentially pacifying them and allowing the two to continue moving, unless of course Johanna couldn't move by the time this was over.

Johanna, however...
13321111.title: Syrup Vines?!

choices: Option A: Plead with the Vines to release her.
Option B: Payback Time: Suck the Vines completely Dry!
133211111.content:
Johanna felt the strangest she ever did in her life.

As she was pumped full of sweet Syrup, she looked down at the lone Vine stroking her gut. Something came over her, and she began wanting, no, *needing* more! She shuddered as she felt an alleviation of pressure in her midsection. This meant she was a long ways away from being full again! Regardless, she watched on as she continued inflating with this syrup.

Her expression changed from horror, to an odd sense of pleasure. She sighed best she could, smiled, and relaxed, sucking in the sweet, viscous liquid.

Richard looked up at Johanna. The Vines turned her around for Richard to see. He noticed that, somehow she was enjoying herself! Richard lowered his weapons in confusion as another vine comically nudged him in the shoulder. He looked at it as it reeled back in surprise. Richard dropped his weapons regardless and watched. He didn't want the Vines sicked on HIM, nor did he desire to get on Johanna's bad side, emotionally and physically invested as she was right now.

Her belly began to sag downwards, the only thing slowing it was the occasional pause to digest, which caused her arms and legs to thicken slightly. Her bosom grew at a crawl, hardly matching her gigantic gut. Johanna moaned as she felt her belly and breasts push her leather armor up, eventually snapping the straps that held it together. Her top fell off of her and landed with a quiet thud.

"rrrrRRRIIIIIIIP!"

Her leather trousers followed suit, splitting down the sides and floating gently to the soft earth below.

"I think I should do something right about now..." Richard murmured. It was odd how, even as he watched, something inside him wanted this to go on, rather than stopping it. He could just sneak away and come back unseen to cut the vines down, but... with the number of vines in here alone, how many were in this forest?!

Johanna shook her head slowly, hearing Richard's comment. Something in the Syrup, possible something about the sugars, were making her addicted to this punishment.

Her belly jiggled wildly as it made contact with the ground. She moaned loudly and shivered.

Sensing her acceptance, the vines on her left wrist released her arm and she moved it to her belly to gently groom her fur, sinking into the soft flesh.

"How are you not full yet?" Richard chuckled.

Johanna shrugged casually and went back to drinking from the vines. One thing did enter her mind though: As amazing as this felt, how would she move around if she didn't stop soon? How would she move around *now*?!

Her eyes bulged in realization, but also realized it was far too late for her. It was too late, ergo, she had two options. Ask the Vines to release her, having done enough, or get some payback: Suck the Vines completely dry, and kill them...

Option A would leave her with a longing for more of the Syrup, and her mobility would not allow her to move on anyways.
Option B would allow her to savor the Syrup Vines' gift, get revenge, get even larger/softer, but she'll still be unable to move...
133211111.title: Just Go With It!

choices: Leave Johanna behind to find help?
Stay with Johanna, talk to her and keep her Company?
1332111112.content:
Johanna weighed (Pun Unintended) her options and decided the best, and her favorite, course of action was to get some payback.

As the vines continued to fill her past capacity, she began sucking on the vines, causing the flow to quicken. Her belly bounces lightly, shaking violently as it spreads out on the ground beneath her. Her legs and arms thickening with her. Whatever was left of her toned muscle was now long gone.

The Barbarian now greedily slurped at the vines, and she began to become heavier than what the vines on her wrists and ankles could hold! She fell onto her bottom without a sound, her entire body sloshing with the syrup inside her.

Just as she thought she was victorious, the other vines attacked, shoving themselves into her mouth. She didn't account for those...

Her speed of growth was now at maximum. She looked over, pleadingly at Richard. "Go! Get out of here, don't worry about me!" she seemed to say.

She whimpered as she began to become "taller", her bottom and thighs now lifting her upwards.

Richard frowned and picked up his weapons. "Release her!" he commanded, "You've already done enough!"

Johanna continued to sate her appetite/addiction, rubbing her soft belly in victory, regardless of the fact that she was not, in fact, victorious.

The Vines seemed to acknowledge Richard's Command, but they refused to stop. "Why are they doing this...?" Richard muttered, preparing his throwing knife.

Johanna was reaching the pinnacle of her pleasure at this point, moaning loudly as vines caressed her and filled her to the brim.

She should have already exploded by now, or had wanted to fight back a long time ago... why wasn't she? Why were all the traps here involved with food? Why only target Johanna? Who was behind all of this, and what was his motivation?

And more importantly, why was he so... turned on by all of this?

He shook his head and looked up at Johanna and the vines. "Release her, please... for now. I want answers to the questions I seek!" he pleaded. The Vines pulled away, temporarily retreating except for two. Johanna groaned in disappointment.

"Jo, are you okay?" Richard asked, deeply worried. He rushed to her side and pressed a hand into her gargantuan stomach. She actually giggled as he rubbed her gut. Talk about a fierce personality change...

"I'm fine, never better..." Johanna replied, trying to hug Richard, but finding she lacked the reach to do so.

"Well, you're pretty much down for the count... what should we do now?" Richard replied, crawling up onto her belly to get a better look at her face.

"Any Ideas? I myself am... actually quite... tired," Johanna said with a deep yawn. She smiled at Richard and looked "down" at her massive body. "I could use the conversation, though." she added somberly, trying to move but failing. All she had mobility with was her neck, head, jaws, eyes, you get it. She could wiggle her toes and fingers, and slightly move her arms up and down, but that was about it.

Richard mindlessly stroked her soft, furry tummy before snapping out of whatever funk he was in. "Oh? Well, I think it would be best if I ventured out. I need to find help, or whoever is doing all of this!" he snapped.

"Well, I guess it would be for the best, but you *are* leaving me all alone out here with the vines. They seem friendly enough before I chopped them up, and... apparently they don't want me dead right now either. I'm sure tons of adventurers are trying to make their ways through the caves. We should wait and see if any backup arrives." Johanna explained. Richard pondered this for a moment.
1332111112.title: Payback Time: Suck the Vines Dry!

choices: "I like you, Johanna... maybe I love you..."
"That was just to shut you up. Don't speak of it again!"
13321111122.content:
"I can't leave you here alone. Not like this..." he finally said. "We're partners, right?" he asked with a smile.

Johanna shrugged and nodded slowly in approval. "So... any ideas on how to reverse all of this?" Johanna said, grasping a roll of her own flesh.

"I'm not sure... not sure if I want to, either..." Richard muttered.

"What?" Johanna responded with a raised brow.

"Ummm...."

"It's alright, I'm probably going to be stuck this way for a LOONG time, besides..." she chuckled. "Comfortable?" she inquired, noticing how Richard had curled up on her belly and began relaxing.

"Actually, yes." he answered.

"Why didn't you help me earlier?" Johanna asked, narrowing her eyes.

Richard looked up at her and smiled, "I saw that you were enjoying yourself. I had no idea it would escalate the way it did. That and I didn't want to end up getting attacked myself..."

Johanna rolled her eyes. "Of course... selfish reasons. You humans are all alike." she sighed with a sad frown.

Richard scoffed and stared at her. "Well if I was attacked myself, we'd have *no* chance of escape!" he clarified.

Johanna stopped and thought. She bobbed her head up and down in realization. "I see, my apologies, then..."

"Mind if I ask something?"

"What?"

"Earlier, when we were at the fudge trap, you were... quite antagonistic. Angry, Pushy, Bitchy... no offense," Richard said, noting that Johanna was an Anthropomorphic Wolf...

"Yeah?" Johanna replied, putting her facade of irritation and hostility back up.

"What changed?"

"Nothing's changed, what are you talking about?" Johanna said, scoffing in mock disgust.

"I know you're faking. You laughed, you were smiling, moaning. Something about *this*," Richard explained, patting Jo's belly, "Brought something out of you."

Johanna looked down in frustration, sighing, before her friendly, cute side came back out.

"I'm sorry, alright?" she apologized, "I'm sorry for everything. I was just... driven. Angry, determined. I need the Adrenaline to keep going! But, now that *this* has happened, I can barely move, let alone fight something or someone... I'm giving up." she clarified.

Richard sat and contemplated what was said, and how he was feeling at the time.

"I've succeeded so many times, but this... this is a failure!" Johanna cried, her senses leaving the addiction as she became fully aware of just what happened to her.

Richard couldn't bear to hear Johanna wallow in this self pity. Unsure of whether it was annoyance, or if he was hurting for her, he did something surprising, something even he didn't quite think through.

Richard slammed his lips into Johanna's and placed a hand in her long, blonde hair. Maintaining this intimate contact for a minute, he slowly pulled away.

"Ri-Richard?!" Johanna stuttered, eyes bulging as she eyed this Human Rogue.

Richard sighed and said...
13321111122.title: Conversation...

choices: The Vines attack Johanna once more!
Nothing Happens. Richard wakes up before Jo.
133211111221.content:
"I like you, Johanna... maybe I love you," Richard murmured. He stared down into Jo's eyes longingly as she processed what was said.

"You... love me?" Johanna replied, her face twisted in confusion. "How? Why? Just look at me! I'm enormous!" Johanna cried in disbelief. How on earth did Richard say he loved her with a straight face? Anthropomorphic Wolf she was, he was human! That, and she wasn't even that intelligent, and this was evident by how she literally sat and allowed herself to become a giant blob.

"Ever since I laid eyes on you, I thought I didn't stand a chance, but maybe I could have tried. Why do you think I was the first to volunteer when you said you needed help for this mission?" Richard explained. "We're partners. Whatever happens, we go through this together. I'm sorry if I'm... being really forwards, really quickly, but..." Richard mumbled.

To his surprise, Johanna started smiling nervously, blushing profusely. "Partners... that we are, eh? I agree. Thanks for, um... helping me out of the vines *without* getting attacked yourself." she replied, giving Richard a quick kiss on the cheek. "We should probably get some rest... I'm going to be sore, this much I know..."

Richard chuckled and nodded in agreement. "Alright, but when our little nap is over, I need to find some help!" he declared.

Johanna was still blushing, thinking about what Richard had said. She began to drift off, falling into a gentle sleep. Richard nuzzled her neck and sank into her body slightly. The warmth that she radiated was soothing to the core, and Richard fell into slumber as well.

They would sleep for about an hour until...
133211111221.title: Love is in the Air!

choices: Johanna and Richard wake up before the vines can really fatten her up
By the time the two wake up, Johanna is FAR larger than she was before
1332111112211.content:
As the two slept in relevant comfort, the vines crept back towards them, barely making a sound.as they drew closer. The vines were practically bursting with syrup and eager to send it all down Johanna's throat.

Gently, they pushed past her lips to deliver there payload. Johanna moaned slightly as the syrup went down her gullet. Slowly but surely, her for began to press out with Richard slowly sinking further into her blubber...
1332111112211.title: The Vines attack Johanna once more!

choices: Johanna holds Richard back and asks the questions from here.
Richard charges straight for Serena and attempts to kill her!
1332111112212.content:
Richard slowly opened his eyes and found that all he could see, at the moment at least, was a giant, gray, furry thing. As he regained full-awareness, he looked up to see that it was Johanna, still sound asleep. He smiled at this sight. She was so beautiful when she was sleeping. Richard buried his head into her neck and sneaked in a little kiss, curling up and relaxing. He dozed off a few times, thanks to the wonderful warmth radiated by Johanna's new body.

Soon, something in the forest caught Richard's eye. It wasn't a vine, or a feral animal. It seemed to walk upright, and was headed towards them! He drew his weapons swiftly and pointed one out into the forest as a warning. "That's close enough!" he barked. Johanna was rudely awoken by this shouting, but calmed down once she laid eyes on Richard. Of course, she went into defensive mode when she saw the pointed weapon, and snarled in an attempt to look menacing.

Emerging from the woods... was an Anthropomorphic Fox, with snowy white fur. She was draped in a brown, dirty robe that covered her lithe frame rather nicely. She pulled down her hood and smiled. "Well, you two look so cute together!" she said with a little squeak.

"Who are you? Why are you here?" Johanna inquired with a low growl.

"The name's Serena..." she said, maintaining her friendly smile. Richard noted that on her robe, the top-left corner of the torso, there was some kind of strange insignia. Nothing he could really describe, though.

"Richard... and this is Johanna," Richard finally said. "What is that on your Robe?" he inquired with a mixture of curiosity and anxiousness.

Serena looked down and searched her robe until she found the insignia. Her eyes widened as she realized what *exactly* she was wearing, in front of these two. She wracked her mind for an answer that, while still completely truthful, wouldn't panic the Rogue and his friend.

"Well, spit it out!" Johanna ordered, narrowing her eyes.

Serena took a deep breath and said... "I'm one of the Lipomancer's ex-Students..."

"Lipomancer?" Richard muttered to himself, sounding out the syllables.

"Also known as the master of this Cave, and the surrounding area..." Serena clarified, with a nervous shrug and casual, yet still guilty grin.

Richard put the pieces together. She was here to collect her master's little "prize", meaning Johanna! He readied his weapons and prepared to pounce.
1332111112212.title: A New Ally. Introducing: The Ex-Student...

choices: Reverse the Weight Gain, and try to escape?
Reverse the Weight Gain, and try to go after the treasure?
13321111122121.content:
Richard had prepared to attack this so-called Student of the Lipomancer...

"Richard, stop!" Johanna cried, and Richard whirled around to face Jo. One look at her dead-serious glare, and that was enough to deter Richard... for now.

"Let's not risk a confrontation, shall we?" Serena suggested, throwing her hands up in surrender. "Whatever questions you have, feel free to ask!"

Johanna bit her lip. "Richard, I'll ask the questions, okay?"

Richard kept his eyes on her. "Alright, but the first funny move she makes against us and she dies!" he warns. He takes a seat on Johanna's ginormous gut and relaxes as best he can.

Johanna smiles, feeling Richard sitting against her belly. She blushes lightly before returning to reality. "Firstly," Johanna said, holding up one finger for emphasis...
"Who exactly is the Lipomancer?"

Serena nods, acknowledging the question. "The Lipomancer is the Arch-Mage of this region. The amount of things he commands are not endless, but quite numerous. A Temple, a few castles, this cave... it's said that he's hiding treasure beyond your wildest dreams somewhere, but he wouldn't tell me where, or what it was." she elucidates.

Johanna gives a partial nod before holding up her second finger. "Secondly: Why are you his Student?"

Serena gives this question some thought. "I'm aware of the purpose and effects of these traps. I myself was a victim of them," she explains with a nervous chuckle. "I was just a beggar with an undiscovered skill in the magical arts. I stumbled upon this very cave one day, and went inside to escape the thunderstorm that day. Eventually, I came to the Fudge Trap. As you knew, I was a beggar. I wasn't the brightest, then. I couldn't solve it, and so I had to swallow as much of the fudge as I could to keep from drowning completely in it. Let's just say... I was five times your size when it finally shut off. I remember crying and crying for hours, trying to move. The Lipomancer found me and forced me to swear loyalty to him. I wasn't in a position to say no. He threatened to kill me!" Serena explained.

"We didn't ask for a life-story, Miss," Richard retorted rather rudely.

Serena frowned at him and continued, "He later discovered my hidden abilities and made a deal with me. He'd agree to slowly shrink me back, a little bit every day, if I'd become his apprentice, to carry on his work. I agreed, and... within a few months, here I am!"

Johanna raised a third finger. "Thirdly, why are the traps here meant to increase weight at such a rapid pace, and why target me and me only? What about Richard?" she inquired, partly to tease Richard, who elbowed her belly affectionately.

Serena looked around cautiously before continuing. "The Lipomancer doesn't have any interest in killing those unlucky enough to fall into his elaborate ruses. And, it's pretty damn hard to restrain a powerful, strong person with ropes. That and you can't force them to sell themselves as his eternal slaves when tied up and left at that. The Lipomancer decided to use... unique... magic to increase the WEIGHT of adventurers, to the point of immobility. That, and it's pretty hilarious to see you guys slowly gain, as you try to march on to the treasure, only to inevitably end up immobile, and slaves to the Lipomancer," Serena said with a haughty laugh at the end, "That, and he told me that is was a real turn-on!"

Johanna's eyes widened at the idea of this. "Hell no, I'm not being used as this old coot's pleasure object!?!" she shouted in bewilderment.

"Hey, Jo, calm down. If anyone's going to take you away, they have to go through me first." Richard said, gently rubbing her belly, comforting her.

"Well, anyways... that brings me to my fourth and final question for now..." Johanna said, holding up her fourth finger. "Why are you telling us all of this?"

Serena bit her lip angrily, bad memories flooding back. "I escaped. I thought I had it all, working for this guy. When I saw what he was doing with other people, the work that he made them do, and that he wasn't ever bluffing about killing people... I had to run away. I know these caves, the temples, the castles, like the back of my hand. Even better, I can control body weight just like the Lipomancer. I can try to reverse the effects of the vines on Johanna, so she can move again. But we have to hurry and get out of here. The Lipomancer sees everything. He's been trying to apprehend me for weeks, and I've already helped several others escape. I need you to trust me!

Richard and Johanna exchanged looks for a brief moment before returning their gaze to Serena.

"Reverse this, best you can. But I still want that treasure!" Johanna said, steely determination in her eyes.


((AUTHOR'S NOTE: Magicaster888 here! I'm not intentionally trying to get the story off it's original WG/Inflation track, but I do not believe that Weight Gain must occur in every. single. chapter. For me, it's about world-building, character development and introduction. We have the power of choice at our fingertips in this and many other stories. We should use it for it's greatest potential. I introduced an Ex-Student of the Lipomancer to help out and advance the plot. To help counter some traps, and get hit with traps herself! I want these characters to find that treasure and come home true heroes for defeating the Lipomancer, but that doesn't mean that the story is derailed. There will be plenty of weight gain, both voluntary and involuntary, and it'll be a long journey. If you want to support this storyline, feel free to contribute!
13321111122121.title: Finally, Some Decent Answers!

choices: Go Right into the Flower Field: Take the quickest route.
Head to the Cabin, get some food, sleep, ask for directions.
133211111221212.content:
"We need to get out of here, you two. No time for treasure. We'd need a bloody army!" Serena advises.

Johanna and Richard cannot be swayed. "We'll make do. You can help us if anything bad happens. Reversing trap effects, right?" Johanna asked.

Serena just facepalmed. "Alright, we'll try to run for the treasure. Hold still, Richard, can you get off of her?"

Richard hops off and Serena approaches. "This may have a slight tickle to it. Not sure if It's painful or not..." Serena says, placing both hands in Johanna's massive stomach and rubbing delicately with glowing hands. "This should work..." she mumbles to herself.

Sure enough, Johanna feels an odd, tingling sensation as her body begins to lose the weight! She smiles like an idiot when she finally feels strong enough to stand. She continued to drop the weight until she slowed to a halt. Her thighs and arms were still pretty thick, and her belly was the size of a very large exercise ball. All in all, she was still extremely obese, but it was light enough for travel.

"You're... nude, right now. I don't think it's the best idea to completely reverse this, for the sake of body temperature, and decency's sake." Serena chuckles, patting Johanna's belly.

Johanna herself snarled in anger. "You agreed to reverse it as best you could, I know you're holding back!" she barked. Richard jumped in between them to forestall an escalation to the physical.

"Jo, please, she's got a point. Besides... I think you're really beautiful like this," said Richard, who blushed at that last comment.

Johanna took a deep breath and settled down, smiling at Richard. "Thank you, you really think so?" she asked, returning the blush while scratching her belly with one hand and putting the other on her hip seductively.

"Alright, I think we should go before you two get sidetracked again... I called off the vines, but if the Lipomancer overrides that..." Serena warned.

Richard simply gave Johanna a pat on the side of her belly and nodded. "Yes, we should get going. Which way?" he inquired, and Serena turned her heads to the left and the right.

Serena snapped her fingers and finally began to speak. "On the right, we have the path that you guys took to get here. We can go through that flower-field, but the Pollen is pretty damn intoxicating. You two will be 'rolling in satin sheets' for days if you catch my drift. That and the pollen also has an effect on the waistline if ingested. Stay close to me and we'll be fine. Our line of sight will be MUCH better, besides," she elucidated for the two adventurers.
"On our LEFT, we'll continue into the forest, but I believe there is a cabin there. A few of the Lipomancer's 'employees' will be of service, providing food... untainted of course, because we eat the same stuff they have to... and bed. We can get some good, safe, uninterrupted rest there and ask for directions later.
133211111221212.title: Thanks, Serena. Now Let's go get that Treasure!

choices: Eat. I mean, if Stacy says it's good...
Fair point. Sleep. MAYBE breakfast in the morning.
1332111112212122.content:
Richard and Johanna pondered their options at this point. Faster, more accurate travel to their right, at risk of falling under the spell of the local flora.
To their left, more delayed travel speed to a cabin. If what Serena said was true, they'd have a safe place to rest up. However it was still risky. The Lipomancer could have warned the "employees" stationed at the cabin. Shrugging, Johanna decided to risk it and head to the cabin. "It seems like a good idea. We can trust Serena, right?" Johanna said, dragging out that final word with a glare at Serena.

"You can trust me, but if you try to hurt me with a bad excuse, I'll balloon you out like you wouldn't believe," Serena cautioned with a lighthearted snicker, "Nothing severe, though. When I use my magic it is only in good fun, rather than a trap for enslavement."

Johanna's ears perked up at this. Two parts Anger, two parts Shock. She shook her head and sighed.

...

The walk to the alleged cabin was a long one. Johanna had to stop to take a breather about thrice before Serena took pity and cast another spell. Instead of dropping weight however, Johanna only found her endurance, and her strength, renewed and bolstered! "How did you..." she inquired, cocking her head in a canine fashion.

"Hey, I didn't learn JUST the lipomancer's spells. You pick a few skills up here and there!" Serena replied with a giggle.

"If you two are done chatting, I think I see the cabin!" Richard exclaims excitedly as he runs towards the wooden lodge.

After the two caught up, Richard knocked on the door and Serena stepped in front. Answering the door was an antropomorphic lioness. Richard's eyes widened when he took one look at her gigantic gut, which was probably her largest feature, sagging down to her knees. She was still mobile... somehow, even with her large body.

"Oh! I didn't know we were to have visitors! Please, come inside, you must be starving!" the lioness said, unaware of her visitors' current predicament...

"That's okay, we're just here to stay the night. We'll be gone in the morning," Richard responded with a kind nod of the head. The lioness frowned sadly in realization. "Oh, that's right. You've been eluding the Master's traps all day." she muttered in contempt for the Lipomancer. "My name is Stacy, pleasure to make your acquaintance!" she then added, extending her hands for Richard and Johanna, who both shook them out of respect.

"The food here... it doesn't... you know...?" Johanna inquired, to Stacy's dismay.

"No, no! The food we eat, you eat. If we ate *that* sort of food we wouldn't be able to maintain the lodge!" she replied, putting a pudgy hand to her thick chest where her heart would be.

"Well?" Richard asked, looking to Johanna and Serena, "Eat or Sleep?"

"I'd like a meal, if you don't mind!" Serena pleaded, walking over to a bar.

"Should we *reaallly* risk it?" Johanna questioned, putting a hand on her wide hip.
1332111112212122.title: A Cabin in the Woods

choices: Make Johanna the bed, but tell her first.
Let Richard sleep on the floor. Not worth the risk.
13321111122121222.content:
"Good point, Johanna. Stacy, Serena, not to offend anybody in this room, but um... I think it's best we rest first. We'll have breakfast tomorrow morning!" Richard finally said. Johanna smirked at Serena.

"You heard him. Two to One, overruled!" she announced victoriously.

Serena rolled her eyes and followed the two downstairs to the basement. It was an almost excessively roomy space, with high ceilings and oversized beds. As Richard went to sit in one of them, Serena cleared her throat loudly to gain his attention.

"That's Stacy's bed," she said. "Most of these beds are assigned to staff. You can tell by the belongings on the nightstands," she added as she gestured to a book resting on the nightstand. Sure enough, Stacy's name was written on the spine in some kind of oddly colored ink. A diary, possibly.

"Are there any free beds?" Richard inquired. At that moment, Stacy delicately waddled down the stairs, gripping the railings for dear life.

"We only have two. Not many people come by here, and those two were reserved for our next... "coworkers"..." she answered with a chuckle, in an attempt to lighten the mood and situation.

"Dibs on that first one!" Serena immediately called aloud, dashing over to it to mark it as hers for the night. Johanna slapped a hand to her forehead and sighed as she stared at the ground.

"That leaves just that one... Johanna, I insist you take it. I can sleep on the floor." Richard said, taking her hand in his.

"Can't we... umm..." Johanna whispered with a blush.

"Share the bed? No. It wouldn't fit both of us. You're about as big as the other people here. The bed was made for you. I can sleep on the floor, milady."

Serena just casually listened to the exchange, examining her nails casually when she hit upon an idea. A brilliant one that could serve as a solution to this issue, and a way to get back at Johanna for her nasty attitude towards her. Not sure how Johanna would react if she *told* her the plan, but she knew it'd be much worse if she surprised the Wolfess.
13321111122121222.title: No More Room in the 'Inn.'

choices: The Next Morning...
133211111221212221.content:
Serena shook her head apathetically. Alright, whatever. She was gonna do it.

"I have a Solution that could possibly please all three of us," she announced.

Johanna looked her in the eye and smirked. "What are you going to do? Make *me* the bed?" she said with a low chuckle and a grin. Her laughter became more and more awkward as she processed that Serena wasn't even moving in the slightest to tell her she was wrong. "Oh no..." Johanna said, narrowing her eyes.

Richard shrugged. "If it'll accomplish the goal, I'm all for it," the human Rogue said.

Johanna took a step back. "No, no!"

Richard pulled her back gently, "Relax, Jo... I'm sure you might actually like it." he said in an attempt to sound comforting.

Johanna eyed him strangely for a moment before she exhaled. "I can't believe I'm doing this," she said. Serena's ears perked up in excitement as she approached, waving her hands to gather arcane energies. "I'm doing this for Richard. Not you!" Johanna added, pointing a finger in Serena's direction.

Serena nodded in respect. "I understand. Could you please move to the back, where there's more room?" she asked, gliding a hand in the direction aforementioned. There was actually another room beyond a door. Storage, but right now, for some unknown reason it was pretty much empty.

"Really? An empty storage room?" Richard asked, turning around to face Stacy.

The lioness scratched her neck nervously, "We're awaiting shipments from another part of the Lipomancer's territory."

Johanna blinked before standing in the center of the room, awaiting Serena's spell. "Before you ask, which I know you probably would have, I am sure that I want to do this!" she declared. Stacy just turned and waddled to her bed and sat down. Richard held her hand, and Serena closed the door with her foot as she finished charging her spell.

"Alrighty then. This won't even hurt a single bit!" Serena chirped, sliding her hands across the air and releasing her arcane energy in Johanna's direction.

"Most. Unorthodox Way. To make a bed... I have ever had to bear witness to." Richard snickered, earning another blush of embarrassment from Johanna. Since the incident out in the forest, she had really lightened up around him. Johanna knew this. She actually kinda liked the feeling. It wasn't something she'd charge into battle thinking about, but... she simply felt at peace with Richard.

Johanna began feeling a strange sensation in her gut. She looked down to see that it was once again growing. This time, she didn't worry, she didn't kick or scream, and it wasn't an addictive like the Vines. She giggled quietly to herself and rested a hand on the "shelf"/top of her belly. She turned her head to examine her rear, which was also expanding outwards. This was a full-body experience, clearly. Bringing her vision back to her growing belly, she couldn't resist any longer. She cracked a toothy smile. "Whatever you're doing..." Johanna murmured to Serena, "You do it well."

Richard held Jo's other hand, but once he saw that she was comfortable, he let go and brought his hand to her back, which he gently began rubbing. "How long will this take?" Richard asked.

Serena only grinned and closed her eyes. "However long you want it to take. You two enjoy each other's company!" she said, stopping the channeling of energy. Johanna was still growing at a steady pace regardless as Serena took her leave.

Johanna turned to Richard. They were of pretty similar heights. Jo only had about an inch or so on him, so their eyes were able to meet without much effort. Richard put the side of his fist, at the thumb, to his mouth to stifle a snicker. "To think that only yesterday my life was normal." he teased.

Jo giggled in response, "I know, right? Yesterday I was a thin, muscular, all-powerful Bitch with a giant axe and a cold attitude. Now look at me: A big fat softy in both meanings of 'softy'!"

Richard grinned as Jo's belly pressed against his. He tried to lean forwards to kiss Johanna, but found that his path was too obstructed. He settled for a light smooch on the top of Jo's gut. "Yes, but you're my softy." he replied.

Johanna sat down on the ground. It was probably just her, but the ground felt rather comfortable! Johanna spread her legs and let her belly rest on the ground. As her body grew in all directions, Richard stepped back and took it all in. Eventually Johanna reached the size she was when Serena first found the two, yet she was still going! "Um, Jo, honey?" Richard said, scratching his head and ruffling his hair.

Johanna seemed oblivious to the issue, though she still responded. "Something the matter?" she questioned as she brought both hands to rest atop each other, on her ginormous belly. Richard shook his head. It was probably nothing. Just Serena being Serena...

Time passed, conversation was exchanged. Primarily about Johanna and Richard's pasts, family, friends, and hobbies. Eventually however, Johanna stopped her growth, double her prior weight! It was miraculous that her arms could move at all, but Johanna managed to do so, patting her gut to invite Richard over. He snickered again and climbed up, giving her a kiss on her muzzle, before wrapping his arms around her neck and bringing her in for a "hug". She nuzzled his cheek and sighed contentedly, beginning to doze off. With the rest of her strength she pulled her arms up and over Richard, blanketing him in her embrace. Richard took a deep breath and caught scent of Jo's long, blonde hair. It smelled oddly sweet, of herbs, most likely. Finally, Richard closed his eyes and gave himself to the slumber...

"No," Richard said both to himself and to Johanna. He threw his desire for gold and jewels aside and slid closer to Johanna's face. "I want to stay here with you."

Johanna smirked, lifting a brow. "Since when were you so infatuated with me?" she asked with a sly wink.

"Since we met back at the Explorer's Guild. Is it a crime to find a woman such as yourself beautiful?" Richard replied, "I had to keep my mouth shut on the way here. Knowing you, you would have beaten me senseless!"

Johanna laughed for a brief moment. "Yeah, I suppose I would have," she said, shaking her head in disbelief. "My mind was on Gold and Gold only at that time."

Richard paused a minute and thought about that. "Yes, I can relate."

The Wolfess nuzzled Richard's neck lovingly before she spoke again. She sighed and said, "Mmm... two treasure hunters, way in over their heads, am I right?"

Richard nodded in agreement. "Oh yeah. It better be worth it though..."

A slight giggle was heard from Johanna as she heard these words. "When this is all over, I just want to settle down for a little while. Take a loooonnnng vacation," she declared. She turned back to Richard and looked him straight in the eye, "With you..."

Richard blushed heavily and cleared his throat into his fist. "I, uh... I don't know what to say, I..." he stammered before Johanna cut him off.

"You don't have to say anything."

The human rogue smiled. "If I could find this Lipomancer's spellbook, do you think that you'd want to do this again some time? For leisurely purposes?" he asked his Wolfess lover, who only laughed for a full minute. A cover for her raging thoughts regarding that question.

Finally she settled down and replied. "I'd love that, more than anything!" she finally said, holding back another snicker. "That is if we get out of here," Johanna added with a roll of the eyes. Richard immediately frowned.

"Don't even think like that," he commanded. "We're going to get out of here, and we're going to leave the richest people in the world!" The rogue stared sternly into her eyes, before they softened up and his voice lowered to a whisper. "Promise me that we're both getting out of this together."

Johanna gave an assuring "yes" before she closed in to lock lips with Richard, who returned it with much enthusiasm. Jo began to moan quietly as she closed her eyes. Richard was massaging her shoulders, working his way to the top of her belly as he remained locked in the kiss.

Suddenly, the sound of a door opening was heard. "Am I interrupting something?" said a familiar voice as the Lipomancer's ex-Student entered the room.

Richard rolled his eyes and partially broke the kiss, keeping his head close to Johanna's. "What is it now, Serena?" he asked.

"Oh, nothing. Stacy woke me up early for breakfast. I brought you your food. I had a feeling I'd walk in on a moment of passion. I don't want to ruin this for you guys!" the white fox-woman replied as she stepped back outside and wheeled in a tray with food on it. "Feel free to eat when you are ready, and meet us upstairs." And with that, she left the two alone.

Johanna smirked and pressed her lips back against Richard's. She thought to herself... "I can eat later... right now, he's mine!"

The two lovers would continue their little date for about another two hours, most of it spent eating and talking, until Richard eventually hopped off of Johanna. He knelt down and kissed her belly before turning and walking out the door to summon Serena.

1332111121.content:
((A/N: I didn't write this chapter to annoy anyone. I wanted to write a Critical Mission Failure for a while, but didn't have the space to do so without derailing somebody else's chapter. Luckily one path was available for the taking. I'm happy to have given you guys so many chapters. :) ))

Richard had now lost all consciousness, and was discarded without a shred of dignity as the vine around his neck tossed him headfirst into a tree.

Johanna whimpered pitifully, her only backup now gone.

At least five Syrup Vines had forced open her muzzle and entered her mouth, pumping Sugary Sweet syrup down her throat vigorously.

Johanna looked down as best she could to see her armor ride up her chest as her belly bulged forwards and began to sag. She knew that, without any way to fight back, and without anyone else to help her, she was pretty much doomed. She would struggle for some time until she felt something that horrified her. She felt her belly brush against the ground. She froze in mortal terror as she realized just how much Syrup was in her now. She wouldn't be able to move, ergo, unable to escape if she somehow got out of *these* vines' grasps.

With a tear, she resigned to her fate, all struggling ceased as the vines continued their work.

Curiously, she gained next to nothing in her face. The one bit of solace she was permitted.

The Vines sensed her pain, and one blew a strange powder in her face. Within five minutes, something strange was occurring inside her mind. A mixture of thoughts both positive and negative were at war with one another.

There's no escape, Johanna. You know it perfectly well. If you are to perish within the next few hours, would you spend them wallowing in shame? she asked herself. A smirk managed to escape her as she shook her head.

If this is my dying day, I want to enjoy this. Savor every last moment...

Johanna, in spite of her common sense, began chugging the Syrupy liquid, moaning as her stomach spread out across the ground below her. Her arms, legs, and bosom inflated as well. Something in the Syrup was causing it to immediately become fat! Not like it mattered, though.

Johanna growled in pleasure as all mobility was lost in her body, now a massive blob suspended by multiple vines that were not cut down by Richard.

She showed no signs of stopping at all.

Johanna lost all concept of time, consumed by her greed for more... The Vines acknowledged her acceptance and lowered her down, releasing her arms and legs and letting her rub her belly with glee. She didn't care if this never stopped! She came here for treasure, glory, fame... but if she wasn't to get it the conventional way...

She may as well become the biggest Wolfess in existence! Johanna consciously fought back the impending Comatose that threatened to take away her feelings of Ecstasy, and was doing well at that, as a matter of fact.

Her Greed would cost her, though, as she grabbed the vines that had previously wrapped around her limbs, and allowed them to join the others in filling her up.

She moaned loudly as her sensitive belly pressed against a tree. Her last reasonable thought: "How am I turned on by this?"

Eventually she cared not, choosing instead to slurp down more of this Syrup. As the vines caressed her belly, Johanna couldn't hold back any longer. She attempted to shout as all she saw was a great blur, along with "stars". She shuddered in relief and pleasure, and, having her energy taken away by this sudden burst of stimulation, she finally faded out of Consciousness, still inflating rapidly with the Syrup.

Johanna and Richard were never seen Again. It is presumed that Johanna is still alive, and that the Lipomancer himself had taken great pride in his achievement. With a little magic, of course, Johanna had been dragged off to the heart of his Lair, where she may be living to this day, as the Lipomancer's most successful experiment, partner, and lover.

End: Critical Mission Failure.
Motives of the Lipomancer: Undiscovered.
Richard: Deceased
Johanna: Captured, Immobilized, and Indoctrinated.

"No, you were probably just seeing things," Johanna replied, turning her head towards the field. "We may have a better time seeing ahead of us in that field, though. I say we go this way!"

Richard took one look back at the forest before following Johanna to the field. The aroma of the flowers were almost... intoxicating. They smelled wonderful, and Richard instantly felt at ease. Johanna, for once, was also starting to lighten up, smiling and looking about like a curious child.

Neither of them were caring anymore about their navigation through the field, and somehow ended up getting lost, wandering aimlessly together in the flowers, just talking to each other as friends, for about an Hour before Richard finally stopped, and sat down.

"What's the matter?" Johanna asked, sitting down in front of him. Her belly wobbled in her lap as she tilted her head inquisitively.

"N-Nothing... should we eat some rations?" Richard stuttered. Thoughts in his mind that he knew were not deliberately his own began flooding in.

Johanna grinned and reached inside their pack, searching for their food.

..........

Richard could notice that pollen flew aimlessly through the air as Johanna ate. What he didn't notice was that the pollen was tainting some of the food. As Johanna ate, her entire body began expanding slowly with fat. Somehow, the pollen was causing the food to be digested immediately, converting into pure fat within minutes.

Richard himself could not eat. He was too focused on his own thoughts. A sort of "meditative" state. His mind was utterly relaxed. No mental noise or conflict except for a select few topics.

He looked up at Johanna as she grew, somehow not caring about what was happening. He was fully aware, but didn't really process the potential danger.

"Wow, when she isn't under stress, she's actually pretty nice..." he thought to himself, tilting his head.

"Actually... she's pretty cute... dare I think it: she's actually pretty sexy..." he mused, before shaking his head. Did he just think that?

He didn't even know he, a human, was attracted to Anthros! Let alone obese ones... Johanna was now joyfully munching on her rations as her expansion failed to cease. Her arms and legs had thickened quite nicely, about the size of her head in width. Her legs were leg tree-trunks, but not the particularly wide variety.

Her gut was the size of a large exercise ball by now, and she showed no signs of stopping. Her breasts each were basketball sized, sitting atop her globular belly. The only things not drastically affected were her cheeks and tail. Sure, her cheeks puffed out a bit, but not so much as to form chins or anything.

"So... wonderful... round, soft, perfect..." he said, his mind giving in to his relaxed, giddy state. He did enjoy rubbing her belly, no?

"Richard? Is something wrong?" Johanna asked as she finally stopped eating. Richard was staring intently at her belly and bosom.

He wanted her now. Something in his mind was screaming for him to just, tackle her and make her his. His better nature, however, shouted in response. Crazy as this was, if he "loved" Johanna, he should at least get to know her, or let her know how he feels.

"...I say we go right." Richard suggested, scratching his chin in thought.

"Then we shall go left," Johanna replied, not hesitating to stroll right down her chosen path.

Richard sighed, throwing his hands into the air in a gesture of aggravation, "You know, you're a bitch in more ways than one..."

"And you're lucky I need you, otherwise I would have snapped you like a twig for that..." Johanna snorted.

The tunnel was becoming darker, and a soft, chattering noise could be heard further down its length.

"Yeesh, it was just a joke you beastly woman... say, do you have the torches? It's getting darker, and that noise isn't easing my anxiety at all..."

They paused for a moment as Richard pulled out his flint and steel, striking the two together and lighting the torch that Johanna held out to him. As soon as the torch caught fire an lit the tunnel, the chattering grew into screeching as the two were swarmed by a rather small group of bats.

"Johanna! Put it out, put it out!" Richard yelled over the squealing din of their attackers, ducking his head down low to the ground and avoiding the swarm.

Johanna was far too busy panicking however, screaming and swinging the lit torch in every direction about her. She managed to take out quite a few of the pests, but they still swooped at her, startled by the light of the torch.

"Richard! Where are you, these thing are-MPH!"

Johanna's eyes widened in terrified surprise as she felt one of the winged creatures fly straight into her open mouth.

She was further surprised, though more perplexed than startled, when she realized that it tasted delicious.

She grabbed at the "bat" intruding into her mouth, and then realized that it wasn't a bat at all, but instead a roast beef sandwich, packed with meat, stuffed with gravy, and flapping its wings of lettuce. The bizarre food construct tasted so good that, instead of pulling it out of her mouth as she'd intended, she pushed it in completely, swallowing the creature whole.

"Get down Johanna! You're going to get hurt!"

"No, it's okay Richard, these thing-MMMRPH!" She was interrupted once more as another sandwich shoved it's way into her jaws. While Johanna found the situation to be extremely strange, she was still feeling oddly hungry and decided to consume this new sandwich as well. Almost as soon as she was done swallowing, licking and sucking the spilled gravy from her fingers, yet another sandwich bat dive-bombed into her maw, and Johanna opened wide as it did, letting it slide down her throat and into her hungry gut.

As Johanna was satisfying her greedy stomach, Richard cowered on the floor, his hands on top of his head. He was still unaware of the true nature of the bats, but when he heard the torch clatter to the ground, he leaped to his feet, startled. He quickly caught sight of his wolfess partner, Johanna now snatching the flying sandwiches from the air with both of her paws and stuffing them voraciously into her mouth.

Richard only stood there, puzzled at Johanna's actions. He had figured his partner needed to eat a lot to maintain her muscular physique, but even this seemed to be a bit much, even for somebody of her size. Johanna wasn't just hungry, she was ravenous, enough so to devour strange flying creatures neither of them had even seen before! He wanted to inquire about the adventurer's strange and sudden appetite, but he decided to remain silent, only watching as she grabbed the last sandwich, a tiny, squawking runt, and pushed it past her lips.

"Mmm... now that's a meal!" She said, murring with satisfaction as she patted her now even further distended stomach, the round white furred bulge sagging slightly past her belt.

"Uhh... Johanna....?" Richard said, concern permeating his words.

The wolfess stopped patting her stomach, her pleased and hedonistic grin slowly fading as she gripped her swollen paunch, "By the gods! Why does this keep HAPPENING?!"

The rogue held his hand over his mouth to stifle a laugh at her reaction, "Come on now, we can't keep delaying like this..." He snorted, his eyes filled with glee, "Besides tubbo, if we get moving maybe you can shed a few pounds!"

Johanna snarled in rage, heaving her axe into her paws and chasing the cackling rogue deeper into the caverns.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------

A pair of gnarled hands gently hovered above a crystal scrying orb as he observed his latest guests.

His lair was receiving quite a few "Intruders" as of late, no doubt due to his network of allies spreading rumors in the taverns and inns of the land.
