1543311111111111112121.content:
The chamber was quiet for a moment as the fat doe's snores died down, but then the bedroom was filled with the creaking of the bed and the groans of the deer herself as she shifted uncomfortably, her huge now much larger body shifting against the sheets.

Light slowly began to disperse the darkness as the once thin ranger awoke until she opened her eyes fully, wincing at the sunlight coming in through the small window of the rented room. Though it wasn't exactly rented was it? Uturi could barely even recall coming up here and falling asleep, and she certainly didn't remember paying for a room at any inn. Just as her eyes adjusted to the light, so too did her mind adjust to her memories.

The inn from before, where she had first met Remus, the one with the elven waitress...

Why had they even come back here in the first place? Where had Remus gone and how could he abandon his companion so easily? And why had she ever dared to eat even a morsel of that accursed food?

The doe girl sat up, using far more effort than she had ever used for such a simple action. She could feel soft flab on her arms pressing together, her now gravid belly bouncing freely from her torn armor, her once muscular thighs now flabby, not just touching but rubbing together as she swung her legs off over the side of the bed. How could this possibly have been from just a single meal?

Grunting sharply as she hefted her body to her feet, she took a deep breath, steadying herself, before she opened the door and walked down the hall. Not only was she exhausted from her newly plumpened form, but the deer's head was pounding as well, likely hung over from the huge amount of booze she'd consumed last night. By the time the doe had made it down the stairs into the tavern section of the inn, she was already panting and sweating, bending down with greater difficulty than she ever had to place her paws on her knees to catch her breath.

"What did they do to me?" She thought to herself, "I need to find Remus, where's Remus?"

Just as the ranger was turning for the door, the scent of delicious food filled her nostrils as a waitress walked by carrying a tray of sizzling bacon. The girl's mouth began to water, her stomach gurgled, and her headache and nausea started to clear immediately.

She was asking the wrong questions, she had realized. What she should have been asking was...

"Can I have some breakfast?"

"Of course dear!" The elf from last night replied, grinning sweetly before lowering a colossal platter piled with eggs, bacon, potatoes and soft, fluffy biscuits.

Uturi's eyes widened as she glanced around, finding herself seated in the same seat as last night. This wasn't right! She was just about to leave, about to find help, about to... to...

"Dig in!" The waitress said beaming, slamming another mug of beer onto the table, "And don't worry, I've brought you plenty to wash it all down with!"

"But I..." Uturi moaned, mouth watering.

"Oh no worries, a little booze this early never hurt anyone! Now eat up!"

Before she had even finished speaking, Uturi was already shoveling the hot, greasy food into her drooling mouth. She didn't bother to use any silverware, didn't even check to see if there WAS any. Her paws grabbed desperately for as much sustenance as she could fit in them, brought it to her mouth, paused once in a while to wipe the grease from her maw or wash it down with a chug of beer, before doing it all over again.

As she ate, the elf girl continued to bring her more and more plates of food. Uturi continued to eat fatty strips of bacon, gigantic eggs, gravy soaked mashed potatoes, tender and juicy mutton... shepherd's pie stuffed with meat and cheese... rich, sweet cake...

Uturi's mind whirled as her hunger came to a screeching halt, crashing like a runaway carriage as it hit a wall of agonizing stomach pain. Cake? Mutton? These didn't seem like breakfast foods...

The ranger looked around the room and saw, for the first time that all of the tables were empty.

All except hers. Night had already fallen in what seemed like the blink of an eye, and it was just her and the elven waitress, who leered down at the seated and overstuffed deer with that smug grin.

"All done for the day, hmm big girl?"

"Urrrggh... soooo... hic!" Uturi grunt, stifling a belch with one paw, cradling the tender balloon of a belly that now pressed heavily against her table, "Too much... food... please, I need to..."

"Have some rest..." The waitress finished assuringly, wasting no time in grabbing the deer's flabby arm and lifting her to her hooves.

"No... Need to... need to..."

The deergirl groaned groggily as she found herself plopped into the soft, fluffy bed, sinking deeper into the mattress, deeper into sleep.

"...to eat!" The waitress chimed cheerfully, slamming a plate full of ham, flapjacks, and sausages onto Uturi's table.

"W-Whuh...?"

"I said 'I hope you're hungry, because there's plenty to eat!'" The waitress repeated.

Uturi groaned, holding her head in her paws, rubbing her temples as they pounded. What was going on? Wasn't she just sleeping? Wasn't she trying to...

The plate was steaming, sizzling, its noxiously appetizing scent drifting in seductive and enticing curls as it assaulted Uturi's nose. Her head cleared. Her nostrils flared. Her mouth watered. She was trying to eat. Trying to eat as the waitress came by again and said...

"More food?"

"Of course!" The doe moaned past a mouthful of roast beef.

"Another cup?"

"Yes..." Uturi gasped, belching as she swallowed two pawfuls of sweet tarts, "More, please!"

"Room for another plate?"

The ranger only nodded up at the waitress, chewing down the sausage and toast in her mouth, grunting an affirmative, "Mmmnnff..." Before taking a huge swig of beer.

Time was whirling like a maelstrom for Uturi, slipping away like sand through her fingers, a quickening march. The only constants: Her soft and warm bed, the cocky but familiar voice of the elf barmaid, the rich and delicious food...

Her pawtips pressed against her temple as she groaned and panted, Uturi shaking her head, trying to clear it of this fugue.

This had to stop... she needed to... to...
1543311111111111112121.title: Hospitality at its Fattest

The chamber was quiet for a moment, the snores of the massively obese doe dying down before the bedroom was filled with the creaking of the bed and the groans and wheezing of the deer herself as her eyes shot awake. Uturi gasped frantically for breath, trying to sit up, fat paws swinging aimlessly above her before they gripped the bed sheets.

Light blinded her momentarily as the once merely fat ranger awoke, the doe shielding her eyes with a flabby arm while her breathing grew more steady. The doe laid on her side for a moment, the rolls of fat that now comprised her stomach rippling against one another as she recovered her stamina, gazing at the door of the rented room. Though it wasn't exactly rented was it? Uturi could barely even recall coming up here and falling asleep... and she... she certainly didn't remember paying for a room...

The inn from before... the one with the elven waitress...

Uturi grunted as she pushed herself upright, sitting with an enormous amount of effort. The heavy flab of her arms squished together, her titanic swollen belly sagging and bouncing between her legs, so disgustingly bloated with fat that it even forced the deergirl's thick blubbery thighs apart. How could this possibly have been...

She groaned, holding her head. Something was wrong, something more than a hangover from last night. Everything was so familiar... like her thoughts were going through a routine both comfortable and somehow... wrong...

Groaning and whining with exertion and discomfort, the titanic doe shoved her fat ass off the bed and onto her hooves. The frame creaked loudly and even cracked a little as she did so, the sweat-soaked sheets clinging to her mammoth and nearly bare asscheeks before they slumped onto the floor behind her. The girl grunted thickly as gravity and momentum began to tug her girthy body forwards even further, nearly toppling the ranger, Uturi just barely able to maintain her balance.

Waddling for the door, Uturi attempted briefly to cram her body through. This ended quickly enough when she realized that she was so wide both her hips extended past the door frame, so she opted to shove herself through sideways instead, just barely managing to squeeze her ass and gut through.

By the time the doe had reached the stairs at the end of the hallway she was already tired, panting and wheezing. Pausing to catch her breath for a few minutes, the doe gathered her strength and carefully maneuvered her bulk down the stairs step by step. Not only was her head pounding, but her heart as well, a slight pain welling up in the tubby deergirl's gut, forcing her to pause halfway down to catch her breath before resuming her descent. By the time she had reached the bottom, the pain had only worsened, the morbidly obese woman huffing deeply, her fur drenched in pungent sweat.

Uturi had to pause again, her paw pressing against a nearby wall as she leaned her hefty body against it. She stood there for a while, her breaths slowly becoming less ragged, but the pain in her belly not going away, increasing more and more until finally...

The doe leaned forwards, bending over slightly before letting loose a thunderous bout of flatulence. She groaned out loud with relief as her short fluffy tail fluttered, moaning as the pain subsided, reflexively ignoring the patrons and tavern staff as they glanced and cringed and snickered.

Something within her mind knew she should be ashamed of herself; not just the gas but the weight she had put on, the way she came down here to stuff herself everyday, and most of all the fact that she had long ago outgrown her armor. For a long while now Uturi had been eating and sleeping at the tavern nearly in the nude, scraps of her leather armor still clinging to her, pinched between the deep, rolling folds of her obese body. The only things keeping her decent were her cloth undergarments, stretched and strained, her top barely covering her plump nipples now, her bottom all but invisible beneath her surging belly flab, lost between her elephantine buttocks.

A part of Uturi knew all of this, knew that she had to be pushing about 500 pounds now, if not long past that milestone as well, but somehow it just didn't register. It all just felt so clouded, so foggy... Was it another effect of that addictive, delicious food, or just her mind's way of dealing with this whole situation? It was impossible for her to tell in this state...

The doe girl looked down at her body for a moment, feeling more lucid than she had been for a while... Her breasts were the first thing she saw, heavy and drooping but still a bit perky as they sat on a stomach that bulged, then folded at her deep navel before sagging over her lap. Rolls of fat hung over her sides and back, her arms meaty and coated with flabby lard, her thighs and hips so wide and blubbery... Uturi could barely look back to see her rump anymore, but she was sure her ass was just as huge as the rest of her now, she could feel it shift and bounce and jiggle with every lumbering step she took now. She looked back down now, lifting her paws, wiggling her sausage-like fingers before she pressed them to her layers of chins, her soft, doughy cheeks...

"No..." She panted to herself, looking about the tavern, "This... this can't be right..."

She pulled her paw away from her head, shook it, then maneuvered her freakishly obese body through a clumsy turn. Her belly grumbled in protest as it was turned from food towards an exit, but she didn't care, not until...

"Now where do you think you are going, fatty girl..?"

The ears of the doe twitched and so did her nose as she smelt the food, the scent so strong now, so close. She looked back against her better judgment, to the elven waitress over her plump should, to the platter she held in her hand.

"That's right porky," She said, holding the huge plate of breakfast meats and other delights up towards the now captivated ranger, "You're not going anywhere..."
15433111111111111121213.title: Losing Time while Gaining Weight

154331111111111111212131.content:
They walked through the restaurant, the barmaid making sure to stay close to the waddling doe as she followed her like a leashed dog, right back to her usual seat at the other end of the room. Now however, there were two sturdy seats, one for each cheek as Uturi plopped down onto them without hesitating, the chairs groaning and creaking already under her immense weight. The doe drooled as the elf set the platter down, stacked with pancakes, piled with potatoes, overflowing with sausage and bacon. She grabbed a boat filled with steaming hot gravy that was shoved onto the side of the plate. She poured it on everything.

The elf watched the entire time Uturi ate, digging her paws into the mess she had been served, cramming it all into her mouth as crumbs and grease and gravy spilled down her chins, fresh stains joining those that had dried on the fur of her breasts and belly. The woman finished her humongous meal quickly, grabbing for the mug of ale that always seemed to be there, chugging it to wash the food down before letting loose a heavy and satisfying belch.

"How was your meal?" The waitress said, nearly sneering at Uturi, "I hope you weren't having second thoughts because you didn't like the cooking!"

Uturi sat there a moment, holding her stomach, rubbing it before she looked up at the waitress, "What... mnnf... what did you do to me? To this... this food..."

The elf laughed, shaking her head, "You should have listened to your friend! Maybe then you would have caught on a lot sooner like he did... He was right though, we do have a little extra we put into the meals sometimes... for those we think could cause trouble in this town..."

"Extra..? Extra what?" Uturi grunted.

"Oh, just some spices shipped down from Lord L's castle... I'm sure you've heard of him by now, haven't you?"

The deer girl thought back to the Berryweathers, how the cows had told them of the food that had been sent to their very doorstep, how they couldn't stop eating. Uturi had become a victim of the very same trick.

"He is behind this then... The reason this town is... nnf... so fat..." The doe groaned, leaning forwards and huffing loudly as she let loose another loud bout of gas against her seats. Some of the patrons around her covered their noses or moved their chairs further away, but none of them caused a fuss: In fact hardly anyone looked Uturi's way whenever she came down to eat here. For the first time though, Uturi noticed...

"Oh my, have some decency adventurer!" The waitress laughed, "I'm sure you are not used to showing any manners, but we aren't in a cave or tomb if we haven't noticed. Show some respect to those around you, you filthy pig!"

"They don't..." She paused, the ranger gripping her full stomach as it gurgled, rubbing it, trying to sooth it, "They don't care... why?"

The elf smiled as she grabbed the deer's plate and empty mug, pulling out a rag once she stacked the two and wiping down her table, "Now that is a good question isn't it? Not everyone's food is spiked you know... Some just are enjoying the prosperity, some enjoying that they can have a full belly instead of a starving one... and when a town like this is doing so well, why risk that success by asking questions like yours..?"

Uturi groaned, "That's... that's horrible..."

"But it's true... Nobody here will help you ranger... in fact, those special spices I mentioned? I haven't used them in your food for a week."

"You're lying!" The doe snapped, slamming her fat fists on the table, "You... you have to be..." The ranger knew she was... her will couldn't be that weak...

The waitress could only shake her head as she looked down her nose at the deer, "Tell yourself whatever would make you feel better, fatty girl... But I think you have wanted to let yourself go... you have wanted to grow big and fat all along, and this is just your excuse!"

A growl came past the doe's plump lips and she held her head in her paws, shaking it profusely, "That's just... just so wrong!"

"Oh really? You think we have been feeding you tainted food this whole time tubby? Forcing you to eat here for two whole years?"

"Two..?!" Uturi sputtered, her eyes wide, heart beginning to pound frantically now, "Two years?!"

That couldn't be right! She had to be fooling with her! Uturi may not have been thinking straight since she first ate here, but there was no way she'd been living at the tavern so long...

Uturi heaved her massive body up, clumsily but frantically as her hooves clopped against the stone floor. She reached for her dagger, her bow, but they were long gone. Her paws searched for silverware, but as always there was none. She glared at the waitress in front of her who stood firm, her free hand defiantly on her hip.

"Behave yourself, lardass..."

"Is something wrong here?" Another voice chimed in.

The voice was female as well, somewhat familiar, until Uturi looked over and recognized another of the waitresses. A blond haired cow with tan fur, taller than the elf and much fatter, but built with so much muscle it seemed as though she carried her weight much more gracefully than Uturi could ever hope to hers. The bovine would be a difficult opponent for the ranger even if she weren't burdened by all this heavy, cumbersome fat, even if she weren't also carrying another two platters of wondrous, steaming breakfast...

"Yes, actually..." The elf grinned, looking over to her coworker, "The doe here was just waiting for her second course..."

The cow smiled knowingly, setting both platters down onto Uturi's table, the aroma of rich, fattening food assaulting the cervine's nose.

"Thank you," The elf said as the cow nodded and moved out of the way, the doe ranger already grabbing pawfuls of meat and pancakes, wolfing down even as she whimpered helplessly, "I think our guest will be joining us for lunch again today... and dinner too."

"Of course," The cowgirl chuckled, taking the empty platter and mug from the elf before moving back through the crowded tavern.

The elf moved behind Uturi, firmly gripping her fatty shoulders and pushing her down into the set of chairs to allow her to eat more comfortably, "I'm sure you're wondering if today's meal used our special spice though, hmm deer?" She grinned as she kneaded the feasting doe's shoulders, "A week without it is a pretty long time... it could be useful, remind you why you love being our guest so very much, yes? Well I won't tell you..."

Uturi groaned deeply, resisting the gnawing hunger in her overfed belly for a moment, her paws gripping the table's edge as her stomach gurgled and churned, "If I don't break free... huff... nngh... Remus will find me... he'll come back and then we'll..."

"You will what? Punish the evil bar wench?" The elf laughed loftily as she pulled her hands from the doe's shoulders, "Oh I do not think so... Besides, we already have your mongrel friend in our care! He's been with us for quite a while just like you... maybe you can meet him again one day! I think he has a thing for porky girls... the bigger the better!"

The waitress laughed again, giving the doe's thick, blubbery ass a hard slap, a loud smack carrying over the chatter of the other patrons as her mammoth cheek jiggled and rippled in the barmaid's groping hand, "I'm sure he'll just love the sight of you... But don't eat too much now fatty girl!" She snickered, letting go of the doe's fat ass, "You see, as hard as you might make your man, none of it would matter if you are too fat for him to reach..."

But as she turned to the hyena to glare at him now, she thought about Sally’s mother and father. She knew she couldn’t let this go, not this time, “You are not!” She growled at him, “And there was no reason to just walk out on them, especially after what I said!”

Remus stepped closer to Uturi, an action most likely taken to remind her of the fact he was over a head taller than her. The heyena’s voice was calm, though the irritation Remus felt rose up beneath it, “Yes there damn well was reason. You can’t promise these people anything deer, especially not something like that. Our job here is already complicated enough and I don’t need you making it worse…”

“How is it making it worse?!” Uturi hissed at him, arms outspread, “If we’re already looking for one person, what harm would there be searching for another in the same place! Think about it!”

“No, you think about it!” Remus spat, “First of all, we barely have direction! All we know is we need to head to some stupid castle and somehow find out where the guildmaster is! Not to mention we don’t even know what we're dealing with here, considering owner of said castle has enough power to take over an entire village, and either kills those in his way or makes them disappear! That doesn’t seem complicated enough for you? Because I'm sure as hell not getting paid enough for this kind of bullshit!”

Uturi scoffed, shaking her head, “Are you seriously telling me you don’t care about these people? About what’s happening to their town, or what could have happened to their daughter?”

“Of course I do!” Remus said, “But I also care about being realistic, about not making these poor people promises we can't keep!”

“Maybe we could keep them if you took that stick out your ass and worried about something other than yourself,” Uturi said.

A furious growl shook it’s way from Remus’s throat, before he pushed past Uturi and walked down the hall, “I don’t need some novice ranger judging me, I’m going to get some godsdammned air…”

It took all her resolve not to go after him, to hold back from chewing the hyena warrior out for running away yet again, but Uturi resisted. Knowing it would do no good, and that Remus was far too stubborn at this point to see reason, she merely groaned with pent-up frustration as she leaned against the nearby wall and held her head in her paws. Remus’s breath grew heavy as thoughts flooded his mind. His contemplation did not remain uninterrupted for long though, as the sound of clanging metal rang from down one of the nearby halls. Immediately he slipped his gauntlet back on, his ears standing at attention as he trotted out of the foyer, but instead of entering the same corridor as before, he entered the one at the opposite end of the hall.

Moving further down the hallway, Remus realized the source of the noise was most likely the kitchen, the sound possibly some kind of utensil being disturbed. Remus paused a moment, making sure to place his paw on his sword’s hilt before opening the door with the other and stepping into the dark room beyond.

He carefully approached the weak light source, looking around the room carefully as he did so, knowing all too well how easily the candle could be bait for a trap. Once he reached the bottom of the steps, he could almost see the entirety of the cellar thanks to the candle's light, but it seemed there were still plenty of hiding spots.

Thought it wasn’t an especially large room, the basement was crowded with an assortment of crates, barrels, and sacks. The hyena warrior drew his sword and steeled himself for a fight as he slid the tip of the blade beneath the chest’s lid and thrust the container open as quickly as he could.

As the smoke showed no signs of dissipating, breathing only became more difficult for Remus as his coughs grew louder and more forceful. Before long the hyena boy was literally choking, dropping his sword and the candle to the ground as he fell to his knees, clutching at his throat as his eyes watered and his vision began to fade.

Just as he felt like he was about to pass out, the smoke finally seemed to clear, and the shadows cast by the spilled and still-lit candle flickered into clarity past the pink haze. As Remus’s wracking coughs settled though, he noticed that the last of the cloud was condensing, pulling together into a singular thick area in front of him. Once this small mass was all that remained, Remus wheezed one last time, sucking in the mist like a vortex until no trace of the bizarre cloud remained.

“What… what was that?! What the hell was that?!” He snorted, gasping and huffing as he pulled himself to his feet. He considered his sword and the candle for a moment, before deciding instead to peer into the chest now that he had the chance, finding it to be completely empty, the interior the same exact color that the mist was. Remus dragged one of his fingers across the surface of the inside, drawing his gloved hand closer to his face and finding a film of the pink stuff resting upon it, like fine dust, “Poison…? Have I been…”

Remus’s words were interrupted by another sudden cough. Before he could even turn to leave however, another pain hit the beleaguered hyena square in the gut. He bent over and grunted harshly through his teeth, his mind reeling as he began to feel nauseous. His paws shook, suddenly feeling clammy as he moved them over the chestplate’s leather straps, wondering how they could have become pulled so taught. The canine tugged the straps loose, only to feel them slip from his paws as they came undone, the chestplate sliding free as it fell from his body with a loud clatter against the cellar floor. As soon as the warrior had seen what was causing so much pressure, he let out a gasp.

Before him, sticking out a good two feet, was a bulging curve of a belly. His bloated gut sagged over his lap, partially exposed as the chainmail tunic and the shirt beneath rode up its curve. Remus brought a trembling paw to touch the bare, furry flesh, only to feel them suddenly sink into a few inches of flab as his gut surged outwards with disturbing speed. Even as he continued to hold onto his stomach in his armored paws, the hyena could feel it stretching and swelling, growing heavier and heavier in his very grasp, “No, dammit!” He panted, cringing as he coughed out even more of the wicked dust, “N-No, this can’t be happening, not when I was so careful!”

Even as he lamented his current situation, Remus was starting to realize he hadn’t been through the half of it. Not only was his belly continuing to surge outwards, but he was starting to feel the rest of his armor growing increasingly tight as well. Pants and legplates began to squeeze against his ass and thighs as they engorged with fat and cellulite, gauntlets began to creak as the sausage-like digits filled up the spaces within, and a swollen, girthy set of moobs was beginning to strain the shirt and chainmail that rode up his fat belly. In mere seconds the hyena boy was wincing and then groaning in pain as he felt the plate metal armor that had once protected him begin to dig into the bloating, soft flesh of his fattening body. Remus’s paws moved quickly as he cursed under his breath, loosening straps and pulling free his armor and shield as fast as he could, the various pieces of his outfit crashing against the ground next to his breastplate. Even though the warrior had years of practice, he nearly stumbled over as he fumbled with pulling his boots off, his balance thrown off completely by his ballooning body and his rapidly increasing weight. Finally though, he felt sweet relief as he tore free of his chainmail tunic, tossing it on the ground and panting heavily as the pain was ended, the pressure removed with the last bit of armor.

“By Emperor’s blade, no wonder everyone in this gods-forsaken town is so fat! Foul sorcery… or alchemy, or whatever it was, it acted so godsdamned fast…” He whimpered, gripping his disgustingly bloated, sagging gut in his now bare paws and hefting it to get an idea of its weight. The hyena groaned as he realized that his new gut’s girth and shape had more in common with an overstuffed sack of flour than the once-toned abs he used to possess, “So many hard years of training, so many bloody years shaping my body into perfect fighting material… gone in an instant… Godsdammit, how could I be so stupid!” He thought, cringing hard.

The hyena shook his head, trying to clear those thoughts from his mind as he focused on the present. He couldn’t let thoughts like that get to him, not now, no matter how true and disturbing. He had fought in enough battles to know that you didn’t survive by giving up when you were knocked down. While this wasn’t exactly a battlefield, there seemed to be some kind of war being waged on this town, no matter how unconventional, and this trap he had triggered was just another attack. Whether it was meant for him or one of the inhabitants of the house didn’t matter, what did was that he had to warn Uturi and the Mistress. While Remus turned towards the stairwell and started to leave the cellar, he took solace in the fact that at least whatever affliction the strange dust had stricken him with, it left him thin enough to still move around with ease.

PLINK!

While at first he’d thought the sound had come from somewhere in the room, he soon realized the source was actually much closer as the same noise repeated once, and then twice more. His heart sank in despair as he caught sight of a small round object flying free from his belly, the broken shirt button sliding across the stone ground before him as a terrible realization dawned on the obese canine. The stomach pains he had felt before only confirmed his fears for him as they returned with even more intensity now, signaling that his unnatural weight gain was still far from done. Not to be outdone however, the seams of Remus’s shirt joined in the chorus of tears and rips, falling to shreds beneath multiplying layers of arm flab. As the weight piled on, Remus’s knees trembling and energy all but spent, he found he had no choice but to collapse, falling onto his mammoth ass as gravity finally pulled his immense body to the ground. The now nearly 700 pound hyena’s flabby body was still jiggling from the impact when he began to try to get back onto his feet. Despite having said feet placed firmly on the ground, and despite his still powerful muscles buried beneath all that fat, Remus could barely lift his ass an inch, achieving little more than causing his still swelling body to wobble even more violently. He was stuck on his big, fat ass and slowly starting to resemble a bloated, grey-spotted blob instead of the hyena warrior he really was.

“Come on, godsdamn you…! Hurrr… huff…!” He whimpered, attempting to rock his huge body forwards as he pushed his feet harder against the ground, only struggling more and more as he steadily grew heavier and his energy was drained even further, each attempt becoming more futile as time went on, “This can’t… nnnnffff… this can’t be happening…. Huff… not to me dammit… Grrr…! I just need to…. Huff.. huff… I just need to get up… Come on!”

Stuck on his ass, completely helpless, the Hyena’s mind began to fill with panicked thoughts just as his body continued to fill with fat. The image of the huge, brass bathtub returned to his mind, the one he had thought obscenely large and yet quickly enough it would be too small for him to fit in… if that wasn’t already the case. The rapid gain of the Berrywaters that once seemed impossible made so much sense now that he was a victim of it, and yet Remus was powerless to tell anyone of it now. He whimpered weakly as he tried one last time to get to his feet, but now found his legs almost impossible to move due to all of the energy he had wasted and the rings of fat now encircling them both.

Now nearing almost 850 pounds, the canine adventurer certainly wasn’t going anywhere in his current state. He stopped struggling once he realized that he could barely feel his legs, let alone move them now, and instead he fought mentally to stay as calm as he could. The titanic, obese hyena gnashed his teeth together fiercely, somewhat due to the now ever present pain surging through his guts as the poisonous dust continued to assault his body, but mostly because of the mix of humiliation, dread, and self-loathing he now felt. He cursed himself a thousand times for his stupidity, for making a foolish rookie mistake that could very well leave his body in this horrible state for the rest of his life, effectively destroying what little dreams he had.

The hyena continued to bloat even now, his immobile, fat-swaddled body spreading steadily across the floor. He grunted, wincing with discomfort as he vaguely felt his humongous bulk crawl across his armor, low, rumpling groans escaping from under his tremendous ass as it slowly crushed the sturdy plate metal into scrap. A slight warmth indicated that his bloating rear was now approaching the still-lit candle that lay on the ground, the heat growing with intensity before a brief spike of pain shot through his blubbery body as the surging flesh snuffed the tiny flame out, sending the already dim room completely into darkness. He wondered briefly how long it would take for one of the servant girls to find him like this, and how they could possibly get him out of here if they couldn’t fix this, when the door at the top of the steps creaked open once again...
154331111111111122221.title: Remus in Trouble

choices: Remus stays silent, putting the lives of others above his own.
Remus talks, hoping that Uturi and the others can handle the consequences.
1543311111111111222212.content:
Pale light briefly flooded the dark room, illuminating Remus’s view only slightly before a shadowy figure once again obstructed it and the door swung shut fully with a slam. The steps creaked and groaned as the figure approached through the pitch-black dark, whistling merrily as it drew closer to the immobile and helplessly obese hyena boy. Whoever it was stopped their jaunty tune once they drew near, and Remus felt a small hand press against his vast belly momentarily, then pull back.

“Ah! Now what’ve we got here?” A female voice with a heavy, westerlands accent said, “Let’s get a good look at ya now, shall we?”

Remus heard soft scraping before a diffused light filled the room once more as the person lit a match. The hyena grunted as he tried to look down at the woman, but found that his head had become just as immobilized as his legs due to the rings of fat surrounding it. He gave up trying to crane his fat neck almost immediately when he realized that even if he could look down, his gargantuan gut and moobs would likely just eclipse the speaker from view.

“Yup, hard to tell just from lookin’ at ya, but you sound like a lad, and… aye, smell like a lad. Yep, definitely a lad ya are, what a shame…” She continued before delivering a firm kick to Remus’s gut with her boot, sending it wobbling wildly, “See, that’s strange! Complicates things a little. Only man that’s s’posed to be in this house is the bull, and none o’ the servants are canine according to what we know…”

The hyena grunted sharply from the pain of the kick, letting out a powerful belch that expelled even more of the pink gas, then growled as fury began to fill him. This wasn’t one of the servants at all, it was whoever had set the trap. Remus briefly felt satisfied that the suspicions about an intruder were proved to be correct, but that satisfaction was quickly mollified when he realized said suspicions had landed him in this tight spot. The gigantic warrior tried desperately to speak, finding it even harder than before as his fat-choked voice groaned out, deep and strained, “Uhhhnn… huff…. Huuuhhh… who… mnnf… Who are… nhhn….!”

“Having trouble there, are we tubbo? Hah! ‘Who am I?’ Who are you! That’s the problem here. Seems the reports of ‘interlopers’ is true… Said you was a ‘hyena man’, they did! And judgin’ by these stretched ol’ spots o’ yours…” She said as Remus felt her hand again on his sweat-soaked fur, rubbing his fat gut, “I’m guessin’ they were right… Hehehe…”

The growl in Remus’s throat only rose further, but it was weakened and lazy, barely threatening as spittle flew past his plump lips and landed on a slope of fat chins and neckfat, “When I geh…. Huff huff huff...! Get… thin… urrrghhh… enough to... unnnghh….!”

The woman let out a hearty laugh before she kicked Remus’s belly even harder, exacerbating the pain roaring through his insides and causing him to let out a thick, husky yelp, “You don’t get it, do you!” She laughed as she walked around his tremendous body. At the very least the hyena’s expansion seemed to finally be slowing to a halt, but that was little consolation when he was already over half a ton and completely immobilized. The hyena boy could barely lift his arms anymore as they rested on the sagging, plump rolls of his belly, “Nah, you just do not…” The voice said, now behind him, “You’re stuck like this hon… Ye’ll never be able to get on those chubby little feet o’ yours again! And ye’ll most definitely never be able to get any kind o’ revenge on me… Oh you poor tubby bastard…”

Remus’s heart thundered, his blood pumping with rage and slight fear as he tried to growl louder, drool spilling down his chins. Again this was more sad than frightening, especially since his snarls were constantly interrupted by desperate gasps and wheezes. The once healthy warrior groaned as his growls ceased completely, the massive hyena’s fur and even the black mane that coated his head absolutely dripping with sweat as he realized with a twinge of shock that simply getting angry was causing him unbearable exertion. By now the woman had reached the chest that had caused this whole mess and was inspecting it, admiring her handiwork.

“My, my, they said that stuff were magic! Looks like they were right about that, haha! Only put a little bit o’ it in this chest, small pile really, and it made you fatter than a prize sow on market day!” She said, giving his monstrous ass a smack and sending it jiggling, “Oi! Who am I kiddin’, yer so fat you’d make a hippopotamus blush! Ahahah! Pathetic! And oooohhhh, look here now…”

Remus grunted softly as he felt something being tugged free from beneath his humungous ass, realizing that it was his sword, “Hah! Quite a nice blade you’ve got here big guy! Strong enough to survive being sat on by you, amazing aint it! A wee bit large, but I’m sure I can get a few gold for it at a shop… you sure as fuck won’t be needing it anyways!”

A whimper escaped from Remus’s lips now, his ears flattening in shame at the momentary but audible lapse in his resolve. He regained his composure soon enough though. If he couldn’t kick this person’s ass, then at least he could try to get some information out of them he figured, “Why… why are… huff… rooohhhhh… urrghhhh…”

Well, at least he tried.

“Shut up, ya godsdammed mongrel!” The woman said before kicking Remus in his flabby side, eliciting another pained bark from the hyena warrior, “Your gonna need to save what little breath ya have for my questions!” She said as she walked around in front of him again, “For example… the scouts said ya were with a ladyfriend… a lil’ doe girl… Is it true then?”

Remus didn’t say anything, the only sounds coming from him the constant panting and the occasional stomach gurgle.

The woman wasn’t silent however, and Remus’s ears perked slightly, his breath quickening as he heard his own blade slowly scrape across the ground threateningly, “I’m gonna ask you again fatty boy. There anything ya can tell me about that deer friend of yours…? What’s her name…”

Again, Remus refused to even let the lady know he was listening, and even as he felt the blade she had took lightly pressing into his fat stomach he did his best to ignore it.

“Last chance fatty!” The woman said in a sing-song voice before pushing the blade more firmly into Remus’s overflowing belly fat, starting to draw blood and staining his gray fur, “Tell me what you two are doin’ here and I’ll let you live…"

Remus bit his lip as he felt the blade press into him, knowing full well how he'd answer would determine how this would end for him. Deep down, Remus already knew what he'd have to do...
1543311111111111222212.title: Too Fat to Move, but not too Fat to Talk

choices: The End?
15433111111111112222121.content:
As the blade sank into him even just that little bit, Remus wanted to cry out in pain. Instead he caught hold of his scream before it could escape his throat and channeled it into a growl. Unlike his previous attempts however, this bark had some bite to it, even if he could only keep it up for a few seconds before it succumbed to his wheezing gasps. It seemed to work though, to the hyena’s surprise, as moments later he felt the woman remove the blade.

“Ya have guts lad, both literally and in the moxie sense of the word,” The voice said, “But it won’t matter a bit in the end. We were hopin’ to take the cows out without fuss, but you two fucked that up right proper... So were gonna have to go with ‘Plan B’…”

“Plan… buuhh… urrfff…! Hnnghhh…! Plan… B…?” Remus grunted, dread starting to fill his massive body once again.

“Aye! See, we got a patrol waitin’ around outside, and once I sneak back out there and give ‘em the signal… well…” She chuckled to herself before heading slowly towards the stairs, “We didn’t want things to get messy, but you nosin’ about down here leaves us no choice. Shoulda just kept your fat nose to yourself. Don’t worry about deer girl though, were gonna try to keep ‘er alive for the time being so she’ll tell us what you won’t.”

“Dohh… don’t… mnnff… you…!”

“Relax tubby! Like I said we’ll keep her alive for now… Can’t promise ya after she squeals though, heheheh… I’ve got a bunch o’ that pretty pink pollen left over you see… And I’m miiiighty curious how much of it that skinny little wench can eat before she pops like a big, fat deer balloon…” The woman cackled as she snuffed out the match, once again sending the cellar into darkness, “As for you? Well I don’t know what my bosses will do with you once they get their mitts on ya, or even how they’ll get you out of here, but that’s something for you to fret over.”

Remus heard a series of creaks echoing through the dark as his unseen adversary slowly climbed her way up the steps, “Don’t worry though, I’m sure you’re proper fucked, lardass. Unless ya got an in with Lord L, then anyone who goes up to his castle aint ever seen again… Hell, that’s the only reason I’m blabbin’ so much to you! But oi, look on the bright side: At least you’ve got a nice, big cushy seat to listen to all the ruckus that’s gonna happen upstairs. Anyways, toodle-loo, tubby!” And with that, the door at the top of the steps opened one last time before the shadowy figure stepped through into the kitchen beyond.

As the door closed, the room was once again filled with darkness and silence. As the hyena was left alone with his thoughts, regrets, and anxieties, he realized he would have almost preferred the taunts of his enemy. What was going to happen to him now that he was almost 1,500 pounds of useless canine blubber? What the hell was this ‘pollen’ and how could it have done so much damage to his once fit frame? And worst of all, what would happen to the Berrywaters and their servants, what would happen to Uturi?

All these questions, all these worries, maybe they could have been avoided if he wasn’t so goddsdamned foolish. He let out a whine, only a little happy that nobody could hear the pitiful noise now. The one thing he’d been trained from youth to do, the one thing he’d still wanted to do deep down even after he had left the military of his far away homeland was to protect those who needed it. To protect people like those in the house above.

He couldn’t now: He’d never be able to again.

Another groan rippled through the immobile hyena’s hideously fat stomach once again, but this time it wasn’t painful. This discomfort wasn’t a direct result of the poison, instead it was caused by something that disgusted the hyena even more, something that would no doubt only grow over time: Hunger.
15433111111111112222121.title: A Big Hyena, an Even Bigger Defeat

choices: She searches the town for a healer.
Uturi treats the wound herself.
154331111111111122221211.content:
Uturi scrambled to the top of a hill near the village walls, crying out in pain. She clutched at a crossbow bolt that had found her left arm, glad that it had not struck anything vital, not so glad at the pain she'd feel removing it.

She dropped her dagger, forgetting the blood coating it, and forgetting what she had to do to escape the manor for a minute. She let the sharp pain replace those thoughts instead as she withdrew the bolt and tossed it down the hill towards a tavern below, and then wrapped the wound with a bandage she had pulled from her bag.

She should probably sit. The hill might have been exposed in the day, but not now. She wouldn't be seen, but after making her way through town she needed a rest. Uturi couldn't though, not when her body was still trembling after how quickly things had gone wrong, not after what she just went through.

The manor was on the other side of Little Silverhorne, but she could still make it easily, the flames consuming it almost entirely now. Tears began to well in her eyes now that she had a chance to reflect on everything, now that the adrenaline was dying down.

Everything had happened as she made her way out into the foyer to look for Remus. She had just met with the Berrywaters to reaffirm her promise and say goodbye, the Mistress and her Ocelot servant following along behind her to see her off, when over a dozen guards broke in through the front door.

The following events were a blur to her, yelling between a guard captain, a tall and brutish wolf, and the Mistress and Uturi herself. Accusations of treason, the refuting of such claims. Then as though waiting for the opportunity, the thugs closed in. Uturi drew her knife, the close quarters leaving her little room for her bow as she was separated from the other two women on the stairs. Uturi had plenty of training, even with her dagger, though she had little actual experience in combat, and had never actually taken a life before.

She held her face in her palms. Tears flowed down them towards her wrists.

Somehow the fire started, perhaps deliberately by the guards and their torches, perhaps accidentally in the scuffle, but the manor burned all the same. Maybe the Mistress and her servants had made it out. Maybe they had only been taken by the guards. But what about the Master? There was no way they could have moved him out in time. Then there was Remus.

Uturi's stomach turned. Did he flee like a coward and leave them to this? Was he still in the house when it...

Her knees trembled. She wanted to sit, but she wouldn't let herself.

She pulled her paws away, the night air cold on her wet face. Through the smoke rising from the manor's flames, past the village and near the summit of a nearby mountain she saw it. Lights flickering in the night, a dark silhouette of towers and parapets against the the nocturnal blue of the sky.

"Lord L."

Her grief and shock started to fade now, replaced by a stronger, and much simpler emotion to understand.

Anger.

Gasping as she shifted her weight, Uturi flexed her left hand, the movement causing more pain from her wound. First she would need to properly treat this thing, preferably find somebody in town or nearby who can help with that. After that though...

She kept looking at the castle, even as black smoke hid it from view. She would find Sally. She would rescue her guildmaster.

She bent down to pick up her dagger. Looking at the blood, still fresh, realizing it was on her paw as well. She wiped the blade on her leather leggings, then sheathed the dagger.

She was going to do what she came here to do, and then she would make sure that this town wouldn't suffer any longer. Not at the hands of its cruel master.
154331111111111122221211.title: That which Destroys can also Forge

choices: Let's see what happens to Remus.
The next day Uturi wakes up in some sort of dungeon.
1543311111111111222212111.content:
Uturi searched endlessly for a healer that could heal her wound, but no seemed to know any healer. Of course she could have treated it herself, but who knows how long it would take to heal? By then she could wind up suffering the same fate as the poor townspeople.

"I have to find a healer. If I can heal my wound from when that bolt struck my arm I should be as good as new. Then I'll rescue my guildmaster and find Remus if he's still alive."

Uturi continued her search. After several more failed attempts she was about to give up until she bumped into an extremely rotund man. The collision knocked the doe back a few steps. When she looked up she saw that the large man was wearing cloak with strange markings she has never seen before and that he had jet black hair, crimson eyes, and stood at least 6'5" tall at a total weight of over 600 lbs.

"Are you alright? What happened to you? How did you hurt your arm? I can heal for you if you would want me to take a look at it."

Uturi was speechless. Here she was looking for a healer when the healer bumped into her just as she was going to give up and treat herself. "I'm fine except my arm got hit by a crossbow's bolt and the Berrywaters home burning down. I also can't find my partner, Remus anywhere"

"That's terrible. Please stay with me for the night. I can treat your wound and give you something to eat for the night. My place is close to Lord L's castle. Lately Lord L and his mistress have been gathering every maiden for purposes unknown. Some say its to offer them up as sacrifices to the Goddess Lipocia."

"I actually have business here with Lord L. I'm here to rescue my guildmaster from his clutches."

"I see. Follow me milady and I'll fix you up in no time." The man said as he smiled subtly.

Uturi follows the cloaked man out of town. He leads the doe to a a fairly large cabin. The cabin was located at the base of the mountain, roughly 200 feet below the Lipomancer's castle.

"Come inside dear. I was about to have some stew when I sensed a disturbance in town."

The mysterious 600 lb. cloak man pours Uturi a bowl of stew. Uturi's stomach gave a low growl.

"You must be starving. Here's some fresh made juice." The made said as he used magic to pour Uturi a large glass of what resembled pink lemonade." I'll be right back. I just have to go get my special medicine that will patch you up in a jiffy."

Uturi tries to start eating the stew with her good arm, but the stew proves to be a touch too hot to eat. She then decides to wait until the kind stranger finds his special medicine before she starts to eat the stew. The cloaked man walked towards the back room of his cabin. The room had various magic artifacts and several magic book on every magic known to the world. He then walks to the round wooden table in the middle of the room and picks up a crystal ball. The man chants in the language of the ancients. Then without warning the image of a lab appears. In the lab a severely overweight hyena could be seen struggling, but his 1550 lb. body was pinned down on the enormous table. A lady with blonde hair, blue eyes, and with a large bust could be seen staring back at the man.

"Hello Lord L, have you found that doe yet?" The lady asked the man.

"I have. She's the last one we need for the ritual. What do you plan to do with that hyena?" The Lipomancer asks the woman.

"I plan on turning him into one of my beats of gluttony. He'll make an excellent servant, especially once we resurrection the Goddess."

"That's wonderful news my dear. Soon we will get rid of all this senseless violence and bloodshed. I have to go now. I'll see in a bit my lovely wife." The Lipomancer said as he deactivated the magic in the crystal ball.

The Lipomancer proceeds to get the "medicine" he was looking for and walks back towards the fireplace, where Uturi begain to eat her stew and drink her juice.

"I'm sorry that took a bit long, but I had to find the right one." The Lipomancer said as he smiled contently knowing that Uturi was falling into his trap.

"It's no problem."

"That's good to hear. Drink this vile until it is all gone. You may feel a bit drowsy, but you'll be as good as new."

"Thank you kind sir." Uturi said before she drank the vile of blue liquid.

Uturi then passes out like a light. The Lipomancer grins evilly.

"Thank you dear Uturi for being such a fool. Now the Goddess will live again thanks to you. Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!"
1543311111111111222212111.title: In Search of the Healer

choices: She only takes a short break. The whole town could be looking for her after all.
She's hidden in a spot nobody will look. She can take a nap for now.
1543311111111111222212112.content:
The wounded deer slid down the side of the hill facing away from town, her hooves kicking up dirt and mud as she reached the bottom. She panted as she came to a stop, letting herself rest for a bit before getting back to her feet and heading towards the town wall.

The wall itself was quite tall, but seemed to have several areas along its flank that could act as sturdy hand and footholds for climbing. Uturi could have easily scaled it were it not for her arm, but thankfully the area she now found herself in served as a good enough hiding place as she recovered. The hill would serve to shield her from view of the town, while no guards that might be patrolling atop the wall would be able to see her thanks to a small thicket of trees growing near its base. Uturi made her way to a nearby log, sitting down and leaning back against it as she rummaged through her pack.

"Must be something here..." She thought to herself as she searched through various tools and supplies.

She pulled out a small vial of healing potion, eyes lighting up a moment before she held it up to the moonlight and saw it was empty.

"Damn!" She cursed as she was about tho toss the vial aside, then thought better of it as she stashed it back in the bag. Those things were like bottled miracles, a potent mix of alchemical innovation and magic that could speed along the body's natural healing abilities. When had she needed to use one of those...?

"On the trip out here, was pretty dehydrated on the road..." She recalled. She then tugged out her canteen, the water inside sloshing heavily enough to block out the chorus of insect chirps filling the night, "Oh! ...by the gods, what is wrong with me!"

She groaned at out of frustration at herself before letting loose a few soft chuckles as she unscrewed the canteen and took a long swig. The laughter was almost as refreshing as the water, but she was still weeping a little as she stowed the canteen away again and continued looking through her pack.

She thought of Remus for a moment, but pushed him out of her mind.

He was dead. And even if he wasn't, he was a traitor.

Instead she tried to focus on something else. Something happy. She remembered when she was just a child, her mother showing her how to shoot a bow, her father watching from the fields, resting his paws on a shovel as he took a break to watch her growing up.

She sighed, wiping at her eyes with one paw as another pulled out a small book. The Joys of Magic.

A smile found its way across her lips and she let out another giggle as she held the book before her in both paws, studying the simple leather cover. It was a gift from her mother, something she gave her when she went off to become a ranger. Both her parents saw the practical advantages of learning spells, but only her mother would practice using them, and even then just simple things to aid her around the house. Fixing a broken plow, making water appear for the plants, or just an easy glow spell to light up the house. Uturi was always eager to learn and loved reading whatever books her family could find, so she cherished the small book, both as a source of knowledge and a reminder of the home she left behind going out on her own.

Unfortunately she hadn't had much practice with the book in her time at the Guild, preferring to socialize or work on her archery and other skills more suited for a ranger. Still, she knew at least some things about how magic worked... It was worth a shot.

"Uturi, remember the basics of spellcasting..." She whispered to herself as she flipped through the book. About midway through she found what she wanted. A spell to heal minor injuries! Something that seemed to work similar to the healing potions she was reminded of earlier.

"Now I just need to say these words, think of the effects, and focus my... errr... energy?" She said before reading the words out loud, moving her right palm over her bandaged wound, and closing her eyes shut tight.

A soft green glow began to radiate from her palm, and Uturi opened her eyes to watch the spell's effects. As she did though, the glow turned into small bolts of green electricity that arced briefly but painfully between her paw and arm, causing her to breath in sharply through her teeth, "Crap!"

She coughed suddenly now, her throat feeling immensely dry as she wheezed a bit. She grabbed her canteen back out of her back, pulled the cork back out and took a few deep swigs as she re-hydrated herself.

"Ack! Forgot that magic does that to you...!" She huffed, wiping her mouth with her arm. Once she had drank her fill from the canteen, she pressed a couple fingers to the bandage where her wound was. It still stung a little, but not nearly as bad as you'd expect from something so deep. She carefully unwrapped her dressings with her right paw and tossed the blood-soaked linens aside as she looked over her handiwork.

The flesh around the wounded area was still red and somewhat inflamed under the bloodstained fur, but it at least was now sealed completely. The thing would definitely still be tender for a while, but as Uturi flexed her left hand, she knew it would be nothing that would hinder her too greatly. Plus now she didn't have to worry about the damn thing getting infected and causing more problems for her.

She sighed in a bit of relief, happy that at least something had gone right tonight. She put the spellbook and canteen back in her pack as she set it behind her, leaning back to rest her head on it like a makeshift pillow, trying to push the painful memories that had got her in this state aside for now. She needed to rest, whether that meant a cautious break or a full-night's sleep, she wasn't too sure...
1543311111111111222212112.title: Healing Wounds...

choices: The woman is the Ocelot servant he met earlier
The woman is... Uturi?!
15433111111111112222122.content:
Remus bit his lower lip nervously as he realized that he had no choice. He would have to talk. Uturi would probably understand.

"I..." Remus started to say before a loud rumbling in his now massive gut, interrupted him. A bubbly sensation in his stomach became more and more intense.

"What's wrong with you? Hurry up and tell me everything you know!" The evil woman says as she waves the sword in his face.

"Oh!" Remus moaned before he opened his mouth and let out the biggest belch he'd ever heard in his life.

The pink mist he breathed in earlier, came spewing out of the hyena man's mouth. The mysterious woman was so surprised that she accidentally breathed it in. She closed her mouth a moment later, but it soon became obvious that it was far too late as her body began to rapidly bloat up with fat.

"No! No!" The woman wailed as she looked at her ballooning body with shock.

Remus couldn't help but laugh, "Karma's a bitch, huh?"

The woman screamed in horror as her growing gut ripped through her shirt and pants. Her thighs plumped up and were soon rubbing together as she waddled around the room. A double chin, and then a triple chin form around her neck as cellulite formed all over her body. Her belly sagged lower and lower with each passing second.

As the evil woman porked out, Remus' own body began to feel lighter. At first he thought that it was his imagination, but after a few moments he was certain. His own body was loosing weight at the same rate that the woman was gaining weight.

The woman suddenly tripped over her own sagging gut and fell to the ground. She moaned and wheezed as she struggled and failed to stand back up. She whimpered and sobbed as she rolled around on the ground in a futile attempt to stand back up. Soon she stopped wiggling as she became too fat to move at all.

Remus looked down at his own body and was relieved to see that he was now back to his normal size. He stood up off the floor and felt grateful that he was able to move.

"I'll never take walking for granted again." Remus muttered to himself.

He took one look at the shredded remains of his clothes and armor, and realized that they were a lost cause. His body was back to normal, but gear had still been destroyed by his weight gain. He would have to find some replacement clothing at the earliest opportunity.

Remus turned his attention towards the mysterious woman that had tried to threaten him. Remus left the room for a moment and returned with a torch. With the light of the torch, Remus was finally able to get a good look at the woman. The woman was now a total blob of fat, incapable of moving a single muscle, but Remus was still able to recognize her.
15433111111111112222122.title: To Lose Weight, Someone Else Must Gain It

choices: "I think I'll go with you, you seem like fun~"
"I'm not sure, I'll probably hang out around here for a bit."
154331111111111122221221.content:
Despite the several hundred pounds of additional blubber, Remus could easily tell that his former attacker was the ocelot maid from before. Before he could make any remarks about the matter however, he noticed that her face seemed, off, her eyes were pitch black, and she had noticeable markings all over her. "What the hell is on with you?" He asked, inspecting her appearance.

As she waved it around over the plush, she brought her free hand forward until it too began to glow and she hovered it just above the figure. As the spell progressed, the ingredients around the table also began to glow and the runes began to crackle with energy. shutting her eyes, a gust picked up within her house, gently rattling the surrounding knick-knacks. Finally, the plush its self began to glow, light emanating from it's pours. In moments it had begun to float towards the sorceress's hand which she raised along with it. Eventually, as the light reached maximum intensity, the mouth of the plush began to open and pour our more yellow light before a bright flash burst from it in a display that could light up the surrounding forest. After that, everything in the house fell still.

leaning over the table, the tall sorceress inspected the construct she had just cast a spell upon, staring anxiously. For the first minute, nothing seemed to happen. Afraid she may have made a mistake, her gaze hopped between each of the ingredients she had used in her ritual, hoping they were still good. However, as expected, they had either shriveled or burned after satisfying their purpose. The sorceress sighed at the notion that she would have to gather everything again and start the ritual over. However, before she turned away, she noticed something. It was a twitch from the hand of the doll. The sorceress's eyes opened wide and seemed to practically light up with joy. The creature twitched again before slowly raising its hand in the air, meeting it with its button eyes. observing the structure, it turned its hand around before inspecting the other. Slowly, it then rose up into a sitting position, looking over its body before examining the room. It seemed to be in wonder. Eventually, its eyes met the sorceress who smiled with glee.

"Y-you... can you hear me? can you understand me?" the sorceress asked.

The plush just sat there for a moment, not saying anything before it slowly rose to its feet. Stumbling a bit as it got used to the feeling of standing, it looked back up to the sorceress.

"Mistress?" the creature asked, looking up at her.

The sorceress stared in awe for a moment before practically squeezing with delight. quickly, she reached out and scooped the creature up into her arms.

"Yes, yes, that's right! I'm your mistress! my name is Aelita. I created you" the sorceress explained, her face beaming with Joy.

The creature looked up to her, taking in the information. the ritual had at least given the plush some basic rudimentary knowledge, however, it would be able to learn as time went on. The creature, seeing her so joyous, smiled back.

"Mistress... Aelita. Mistress Aelita" the plush repeated, practicing it's voice and memory.

It then reached out and returned the hug, noting the sensation of her body against its own.

"Uh huh... but... you're gonna need a name too, won't you little guy... hmm..." said Aelita before looking around the room for inspiration.

her eyes skipped around to the various objects within her house but nothing seemed to click, that is until she noticed a bundle of lavender sprigs beside the front door.

"Oh, that's a good one. I'll name you Lavender my favorite scent" Aelita declared.

"L-Lavender... okay, my name is Lavender, Mistress" said the plush, committing its new name to memory.

Aelita smiled before her eyes shot open. she suddenly remembered what it was she was really doing and knew the little guy would require an explanation. Noting this, she set the plush down on the table before backing up a bit.

"Okay, okay, so, as you've already been imprinted to know, you are a golem and I created you for a very specific purpose. You see, I'm going to need your help with a certain problem that the lands have been experiencing. For a while now, people have been talking about a wizard with odd powers. Powers that he uses for ill intent. To be honest, I really don't know anything about it or what this guy's actually doing, but I've heard stories of many adventurers going after him and never coming back. the few who have.. well... they returned under strange conditions, notably, they were severely overweight. nobody has even seen them, so we don't know what they look like, though, they suspect the individual is male. Well, I probably haven't been following these stories like I should have been, but recently, the lands not far to the north of here have been changing. they say settlements no longer respond to messages and trade has been cut off. Those who have been to the lands say that it's full of odd wildlife and plants, and worst of all, it's spreading... so, umm you with me so far little guy?" Aelita explained, stopping just in case this was too much for Lavender to take in all at once.

Lavender was silent as he processed everything. However, when he finished up, he smiled and nodded.

"Yes Mistress, I will help you find the bad wizard. What is it you wish me to do?" Lavender asked.

Aelita rubbed the back of her head. She didn't want Lavender to get the wrong idea from how she would explain this. Even though she had just created him, she already valued him and was afraid that whatever she may say might sound like he was insignificant.

"W-well... You see, we don't know why this guy does what he does, but thanks to the cases we have seen with whoever returned, se think he uses some sort of magic that people have started to call lipomancy. I don't know how he does it, but if the rumors of lost adventurers are to be believed. it seems powerful... So, that's where you come in Lavender. I need you to be my... umm... surrogate. I don't expect to get out of this one unscathed, but if something happens with my bod, you know, if the wizard does something that makes me... you know... get fat... I need somewhere to transfer it. I've created a link between us that should let me convert any fat I gain into stuffing in your body. You see, if we humans get big, we loose allot of energy and have a hard time getting around. If that happens, I might fail as well. You however, stuffing doesn't weight much, and you're further strengthened with magic. You shouldn't have any problems with it. Not to mention I can unstuff you whenever you need it" Aelita explained to the best of her abilities.

Lavender was silent for a moment. he actually appeared to be growing worried and looked down at the table.

"W-well, I really don't want to get too big mistress. That might be uncomfortable... but, I will help you in any way I can" Lavender promised as he rubbed his plush body.

Aelita smiled meekly. She didn't want to put her new friend through that if she could avoid it, but if the rumors were true, she would have to stop it before the corruption spread too far.

"Thank you Lavender, I'm sorry if it just sounds like I'm using you, but I promise I'm not! after all, I gave you intelligence and self awareness. You'll be a nice companion on the road" Aelita explained, trying to make Lavender feel better.

Lavender looked around. fortunately for Aelita, he didn't feel as if he were being used, but still had his own reservations. Regardless, it's what he was made for, and even if he was nervous about it, this is here his mistress needed him. In the end, he was fully accepting of the task.

As Aelita looked outside, it appeared to still be dark out. She had stayed up for much of the night. Despite her eagerness to set out now, maybe it would be best if she waited until sunrise to set out.

Ferris yawned loudly, stretching out his arms. The sunlight, which had awoken him, was streaming through the window. It was a bright new day. With one arm behind his back while the other scratched his bare, hairy chest and continued to stare out the window.

The covers shifted next to him. He looked and a small smile touched his lips. The innkeeper's daughter, a slim woman with golden brown, curly hair, was lying next to him, nude under the covers but still fast asleep. Ferris sank lower into bed and recalled the events from last night.

It was a ball: ale flowed like a massive waterfall, the inn packed with people laughing, shouting, cheering, and even dancing on the tables while they were getting drunk off their asses, stuffing their faces with meat, or doing both at the same time.

In the center of all the chaos was Ferris, singing with his sweet voice while his talented fingers played on his guitar. Some remained quiet, sipping their mugs, listening, while others sang along with their unbearable, hoarse voices, their noses beet-red from all the beer.

Of course Ferris drank too, but he had to remain sober enough to entertain. The innkeeper, who thanked him greatly, claiming all these villagers came to see him perform (which was an exaggeration (though Ferris himself would have boasted this as well), for the town was rather large and they were celebrating another successful harvest before the bitter winter settled in), rewarded him handsomely, throwing in his daughter Edna as a bonus.

Of course she came willingly, for Ferris had seen her eye him while serving his drinks, occasionally showing slyly her cleavage. The minstrel wasn't quite sure why she was attracted to him. Sure, he was handsome to look at, clean-shaven with short, raven black hair, but he was fat.

He guessed that she was one of those who liked her men on the corpulent side, which should come as no surprise in these parts of the land, for people were rather thick of waist around here. As Ferris lay in bed, he wasn't sure if he should owe the bountiful amount of food they had to a certain fairy tail that was spun around these parts.

Some say this area was the place where the Lipomancer roamed, a legendary wizard who, strangely enough, like to fatten his victims. It was a good ghost story for parents to tell to their children, saying that the Lipomancer would catch them, make them so fat until they nearly drowned in their own blubber, and take them to his castle where he would eat them!

But Ferris didn't believe in such nonsense. And it was high time that he got out of bed. Being a minstrel, he disliked staying in one place for very long, and would like to leave as quickly, and drawing very little attention to himself, as possible.

He silently got out of bed, put on some clothes, a plain tunic and brown pants, gathered his belongings, and went for the door. Just as he was about to leave, he stopped and looked at the bed. Edna was still sleeping peacefully.

Ferris smiled. "Perhaps I'll see you soon again, my love," he said, blowing her a kiss.

He went downstairs, got his horse and was soon on the road again, following the large dirt road that led away from the town that was nestled in the bottom of a valley. The Autumn winds were kicking up fallen leaves and plucking a few from trees.

Winter was coming fast. Ferris could feel it, which meant that he had to find temporary shelter com these three months (he wondered if any lords were hiring), but for now the nights were mild and the days still warm.

He got out his guitar and began to sing.

Pandas. They are a very innocent species. Found in a distant bamboo forest seemingly hidden from every other being on the continent, their kindness is as limitless as their appetite. When not visiting with the others in their tribe, much of their time is usually spent eating and sleeping. Always a cheerful group, nothing was ever to come their way, until that fateful day...

Everything was going as usual. The sun shimmered in between the shoots as the hidden group lay peacefully among their roots. Usual chatter filled the air as one panda sit down for her morning snack.

"Another day in the forest", the panda sighed with glee as she reached out her plump hand to grab some bamboo, "Another day to eat without any worries." She placed the long green stick in her mouth and began to chew as her stomach growled. Reaching down with her free hand, she pat her belly, feeling the extra flesh as it jiggled in her lap. Like all the others, she was large, likely from her laziness and eating habits. Thighs that touched and shapely bottom just above them, comfortable for sitting on. Her arms were thick and hefty, and her chin was only surprisingly starting to double below her soft, welcoming face. But those weren't her biggest features. Just below her face sat a sizable chest lazily resting on her even larger belly. When she stood, it hung just a few inches over her waistline, more rounded in appearance with noticeable creases adding depth to her sides, and she was proud of that.

She lay down, stuffed, after eating so much, and almost passed out until... "Lilly! Come look at this!" Lilly slowly rose from her comfortable position, gradually walking over to the sound as she rubbed her stomach. "What is mom?", she asked curiously. "I don't know", her mom grinned, "It could be a blessing from the gods." Within a few minutes, there were many times the bamboo than before, the most plentiful the forest had ever been.

Making sure she had one of her small daggers in her hands, Kami slowly began to walk around the moat, noticing that the castle was quite large, and seemed to have several low towers and windows. There was even a moment she thought she saw a shifting shadow moving around in one of the windows... But immediately dismissed it as a ragged curtain or something of that matter.

Eventually, the hot headed, petite elf girl came to the lowered drawbridge of the castle, tightening her grip on the dagger she kept concealed. 'The front door? Number one rule of assassins, don't be seen...'

Looking around, Kami nodded to herself as she turned around, unaware of a creepy shadowed figure who watched her from the woods...

A few minutes later and at the back of the castle, Kami had pocketed her dagger and produced a grappling hook from her belt (interestingly enough, it was once enough to kill one of her targets, but it still had its practical purposes...). And since there appeared to be an open window...

CLANK!

"Yes!" Kami hissed as she immediately swung over the moat and began to climb towards the opened window. Moments later, the young elf crept into the room... Which seemed to be a well lavished bedroom with several lush furniture...

... And a bed that seemed to be able to fit over ten people on at a time. "... Yeesh, at least he keeps it clean..."

Kami quickly held her breath as she heard footsteps echoing through the hallway outside the room, immediately she ran into the nearby closet, nearly closing it so that she could see that whoever was walking into the room.

Slowly the door to the room opened up to reveal...

15512211.content:
The door flew open, and then immediately closed as a familiar overall wearing, big-breasted cow girl slammed her back into the door, breathing heavily, "S-Stupid feedbag..."

From her hiding spot, Kami raised an eyebrow at the girl who just entered the room and then remembered the photo that her contact had given her before this mission began... It was almost a dead ringer for the cow girl in that picture. Same hairstyle, same face, and much to Kami's cargin - She had the same dynamite figure that she secretly wished she had. Although, looking a little closer, Kami noticed that the cow girl seemed to be a bit thicker around the middle and thighs... And of course the overalls seemed to strain over the enlarged melons that the girl had.

'Is this the same girl?' Kami thought as she continued to watch the cow girl.

For a moment, the thick cow girl took in the sights of the room before she turned back towards the door. Slowly, the girl opened the door once more and peaked her head out...

... Only for seconds later to stumble back, revealing a large feedbag was strapped to her mouth, and it was visibly shown that the girl was chewing on whatever food was in the feedbag. But that's when Kami noticed something else about the scene, with every chewing motion that the cow girl gave, her slightly chubby body seemed to put more strain on her clothing, as if she was growing with every bite. But that was impossible...

Right?

155122111.content:
Kami rushes to grab the feedbag attached to Sally's face but as she gets near it detaches by itself and instead springs onto Kami's mouth, trying to force her to eat the grain inside. Panicking she tried not to chew and swallow it but the food quickly began to build up inside of her mouth, the torrent of feed seemingly endless as her cheeks filled up painfully. Unable to remove the feedbag, she had no choice to chew and eat while Sally watched. With each bite she took she could feel herself expanding, getting a little fatter each time she swallowed a mouthful of the grain. She felt her pants getting tighter and tighter, her belly swelling to form a muffin top over her pants yet still growing even more.

It was a good five minutes till the feed bag ran out of food and detached itself from her, slipping away back into the depths of the castle. At this point Kami had put on a good fifteen pounds, most of it going to her rear, hips and belly. Sally walked over to her and cautioned the poor girl, "You must try to avoid it....it has a mind of its own, damn thing keeps coming back."

"Yeah, I can see that," Kami said quickly, "By the way, are you Sally?"

"Yes, why do you ask?' Sally replied studying the elf closely.

"I was sent to find you and get you out of here." Kami said.

"Well we should get going, we don't want to stay in one spot for too long. Also this place seems to change its layout often, so be careful." Sally warned.

Kami rubbed her temples, "Great, just great... The name's Kami, by the way".
