1551221112.content:
“Pleased to meet you!” Sally said, bowing her head politely, “Especially in that sort of situation, if that bag stayed on my snout any longer, I don’t know if my poor lil’ overalls would have survived…”

The pudgy cowgirl fondled her plump breasts curiously, much to the envy of Kami. Of course all the fat that got forced upon her would go straight to her ass. She attempted to straighten her skirt out once more while also trying to tug her black vest over her newly formed muffin top, “I’d say the feeling’s mutual…” The elf grumbled, “But I seemed to have caught much of the pudge that was meant for you…”

“Oh dear… I’m sorry… now, you said you were looking for me, right…? That must mean my parents know I’m gone… Oh I do hope they aren’t to worried…” Sally sighed, putting a finger to her plump lips as she thought deeply, “So are you a constable of sorts…? Or a bounty hunter or something?”

“I prefer the term ‘assassin’, thank you,” Kami said begrudgingly, still fumbling with her stretched outfit as they came to a long room with sleeping cots lining both left and right walls, “Wait… this isn’t the way I came, is it…?”

Sally merely sighed and shook her head, “I told you, didn’t I? This place is kinda funny… you think you’re going one way, and then you end up in another direction entirely…” She yawned as she looked at the various, comfy looking cots.

Kami yawned as well; she was still quite sleepy after her uncomfortable and long carriage ride to Little Silverhorne. The beds did look quite comfortable to her… though also a bit odd. They all were rather sturdy looking, and were wider than they were tall. She shook herself awake when she felt Sally tap her on the back.

“So why is an assassin looking for me anyways…? You aren’t trying to kill me, are you…?”

“No, no, if I was you’d be dead…” Kami replied, strutting over to the nearest cot and pushing down on its mattress. It was as soft and fluffy as it looked.

“Meep! Well that means you talked to my parents, they sent you, right? Were they worried? What about Roland? Was he looking for me too? Did you meet him?” Sally asked, her curiosity getting the better of her to Kami’s annoyance.

“…who?” Kami asked grumpily, eyebrow rising as she fluffed a pillow: It was just as soft as the bed!

“Oh… just… a neighbor of mine… he’s very nice and he cares about me a lot I think!” The cowgirl looked away from the elf, a dreamy look spreading over her features as she blushed deeply.

So there was a boy then, and she seemed to be rather enraptured with him, enough so to do something ridiculous like throw away her parent’s money. This definitely had to be the Sally she was looking for.

“So…. Whatchya doing over there…?” The blond bovine asked.

Kami frowned groggily, “Was thinking of taking a nap actually… I know this place is dangerous, and it might not be the best idea, but I’m running on very little sleep and these beds are just so nice…”

Sally yawned and nodded in understanding.
1551221112.title: This was the Way Out… Right?

1552.content:
"Treasure ahead," Mimi thought to herself. She couldn't help herself. The rogue had a large affinity for any and all wealth, and sometimes had to fight to avoid becoming obsessed.

Maryanne Isengard Milliams IV, "Mimi" for short, renounced a life of aristocracy at the age of 17 to become a rogue. The limber black cat, with a stripe of white across her belly, wore skintight clothing she had paid for an enchantment on. They acted like a mix of armor and rubber, stretching to her form, able to take a lot of stress without ripping, and very intolerant to attacks no matter how sharp the blade. Known as the Blackest Night by her peers for her ability to sneak into and out of areas leaving only empty rooms and the occasional guard with a slit throat, she was one of the best rogues in the area.

Mimi headed to her new target after hearing a discussion at a local tavern about a "temple stuffed to the brim with treasure. I mean, this thing's bursting at its seams with the stuff! The size of it's incredible, and what's even better is the weightyness of the whole deal. You heist in there, you don't have to move for the rest of your life." "Set for life, I could be..." she thought.
1552.title: Mimi, the feline rogue

15521.content:
Mimi loved treasure. She really did. It was her favorite thing in the entire world, to have money, and the fact that she had to work for it made getting it even better. The idea of piles upon piles of riches, gems, scepters, jewelry, all of which she dredged up and made off with herself, made her positively wet. And to think that this place, within it’s halls, was purported to hold more treasure than all the rest combined, well, to put it lightly, it made her want to warn the nearest town of floods, because she was about to cum a tsunami.

Her mind was so clouded by thoughts of riches and grandeur, that she failed to keep in mind the first and most basic rule of thievery.

DON’T GO IN THE FRONT DOOR.

DON’T.

DO NOT.

IT.

IS.

DUMB.

But god rest her soul, all she was thinking about was the pile of gold and silver awaiting her. Thinking so hard about it, in fact, that as Mimi stepped inside those glistening arched halls, she completely failed to notice the golem rushing at her from her left flank screaming drunken obscenities about why 2+2 equalling 4 was a crock of shit.

As he beaned her across the face with a sausagey fist, he changed the subject to his favorite romance novel. Then he changed the subject to nothing, because golems can only form thought for so long before getting bored and doing something else. Anyway, more to the point, Mimi was now on an all-expenses-paid trip to the quaint village of Knocked The Fuck Out, which means that we will predictably cut away for a while and come back to her later. Parcheesi, anyone?

The first thing Mimi felt was the cold. Wherever she was, it was dank. Wet. Shivery. The first thing she heard was the rattling of the chains that shackled her to the table as she attempted to shake out of them. And the first thing she saw was him.

He was a dark, tall, imposing figure, hooded, bleak. He didn’t look nice at all, but that was probably to be inferred by the fact that he had locked a women in his dungeon. Mimi began to say something, but before she could, he cut her off.

“Trying to steal from me? Trying to, break into my home, take my belongings, add ever more to that burgeoning pile of spoils lying in your pitiful little shack?” he said, snarking. “Well, honestly, I would have to thank you. And I thought tonight would be boring!”

His earlier sarcasm had turned to a fiendish, sick sort of joy. Mimi was immensely confused, and a due bit scared as well. Just what was this man planning?

“I know the way you people think. Thieves, rogues, whatever the name, I know what you’re like. Your personality can be summed up in one word. Do you know what that word is?” he asked, leaning in a bit to meet her gaze, but not enough for her to get a clear look at his face.

“More."

"The word is more. More, more, more. More, more, more for me.

"More.”

He had returned to his earlier condescending snark.

“Well, I think that for all of your trouble, you deserve more. The best kind of more, the closest kind. More YOU. More YOU than you could ever hope to handle!” He was shouting now, his tone a mixture of passionate anger and a sort of childlike excitement, and as he said this, he drew from his robe a single slice of Black Forest Cake, and he shoved it into Mimi’s mouth more quickly than she saw him reach for it.

And it was the best goddamn thing she had ever tasted.

Every thought she had, every escape plan she was plotting out, every way to make this guy pay for tying her up...

Gone.

Poof.

Evaporated. Replaced with pure exstacy. She couldn’t think of anything else but tasting something, anything that tasted as good as that. And her captor was happy to oblige.

Cookies, cake, sausage, ribs, all disappeared in instants down Mimi’s gullet. And, not by coincidence, reappeared in her ever growing gut. What, hours before, had been a perfectly flat washboard of a stomach, was currently slowly and ominously swelling outward, the thin strip of white fur across her belly stretching ever larger. As food of every variety was shoved down her throat, her slender body began to grow, her enchanted jumpsuit attempting to keep up as best it could.

Not that Mimi noticed, or even cared. The only thing on her mind was the food. Give it to me, all of it! More, more, more. The minutes disappeared into hours as her dizzied stupor continued.

============================================================================ ==============

Ugh, where am I, Mimi thought, coming to. The world was spinning, a blur. Make it stop.

World, stop spinning.

Stop it.

It’s rude.

Hey, why can’t I move? Oh, right, I’m still in that creepy dungeon.

This is the when Mimi snapped the fuck out of it and woke up.

“HEY!” she shouted to nobody in particular. “YOU BETTER LET ME OUT OF HERE OR I’LL... I’ll...” Her voice trailed off as she began to look herself over.

Not that looking herself over was particularly hard, because there was so much of her to look at.

Her lithe abdomen had ballooned into a corpulent belly, a massive ball of marmalade that helped a new pair of beach ball sized breasts weigh her down to the table, still chained there as she was. The stripe of fur she bore there now looked more like a blob, a blob of white floating in a sea of black.

The lower half of her body fared no better, legs of lard and an ass with cheeks bigger than some people, but she couldn’t exactly get shocked at that, seeing as she couldn’t see them past her gut. No, that was enough for her.

She sat there with mouth agape in total disbelief over what she had become for what felt like hours, when who came sauntering in but the bastard who made it happen.

“Enjoying the new you?” he said sarcastically, straining himself as he dragged something large in with him. “YOU!” Mimi screamed hysterically. “YOU DID THIS TO ME! CHANGE ME BACK RIGHT NOW!”

He laughed.

He roared.

The man tore the tarp off the large object he dragged in to reveal a massive glass tube full of some kind of brown liquid. “Oh, but we’re just getting started.” he said as he ominously lifted up a hose. Mimi’s fat face went from anger to paralyzed nervousness in the blink of an eye.

“mew...”

============================================================================ ============

They tell a lot of stories about that creepy old castle up north. About how the master is some kind of fat-bending mage, about all of the ‘foolish adventures ‘to fall into his grasp. I always liked the one about the cat girl he caught one day tryin’ to rip him off. Locked her up in his dungeon. Think it was a poem, actually, lemme see if I can remember it... Oh yeah!

There once was a catgirl named Mimi.
She was strong, steadfast and greedy.
She met with a fright
When her clothes got real tight
Cause she got caught by a guy, he was seedy.

He locked her up in a dungeon
Cause see, she couldn’t outrun him
She tried to steal
So he made her a meal
That just kept comin’ and comin’

He fed her cookies, and pies, and cake
And her jumpsuit, it started to break
Came apart at the seams
Because custards and creams
Poured down her throat in a lake

Her belly grew to be massive
And she then grew to be passive
She didn’t care anymore
She couldn’t fit through the door
So escape, she couldn’t have had it

Some say she lays down there
Stuck in neverending despair
She’s gotten so big
She used to be such a twig



So perhaps we should leave her a prayer

15523.content:
The kitty bravely sauntered over to the temple's front door. "Well, here's the first step to a new life..."

"NO! DON'T!" cried a nearby voice. Mimi paused long enough to turn around. "What's all this about?"

In front of her stood an average-height male Husky, 6 feet, average build. He wore the garb of a druid, a hooded white robe that reached from his shoulders to his knees with regular clothing underneath, a large white cloth shirt and stretchy cloth pants. He was handsome but unremarkable, and appeared to have a large money bag with him. Mimi sensed an easy steal.

Pretending to stretch, she pulled a knife from the back of her shirt, and hid it behind her arm. Slowly sauntering over the dog, she asked "And who would you be, stopping me from an easy raid?"

The husky threw out a hand, and Mimi's knife flew out of her hand, landing harmlessly 15 feet away. "First of all, lady, you're not killing and robbing me, especially when I'm giving you a hand right now."

"The name's J.T. Johnathon Templa. And you, m'lady, just avoided a very heavy fate."

155231.content:
"What, pray tell, did you just save me from?"

"Well, the moment you were to step into that entrance, you'd have been stopped cold by a wall. Trying to turn, the walls around you would close, and the room would fill with gas. You'd be knocked out, and when you awoke, you'd be strapped to a large banquet chair. A chute in front of your face would pour a mixture of the most fattening potions ever made into your mouth. You'd gain about 400 pounds in minutes flat. Finally, you'd be dumped back at the entrance with nothing to your name but a quarter ton of blubber."

"...what?"

"Luckily for the both of us, this temple's qualities had been made clear to me by a few... let's just say these women had a lot more to love. Making my way through here, I was stopped by a few different people- a wolf who looked as if she'd been made to eat an entire pig, a cowgirl who appeared to have about 7 glandular problems, and an elf female who had about 17 love handles on each hip. Each warned me of this temple's qualities. It's the prize possession of one called the Lipomancer, who enjoys making a game out of his dungeons. The traps in here aren't deadly in most cases; they're weighty, as in weight-gainy. He likes to fatten people up. If you're going in there, I'm helping you out. While those women who assisted me had... VERY deserving qualities when I... "consensually repaid" them, I couldn't stand to see a beautiful wench like yourself needing to go up about two dozen sizes. I'd like to try my luck as well; as you could see, I wore my loosest garb."

"Thanks for your chivalry, Mr. Templa, you crazy horndog. Two is better than one, they say, so let's get moving."

1552312.content:
"Well," ventured the gray husky, "since we know not to use the front door, how about we split up and look for other entrances? I'll take the left, you the right. We'll meet at the back of the place, and discuss what to do. Deal?"

"Sure, whatever," groaned Mimi. She had always worked as a loner- not because she didn't like people, but because she could never find anyone competent to deal with. They'd always bumble, or fail, and she'd end up framing them for one of her treasure hauls. But this Templa guy seemed different. He seemed a bit full of himself, true, but he seemed quick on his feet and intelligent. And a bit cute, she ventured. If it worked out, she thought, maybe they could team up. "And if not, there's always the quick blade to the throat."

The dog had padded off to the left side of the building, so Mimi hurried around her side. Along the brick wall, there seemed to be about 6 entrances. Three wooden doors, each with a small number carved in the side- respectively a 1, 5 and 100; two large windows, one reachable by one person, the other requiring a boost of teamwork on the second floor- and a basement cellar. Oddly, none were locked as far as she could tell. She quickened her pace before running into Templa on the back side. He had been resting against the back wall.

"What did you find?"

"Half a dozen entrances of varying sizes and types. A few doors, two windows and a basement."

"Well, my side was barren. There's one window on the back, but it's 5 or 6 stories up. I could get us up there with some magic, but it'd take nearly all of my efforts."

155231211.content:
...ended up with tails. "Cellar it is," Mimi said with a bit of happiness showing through her face. "Let's not waste any more time. Go go go!"

Mimi threw open the cellar door and crept down the stairs slowly. Following closely behind, J.T. illuminated the room with magic, hoping to see any possible traps. The cellar seemed normal, just a barren room. About half the size of the building itself, it expanded out both ways from them, with a large staircase about 500 paces ahead leading up into the normal room.

"Ah, there's our path-" Mimi began to say. However, a large metal noise cut her off. In front of the two, a large machine appeared, decloaking from an invisibility spell.

"What the hell?"

The machine began to whir its motor, and as it did a large splash of dirty-appearing water started to flood into the room. Flowing at the rate of a vacuum in reverse, the liquid quickly spread over the surface of the water.

"Make a break for it!" J.T. yelled. The two furries sprang into action towards the cellar stairs. However, the machine had different ideas. As they came close to it, it began to whirl two nozzles towards them, each spilling out more of the water. Mimi opened her mouth to say something, but before she could, SPLASH! The nozzle's aim hit her square in the face. Sputtering, she swallowed some of the murky water. "Hey, this isn't water, it's-" SPLAT, another burst in the mouth. "It's chocolate-flavored!" she spat out.

"Good to know-" J.T. too was cut off in midsentence by a splash of water in his muzzle. The two continued to run until Mimi slipped and fell face-first into the knee-high drink. The nozzle reached her in its pursuit and grabbed her legs, wrapping around them like a snake. It spread around her body until closing in on her muzzle, where the water directed itself right down her throat. As J.T. diverted his course to her, her belly quickly inverted, clearing her abs away for a small gut. Once her stomach reached capacity, the tubes suddenly dropped her to the ground harmlessly....

only to turn and hit J.T. He was wrapped up quickly, but the nozzle only had time to put a little liquid into his stomach before a panting Mimi sliced it in half with a knife. With this, the machine gave a defeated whir and collapsed into a pile of scraps.

"Well, I guess you were right..." Mimi trailed off, poking her bloated belly.
155231211.title: Trap!

1552312111.content:
The two panted for a minute, tired from the trap's difficulty and being force-fed chocolate sludge. The black cat opened her mouth to speak, but was cut off by a loud, imposing voice seemingly coming from above them.

"Welcome, intruders! I can see you've met my first trap! I am the Lipomancer, and you have broken into my fortress. Although, instead of killing you thieves, I think we'll play a little game instead. I'm on the ceiling of the building, above the seventh story. If the two of you can reach me, I'll reward you by not killing you. I'll even be nice enough to send a map your way!"

With his words, a sheet of parchment appeared in front of the two. The extended paper ran about four feet long, two wide, and had floor plans of all seven (eight, with the basement) levels. The different rooms were labeled as well; some with T, some with S, and three with PH. Of course, only half of the map was labeled.

"If you're mobile by the time you get up here, we'll have a meeting on your reward. Otherwise, too-de-loo!"

"By the way, you might be wondering what just happened. That machine was meant to separate the various liquids flowing through the fortress, but it broke down one too many times. I decided to modify it. You both just got stuffed with fattening liquids. It's a handicap you get for entering the easiest way. I can see the cat got filled to the brim with the stuff, but the dog in the robe only got a splash. I'd say it's about 5 pounds per splash, so..."

The two shot each other looks and glanced at their bodies. Templa's single splash led to a quick spurt around his body, but the 5 pounds did nothing noticeable to his 150-lb frame.

However, Mimi not only got a lot of the water, but she wasn't too big to begin with. Her lithe 120-pound frame began to quake. Her bloated belly shrank in on itself for a moment, only to jut out further with fat. Her entire body, covered with the stretchy black cloth, began to expand outward. She was helpless as her chest and gut expanded outward about 3 inches, her arms thickened some, but her thighs took the brunt of the damage- they each rounded out two or three inches. The clothing began to stretch, and a faint strip of her white belly became visible around the end of the shirt and the start of the waistband. She seemed to gain 40 pounds in the instant. She began to cry, and was once again cut off by the Lipomancer.

"Shut up, there's more where that came from. Good luck, kiddies!"

1552312111112.content:
Johnathan glanced nervously at the closing stone door, then looked over towards Mimi, then back to the door again. All of a sudden, he bolted down the tunnel towards the shrinking entrance, with a startled catgirl following close behind, screaming out warnings.

"Stop! You don't know what's down here! You damn stupid mutt, STOP!" Yet she was still right behind him.

Mimi was even more startled when he did stop, nearly falling over as he barked in what sounded like pain. She was puzzled until she felt a sharp pinching in her side, instantly stopping and reaching for whatever the hell hit her. She gabbed at her chubby thigh and pulled out a small dark, black liquid still oozing out the tip. She looked up and saw J.T. was doing the same with the one that had hit him on the shoulder. Yet after a brief examination, he merely shrugged it off and tossed the dart aside.

"What the hell?! Are you nuts dog! We walked right into that, it could kill us!"

"Well then I'm not dying for nothing!" He called back to her as he ducked beneath the door.

The only thing she could do was follow him in. Besides, if she was going to die, she'd want to do it in the company gold coins and precious gems than out in this cold, dark tunnel.

Yet what she saw as she entered the room beyond the door wasn't a treasure trove, and it definitely was not cold, in fact, it had a warm cozy feeling. It was a gigantic banquet hall, filled with tables stretching as far as she could see. And as if that wasn't incredible enough, each table was overflowing with food, everything from thick, spicy sausage to warm cherry pie. It was a feast that could literally feed an entire city... if not two, maybe even a nation...

"This must be an illusion..." She said, simply awestruck by the size of the room.

Johnathan picked up an apple, brushed it off upon his robe, then took a bite, "No, it's very real..." He said swallowing, then taking another bite.

Mimi looked from the apple to the rest of the food, walking down the length of the closest table and examining what it had to offer. Meanwhile, J.T. had already finished the apple, and was picking up a rather large turkey leg.

"J.T., don't you think that can wait? I mean we already brought some food along and we should keep moving, it looks like there's no treasure... here..." She was interrupted by her stomach grumbling in protest to her, demanding food, "Then again... I am hungry... one bite, that's it..." She wasn't sure whether she was talking to the dogboy or herself.

Even if she was talking to him, Johnathan wasn't paying attention, he was too busy stuffing his muzzle feverishly, not even caring as his robe became stained with juices and sauce, grabbing a massive jug of wine and chugging it down.

Mimi saw this and began to worry, yet all her common sense was soon drowned out as she suddenly clutched her belly in pain, "I'm... I'm... what's wrong with me... I'm... STARVING!" She roared as she leapt upon a nearby ham and sunk her sharp, feline teeth into it....

As the potion that had been so suddenly introduced into their bloodstreams took effect, the stone door finally sealed shut with a grim thump, falling on ears of those too lost in gluttony to notice....

----

Within his dark chamber at the top of the tower,, the Lipomancer grinned wickedly. He placed his hands upon his crystal globe as he watched the two doomed adventurers consume mindlessly, lost in the thralls of his toxin. They ate and ate and ate, growing larger and larger before his eyes as food was turned to blubber, rolls formed, tripled, then quadrupled, and clothes tore to shreds: He couldn't help but to laugh.

"And here I thought they'd actually make some progress into my little abode... looks like I was wrong, but how can I complain? It's such a delicious ending..."

He howled with laughter, leaning back, kicking up his feet as he waited for some other naive explorers to fall for his trap, passing the time as he watched the two who already had eat their way towards their heavy fate.
1552312111112.title: The Price of Recklessness

choices: Jon begins his battle with the Sumo Skunk
He discusses strategy with Mimi beforehand
15523121112.content:
"That bastard's going to pay for that," Mimi snarled. Her chubby frame masked the pure hatred flowing through her veins. "Templa, what now?"

"We go up the stairs, Mimi." The husky was motivated. "I feel awful about this, and I think I know it's going to be us or him. I'm on your side."

"Thanks, dawg."

"Was that the insulting form or the slang form?"

"Slang."

"Awesome."

The husky led the charge up the staircase and out of the basement. The top of the stairs held a small doorway with two doors. One simply said SUMO, while the other said SGAL.

"Well, we know what one of those means," J.T. said, turning toward Mimi and away from the doors. "The other, I have no clue."

"BETTER THE DEVIL YOU KNOW, THEN," screamed a voice from inside the door marked SUMO. Before J.T. could react, the husky was snatched by a massive black-furred figure that blasted from inside the door.

"Jon!"

Mimi ran inside the SUMO door to find a medium-sized room. At one end was a traditional sumo ring, the other held Mimi's husky friend in a makeshift prison attached to what appeared to be a strange obstacle course.

Suddenly, the Lipomancer's voice filled the air. "Well well, I see Mr. Sanchez has made a decision for you!"

Mimi began to ask "Who's Mr. Sanchez?", but before she could begin pronouncing the surname the same voice from before boomed from atop J.T.'s makeshift prison, a fenced-in square covered by a glass ceiling where the husky had been forced into a silver suit. What appeared to be a black-furred creature ended up being a sleek-furred black skunk in a mawashi, weighing about 350 pounds, standing atop the cage. "CAT, YOU WILL GUIDE THE DOG THROUGH THE SUMO COURSE. HE MUST COMPLETE THE COURSE AND DEFEAT ME IN BATTLE."

"Why do you always have to yell?"

"MY VOICE WAS CURSED BY THE LIPOMANCER. HE SAID I SOUNDED TOO PRETTY, SO HE MADE IT SO I SCREAM EVERYTHING I SAY. BUT HEY, I LIKE BEING A SUMO SKUNK, SO SUE ME."

"So what's this suit about, anyway," asked the husky from the cage, "is it magic or something?"

"YES, DOG. IT'S SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED FOR THE SUMO COURSE. DUDE'S GOT MAGIC ALL OVER THE PLACE. IF YOU EAT ANYTHING IT INSTANTLY GETS CONVERTED INTO FAT. SPEAKING OF WHICH-"

The skunk lifted a side of the prison. As he did so, the strange obstacle course pulled itself into place. Its common theme, which neither Mimi or Jon had noticed, was of food. Specifically, cake. Suddenly, it became clear: the obstacles were food, which launched even more food directly toward the competitor's mouth.

"ENJOY THE CAKE. CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU IN THE RING." The sumo skunk climbed off the cage and sauntered over to the sumo ring, awaiting his opponent.

Templa opened his mouth to talk back but found his speech halted by a gob of triple chocolate cake. A slow flurry of cake began to rain directly upon the silver-suited husky, who gasped for air after swallowing his first piece only to find a second, even bigger hunk of quintuple-fudge quickly following it down his windpipe. Beginning to run into the obstacle course, the dog called out for help from the cat. "Mimi *gulp* help! *gulp*" he cried, each swallow a major cheat on his diet.

As the cat surveyed the course, she checked to see how Jon was doing. Yep, the silver suit was doing what the skunk said it would. Even though Jon had only eaten about half a cake, his gut was two inches thick, his arms and legs' thickness slowly growing. But the course was about to change, and as Mimi told Jon to get ready to jump, the cake stopped attacking. The husky hit his stride as he lept off a sudden decline, only to find himself falling into a pool of green water that appeared to be about Olympic-sized. His extra twenty pounds betrayed the husky as he prepared for impact, a planned dive falling off-center to instead form a spectacular belly flop. Dazed for a moment, Jon accidentally took in a gulp of the off-color water, which he immediately knew was a bad idea. The effect was instantaneous. The silver suit suddenly stretched around an immediate gain of about fifty pounds.

"Swim, Jon, swim," Mimi cried, "you can do it!"

The dog regained composure and quickly began to swim across the pool, lapping it quickly and reaching the stairs. "What's next, Mimi?", he asked as he began to climb out. "There's only one more obstacle, take a second to breathe and then keep going," the cat called. "Sounds good," Templa replied, pausing at the top of the stairs to lean on their armrest.

It was the wrong move. Instead of holding his weight, the armrest immediately broke in two, sending Jonathan into a surprised backwards tumble back into the water. The sheer surprise of the armrest's treachery left the husky off-balance and confused, not remembering to take a breath until he was already half-submerged. He sputtered in the water, trying to avoid drinking any more of the fattening drink, but it instead sent more down his windpipe.

Mimi winced as she watched the dog slink out of the water a few seconds later, embarrassed and all-around fat. What a way to have a setback, she thought to herself as she viewed the damage. Jon's gut was now pronounced, though his arms and legs had swelled. Though it wasn't covered by the suit, Jon's face wasn't immune to the gain, two and a half chins and some incredibly chubby cheeks now resting where his skinny face once had.

"Let's get this over with," the now-300-pound husky muttered half to himself as he waddled toward the final obstacle. It was... a chair. "There's no way I'm sitting in this," Jon thought to himself. As he tried to walk past it, it appeared he didn't have a choice; an unseen force pulled his fat tush into the seat.

A card with five questions appeared in Mimi's hand. She began to read:

HELLO, MIMI
SKUNK HERE, THROUGH MAGIC
SO YOUR BOYFRIEND OVER THERE IS ALMOST READY TO FIGHT ME
THE REST IS UP TO YOU

QUESTION 1
WHAT'S YOUR FAVORITE CANDY
QUESTION 2
WHAT ARE YOUR HOPES AND DREAMS
QUESTION 3
WHY ARE YOU WITH THE DOG
QUESTION 4
SWEETS OR MEATS?
QUESTION 5
DO YOU SEE YOURSELF IN HIM

SINCERELY, SUMO SKUNK

"Huh." Mimi was perplexed. "Answer the questions, dummy," the skunk said, having snuck up on Mimi. He handed her a pen. "By the way, the benefits here aren't bad. You know, for when he offers the package."

"What?" She had no idea what he meant.

"Ah, you'll learn," he said. He then wandered back to the sumo ring, ready for Templa.

"So... answer the questions," Templa said, still sitting.

Favorite candy? Um... I'll go with caramel, Mimi thought to herself, writing the answer quickly. A thirty-six pack of inch-thick caramel candies appeared in front of the dog. An invisible force began to thrust the candies into Templa's waiting, unwilling mouth every five seconds, each one adding a pound to his frame.

Question two, she quickly thought, hoping the candy wouldn't do much harm. "Hopes and dreams? To get out of this dungeon," she thought, answering the question. "Correct," the card scrawled in reply. Turning to the third, she thought for a moment. Should she answer honestly? At the same time, Templa's force-feeding had concluded, his frame now showing close to the thick, fatassed build of the skunk. He carried it well, though, she thought. It was true; his strong frame could hold some weight, she thought. And the suit, which was now beginning to truly stretch? Mm. "I like him," she wrote.

"Ooh, crush?", the card replied. "Just joshin. Finish up."

Question four: sweets, she said. Has to be sweets. As she wrote down her answer, a vat full of a thick ice-cream candy mix apparated, the tube pouring into Templa's mouth for thirty seconds. Each gulp of potent, calorie-laden fat made Templa's gut swell, his 360 pounds becoming 380, 400, then 420 pounds before the vat disappeared to wherever it started. At this point, the dog was a level past obese, his white, wide gut, tree-trunk thighs and puffy arms making Mimi almost forget his recent past as a skinny puppy.

The final question. Did she see herself in Templa? She looked him over. He was still full of anger and confidence despite his fluffy exterior. He was driven for revenge, just like her. "Yes," she wrote. With a gasp, her middle felt strange; the forty pounds she had gained suddenly disappeared, then immediately reappeared on Templa, whose suit doubled its effect. From 420 to 500 pounds, the wide mutt sighed, relieved that his bout with the skunk, and his first shot at revenge, was close at hand. The skunk was waiting for him; whatever Mimi just did to him could wait for now.
15523121112.title: They go up the stairs and are stopped

choices: Better start drinking!
Find some other way out!
155231212.content:
The coin landed heads up, leaving the druidic husky victorious. "Heads! I win. Well then," he said through a grin, "let's see what's through Door Number 1."

The door itself was locked, but Mimi found it no challenge to pick the simple thing into compliance, and the door creaked open into what appeared to be a simple stone antechamber, lit up by simple torches. There was nothing else inside the room but another door, larger and made of thick iron. The duo skulked inside, examining the forbidding portal before them. In the middle of the door there was the image of a corpulent human woman's face, her mouth open as though waiting to receive something. Mimi bent down, looking inside of it.

"I think it's some sort of mechanism... Maybe a lock of some sort. But it doesn't have any tumblers that I can see..."

At that point, the wooden door, and their only escape to the outside world vanished, melding into the stone. J.T. whipped around, and slammed his fists on the hard stone wall where the door used to be. "It's a trap!"

A commanding, self-assured voice sounded out from thin air in reply, reverberating through the room. "Yes. A trap you blindly walked into, like so many other idiot adventurers have!"

"Welcome, fools, to my lair! The Lair of the Lipomancer! You have come here seeking material gain... And so I shall give it to you! Perhaps you noticed the number on the door, and chose it due to being the smallest one out of the three. Fools that you are, you never realized that the number could stand for a single unit of great quantity! The only way to escape this room is to suck on the lips of the beautiful iron face before you. Doing so shall activate a mechanism that will drain a solution of my own devising from a hidden container in the walls and into your mouth. This container holds enough of my solution to induce a weight gain of one TON! How fortunate for you that there are two of you... Perhaps you can split it! Not that it will make any difference in the long run! And if you choose NOT to drink... Hohohoho... Well. Let's just say that you'll wish you had. If you make it past here, seek me at the highest point of my fortress, that I might give you your 'reward'! Until then! Ahahahahaha!"

The Lipomancer's maniacal laughter trailed off into nothingness, leaving J.T. and Mimi to decide amongst themselves how to escape.
155231212.title: A Heavy Burden

choices: "Actually, there is something..." He commands the power of nature to free them!
"I don't know!" They must decide on drinking...
1552312122.content:
“Damn you!” J.T. shouted as he looked up at the ceiling, his lips curling into a snarl, “I can’t believe I fell for this! Stupid, stupid!”

Mimi placed her paws upon the iron door before them, hoping that if she pressed hard enough that their only exit would open. She did this for a good minute or so before giving up and twirling about to glare at the druid, “What’s wrong J.T.? None of your porkers squeal about this one when you were fooling around with them?!”

“No! No...” The husky sighed, placing leaning his head against the wall in dismay, “Most of them just went through the front…”

“Oh I’m sure you gave them the same courtesy...” Mimi purred, grinning as she pulled out some tools from her belt.

J.T. growled once more, his hands curling into fists as he slammed them against the wall, “Now is really not the time thief! Especially not when we’re about to round out ourselves…”

“Who says we have to?”

The druid turned around to look across the antechamber at the catgirl, his frown disappearing into a smile almost immediately as he caught sight of her kneeling down and trying to pick the door’s “lock”. The dog rushed over to her, his tail wagging with excitement, “You think you can pick it?! But you said there were no tumblers!”

“None that I can see!” The cat replied over her shoulder while fumbling with the lockpicking tools, “ Doesn't mean there aren't any back here… Or there’s a fail-safe built in that will let us out… Or I’m just extremely desperate…”

The rogue continued to feel about the mechanism with her picks, grunting in frustration as she continued to find nothing, no matter how deep she searched inside of the metal mouth. She was beginning to think she had found something, but stopped pressing at whatever it was when she heard a sudden, loud whirring coming from above. J.T.’s ears perked and Mimi’s fur prickled as they both looked up at the ceiling for a moment. Seconds later the catgirl shouted in shock as her arms were pulled into the mouth up to her elbows and the sound of rushing air filled the room.

“J.T.! It’s sucking me in!” She yowled as she let go of her probing tools, leaving them to be taken away as they rattled loudly against the pipes of the door mechanism, “Help me, please!”

“Alright, alright! Push your legs against the door, I got ya!” The rogue did as she was instructed to, placing her feet square against the door and pushing hard, just as the husky wrapped his arms around her waist and tried to pull her free. Soon though, their struggles were rendered unnecessary as the suction in the pipes shut off, leaving J.T. and Mimi to fall clumsily to the floor.

“Son of a bitch, that was nuts…” The catgirl said as she laid back on J.T., momentarily daze, “And I lost my damn… Hey... Hey dog boy, paws off!” Mimi hissed, swatting the husky’s hands off of her chest as he let out a startled and confused yelp.

“Well excuse me! It’s not my fault you got stuck in there,” He said, rubbing his paws gingerly, “Besides, the girls I've met before usually enjoy my hands-on approach…”

“The girls you met were also probably getting used to waddling for a change…” The cat responded, frowning as she stared at the metal door, once again trying to figure out what to do, “And probably in need of a way to feel more comfortable about their new size. I’m sure a “gentleman” like you was all too happy to oblige..."

J.T. scoffed, “I’ll have you know I've had plenty of women, thin and plump, more than just those today! I doubt it will matter anyways, it seems like you'll be in need of some comforting soon enough..."

“Hah! There’s no way either of us aren't sharing this load. Think about it J.T., you think either of us would be able to carry a ton of fat gracefully? We’re going to need to be in shape… or at least as fit as we can be if we’re going to make it to the treasure.”

“Oh I don’t think you two will have to worry about sharing much longer!” The Lipomancer’s disembodied voice cackled once more before a loud, metallic thrumming was heard coming from the door in front of them. As the two treasure-hunters watched, the corpulent face in the middle of the steel portal began to morph, slowly stretching apart and then reforming into two identical faces, each equally spaced upon the door.

“I don’t understand…” Mimi said, her voice shaky, “Is this so we can divide the ton of weight more easily between ourselves…?”

“No, of course not you foolish girl!” The Lipomancer replied with unrestrained glee and malice, “Since the two of you seemed so content with trying to find a way to avoid my ingenious little trap, I have decided that you both must gain one ton each! Unless that is… One of you wishes to devour all of the liquid, though I wouldn't suggest it... Otherwise, good luck deciding!”

“This isn’t fair you bastard!” J.T. barked in response.

“Of course it is mongrel! I told you if you chose not to drink that there’d be consequences! I warned you, you dog!” The Lipomancer cackled once more before his voice faded away like an echo.

“Crap… J.T., you said you’re a druid right? Is there any magic or something you can do that’ll get us out of here?”

The husky boy stood still for a moment, rubbing his chin with his paw whilst thinking…
1552312122.title: Considering the Alternatives

choices: J.T. Continues to channel the extreme forces of nature!
J.T.'s concentration is disrupted by a rather frightening interruption.
15523121221.content:
J.T.’s ears perked, and his eyes lit up with hope as he suddenly came to a realization, “Actually, there is something…” He said, smiling as he rolled back his sleeves.

Mimi looked more than a bit surprised at this, somewhat expecting the Husky’s druidic powers were a sham. She couldn't say she was unhappy to be wrong however, and watched the mystical mutt with much interest, “You’re saying you know a spell that can get us out of here?”

“Yes!” J.T. replied, grinning from ear to ear as he tried to recall the exact methods of casting, “I've been trained to command many of the elements of life with my powers, and my masters have taught me well… Make sure you’re watching kitty, as you are about to be amazed…”

“Well, we’ll see about that once we’re out of here…” Mimi replied skeptically, though it was hard for the rogue not to smile herself. They may have beaten this infernal trap, and without gaining a single pound!

“You might want to stand back, believer or not!” Jonathan chuckled, “Things are about to get messy!”

Heeding the husky’s warning, Mimi stepped back a bit, her back pressed to the iron door as the dog turned to face the way they had come in from. He spread his arms outwards, closing his eyes in concentration as he muttered a few archaic words…

At first nothing happened, and Mimi sighed in disappointment… Not Jonathan though. As his eyes opened, he was still smiling, and after a moment’s more of silence, the two could hear a faint rumbling.

Suddenly the rumbling grew even louder, and bits of loose dirt and small chunks of stone began to fall from the walls and ceiling.
“J.T., what’s going on…?!” Mimi cried out, not sure if being buried alive was better than being caught in a trap they could at least live through.

“I’m bending the plants outside the walls to my will! We should still be close enough for their roots to tunnel through and dig us out!” He called back as he looked behind him at his companion, the excitement on his face in direct contrast to her ghastly pallor, “Don’t worry! I've got it all under control!”

“If you say so…” Mimi said uncertainly, pressing even harder against the door.

Just then, the stones beneath their feet began to crack and be pushed upwards as the roots beneath began to break through, “There we go, almost baby, almost!” J.T. shouted in a frenzy, his tail wagging like a fir tree caught in great storm. Mimi couldn't help but to bite her lip with anticipation.

At first, the only visible plant life that breached the flagstone floor were tiny fibrous branches, as though the roots of a small plant or the beginnings of a much larger limb… But then…
15523121221.title: The Mastery of the Druids!

choices: Take the opening while it lasts!
Wait for another... if there is one!
155231212211.content:
J.T. focused upon the thin, protruding sprouts, gritting his teeth as he stretched his paws out towards them and then...

Nothing.

Jonathan stood there for a moment, arms still outstretched before his posture relaxed and he quirked his brow. After a little while longer of looking at the tiny protrusion of roots and nothing happening, he bent closer, squinting for a better look, “Well come on now… keep going!”

Mimi’s heart sank, “Wait. So that’s… it? Really?”

J.T. slowly stood up to look back at her, a nervous and strained laugh escaping his throat, “Um…”

“That’s it?!”

“The walls must be too thick!” J.T. stammered, “Or the trees are too far away!”

“Well now what do we do?” Mimi fumed, barely restraining a rising mix of dread and rage.

“…dig our way out?” J.T. suggested sheepishly.

Mimi hissed angrily at the husky before drawing her daggers and pointing one’s bladed tip straight at her “companion”. She slowly walked towards him, still holding the blade in the air and aimed in his direction, “Of all the druids I had to be trapped with, it had to be the most useless one!”

“Mimi! Please!” J.T. cried out in panic as he backed away from the seriously pissed off woman, “Don’t you think you’re overreacting?!”

“There’s only one way out now, thanks to you!” She hissed as she stepped closer to him, keeping the knife pointed in his direction the entire time as she held the other one behind her, “And I've trained too hard to get such a perfect body! You’re going to drink it all or die!”

J.T.’s eyes widened in shock, and Mimi felt a rush of guilt as she realized this was not what he had been expecting at all, “Are you serious right now? Mimi, think about what you’re saying! I can’t drink it all; I won’t be able to move!”

“I’m sorry J.T., but it was your decision, “ She said grimly, her grip on her blade not wavering in the slightest, “And it’s better that one of us can stay in shape and avoid any other traps than both of us being reduced to clumsily waddling through a dangerous fortress… You got me into this mess, and you’re getting me out!”

“So you’re just going to stuff me and leave me to die like a barbaric sacrifice then!?” He growled at her, “Or do you expect to be able to move me once I weigh more than a herd of cattle!”

“I’m sure we can figure that out later, now get drinking mutt,” She said, smiling, “Unless you’d prefer to die now, rather than maybe dying later?”

J.T. sighed before shrugging as if in defeat. Mimi smiled even more, that is until she felt his foot swiftly connect with her paw, a quick kick knocking the dagger from her hand, “What th-?!”

But before Mimi could even say anything, the husky was already charging towards her with his elbow raised. Luckily for the rogue however, her feline reflexes allowed her to dodge just before he would have knocked the wind out of her; the cat landing nimbly on her feet as she threw her extra knife into the air to catch it in her right hand.

Before she could bring it to bear against her attacker however, the husky was already following up his charge with a sweeping kick. Once more Mimi found herself jumping into the air just before he struck, barely dodging the attack on her footing.

“Pretty impressive, for a druid!” She quipped, smiling as she was beginning to enjoy this dance of conflict, “I didn't know they taught you guys to do much more than petting trees and hugging squirrels!”

The husky growled as the rogue brought her claws into the fray, their sharp tips grazing lightly against his face before he backed up against a wall, “There’s plenty for you to learn when you’re not busy lusting after other peoples’ coin…” He barked back at her.

She ignored the comment, too caught up in the moment as she saw him pinned against the wall. This could be the perfect time to act, but then again if she was careful, he might make even bigger mistakes. Besides, it was rare for her to be part of such a challenging straight-up fight…
155231212211.title: Only Tension Grows Around Here

choices: She tries to grab the vial in her mouth.
She tries to reach the vial with her arms.
1552312122111.content:
“You’re one to talk about lust…” Mimi hissed, before rushing the cornered husky, her knife raised, “You womanizing PERVERT!”

Once more though, the monk was too quick for her. As Mimi was swinging her knife in a slashing arc towards the canine, all she found herself hitting was bare wall, her steel weapon clanging loudly against the hard stone. J.T. himself was not so reckless however, and before Mimi could turn to face her foe, she felt something hard and blunt striking the back of her head.

The girl’s vision went black for a moment, and before losing consciousness, the only things she could make out was the feeling of cold iron pressing against her lips and J.T.’s calm voice…

“Don’t worry cat…” He purred teasingly, “Soon you’re going to have tons more to worry about than revenge…”



When Mimi woke up, the first thing she noticed was the sluggish flow of thick, gooey sweetness filling her mouth and flowing relentlessly down her throat. Immediately she gagged, trying desperately to spit it all out, trying as hard as she could to pull away, but found she was unable to. As her groggy mind cleared, she could feel the paw on the back of her head holding her head firmly against the door as another soothingly rubbed her throat. She tried struggling once more, but it felt like something more held her in place.

“Hey! Hold still you stupid cat!” She heard J.T. plead from behind her, “I think you’re almost finished with the second lock, and then I can finally get out of this damn room…”

”Second lock?! Mimi thought to herself, her heart racing with realization, ”But that means…!

Mimi struggled even more fiercely now, but it felt almost impossible just to move her arms, almost as though they were bound in heavy iron shackles. She grunted against the constant flow of gooey liquid as her breath grew short from her exertions and she felt just how much the druid’s paw was sinking into the flesh of her chins and neck.

"Wait, chins?!"

“You’re just tiring yourself out thief!” The husky chuckled as he patted her head, “Just keep drinking and maybe I’ll be kind enough to come back for you!”

Mimi furrowed her brow in anger as she tried to look back at him, but that proved just as futile as fighting his grip, so she gave in and kept drinking from the door. Fortunately enough, J.T. was right, and it wasn't much longer before the flow turned into a soft trickle and then ceased completely.

Both adventurers’ ears perked as suddenly a loud metallic clanging could be heard inside the doors and around them. J.T. looked about as he let go of Mimi’s head and throat, and the cat girl was finally able to pull away. She gasped and wheezed as she tried to stand up, but found it physically impossible for reasons she was dreading she already knew.

She was thankfully momentarily distracted from her current condition however as she caught sight of the mighty iron gate before them creaking open. The two faces parted as the doors revealed the dark, stone hall beyond them. Before Mimi could look too closely however, her vision was blocked by her husky “friend”, the dog still as skinny as ever.

"I wouldn't be so sure!" The voice of the Lipomancer boomed overhead, "There are still plenty of opportunities for THAT! In fact, here's one to get you started..."

Mimi's heart sank as she heard the villain's words and the odd sound of grinding stone that soon followed. She looked up to find it's source: Another trap door sliding open, this time in the ceiling behind her. She stepped back from it towards the door at the far end of the hall, and nearly yowled in shock as something large, yellow, and blob-like dropped from the opening. While suspicious at first, Mimi cautiously approached the odd mass and quickly realized that it was a pile of crumbs and frosting that was almost as tall as she was.

"What... what is this thing?" She said, poking at it and letting out a meep as the blob suddenly began to squirm and wiggle.

"THAT is your newest challenge!" The voice cackled as the crumbly ooze began to come together, the mass beginning to take shape until it formed into a large, humanoid creature comprised of pink-frosted wedges, "Don't worry, it's a piece of cake! MUHAHAHA!"

"You damnable son of a bitch!" Mimi groaned before turning tail and running as fast as she could for the door at the end of the hallway.

The cake creature was already moving towards her though. The thing barreled straight through the stone pedestal and the remaining potion that lay between it and its target without a second thought, knocking them over and crushing them. Mimi's heart raced as she grabbed for the doorknob, thanking the gods that it was unlocked before swinging it open and slamming it shut behind her.

She looked around, finding that the door intersected into another hallway. Which way should she go now though: Right or left? The wrong choice could lead to a dead end or worse, another trap, but Mimi was running out of time.

Mimi continued to sit on her fat rump, far too heavy to even try standing at this point and effectively immobile from being forced to drink the entirety of the door-trap's contents. She huffed and wheezed angrily as she glared down the hall in the direction J.T. had left her, trying to think of the best way to reach the feather-weight potion she kept stored in her cleavage.

"Probably can't run all that fucking great after what that bastard did to me..." She thought to herself, wincing as her voluminous stomach gurgled, still churning through the literal tons of goop she had to devour, "If I even have a hope of catching up to him now, I'm going to have to act fast..."

Thinking her options over then, Mimi immediately decided that trying to grab the vial with her mouth would probably be a waste of time, especially with so much flab in the way. Her best bet now would be to simply try and grab the thing with her paw... Even if her arms were almost pure lard now.

Gathering all of her remaining strength, Mimi concentrated hard on trying to move her right arm mere inches. Even though the muscles still remained strong, the blubber that coated them weighed several times as much now and it was tough going. Thankfully Mimi found that they hadn't become completely worthless as her flabby limb slowly shifted towards her heaving, wobbling chest.

"Yes! I've almost got it! Just a little more and then I'll be okay...! I'll be moving around in no tim-"

Even though Mimi's muscles may have still had the strength to move her fat arm, she didn't even consider how clumsy the heavy appendage might be... at least not until it knocked straight into her right breast. The feline rogue felt her blood run cold as she sent the huge mammary jiggling with the accidental collision, the movement just enough to shake the vial of potion loose and send it tumbling free. Unfortunately for her, it fell right onto the curve of her belly before rolling down its slope and off the side of her gut. The vial fell out of view but Mimi could hear it shatter, cringing as she sat there helpless to prevent it smashing along with her hope of escape.

Mimi tried to shake her head in denial, but even that was hampered by her enormous weight. Her breaths grew heavier and more frantic as her heart beat harder within her chest, the catgirl refusing to believe she had failed so miserably. She grunted as she strained her legs, pushing her fat feet against the ground and trying as hard as she possibly could to simply stand but to no avail. She kept trying, not letting herself see how fruitless it was until the only thing her efforts managed to do was break wind from her immensely fattened and jiggling rear.

The fatass feline sat there defeated upon her rump, hot tears rolling down her fat cheeks as she thought of the potion now soaking into the stone floor beneath her belly and a growl spread across her lips as her mind returned to the druid. She stared down the hallway for any sign of J.T., the asshole that had done this to her and now possibly her last hope of getting out of this place... if he even made it back himself.

"I'll show that fucking mutt the price for screwing me over..." She hissed to herself furiously, "Once I'm back to my former self I'm going to kill you J.T., you son of a bitch!"

As the last echoes of her threat faded down the open hallway however, she was left with only silence, indigestion, and a couple tons of doubt.

15523121222.title: The Weight of Choice

155231212222.content:
"Actually, dogbreath," Mimi started. She slowly meandered toward him, trying to deflect his attention with a well-placed hip thrust. When the husky temporarily darted his eyes to her hips, enticed, that was all the time the cat rogue needed. In one movement she had tripped the dog, grabbed anything he had in his pockets (a few spells, some gold, not much else) and pulled her blade, which she put to J.T.'s throat.

"The dog volunteers to drink it all," the cat spat at the Lipomancer, who was momentarily taken aback by her actions.

"Well done, the cutthroat lives on to fight another day! Unfortunately, the dog you've tricked lives on to 'fat' another day. Ha... well, they aren't all winners. Do know, Dog, that I'm lowering the total amount gained to 750, if only because I want to see you two make it a little further. It's rare I have company, might as well stretch you out. And your waist, too. Ciao!"

With that, the faces decorating the door merged back into one, and the Lipomancer's vocal presence was silenced, leaving only the cat, still with a knife to her companion's throat.

"Well, get drinking! I wasn't about to get myself screwed over by inaction. I'm sorry, but you're going to have to deal with it."

Though he was clearly pissed, and more than a little scared, Jonathan regained enough posture to sneer. "Well, cat, I'm going to show you what you just gave up. Enjoy the show, sweetcheeks."

Fear swirling a bit in his mind, the husky calmed his nerves, stripping down to his skivvies right in front of the cat, who at the very least blushed a bit. He wasn't jacked, but Jonathan wasn't exactly husky, with a solid frame.

Slowly walking to the container of his imminent doom, the husky dog tried to rack his brain for a last-minute way out of the scenario. There was some spell way, way back mentioned as a weight-loss between the girls in his druid classes in his school days. It was... what was it, again? He couldn't be sure. A name popped into his head, and after a second of consideration while simultaneously placing his paws upon the door, he whispered the possible savior under his breath before placing his lips upon the iron ones of the mechanism., which clearly held three swigs (originally four, one magically removed by the 'Mancer for Mimi's act of, well, cowardice and bravery simultaneously).

After a few unsure moments without change, a sudden puff began to fill the husky's body. It seemed that about two-hundred and fifty pounds descended into his gut, his cheeks, his butt, chest and legs, quickly growing him into an obese, though well-proportioned, husky dog. The sudden onrush of fat had taken the husky aback, but considering he didn't know how much time he had before more dire circumstances would come into play, the husky husky downed the final two swigs in the door lock.

Mimi was stunned, watching the transformation from a few feet away. In front of her very eyes, J.T. had gone from a relatively lithe, skinny pup into a wide, winter-ready dog, before his sudden decision to finish the drink took her aback. The effects were slower this time, but she swore she could see the dog's already bulging body slowly sponge out more, his light fur only adding to the visuals. His thighs thickened past thunder-thighs, finding a new definition of fatty thighs, while his gut didn't expand as much outward as wide. The spell he remembered to cast upon himself didn't control how much he gained so much as where it ended up, so while he was still a dog with 750 new pounds on him, the mutt felt great, the weight evenly distributed among himself. Sure, the beach was a thing of the past, but upon seeing himself out of his peripheral vision, J.T. could tell the change wasn't all that bad. Meanwhile, though she was oddly fond of the dog's new form, thinking it more friendly than usual and more than a little powerful, Mimi searched the room for a way out. Two exits became visible after a moment - one wall had a hidden slide, strangely jumbo-sized, while another had a hidden switch, which she flipped to reveal a staircase heading up.

Meanwhile, the Lipomancer sat excited at his chair, watching the proceedings. "I've roped the dog, admittedly pretty easy to do, but this cat here... how do I slow her down?" he thought to himself. "Well, let's see what happens next."

1552312122222.content:
The newly fattened husky and his still-quite-thin partner stood before the two branching, newly opened pathways, considering their options. From the looks of it, both paths up and down were quite dimly lit, so there was little they could see as they ascended or descended into the inky darkness. Mimi scratched her chin while J.T. looked at her with a glare, perhaps envious that she still only had one.

“Which way do you say we go mutt?” She purred, ignoring his sour mood, “I’d say up!”

“And if I weren't so mad that I didn't want to speak to you, I’d say down, but I’m not,” Jonathan grumbled, looking away from her.

“Down? But wouldn't that lead to the way out?” She frowned as she looked over at him, “I can see why you’d want to give up so soon, but I still want that treasure… no matter what.”

“As if I couldn't tell that already…” J.T. sighed, cringing as he grabbed his new gut, “Anyways, I doubt that it leads back to the cellar entrance we saw earlier. More than likely it just leads deeper into this fattening deathtrap.”

“Oh?” Mimi said, her brow furrowing in concern, “And why might you think that?”

The druid whined gloomily as he looked down the chute, “Because just think about it for a second, alright? He’s got us trapped in here already: the wall sealed shut behind us as soon as we walked into this room and it still hasn’t opened, even after “we” solved the puzzle. It’s clear he wants to keep us in here and moving deeper into his fortress, so why would he just give us the exit like that?”

A chill went through Mimi’s spine. She was somewhat expecting he would say that, but it was still a troubling thought, “But… what about the adventurers you met on the road here?”

“I’m guessing they were just the lucky ones…” J.T. said, “I bet there are plenty more still stuck in this place, maybe in trap rooms, or maybe somewhere else…”

Mimi was really starting to become worried now, but she pushed her fears aside: They wouldn't get her anything, whether it was treasure she wanted or escape, “Well then, if it doesn't matter, then I say we go up!”

The canine’s ears drooped as he whined in protest, “But it’s so much easier to go down! And you just said it didn't matter anyways.”

“Yes… true…” Mimi purred as she held her dagger up to the husky and poked him in the back with it, “But I think I’m the one in charge here, so I decide where we go…”

“Really?” J.T. winced as he began to climb up the stairs slowly, “Is this how we’re going to treat each other now? With distrust and cruelty?”

Mimi chuckled, “Sorry, but after what I put you through big guy, even I think you’ve earned some payback… Besides, you really need the exercise.”

“You know, you’re a real bitch…” Jonathan grumbled under his breath as he continued to lumber up the stone steps.

The flight of stairs didn't seem to be that long, but it was slow going with J.T. in the lead. The obese husky boy was still getting used to his new bulk, and was already panting heavily and slowing down as the reached the halfway mark. Mimi would have been less patient with the druid, and maybe even prodded him a bit with her blade, but something about watching his tubby, almost bare rump jiggle with each step was quite… entertaining?

“You know, I’d normally say eyes forward…” Templa snickered, “But I think that’s the problem.”

Mimi scowled as she muttered a response, “Just keep moving your fat ass before I give it more motivation…”

As they reached the top of the steps, J.T. still gasping for breath a little, Mimi could see it led to a rather long and straightforward tunnel before them. Unfortunately the lighting wasn't any better here, so she wasn't sure for how far the hallway went.

“Mimi…?” J.T. gasped as he bent over to catch his breath, “Not that you have a track record for… huff… huff… being selfless, but can we take a bit of a break? Those steps…”

Mimi frowned as she waved her dagger in the air, “It was only a small climb, you can’t be seriously wanting to take a break now, we’ll never make it through this place if you keep this up!”

J.T. looked up at her and whimpered pitifully.

She began to walk down the tunnel but only made it about twenty-five feet before a large SHUNK sounded above her. Startled, she looked up to find a sheet of glass quickly lowering right above her head. The cat quickly sprung ahead of her past its dangerous grasp... only to hit another as it lowered quickly, pinning her between the two.

"Hello there, you too!"

Oh, not this guy again.

"Wow, cat, I can see you lack patience! Pretty much entirely! So now you're trapped! The thing is, this one's an interactive trap. Mr. Templa, you're going to play a part in your friend's outcome here! I'm going to begin filling your companion's little enclosure with a little something I whipped up one afternoon. It's a sickly sweet condensed air that holds plenty of latent magical calories just begging to fill out that tight little costume she's got on there! Where you come into play is that you can end her fatty breaths by simply allowing her to apologize to you for her prior conduct. The one that left you the size of a binge-eating polar bear. You can let her off easy, but where's the fun in that?"

"Jonathan, I'm sorry," she stammered, choking on the last word and taking a sharp breath. Considering he was already carrying close to a thousand pounds on his frame, he'd surely need her in the future if they had any chance of getting out of this godforsaken hellhole. Seeing things from her side, it was clear to him that she only pulled the knife on him out of desperation, and despite literally fighting like cats and dogs, the two were slowly bonding. Sure, it might have just been a form of Stockholm syndrome, but they definitely got along better than they had been at the outset of their journey. Still, though, he did want to at least pull one over on her...

With every gasp her frame curved out a few additional pounds, and in mere seconds the twenty-five pounds she had added doubled itself. Realizing that she would quickly swell herself up if he didn't stop it, the dog spun back around as quickly as his bulk would allow, calling out "I accept the apology, you can stop now!" Just as he said the word "apology," the sweet pink air around the cat dissipated and the glass receded into the ceiling.

Both Jonathan and Mimi immediately assessed the damage from this latest trap. The cat's tight clothing was pretty close to giving up the ghost, revealing all of her puffy midriff. It still covered her slightly-larger breasts, with her pants still easily containing her lower half, so she wasn't close to nudity yet, but she had put on a quick 50 pounds in just a minute's time.

"You asshole! What did you think you were doing there?!", the cat immediately yelled, getting as up close in the husky's face as she could. "Look at what you've done to me!"

"I wanted you to feel how I felt, without actually having to feel all of what I felt," he continued, referring to his overlarge body. "Seriously, you're fine. We need to stay as mobile as possible, and you've still got a hell of a lead on me."

The cat paused for a moment, reflecting, before accepting Jonathan's argument. "OK. I get it. Let's just keep moving so we can still get out of here at some point."

With the cat leading the way, Mimi and Jonathan progressed through the wooden door on the left, which unceremoniously slammed itself shut as soon as they entered. "Great," Jonathan muttered, "what stupid trap is this psychopath going to put us through now?"

Looking around the room, the two were confused. Sitting on a table in the middle of the room was a simple glass of water and a note. The brick room had one exit across from them, a simple door. Things seemed simple... too simple.

Mimi sauntered over to the note and began to read aloud. "Welcome to your latest test!", the note began. "I've decided to give you two an easy challenge to make things more interesting. As you can see, there's a glass of water on the table. Of course, as you've probably guessed, it's no simple glass of water. I've enchanted it with an interesting spell. When the glass is empty - and don't think about dumping it out, I'll pump this room full of pink mist if you do and you'll never leave - the door will open and you'll progress."

"The interesting thing here is that the water has different properties depending on who drinks it. If the dog drinks, nothing happens. No, really, I'm not pulling your leg for once. The chunky cat and fatty dog get to move on. If the cat drinks it, however, things get interesting. I know how much you love your precious figure, thief, so you'll be losing it. I think you'll double your weight? Which will still be a major change for you, maybe 150 pounds? However, should you accept that, the dog's weight will be halved, I'd say by about 400, 450 pounds? And seeing the way you're already struggling through the halls, husky boy, that'll be a big relief. You've got as long as you need to make the decision. Once again, don't drop or spill the glass, I'd hate to puff you up for good when you're such clever adversaries."

Mimi finished reading the note and looked up at Jonathan, directly into his best puppy-dog eyes. If nothing else, his chubby cheeks made him much more sympathetic. "Mimi, think about this. It sucks - this whole thing does - but for once we'll get out of here with a net positive. For every pound you add, I lose two. And that keeps us a step away from losing to this crazy bastard. I mean, shit, you've seen me in this place lately, it would probably take me an hour to walk a mile at best. Mobility is our friend here."

"But what if it isn't?", Mimi replied. "Woah, not like that," she added, seeing some lines of anger cross the dog's face. "No, I mean, what if the next room has some kind of antidote hanging from the ceiling and it takes me climbing up to do that? If I'm 300 pounds, I can't do it, and you're out of commission there completely, so we'd be screwed."

"He could make you gain 1,000 pounds instantly in the next room too," the dog curtly replied.

"Well..." Mimi tried to reply, but yeah, that was a possible outcome. After a few more minutes of deliberation...

Considering she had recently held a knife to his throat and made him blimp up four times his size, Mimi realized she didn't really have a leg to stand on in this argument. "Alright, Jon, you win," she said, drinking the water fast enough that she wouldn't have time to regret it.

The changes happened almost instantly. In the time it took her to blink, Mimi's, well, everything lurched out and lurched out far. 15523121222222111.title: Jonathan wins, Mimi drinks

155231212222221111.content:
Mimi took two beleaguered steps before faltering in her stride. An impatient grumble loosed her lips while she tried to recover. Her hope to clear the corridor with some scrap of dignity faltered.

"Something wrong?" Said J.T. Mimi needed not turn around to see the smirk on his face.

"Like you don't know."

The cat-girl took a deep breath and tried to stand straight, despite her rather front heavy situation. Deep beneath her new body lay years of well-toned muscle mass, no way a little fluff changed that. Just try again, Mimi thought to herself.

Baby steps, Mimi, baby steps.

Her thighs chafed together within a few paces while she floundered in her stride once more.

"I think I know what the problem is." Jonathan said. "Well, despite the obvious."

"What, pray tell, is that." Mimi seethed.

"You're trying to walk like someone half your size." He said in a matter-of-fact tone.

"What suddenly makes you an expert on fat people?"

"A healthy understanding of anatomy and the flow of energy is kind of my thing." Said J.T.

The husky shuffled over to Mimi and stood beside her.

"This," He prodded her belly-roll with his forefinger, "is hindering movement in your legs. And speaking of your legs, you need to stand with your feet further apart. Trust me your thighs will still touch."

"Okay fat-boy, how do I fix it?"

"Wider steps, like this." J.T. took a bit of a waddling step, the heft of his belly shifted to the side and gave his meaty leg enough room to walk forward.

Mimi rolled her eyes, and did her best to emulate the husky. Her hips wagged a little more than she felt comfortable, but true to his word, walking felt a little more natural with her frame. Any chance of stealth disappeared with a jiggle, but if they made it out with the treasure there might be no need for sneaking.

"Hate to say it Templa, but you're right." She waddled ahead of the husky. "Now try to keep up, I'm not too keen on waiting for anything to find us."

"Don't worry I'd protect you." Jon said between winded breaths.

"I don't see how you're fit to do that." Mimi said.

"'Course I am, I could just sit on anything that comes our way."

Mimi let out an exhausted, but genuine chuckle. The two walked on in silence, well for the most part. A steady cadence of fat laden foot falls backed a duet of wheezing and grunts. Mimi's thoughts turned to what horrors awaited them along the line. Spells, monsters, booby traps, stairs, gods please no stairs.

"What do you plan on doing after we get out of here?" Jon asked.

"Dunno, not exactly a lot of job opportunities for a fat rogue." Mimi shrugged. "You?"

"Going to go live in the woods, eat berries and twigs a for a few years until I'm thin again." Jon said. A low grumble filled the air. Jon rubbed his stomach without giving it half a thought. "Maybe I'd supplement my new diet with shepherds pie. Some mutton chops and a sweet roll or two. On second thought make that eight."

"I don't think you're too set on being thin again with a diet like that."

"I...I guess I'm a little hungry all of a sudden." Jon said.

The two stopped walking down the corridor for a moment.

"What if we're stuck like this?" Jon said, his eyes widened. "I mean it's magic fat, not normal fat."

"It feels like regular old fat to me."

"Tell me, Mimi, how might you get in shape again?" Jon said.

"I might start with swimming to get my endurance up." Said Mimi sighed and leaned against the wall. "Though at the rate I'm going, I might just float instead. Hmm, just relaxing in the water not a care-" Mimi caught herself mid-sentence.

The two anthros looked each other in the eye, then at their own bodies.

"Uh, how about running." Said Mimi.

"That's a start, I used to jog at my old town all the time. I passed this one tavern every day, and they had the most amazing honey mead, I could just sit there for days drinking-"

"Jon?"
