The Right Door
155331111112211211112221.content:
Sally stepped into the hallway, walking past the marble columns that separated it from the main hall. It was really more like an antechamber to the much larger grand hall, but was a bit darker, being more recessed, only a few lit candlesticks adorning the walls of the room. Sally slowly stepped inside, looking about the area not just to take in the sights, but to make certain that whichever direction she went, it wouldn’t lead her back to where she began in one giant circle.

The room, like the adjacent one, was decorated with paintings, though fewer in number and most of them quite a bit smaller, most of them simple portraits. She still knew better, however, and put good distance between herself and the unsettling artwork. There were also a few tables, two small ones to her left and right and one in the middle, which held bowls, candelabras, and even a couple busts (Of course depicting obscenely heavyset subjects. Besides that, there wasn’t much else to note besides the musty rugs and decaying wallpaper.

There were the doors, of course, two on each side, left and right, and one directly across from Sally. The young lass stopped momentarily to think about her choices. If she chose the doors on the left side, she would likely just end up back in the courtyard eventually… But if she chose the doors on the right, then she would just be heading deeper into the castle, and more than likely into more tricks and traps. All of this, of course, was assuming that the basic logic of navigating a house was still in effect here, and she was just imagining things or more lost than she thought when she wound up back in the courtyard again.

So of course, the best choice would be for her to go through the door at the opposite side of the hall! Sally nodded, assuming that it would hopefully lead outside of the dreaded castle, and walked over to it, gripping the doorknob and taking a deep breath. She then opened the door and gasped.

She found herself not looking into another room or hallway, as she had expected, but instead looking out over the castle courtyard from what seemed like a few stories above it! She trembled slightly, not really a fan of great heights, and stuck her head out through the doorway, gripping its frames as she looked around. It seemed as though she was high up in one of the watchtowers lying at the corners of the courtyard, and although there was a small balcony directly on the other side of the door, she felt more comfortable on the near side. In fact she felt much more comfortable with the door closed, and so she slammed it shut, breathing heavily and sighing.

“I… I must be hallucinating… Maybe I’m just tired or something, but… but that wasn’t real!” She said, trembling.

Still, however, she moved onto another door, this time on of the ones on the left side (Now on her right as she faced the entrance hall), figuring that heading away from the center of the keep was still better than heading further into it. She tried the left door and found it to be locked. It shouldn’t have felt odd to Sally to find a locked door in a place like this, but when it was the first one she encountered after all this time wandering around, it kind of stuck out. She frowned, grumbling as she tried it again just to make sure, before moving on to the door next to it.

At first, the space the door led to seemed to be quite ordinary, if pointless. The room was completely furnished in stone bricks, not very wide across, but about three times its width in depth. It was quite dark, but Sally could still see what appeared to be puddles of… something… dripping down the walls… No, wait… not dripping down, but flowing towards her? There was also a heavy, overwhelmingly sweet aroma that filled the room, strong enough for the cowgirl to smell clearly even as she stood outside of it. Her curiosity, in the end, got the better of her, and she stepped through the door.

She immediately let out a startled scream as she lost her balance completely and tumbled to the ground, “Bwuhgh..?!” She gasped, completely confused and all but a little rattled from the unexplained fall.

It wasn’t clear to her what had occurred at first; in fact Sally almost became hysterical. As she looked around the room, she had realized that the door had disappeared entirely, and began to panic as she assumed she was trapped. A few moments later, however, and she soon realized that the door wasn’t gone, but had just moved… to the floor. Then, as she looked around once more, seeing how small the room was, but how tall it had become, she came to the correct, if insane, conclusion: Somehow gravity had shifted as soon as she walked over the door’s threshold.

Sally twirled around, still confused, her hooves clattering against the stone while her tail swung through the air. How the hell was this even possible?! It simply wasn’t… not normally. Yet Sally started to calm down much more easily now, especially after all of the crazy things she’s seen the past couple of days. Sure, bending physics is crazy, but compared with cursed paintings, vicious vines, and living feedbags? It all had to be some kind of maniacal sorcery at work, and despite it all starting to seem less and less spectacular, it still made the farmgirl’s skin crawl.

Still, it wasn’t long before Sally regained her composure, and her initial curiosity returned. She pushed her chubby bulk up and looked at the walls, realizing that the strange liquid substance was, in fact, dripping… though now in the “correct” direction. There were also large pools of the black stuff on the ground, and although most of it had long since dried, she found a spot that was still wet and stuck her finger in it.

“I’m pretty sure my mother warned me not to do this…” She frowned, examining the glob of slime at the end of her finger, “But she sure as hell didn’t prepare me for all this other kooky shit, so, here we go!”

She stuck her finger into her mouth and winced. The goop tasted even sweeter than it smelled, however it was deliciously so, and not overwhelming in the slightest. Sally felt comfortable enough to open her eyes by this time and, to her amazement, she didn’t look even the least bit fatter!

“Well thank the gods for small favors, I guess…” She giggled as she looked around the room, up towards the ceiling, “But I wonder what happened to the rest of it!”

Shaking her head dismissively, Sally got onto her hands and knees and crawled back out the doorway, carefully this time. She felt a bit queasy as the natural gravity on the other side of the portal pulled her to the floor of the side hall, and she clumsily got back up on her feet.

“Well that was fun…” She said, closing the door behind her and frowning, realizing how much time she was wasting.

Only two doors left now though… well two unlocked ones. Both of them seemed to lead deeper into this bizarre abode, but after the other ones, Sally couldn’t even be certain of that. Still she was optimistic that one of them had to lead somewhere.
155331111112211211112221.title: What's Behind Door...

choices: Keep exploring: Maybe she'll find something interesting.
Try opening one of the doors: Maybe she'll find a way out.
1553311111122112111122211.content:
As much as Sally thought over her choices in her head, there was really no way to tell which door led where without opening one up. Still, she wasn’t too eager to do even that… Sure, the other two doors hadn’t exactly harmed her, but they were pretty strange, and what if something worse was still waiting for her? What if on the other side of one of these doors was another of those feedbags, or some other monster wanting to feed her or… well, actually eat her? She really wasn’t so sure she was better off waiting out here though.

As fate would have it, that last thought was proven true as a series of clattering echoes filled the foyer. This was followed soon by the feedbag dancing down the grand staircase and heading towards Sally, its fiber-rich contents spilling out the top and eager to fill the woman’s mouth. Not wanting to give the infernal object any more opportunities to fulfill those desires, Sally swung open the left door and slammed it closed behind her. Once safe on the other side, she let out a sigh of relief, but her brief moment of rest did not last long.

About a minute after she had shut the door, she heard the expected sounds of the feedbag clawing at the other side. What she didn’t expect, however, was the doorknob to rattle. She soon realized that she wasn’t even sure if the feedbag could open doors like these: The other ones she recalled didn’t even open by doorknob! She held the bulb of the handle tightly, teeth gritting as she glanced about the door for a lock but couldn’t find one. Damn it though, she was not going to wait around this place all day! She looked around her surroundings, finding herself in a thankfully normal looking, if gloomy, hallway. But it wasn’t the décor she was looking for, it was a barricade, and fortunately she found it in a nearby grandfather clock. "With food of course." The Lipomancer chuckled mirthfully, "I'm joking. You can use any method you want to fatten up adventurers. For example, you can force feed them, put weight gain curses on them, or enchant your fire breath to cause weight gain."

"But I'm not big or strong enough to force feed experienced adventurers and I don't even know any magic spells." Fenra pointed out as she shook her large head.

"Oh, don't worry about that. I give all of the new monsters I recruit the basic tools they need to do their job. I'll show you after we reach the treasure room that you'll be guarding and living in." The Lipomancer explained as he kept walking.

Fenra nodded and obediently followed along behind him. She kept silent the rest of the way. A few minutes later, the Lipomancer led her into a large stone room that was lined with torches. Fenra's jaw dropped as she took in the size of the room and noticed it's contents. There was a huge pile of treasure in the center of the room. There were gold bars, jewels, pearl necklaces, diamond rings, and thousands of other shiny objects! The treasure pile was so large that she could bury her entire body beneath the treasure and no one would know she was there. Fenra was practically beside herself with glee. Dragons are a lot like Magpies, they love shiny things.

"Fenra? Fenra!" The Lipomancer shouted.

"Er, yes?" Fenra said as she managed to tear her eyes away from the treasure.

"Glad to see you like your new home." The Lipomancer chuckled.

"Yes I do, thank you very much!" Fenra replied excitedly, "So... when are you going to make me bigger?"

"If you want to become bigger, you'll have to prove yourself worthy. Your job is to guard this room from adventurers. I'll cast a spell on you that will make you a little bit bigger each time you defeat an adventurer. They can either pledge their loyalty to me and become my slaves or they can die."

"Okay, that sounds fair." Fenra agreed, "But you still haven't explained how I'm going to fatten up adventurers. You mentioned something about tools?"

"Yes and I'm about to give you those tools right now. I have to warn you though, this will hurt, but when you wake up you'll have new knowledge that will allow you to cast basic magic spells. Those spells will allow you to fatten up adventurers." The Lipomancer said as he suddenly spun around and placed one of his hands on Fenra's scale covered head. His hand immediately began to glow with magic.

Fenra felt herself fill with fear as she thought that he was about to inflate her with fat like he did to the adventurers. She didn't have to worry however, because instead of her body filling with fat, her mind began to fill with knowledge. The sudden rush of information into her brain felt like someone had hit her in the head with a brick. It was confusing and trying to understand it gave her a blinding headache. After a few moments of pain, she passed out.

...

Fenra moaned a little as she woke up. Her head throbbed a little in pain, but the pain was fading quickly. She lifted herself up off the floor and looked around. The Lipomancer was gone, he must have left when she was out cold.

Fenra rubbed her large head as the last of the pain faded away. That was when she realized that she could finally understand the knowledge that the Lipomancer had forced into her brain. She now knew how to cast several different weight gain related magic spells. One of the spells would make her fire breath cause weight gain instead of burns. Another spell would summon a small cursed feast, any adventurer who smelled the food would be unable to resist eating it. There were also several other spells that would work well together. For example, one spell would make an adventurer fall asleep and another would summon a large chair with leather straps on it. She could use the two spells together to put an adventurer to sleep then tie him or her to the chair then force feed the adventurer. There were a large number of other spells too so she would be able to get quite creative.

Fenra let an evil smile creep across her face. She would finally be able to get revenge on adventurers for all those times that they had laughed at her and said that she was too weak for them to waste time slaying her. She had a feeling that she was really going to enjoy working for the Lipomancer.

Fenra whiled away the time by rolling around in her pile of treasure. She had tried swimming in it, but that simply proved to be impossible. After an hour of this, she simply sank back into her precious new hoard, adorning herself with the odd bit of jewelry and ruminating on this new upturn in her life. The sheer terror that she had felt earlier when first encountering her new master had transformed into a healthy mixture of fear and respect. Certainly, he seemed to be a ruthless man, but he did offer people a choice, which was more than any adventurer ever offered her. She'd never done anything to earn their ire Maybe devouring the occasional bit of village livestock in the lean seasons, but Fenra had been careful to take only enough to keep her going, never enough to justify the village pulling together to go form an angry mob or put up a reward for her head. She sighed, realizing only now that it never mattered. Wherever some sellsword heard about a dragon, two thoughts came up. 'Fame' and 'Treasure'. She remembered the times where adventurers saw her copper coin and threw down their swords in disgust, or saw how relatively puny Fenra was and simply laughed and turned away. The painful recollections made her seethe with fury.

Suddenly, the loud clanking of metal down the hall registered to Fenra's hearing, and she concealed herself in the treasure, lying in wait. Into the room charged an armored knight with sword and shield. Something about his armor was very much off. Namely, it appeared to be fashioned from whatever metal objects the maker could find. Furthermore, the shield the knight was holding was really more like a barrel lid that had a childish coat of arms painted on it. The sword he was holding was very much real, though, glowing with some sort of intrinsic magic, and despite the quality of the warrior's other possessions, the man himself was absolutely huge, and not in the way she would have expected in this place. He was about seven feet tall and dragging around a kitchen's worth of metal like it was nothing. Additionally, if the dragoness was hearing correctly, there was one other person following this man.

"What ho! This is not the room I seek!", said the ramshackle knight. "Where are you, fair maiden? Sir Bartholomew has come to rescue you!"

It was about ten seconds before the other person came in after the knight, and Fenra knew that the various countermeasures of the fortress weren't broken. Behind him, a female human blundered into the room, huffing and flushed and covered in sweat from the exertion of her pursuit. She was a pretty young thing, but she was dressed more like a servant than an adventurer, wearing clothing that was stylish, but serviceable. They also looked like they were about to tear right off.The castle had taken its toll upon her figure, ballooning it to what seemed about a hundred pounds more than her usual. "They... Hfff... They don't pay me enough to take care of this madman... Sir, there's no maidens here! I told you already!"

"Nonsense, lad! It's an old castle with an evil master! He's surely keeping some kind of princess hostage! And by the blade of my forefathers," he intoned, holding aloft the shining weapon dramatically, "I shall retrieve her, as is my noble obligation!"

"Sir Bartholomew, your family is noble, but it's y'know, desk job noble! They gave up their swords ages ago! Please, let's get OUT of this crazy place and back to the estate! Also, while we're at it, I'm a GIRL."

"Nonsense, Ellis! A bit of hearty exercise will burn away that feminine flab like nothing! Still, what strange traps. Clearly to mock us! I won't"

"Ella! My name is ELLA!" The harried 'squire' finally managed to pick her head up, brushing her short brown hair out of the way. "Should be in an a... sy... lum..."

Ella's tongue fell flat at the sight of the treasure before them. And while Ella boggled and her slightly mad charge searched around the room for non-existent damsels, Fenra tried to figure out exactly what to do. These weren't really adventurers, in the strictest sense of the word... But they were right here, and it wouldn't do to tempt the Lipomancer's wrath.

155332111111111112221111111.content:
Fenra stood in place as she continued to look around the Monster Lounge. She knew that she should just go and introduce herself to the other monsters, but she felt too nervous.

After a minute or so, one of the other monsters in the lounge noticed her and shouted, "Hey everyone! The new dragon is here!"

The other monsters all shouted hello as one monster grabbed her and pulled her towards the others. Fenra smiled at them nervously as she told them all her name. Then they began to introduce themselves to her. In the end there were simply too many names for her to remember. After the introductions were over with, most of the monsters went back to what they were doing before she entered the room. A few of the monsters offered to share a table with her and she agreed.

They led her over to the table and began to make small talk as Fenra looked them over. The other monsters at the table consisted of a female troll named Gurtha, a female minotaur named Silene, and the male orc she had met earlier named Hurgar. All three monster were fat.

"So tell us about yourself, Fenra." Gurtha the troll said, "What was your life like before you came to work for the Lipomancer?"

"I don't know if I want to talk about that." Fenra hesitated but started to talk about it anyway, "I'm such a small dragon because I'm a runt. I was never able to accumulate a horde of treasure."

"You don't need to worry about that." Silene the minotaur snorted, "The Lipomancer only hires down-on-their-luck monsters to work for him. All the monsters here had a hard life before they started to work for the Lipomancer. Take me for example, before I came to work here I had no maze to live in. Minotaurs are supposed to live in mazes and I always felt sad without one."

"I have a similar story." Gurtha the troll said, "Trolls love to live under bridges, but before I came to work here, I didn't have a bridge to live under. Now I get to live under the castle's drawbridge and fatten up clumsy adventurers that fall off of it. We're all loyal to the Lipomancer, because he gave all of us a better life."

The other monsters at the table nodded their heads in agreement. Fenra felt relieved that none of them made fun of her small size. Like her, all of them had a difficult life before they came to work for the Lipomancer.

Fenra still felt curious about something though. She knew it might be rude to ask, but she couldn't restrain herself anymore. She blurted out, "I know that the slaves are all fat because they were adventurers that were fattened up. But why are most of the monsters, like you, also fat?"

Instead of being offended, the other monsters at the table just laugh.

"That's because the food here is so unbelievably tasty." Hurgar chuckles, "The Lipomancer also lets us eat as much as we want."

"But if you're over weight, won't it be more difficult for you to fight off adventurers?" Fenra asked.

"No, unlike the adventurers and the slaves, the Lipomancer has all the monsters enchanted with a spell that prevents our body fat from hindering us." Silene explains, "In fact, being fat somehow makes us stronger. The fatter a monster is, the more powerful they are. So if you want to become very powerful, you're going to have to start eating."

"Why don't we have one of the slaves bring you some food?" Gurtha suggests.

Fenra hesitated. It's always been her dream to become a powerful dragon. But she isn't sure is she wants to get fat. After thinking it over...

Fenra reached a decision. She had done well in taking care of the ragtag duo that came into her room, but she knew that it was only a matter of time until larger parties of more experienced adventurers happened into her lair, and she'd need every edge against them. Besides, wasn't growing wider the same as growing taller? It all made her larger, and besides, if she didn't like it, the growth earned from thwarting sellswords and spellslingers might even the blubber out.

The dragoness nodded determinedly. "Yeah. Bring it on, and keep it comin'!" The resolute reply earned the smiles and hearty cheers from her new companions, who immediately called over for a small cadre of slaves, male and female. Fenra noted the humiliating attire each of them were clothed in; essentially very ornate and inadequate loincloths, a collar around what passed for their necks, and nothing else. Their expressions varied; a few had faces tinged with fear, while less of them had the calculating and desperate glint of scrutiny in their eyes, probably hoping to find some way out of their situation. Most, however, seemed to wear a placid, almost content expression, as though accepting of their situation. One of them hefted a large, well-worn codex above him, and it took Fenra a moment to realize it for what it was.

A menu.

Fenra turned the pages deftly with her claws. Each set of pages was dedicated to a delicious, mouth-watering meal, an almost pornographic description of it on one side and an equally obscene picture of it on the other. The dragoness felt enraptured, almost tasting the food on her tongue as she savored it with her eyes. She flipped and flipped and there seemed to be no end to the variety of foodstuffs available to her. She was nearly paralyzed with choice. Gurtha, Silene, and Hurgar peeked over, trying to discern in their minds what she'd take.

Finally, Fenra seemed have made up her mind.

Fenra couldn't make up her mind on what she wanted to order. Everything on the menu looked delicious and fattening. That was when she realized that she didn't have to just pick one thing. It was probably best if she did eat more than one dish. She was very small for a dragon, but she was still large enough to eat more food than several humans combined. If she was going to fatten herself up to become more powerful, she would have to eat a ridiculous amount of food. She would also have to start a strict diet of gluttony to follow in the days and weeks ahead. But she was getting ahead of herself.

"What the hell, I'll take one of everything." Fenra declared. She blushed when the other monsters cheered again.

"That's the spirit!" Gurtha said with a smile on her trollish face.

"You heard her slave!" Silene bellows at the obese slave that brought Fenra the menu, "Bring her one of everything! While you're at it, bring me one of everything too!"

"Same here!" Gurtha and Hurgar also shout their orders at the slave.

"And make it snappy!" Silene snorts through her bovine nostrils.

"B-but it will take time to make so much food!" The poor slave stuttered fearfully.

"Are you arguing with us slave?!" Hurgar roared at the slave.

Gurtha lightly shoved the chubby slave to the ground and sneered, "Do you want us to use our magic to fatten you up until you pop?"

"Yeah, is that what you want?!" Fenra joined the other monsters in threatening the slave.

After being the punching bag of adventurers her entire life, it felt great to be able to boss around and humiliate these slaves which had all been former adventurers that were fattened up. Judging from the looks of amusement on the faces of the other monsters, they enjoyed it to for the same reasons. Fenra was going to make sure that every adventurer she meets would pay for the humiliation that she had endured. She knew it was evil, but she is an evil monster working for a powerful evil magic user so she couldn't care less. These slaves are nothing more than toys for her and the other monsters.

"I-I'm sorry! It won't happen again!" The slave whimpered, "We'll get your food as fast as we can!"

Fenra and the other monsters laughed as the slave ran off to the kitchen.

"That will teach him." Hurgar chuckled to the hearty approval of the other monsters.

"Hmm, I was wondering about something." Fenra commented after she and the other monsters finally stopped laughing, "You said that all of us monsters are enchanted to become stronger as we get fatter. Couldn't we just use the magic spells that the Lipomancer taught us to fatten ourselves up? Using magic to do it would be 1000 times faster than gaining the weight the natural way."

"No!" Silene, Gurtha, and Hurgar all yelled fearfully.

Slightly startled by their outburst, Fenra asked, "Why not?"

"The enchantment that makes us stronger as we get fatter and it prevents our body fat from hindering our movement at all. But the enchantment only works if the weight is gained naturally. In other words, by eating huge amounts of food." Silene explained, "If a monster gains fat magically, the enchantment won't work and the fat that was added will hinder the monster just like normal fat would. Basically, the monster would become just as weak as these stupid fat slaves."

Silene looked at one of the nearby slaves for emphasis. The unfortunate slave cowered in fear when she saw the Minotaur gaze at her.

"I see, thanks for letting me know." Fenra said.

"No problem." Gurtha replied, "There is something else you should know. You need to be careful to make sure that your own weight gain spells don't backfire on you. The weight gained from any of those spells won't work with the enchantment."

"Yeah," Hurgar nodded, "About a year ago, one of my own spells bounced off of a magician's spellward and hit me. Thankfully, I didn't put much power into the spell so I only gained about 25 pounds, but it was still a pain because the enchantment didn't make me stronger to compensate for the extra weight. I was able to lose those 25 pounds of magically added fat after a few weeks of dieting and exercise."

"I understand. I'll have to be careful with how I cast my weight gain spells then. Thanks again for the information." Fenra said.

After a few more minutes idle conversation, Gurtha growled, "What is taking those slaves so long?"

Fenra practically leaped up from her table. She wasn't going to let these slaves get away with their impudence in delaying her growth! "Let's go find out what's taking them so long. Maybe we can get them to hurry up with a little 'encouragement'.", she snarled. Hurgar clapped her shoulder, grinning. "Looks like you got a real vicious streak in you! I like that. Let's go check in on the useless little scutpuppies."

As the group stomped their way towards the kitchen, they noticed the slaves screaming and the sound of crashing kitchenware. Silene snorted. "I think they know we're coming, the way they're panicking." She kicked open the door and together, all four of the gluttonous monsters loosed a bellowing roar. "Slaaaaaaves! Where's our FOOD?!", they began to cry, but their demanding question died in their throats as they observed the kitchen.

It had been remodeled.

The kitchen was always large, but it had become massive, to the point where the hordes of slaves seemed like fat little mice, scurrying hurriedly while bearing massive platters that took teams of ten slaves to carry, each of them groaning and straining beneath the sheer weight of food. The quartet seemed to shrink into themselves despite their bulk when they sighted the master of the kitchen, a towering metal construct cast in a mold that could have been fashioned after an powerful giant or an ancient god. Clad in the raiment of a chef de cuisine, his face was frozen in an expression of stern judgement.

Upon his chest he wore a nametag roughly the size of Fenra, emblazoned thusly; "HELLO! MY NAME IS LEM."

"KITCHEN STAFF ONLY.", came a painfully loud voice, heavy with resonance like the defiant cry of a titan chained beneath the earth echoing through endless caverns. "PLEASE LEAVE IMMEDIATELY OR BE PUNISHED."

Hurgar whistled. "Well... That's... Uh. New. You think this has anything to do with that giant who got so drunk that he barreled into the kitchen and tried to empty the pantry, and disrupted operations for like two whole days in the process?"

Gurtha closed her eyes to think. "You mean the girl the boss..." she shuddered. "Oh, no, I don't even want to think about it. So terrible."

Fenra just squeaked as her thoughts ran wild. What would she do?

As the food kept pouring out from the kitchen doors in what seemed like an endless supply, Fenra continued to gorge herself on the variety of dishes laid out before her. A stream of servants was easily visible as they came through the door with massive platters in tow, and leaving carrying empty dishes back to the kitchen with nothing but the occasional cleaned bone. "Those dish washers are gonna have a field day." thought Fenra, as she continued to dig into the food with zeal.

Fenra had never been used to this kind of sheer gluttony, only living off of the bare minimum up to this point in her life in her attempt to keep would-be intruders away. However, she enjoyed every second of it as her belly distended with the many morsels that filled her gut. Shortly after, though, her eating began to slow-- she was getting exhausted, with her stomach already stretched out several feet in front of her.

Then, it happened. Fenra's eyes rolled into the back of her head as she fell backwards, landing square on her back with the contents of her stomach sloshing as she hit the floor. The moment she hit the ground, all the monsters in the lounge let out a guttural cheer. "Alas, down she goes!", shouted Hurgar. "Let's get the growing lady some help, shall we?" Then, as if on queue, Gurtha shouted, "SLAVES!" with a loud retort. Within seconds there were four fattened slaves lined up, ready for orders. "I called you all here for one simple job, and that's to make sure this dragon is fed, can I trust you all with this basic task?" The four slaves nodded nervously as they eyed the bloated dragoness lying there. "I said, CAN I TRUST YOU WITH THIS TASK?" almost immediately, their response was an affirmative, "Yes, Ma'am!"

Meanwhile, as Gurtha was "preparing" the slaves for their intimidating challenge, Hurgar strolled up to Fenra and knelt so she could hear him. "So...full..." was all Fenra could muster to say. Hurgar chuckled, "Here, that is never a problem-- in fact, I'm pretty sure you're forgetting you're own new abilities." He was right, the Lipomancer did give her the ability to remove all anguish from overeating, but in her stupor, the spell was just a blur in her foggy mind. "Here." Hurgar reached for the pitcher of the unknown juice. "Drink this." He said, as he lifted her head to meet the lip of the large pitcher.

As Fenra drank the strange purple liquid, she began to feel much better as her stomach began to return to normal, well, normal plus a healthy layer of fat. As her bloated belly shrunk, the rest of her body grew and bulked up. Her whole body was affected as she began to put on pounds of fat. In less than a minute, the juice's effects were finished (or so she though) and had deposited the calories throughout her body, with most of it appearing to settle around her hindquarters and tail. And with that, she got up, stumbling a bit as she got used to her new weight. "There we go, good as new." exclaimed Hurgar.

Just as Fenra got up, Gurtha had finished harassing the slaves enough to "motivate" them to move as fast as their fat little bodies could. It was then that the whole process repeated over again, this time with the help of the slaves. All Fenra needed to do was sit there with her maw agape, and the food just kept on coming...

After hours of binging, Fenra was finally full once again, even more so than last time. It was at this moment that she heartily thanked everyone in the lounge and took her leave, the now wider and heavier Fenra slightly waddling as her belly swayed alongside her thickened limbs. As the labyrinthine hallways pointed her in the right direction back to her new lair, she was startled to find...

There were three of them: two warriors and a ranger, and they were haplessly wandering around the keep's dungeon. Luckily, they were also headed in the direction of her new abode. As they rounded the corner far, far ahead of her, she quickly hastened her pace and took a more direct route so that she might beat them to her lair. Of course, she didn't want to deny them a door to the treasure room, or the encounter with the dragoness that guarded it. She sprinted, following the enchanted signs that guided her along her course.

It was quite surprising to Fenra that she experienced no extra fatigue or required any more effort to move with her new, somewhat weightier frame. Immediately she remembered: none of her new weight would hinder her in any way, as long as magic is not directly involved. With that in mind, she thundered down the hallway. As she ran, it was obvious to her, despite her compensated strength, that she had put on quite a few pounds back in the monster lounge. She could feel her heavy tail crash into the wall behind her as she rounded the next corner with her extra momentum, her claws screeching the cobblestone floor as she tried to maintain traction.

"As I keep getting bigger, I'll have to be a bit more careful." Fenra noted to herself, as she eyed the dent she had put in the hard stone behind her.

Her belly still weighed down from the meal earlier, she nearly tripped over herself multiple times before finally making it back to her lair. Sure enough, once she arrived back at the entrance of her special room, the blank wall began to shimmer and the enchanted door leading to the riches behind once again reappeared. She opened the heavy metal door with ease, and, before stepping inside, she unleashed a loud roar that bounced and echoed across the many corridors around her.

"If they're real adventurers, they won't be able to resist a dragon's horde." Thought Fenra with a smirk as she trudged inside.

She splayed herself out on her mound of treasure, trying to get some well-needed rest after her recent gorging, hoping that her outburst would lure them to her. She delighted at another opportunity to become larger.

Waiting for over an hour, she couldn't stay awake any longer as she digested her meal. It was at least another hour after that that she finally woke, hearing her would-be attackers clamoring at her reinforced door. Getting up, Fenra noticed that much of her belly was was gone, and in place another layer of fat had spread its self throughout her body.

"That potion must last longer than I thought." She pondered.

She could tell they were having some trouble opening the door considering its immense weight, so she took this opportunity to ready herself. Then, slowly, the door opened halfway before she saw the party setup formation in front of her, warriors in front, with the ranger in tow. It was then obvious why it had taken them so long.

"Well hello there." "I see you three were no match for the traps laid before you." She snarled.

Fenra inspected the three adventurers with a toothy grin, they had clearly fallen victim to numerous traps set in place by the Lipomancer. The two warriors, male, had apparently been forced to ditch the armor she had seem them wearing earlier. Their bellies alone sagged to their knees, and the clothes they were still wearing were mostly shredded and at this point-- didn't cover much. It was surprise they were still able to get to her. Still though, they were apparently strong enough to manage despite the fact they must have weighed nearly 500 lbs. The Elven ranger had fared a bit better than her two counterparts by comparison. At around 300 lbs. she must have been top heavy from the get-go, because her breasts (resting on her now large, flabby belly) now reached almost all down to her waist, and stuck out as far as her mammoth ass. In fact, she had been forced to move her quiver to her side, being too fat to reach over her shoulder without difficulty. Fenra kept back a few deep chuckles as she saw the elf's now ruined outfit.

To them, Fenra did not look very imposing, they knew that she, at almost 11 feet long and only 7 feet tall was despite her size, small for a dragon. However, it made them wonder as to how she was able to gain so much weight despite her small frame. She must be pretty good at what she does, they thought, almost in tandom.

After they glared at each other for almost a minute. Fenra knew they weren't in the talking mood. "I know why you three have come, no need to bore me with the details." She said, as she walked off her mountainous pile of treasure.

Her eyes then narrowed to sharp slits as she prepared to make the first move.

Fenra's stomach growled hungrily as it anticipated the rather large meal ahead of her. It groaned loud enough to be easily audible to the three adventurers in front of her, warranting a few steps back from her and her intimidating appetite. Given the nature of the dungeon up to this point they surely must at least have an idea of how their encounter with her would play out. Fenra glared at them, and then took a deep breath. As the two warriors raised their shields, which were now hilariously small compared to their now enormous bodies, Fenra exhaled, letting out a short monologue: "I'm sure fire was the first thing you fools expected, however, I have a different plan for you all." The Elven Archer snapped back immediately, "Do your worst, dragon!". Happy to oblige, Fenra closed her eyes and muttered a few unrecognizable phrases- as she spoke, the air began to swirl with magical energy, converging in the center where it materialized into an enormous banquet.

The intruders looked at Fenra with a confused look, and then at each other, and then Fenra once again. With a smirk on her face, Fenra waved at them with her paw as if to, "hop to it". Fenra then curled herself up on her horde and then drifted off into a nap, seeing the magic of the feast draw in her attackers out of the corner of her eye.

Waking up after just a short while, Fenra craned her thick neck groggily over her shoulder, looking at what she had wrought. The three adventurers were all blimped to the point of nigh immobility, each sharing a look of grimace and despair as they yet still stuffed their faces as fast as their bloated limbs could handle. Muttering a few more inaudible sounds, Fenra suspended the enchantment binding her captives, eager to hear of their choice of whether or not they will serve the Lipomancer. As she trudged over to her prey, a twinge of sadism clicked in her head for just a moment, making her hatch a rather diabolical ultimatum with her response. Standing over them, she boomed:

"I hope you three enjoyed your meal, because it could very well be your last. As powerful as I am I do have a master that I serve eagerly, and now all of your have the opportunity to as well. Here is my ultimatum: you all will be humble slaves preserved in your current forms to serve the various residents of this place, or... perish. There is one catch though, I will only accept one answer from all of you."

The two warrior-knights looked at each other with hardened expressions on their faces, and then at Fenra with bitter anger. They vehemently denied any want to ever exist in their current forms accompanied by harsh curses and nasty swears. Meanwhile the ranger alongside them, apparently a bit more comfortable in her current obese state than the two beside her, shook her head and waved her hands, seemingly willing to serve fully.

Fenra looked at her with a smile and spoke, "It seems your friends have you beat here."

In one motion, she lunged her whole body in their direction, snapping up the first knight as the banquest table fizzled out of existence to her touch. She swallowed him whole, all 700lbs of him- the lump of his body visible in her fat neck as her powerful muscles worked him down to her gut. Before the first victim had completely made it down the length of her throat she had already begun eating the smaller, but still huge elf. Then finally, as the first two of her compatriots settled down into a bulge in her stomach, she devoured the last knight, protesting all the way down as he too joined the wriggling ball nestled between her chubby thighs.

Lumbering back over to her horde pile, she plopped herself down on the castle's treasure as she squished a paw into her belly, feeling both the squishy fat and the tautness of her stomach. Happy about how well that battle had gone to her particular favor, she began to daydream about just how big she would become. She would gain the title of the largest creature to inhabit the Lipomancer's domain and would become his personal favourite, being the guardian of his riches, gaining preferential treatment above her cohorts.

As she concentrated on her thoughts her body began to expand outward as the power of her mind facilitated in the fulfullment of her wish. Her round taut gut began to shrink as she expanded both outwards and upwards, her body filling out a little more as her limbs begin to thicken somewhat. Her flanks widened as well and her tail even stretched out a little bit, gaining thickness and even a bit of length as well, attributing to a more "wyvern-like" appearance. She opened her eyes and marveled at what had just happened, and just as she did the Lipomancer entered through her side door entrance. "What an excellent display- and my have you grown! I watched the whole thing from my scrying stone in my chambers." I urge you to keep up the good work, As I'm sure you've just learned your powers get a little stronger as you continue to grow."

"I do enjoy this power, it's nice to be the one in control of things for once. Thank you master." Fenra replied.

He marveled at the now 14x8x5 Fenra, now beginning to take on a more formidable stature. Before he got too distracted by her now imposing figure he quickly said, "As well as you are doing, I do urge you to occasionally let-go the lone-travelers, but of course not without first having your fun with them. if all those who entered here got either eaten or turned over to servitude, no-one would ever know about this place- just a little something to keep in mind."

And with that he turned and left, waving his hand over his cloaked head as he left through the side-passage door.

It was a luxurious, yet hardy transport, held aloft by four skeletons and directed by a masculine figure in ominous black armor, luminous blank eyes the only thing showing through his spiked helmet. The macabre procession had been in progress for about a few days now, heading away from a rather conspicuous tower of smoke that had formed in the hills behind them.

Suddenly, a voice, smooth like the silk lining of a coffin, called out from the curtained inside of the palanquin. "Mortimer. I grow impatient. Are we nearing my back-up mausoleum?"

The dark knight turned his head 180 degrees to reply. "I'm almost certain that we possibly should be there any second now, Your Paleness.", he said, his deep and powerful voice sounding like an echo in an empty church. He consulted the map his mistress had made of the area.

"...Good. I'm nearly out of food... Dark Gods, I hate these trail rations so much... They taste like cardboard..." The feminine voice would have gone on complaining, but she was interrupted by her lieutenant.

"Er, Your Deadliness? If I may ask a question... What does 'dvW stand for on maps?"

There was a moment of silence, before the inhabitant of the palanquin pulled aside the curtains and revealed herself. She was a white lapine woman, lithe of figure and wearing a slinky black dress with silver jewelry fashioned after bones and skulls. Her ears, pierced with the odd ring, were up stock straight as her nose twitched involuntarily from irritation Two beady red eyes lined with dark eyeshadow glared out at Mortimer.

"You... You... You WITLESS LACKEY! You've been reading the map upside down!' The necromancer's black-nailed slap came swift and terrible, sending Mortimer's head into a dizzying spin that was only halted when he put his hands to the sides of his helmet.

"I'm sorry, Mistress Malicia! I'm not good at reading maps! Please forgive me!"

"Forgive you?! I'd fashion you into a lawnmower if I wasn't so desperate for minions right now! Goddamned adventurers and their prying eyes! They took my treasure, slew my army, and destroyed my crypt! What did I ever do to deserve that?!", she exclaimed, leaving out the myriad crimes she had committed to deserve all of that and more. "And now we can't even go back to find my crappy back-up base because YOU were holding the map upside down! You bumbler! You cretin! Stop the palanquin! I'm tired of running! We're setting up camp! You two, go hunt down some food! You others, go find a suitable campsite! Mortimer, you're staying with me! And if you goof up one more time, I'm revoking your head privileges for a week!"

Mortimer sighed as the other minions scrambled about to their duties before their laziness displeased their almighty creator. "Yes, Your Tenebrousness..."

Malicia, meanwhile, kicked a skeleton off of a small bier and sat her dainty rear upon it, filing her nails. This was what minions were for, after all, and she hated physical labor anyway. In her old mausoleum, if there was a task unfit for her unswervingly loyal undead army, it was left to a group of terrified living servants. In her mind, she would have to conserve all of her strength for the actual raising of the corpses. After a few minutes of grunting and strained maniacal laughter, the lid fell to the ground with a mighty crash, the tremor knocking the lazy lapine off of her ass and onto the floor.

Bringing it under her control would prove tricky, as she preferred to work with the corporeal dead, but it would be quite the feather in her cap. She turned to address the spirit, and found her tongue stilled in her mouth again. But at least she knew why the coffin was so big.

The ghostly figure looked mournfully at the smashed statuary of fruits and meats that adorned her coffin lid, and let out a low moan.

Malicia had also heard of this, the phenomenon of hungry ghosts... When a particularly greedy, gluttonous, or otherwise materially-obsessed person died, they would carry that obsession over into death, seeking eternally to fulfill it in vain. Typically, they would possess living people to use as proxies, attempting to satiate themselves vicariously to no avail.

And Malicia was the only living person in the area. The ghost homed in on her immediately, and the necromancer felt herself engulfed in folds of spectral fat before the figure vanished into her body. She could feel the dead thing's maddening hunger taking her over, the invading mind warring with her own for control of her body. And to better facilitate control, the ghost began to alter the morphic field of Malicia's body to better suit her own.

Leaping desperately across and around the holes that seemed to grow more numerous every moment she had almost reached it. It was in that moment though she felt something grab at her leg, turning around she saw what had grabbed hold: the cat. A wide grin on her face as they both were dragged away into the darkness of the pit.
Shadows swirled through Midea's head, the void of unconsciousness keeping a firm grip upon her for a time. Soon enough however it did finally release
"Uhn... my head." She groaned, reaching to place her hand to her forehead. Opening her eye yielded no difference from when they had been shut. Worriedly she began running her hands along the cold floor she found herself on, searching for her staff. "Come on... come on... there you are!" She exclaimed in triumph when her hand felt a hunk of dead wood. Near instantly a magical orb of pale light formed at the tip, however this did not accommodate for the darkness, nor size of the room she quickly realized. Even with the dull light she could see a wall in any direction, only her own body and the cold stones of the floor directly beneath her escaped the blackness.
"Good, you have a light. We'll need that." A voice broke through Midea's focus on observing her options in the dark chamber. The voice was familiar though, a voice she had heard recently. Indeed it was the voice of the necromancer she had met on the surface earlier.
"W-What do you want?" Midea stammered, looking around in the darkness for the lavishly garbed witch.
"Well firstly to leave this place alive, and that's something I think we both want to do."
"But you forced me down here!" Midea shouted at the room, throwing her hands into the air.
"I saved your life, I guess you didn't realize just what was on the other side of that door, did you?"
"No... why? What was there?"
"A fa- actually, it's probably best that you don't know. So are you going to help me or are we going to starve to death in this room?"
"I don't have much other choice do I?" Midea asked, frowning as she sat on the floor.
"Exactly." The black cat said, even though Midea couldn't see it she knew the sorceress was grinning after saying that. With that the feline stepped into Midea's light. "My name is Faydra, just so you know."
"H-Hi Faydra, I'm Midea." She replied with a soft smie, putting out her hand to offer a handshake.
"Well come on I need your light over here." Faydra said, ignoring the gesture entirely as she walked back into the dark recesses of the room.
With a small frown once again on her face Midea followed the direction her new companion had walked off in. The room proved larger than she had expected, and as she walked her thoughts turned to the necromancer, "She seemed a bit wider... didn't she?" She thought on the cat's appearance, "Maybe it was just her robe, it did look a bit too big for her earlier but..." But with that final thought she had bumped into the cat once again, who was leaned against a wall awaiting the cleric.
"I hope you bumping into me doesn't become a theme... but that doesn't matter, now I can see this." Faydra said, turning to face the wall. "Ah, there's an inscription here..."
"What does it say?" Midea asked, looking at the remainder of the wall. It was painfully ordinary, merely a soulless face of grey stone bricks. The only features to break this pattern was the inscription Faydra had already pressed her face against but aside from that there lay two buttons that jutted out form the wall on either side of where the kitty was stood. One was decorated with the symbol of a crescent moon, the other featured the image of a man carrying a sack.
"It's a riddle... a terrible one." The unholy mage grumbled, "I am a traveller, passed over the greatest roads of all, and seen all the world has offered, yet I have never left my home."

Strewn along the walls spiraling downward toward the base of this tower, entering and exiting from countless black doors that lined the walls below.

Silently Midea strolled down the walkway, her eyes turned skyward to gaze into the elaborate glass work overhead. Faydra, faced with no choice but to follow the woman let out a brief sigh, running her hand along her forehead after the cleric had made the decision to go the way that the cat could as well. Silently they re-entered the darkness that they had left moments ago, the only difference being the location from which they entered it.
The duo cantered down the hall, finding it to be eerily similar to the room they had escaped from, design-wise at the very least. Between the walls, ceiling and floor of the corridor they looked during their walk, searching for anything that would break the unending stream of worked stone halls that had comprised everything they had encountered thus far beyond, and before the tower.
"For how bit this dungeon is you would think it would be populated by... something." Faydra grumbled, slowing her pace before giving a brief yawn.
"Maybe everyone else got through here before us." Midea suggested, who had for a time walked with her staff readied for combat, but now simply used it as a walking stick once more.
"For some reason I doubt that..." Faydra retorted, her thoughts turning to the dense paladin she had gotten much better than she would have preferred before this had begun.
So onward they marched, with their footsteps being the only sound accompanying them. This ended abruptly however when a great wait echoed down the irritatingly long corridor. Upon hearing it Midea let out a gasp, grabbing her acquaintance's hand before sprinting off in hopes of finding the source. After a full minute of dashing the hall still stretched on, the blackness of it keeping the two from seeing anything beyond what lay immediately before them.
"Hey! Slow down a bit... I... I can't breathe." Faydra pleaded between gasps for breath as she was forced to keep pace with the lithe cleric.
"Not until we find who screamed, they need our help." Midea told her unwilling company, not noticing how the necromancer's rob pressed against its own's body as she ran, revealing the shape of a rotund belly, too small to support yet still giving a slight shake and jiggle with every step the feline took. Below that lay somewhat thick thighs that pressed together, competing for dominance over who shall cover more of her groin as she ran. Despite this chubby body however the kitty's face showed no signs of this fat that had lined the remainder of her body... yet.
"I'm... gonna pass out." She choked out, but just then they stopped.
"What in the blue blazes is that?" Midea shouted, readying her staff which glowed soon after with a red, pulsating light. Before her lay what she would have once called a woman, but was now overflowing with layers of pure lard all over her body. The poor grey furred lady had been rendered barely capable of movement to move due to the incredible weight that had been added across her entire frame. The ruins of what were most likely once form fitting leathers were strewn across the floor around her, leaving the woman covered by her surprisingly elastic undergarments, but they too were now forming tears, unable to hold their ever expanding owner. With a belly like a fleshy orb, and numerous rolls and crevices formed by the fat across the wolfess's back, arms, and thighs. The source of this weight, a strange globule of golden gel, wrapped around the once nimble lady's neck forcing itself down her forced jaw. With every pump of its own mass its victim expanded further, however when Midea let out a shriek it tore itself from its fattened prey and immediately landed before the still thin lady, its new goal set.
The slime had already spent the majority of its mass but still it moved with determination, slicking across the floor attempting to get a decent angle from which to strike. It leapt into the air, the red light of Midea's staff shining off of it as it flew, Midea struck it away, or so she thought. It clung to her staff and before she could react properly it had slid its way down the stick, and along her arm making a direct course for her mouth. Forcing its way into the cleric's mouth she was overcome with a flavour not unlike honey, just as quickly as it had entered it had begun forcing itself down her throat into the stomach. Her stomach pooched out, the remainder of her body becoming delicately enhanced with a new thin sheet of adipose.
"Mmmph!" Midea shrieked, shaking her head violently to throw away her sweet attacker but then she saw something: Faydra had shoved her hand into the gooey monster. The feline's hand glowed with a black aura, causing the slimy creature to toss itself away from the cleric. It scampered in various directions, slowly evaporating under whatever magical energy it had been charged with before fading away entirely. Midea moved her hands to her barely expanded midsection, "I'm... I'm fat." She said, eyes wide and jaw agape, she gently poked her new belly that could barely been considered a belly if even that. "Oh gods I'm so fat... my life is over!" She screamed, looking up at her friend.
Faydra simply rolled her eyes, "Oh quit your whining, you're still skinny."
"What the hell do you mean 'skinny!?' I'm a damn whale!"
"I mean the situation isn't nearly as bad as you think it is, or as it could be." Faydra sighed.
"You don't know what it's like! I'm fat! F-A-T!"
"You think you're that fat do you? I'll show you fat." The cat shouted, clearly angry at the woman's despair. In one swift movement she raised her robe, revealing her ultimately doughy body. "Look at it." She demanded, gaining Midea's full attention.
Midea's eyes fixed upon the necromancers body, "I-I guess you're right..." She squeaked out. Putting her hand to her mouth she made a vain attempt to hide a slight blush that had quickly formed as her eyes took in every detail of her portly friend.
"As much as I'd hate to interrupt your moment there could I get a hand standing up?" The wolf they had just accidentally rescued asked, attempting to come to a stand herself before falling back to her plush rump.
"Depends, what's in it for us?" Faydra asked, dropping her robe back down and turning to face the obese canine, bringing a small frown to Midea's face.
"I could help you with... things. I promise I won't be any trouble." The wolf pleaded, still trying to make progress on returning to her feet.
"What do you think?" Faydra asked, looking back to her friend, given that the encounter was the cleric's doing.
"Can I see that again?" Midea dumbly asked, nervously smiling at the cat.
"Well I guess it's up to me then." The feline grumbled, "I guess you can...

The vixen stood with her booted feet planted in the earth, her posture and expression that of poise and cold determination. Slowly, she lifted her arms, her form visibly tensing as she drew back an arrow with her right hand, aiming with her bow in the left with her index finger pointed outward towards her target. Lucille looked perfectly at home as she took aim, with eyes as green as the pine needles around her, the vixen's fur as pale brown bark, with a creamy white front stretching from her cheeks downward. Her cloak billowed around her, exposing her light leather armor; standard bracers, boots, and a fashionable waist cincher to accentuate her femininity beyond what her grey tunic could offer. Beautiful and deadly in one package. With the release of her fingers, her arrow flew like a gust of wind, sailing towards its target.

Her target was an unmoving bulls-eye, some well-packed hay with canvas draped over the front, with three circles drawn in. Lucille's poise sank to a disappointed slump when she saw where her arrow struck. To her credit, the steel head punched through the target and into the tree it was propped against... but it was woefully off target. Not the yellow bulls-eye, or the red circle for nice try, but the blue outer ring, which could mean all the difference in a real battle.

"I don't get it, Rose. I've been practicing all week, and I can't make shots like normal." Lowering her bow and drawing the locks of her hair away from her eyes, the vulpine turned to her friend, the wolfess, who was still going through her motions for Tai Chi, a simple warm-up to the heavy hitting the warrior monk was used to.

"Balance of the body and spirit. You will practice your form all you like, and until you realize the true problem, your archery shall suffer," The wolfess calmly replied, moving through the sweeping motions and calculated, fluid steps of her technique. Rose's fur as as black as the night sky, the same true of her hair; behind her tall ears was a braid that reached down to her tail, while a small fringe framed the left side of her muzzle. Her dress was in sharp contrast with the ranger next to her, distinctly the style of a Far Eastern martial artist rather than a Western warrior. A crimson top with no sleeves, folded one side over another, exposing a small bit of her cleavage. Her pants were deeper red, embroidered with a gold dragon design that stretched from her slipper-clad feet up to the silken black sash around her waist. The wolfess opened her yellow eyes when he finished her exercise, to find the vixen looking none-too-pleased and tapping her foot.

"That's all very beautiful and poetic, but I'm concerned with results, Rose. I'm worried I'm gonna under perform in the next assignment, and I don't want you getting hurt," Lucille crossed her arms, and narrowed her eyes at Rose. "What's wrong with me? You're in tune with this stuff, so what am I doing wrong?" The lupine just smiled, walking to her friend and meeting her eye to eye, reaching for the vulpine's arms and bringing them to her sides.

"Calm yourself, and think of what I've said, Lucille. Body and mind. Which is it that troubles you these days?" The fox rolled her eyes and sighed, but her friend squeezed her arms a little, gathering back her attention.

"What? I don't know what's wrong, that's why I'm asking you!" Rose let her tail wag calmly, while her friend's bushy tail lashed back and forth in frustration.

"It is simple. It is your..."

155332222211211.content:
"It is your body which gives you trouble. You have been gaining weight." The wolfess said bluntly, smiling to her friend who just stood there blushing furiously through her white-furred cheeks.

"You... I should smack you silly, Rose. I have not been gaining weight!" The ranger huffed, attempting to twist her wrists out of the wolfess' grip, but failing, looking away from the black-furred canine with contempt for those words contorting her brow. The monk simply sighed, gently releasing Lucille's wrists to reach further into her cloak, pushing on the leather waist cincher. Gritting her teeth, the vulpine looked back to her friend, her fists balling up. "Rose, I swear to God and heaven above..."

"You know I'm right. Just let me help," Rose looked to the fox with a smile, stepping closer to get at the drawstrings on the fox's back. With a few deft pulls, the wolfess began to loosen the thick, slimming belt, as Lucille stood still, her eyes closing as a sigh escaped from her. The garment was painfully tight around the vulpine's waist, and it quickly became more apparent that she had indeed added a few pounds to her frame. Her belly filled out the leather that she'd squeezed around her midsection, revealing that her tummy had gotten quite doughy, sagging outward three inches, as compared to inward one inch just moments ago. The wolfess quirked a brow; even she thought her friend hadn't packed on that much, but it was well worth seeing Lucy smiling again, even with her little dome of a gut bulging out her loosened waist cincher. "Feeling better, are we?"

"Tons better. I'm sorry, Rose." The vixen dipped her head, only to have her chin caught by the Rose's paw, and her nose licked by a nice, broad wolf tongue. Lucille acked and giggled, turning away from her friend with a big grin. The monk just smiled back, eyes lingering a bit too long on the fox's backside, wondering how much bigger the fox's butt had gotten... damn that cloak!

"You've nothing to feel sorry for. I can bet your aim will be much steadier without the pain of squeezing into that silly thing." Wagging her tail, the lupine padded over to Lucille, who had just pulled her arrow free of the target with a sharp tug, placing the arrow in the quiver on her back and draping her bow over her body, careful not to let the string dig into that ample, fuzzy cleavage her tunic allowed. The vixen turned around with a worried glance at her friend, stepping along the forest's understory, the dried pine needles crunching under her steps.

"It's so weird. I've never had a weight problem before now. I'm not losing my metabolism or anything, right? I mean, I'm only in my twenties." As the vixen walked back towards the path, the wolfess jogged to join her companion's side, her brow furrowing with thought.

"I believe it is tied to our assignment. Every day we draw closer to Greenshire, the fatter your kills are." Rose tapped her chin as she spoke, with Lucille flushing scarlet yet again.

"Birds and boars are fatter cause they're living off the farmland. Makes sense. They're delicious, too, is the problem." The fox giggled as she looked down at her stomach. She filled herself to the brim each night on the way there, while Rose subsisted on various edible plants.

"That is true. The nature of this assignment has troubled me for days. I do not trust our employer. A bounty like the one he promised does not warrant fetching two amateur thieves from the breadbasket of the country." To that, the vulpine rolled her eyes, giving Rose a little nudge.

The vixen looked to the horizon through the trees, then off in the distance to the faint light from Greenshire. It was nearly dusk, time to begin thinking about shelter. "We can rough it for another night and stay outta town. Or we could go to an inn, your call." The vixen nodded to the wolfess, who stepped forth and began to speak.

"To Greenshire. We've been in the wilderness enough," Rose smiled to the vixen, drawing ever closer to the farming community turned boom town. Greenshire had experienced a massive growth in recent years; the fields were vast and fertile, the land for grazing equally so, and the quality of the town's products was so good it nearly took on a brand name even in times of antiquity. What was once scratching and surviving in a dusty little town had grown into a center for agriculture, with merchants and homeowners from all around flocking to make a living. Indeed, it was out of the wilderness, and into the fields, and eventually the stone city walls. The wolfess stopped walking about halfway through a cornfield, watching the sun begin to set, the city's guards beginning to light lanterns to help see in the coming darkness. "I still do not like it, Lucille. This is hardly the ideal place for thieves to hide."

"Maybe that was their angle. Go to the last place someone would expect. I mean, sure, the city's safe, but it's also one of the biggest around. Not to mention there's farms all around out here. They could be hiding anywhere." Lucille frowned, then patted the monk on the back, smiling. "Come on. At the very least let's get a nice warm bed and a good meal. We can settle in and worry about investigation later."

"Oh, looking forward to the good meals now, are you?" Rose mused, watching with girlish glee as Lucille flushed and pulled her robes around her more tightly, concealing her belly. "You know, I can show you a few things about sumo wrestling if you like."

"If I knew you wouldn't be able to dodge it, I would punch you so hard." The vixen growled, right as the pair passed through the gate in the city, the armored guards stationed outside peering at the furred beauties walking past, eyes drawn down to tail level, with grins behind the grills of their helmets. Even at dusk, the wolfess and vixen could see the bustle of the town wrapping up. Clothing merchants, blacksmiths, confectioners, a tavern or two, inns, and not to mention many townsfolk looking quite large as the ranger and monk passed by. The vixen and wolf alike brushed hips with other men and women whose berth had become very wide, apparently not used to their own weight they had to throw around. Leaning to her black-furred friend, the vixen muttered, "See? Not just the pigs are fat around here," Rose giggled, leaning right back in to Lucille's tall ears.

"Oh yes. The vixens dwarf the pigs any day." The vixen growled at Rose, who stuck her tongue out at her friend as they came to Greenshire Inn, a three-level structure with stone foundation and bright, clean lumber for the structure. As they stepped in, they were greeted by a plump dragoness with white scales and a violet dress, waving to them and offering a smile.

"Hello, ladies. Would you happen to be Rose and Lucille?" The monk and ranger stopped for a moment, turning to face each other with brows furrowed. The dragoness took note, raising a finger. "Um, I have been reserving a room for you. Courtesy of your employer. I've kept the matter confidential, but you two matched my description. My name is Gwen... please forgive me for distressing you." The vixen gave a sigh of relief, and the wolfess smiled, bowing her head.

"Thank you, Gwen. We were unaware of this." Stepping to the counter, the two adventurers were given a key from the dragoness, who smiled and dropped the shimmering gold key in the wolfess' black palm. Gwen giggled at the two across the counter, and nodded. "Does any of that interest you?" Lucille and Rose looked at each other. They were both grinning, quite ready to take advantage of the hospitality. It was the vixen who spoke, though, swishing her tail.

"Yes, yes it does! We'd like..."
