... But she most certainly didn't like it. She usually kept a "nocturnal" schedule, but it was very important that she be out and about today; she had to secure a cart to haul away the 5-ton Leonard. As few qualms as she had about "immoral" activity, she still didn't want to steal one; it would be far more difficult for her to procure one at night, and she needed all the time she could get to prepare for her travel that night.

"I hope that smelly lard-pile appreciates what I'm going through to haul his fat ass away..." she said. She knew, of course, that he wouldn't appreciate being hauled away to his probable slaughter. "I bet that fat mutt isn't even thankful for all the effort I'm going to turn him into dragon-food..."

"Pardon me, miss..." a gravelly voice came from behind her.

Voxiche ignored it, until it came closer... And grabbed her shoulder.

"Excuse me, miss..." it said, although a bit sharper this time.

"What!?" she shouted, as she turned around to see...
15533222222112212.title: An Unexpected Visit

choices: Trying to slip through the front door.
Head out the back, it might be safer!
155332222221122121.content:
A male Doberman standing before her, wearing a dark gray leather coat that went down to his ankles and a snarl upon his lips, "What was it you were saying about a 'fat mutt'?"

Voxiche's eyes narrowed as she glared at the man, "I'm so sorry, have we met before, because I don't believe you have ANY reason for eavesdropping!" She spat.

"Oh I have reason madame..." The dog said under his breath as he reached into his coat, his paw coming to rest on the wooden grip of a pistol holstered beneath, "And while I'm not sure how much good this would do, if what they say about your sorcery has any truth to it, I'm sure that you wouldn't want to risk blowing your cover... Voxiche Lecard..."

The bat's ears twitched involuntarily and her skin crawled as she heard her name. She glanced about at the townsfolk walking by them, hoping none had been listening, "I'm sure you're mistaken!" She hissed softly before turning to walk away, "Now, if you will excuse me, I have some things t-"

The dog grabbed her by her coat, this time with both paws, and dragged her into a small shop selling rugs nearby, slamming her against a wall. The owner of the store, a red-headed dwarf woman, seemed rather mortified, "H-Hey there! Jus' what do ya think you're doing with her!"

The Doberman held Voxiche up against the wall as she whimpered, "I need you to alert the town guard right away, this woman is Voxiche Lecard, a criminal and a proven murderer! They will verify my claims and what I am doing here." He looked over at the shopkeeper, only to be met by her slack-jawed expression, "Go! Now!"

Voxiche continued to scowl at the dog pinning her as the dwarf rushed from the building, slamming the front door behind her, "Fine then... It's clear that you are not dumb enough to fall for the innocent routine, but still stupid enough to try and corner me..." The bat whispered before lifting a hand up towards him.

The Doberman was two steps ahead however, drawing his pistol and placing its metal barrel to her chin, "You even think one of your incantations and I'll make sure it'll be the penultimate thing going through that demented mind of yours... Now talk, what have you done to him?"

The bat woman giggled defiantly, wincing once she felt him press the gun harder against her head "Who? You'll have to be more specific mongrel, there are a lot of 'him's I've done terrible things to..."

"Leonard!" The man barked as he pressed the side of his arm painfully against her stomach, "The bounty hunter! Tell me what you've done to him! Tell me where he is!"

Voxiche grunted as she licked her lips, "Oh my! So pushy... Is the mutt your partner? Is that it, the two of you working together to fuck over people like me?" She tilted her head and grinned, flashing her fangs at him, their eyes meeting as she cooed, "Stupid mutt number two! Oh, but there is something else isn't there... I doubt you are brothers..."

The bounty hunter clicked back the hammer on his elaborate firearm, "You tell me now! I won't get nearly as much dead, but I swear if you don't stop screwing with me..."

"Believe me foolish pup, I could have fried you to crisps the moment you touched me... You have no idea how long I've been running from people like you, nor how many there were that have failed before..."

As he was about to retort, the bat pressed her palm flat against the dog, her paw glowing with a pale blue mist as it met his chest. The canine's mouth went agape, then hung open fixed as his eyes glazed over with the same blue tint as the sorceress's spell. As Voxiche pushed him further, the paralyzed man fell, legs locked and paw still clutching his weapon as he slammed to the ground with a thud.

"But killing you wouldn't be fun!" She sneered, walking over to his side and kneeling over him, "You know who I am already... So you probably already guessed what I've done to your friend... hmm?"

The Doberman remained silent, face frozen in the moment he was caught off guard.

"Oh oui monsieur mutt... But that is not what worries you, oh no, no, no! The question troubling your simple little mind is 'How far has she gone?'!" She grinned, leaning in closer to whisper to the helpless bounty hunter, "And the answer is far worse than any you've imagined, I assure you puppy... No, I will not kill you, instead I will show you your 'partner', and then..." She purred, stroking his chin with her nails,"I will do to you everything I've ever done to him... And more... I hope you're hungry my little puppy... "

Voxiche's mind was racing, going from her delicious fantasies of what she'd do with the bounty hunter to more practical thoughts on trying to figure out how to smuggle the stunned Doberman out of the stall. She had decided that it'd be best to try rolling him in one of the rugs and smuggling him out when Voxiche's ears perked. As she listened, she heard the sounds coming closer: The unmistakable stomps of rushing boots and the clank of chain-mail.

"Shit!" She muttered under her breath as she looked to the entrance of the stall, then to the Doberman on the ground, and then towards another exit in the back, "Looks like you caught a break this time dog..." She said as she tried to decide between...
155332222221122121.title: Beware of Dog

choices: Left!
Right!
1553322222211221212.content:
Voxiche listened closely to the sounds of what she was certain were approaching guards as she looked between her two possible escape routes, "Such a shame... I was looking forward to reuniting you and your companion over dinner puppy, but it seems that I simply do not have the time..."

The Doberman bounty hunter remained on the ground, paralyzed by Voxiche's spell as she knelt over him once more. She quickly grabbed the pistol out of his petrified grasp, looking over the ornate weapon before pocketing it, "What a valuable toy you have here bounty hunter... If you can afford something like that...."

The sorceress bat patted her paw over the vest the dog wore under his coat before slipping her fingers into one of its pockets and pulling out a hefty sack of gold, "Ah, there we go!" She grinned, shaking the purse before stowing it as well, "I should probably kill you, but I'd rather they find a living fool when they get here than a dead one... Yes, this is a small price for you to pay after what you've just put me through, but I'm sure we'll meet again... audieu puppy!"

Before she could could stand to leave however, the front door swung open and a young human with sword brandished charged in, wearing a tabard that bore the city's standard over his leather armor. He caught sight of Voxiche, his eyes widening and the confidence in them turning to fear as they met the those of the sorcerer and he blurted, "S-Stop right there cr-HURK!"

The young man slumped to his knees, a scorching hole burning through his armor and charring his flesh of his chest before he fell face-first to the floor. He clutched at the wound, gasping for breath as Voxiche stepped over him towards the door, flames dancing in her hands as she kicked it shut. She grasped the lock and hinges in her burning clutches, melting the metal like butter against the door frame with the heat of her spell.

"That should buy a bit of time..." She muttered, kicking the gurgling guard out of her way as she made sure to draw closed the drapes of the shop's small front windows. Once that was done, she started to head for the back door, pausing only as she heard further commotion outside.

From the sound of it, the rest of the guards were now right outside the shop, a gruff voice shouting from the street, "Criminal! Surrender yourself at once! I have half a dozen men at my disposal Miss Lecard, with more on the way. If you don't give yourself up we WILL use force!"

Voxiche knew she should probably keep quiet, but she couldn't resist, "One of you has already tried! Enough of your threats, all that's left for you to do now is come in and die!"

"You heard her men!" The voice shouted, "No mercy, ATTACK!"

Mixed voices sounded their fury and shouted threats of their own as the front door began to rattle and shake, presumably from the beating of fists and pommels. A part of the vampire bat wanted desperately to make good on what she'd said, but she knew it wouldn't be wise to fight so many at once.

As the bat was about to turn for the door though, her heart nearly stopped as she felt a hand clasp about her ankle. Gasping in fright, she looked down to see the young guard grabbing hold of her. Tears rolled over his cheeks as he struggled to keep a hold on to not only her, but his life, "Please... Please don't..." He wheezed, almost pleading. Voxiche of course assumed he was speaking to her at first, though catching sight of the boy's eyes it was clear he was looking right through her, as though she weren't even there.

She continued to look down at him, her eyes wide with shock as she tried to tug her leg free, "What are you doing you wretch? Let go!"

He looked up at her now, mouth agape and skin pale as snow as the life slowly drained from it. The boy's tabard lay crushed beneath his body, continuing to smolder and burn from where the bat's spell hit him, the flames slowly spreading and licking up his sides, "Father... He has to know... plea-"

Voxiche's face quickly contorted into a snarl, the sorceress letting out a shrill scream as her hands were once more engulfed in flames. Without hesitating, she flung the fire down at the dying guard with one hand and then the other, both of her paws soon casting flame upon the helpless boy's body, only stopping once most of what remained was a charred husk.

For a moment, all Voxiche could do was stand still, gasping for breath as she recovered from the sudden shock, as well as the drain such unchecked use of magic had on her body. The continued pounding upon the shop's door was not enough to pull her out of this daze: It wasn't until one of the guards outside had broken a window with their halberd when the sorceress was pulled her back to her senses. With the guards already breaking down the door, Voxiche pushed what she'd just done to the back of her mind, once more focusing on escape. She pulled her ankle free from what was left of the guard's hand and headed for the back door.

Fortunately for her, the guards hadn't surrounded the building yet, but as the bat girl stepped out into the alley, she knew they'd be arriving soon. Looking around the alleyways, Voxiche decided to take the one to the...
1553322222211221212.title: Escaping the Town Guard

choices: Later that night...
155332222221122122.content:
A red dragon-man garbed in a purple robe. He was 8 feet tall, and of a rather slender build for such a dragonoid. He recoiled as she shouted at him, and she noticed a ring around one of his claws as it hovered in the air for a second.

"Oh! Er... Pardon me, madam. I'd just overheard you muttering something about 'dragon-food,' and became a bit curious. My apologies." He brought the claw with the ring on it to his chin, subtly brandishing the insignia on the ring. The insignia was one of a dragon's head, encircled by forks, knives, and spoons... The mark of the Meal-Wyrms, a crime-syndicate notorious for kidnappings and the trafficking of sentient creatures as food.

Voxiche noted the insignia, and changed her demeanor, accordingly. "No, I'm sorry..." she said, faux-apologetically. "That was rude of me." If she played her cards right, not only would she be spared the trouble of procuring a cart and traveling 19 miles to a rogue dragon settlement, but she might make bank as well.

"Well, er... Anyway, I'm interested in this 'dragon-food' you were speaking of, Miss... Hmmm. I do believe I recognize you..." the dragon said.

"Uh... You- you do..?" Voxiche stuttered; she wasn't quite prepared for that.

"Yes, you're... Vox... Ah! Voxiche Lecard! I recognize you from a poster."

"Oh..."

"Don't worry... I think we understand each other, Miss Lecard. I know you saw my ring, ma'am, and I know you're looking to get rid of 'something.' And trust me, I know what that 'something' is; anyone who's ever read a wanted poster knows what that something is."

Voxiche was still a bit uncomfortable with where the situation was headed; while she was sure it wasn't going to end in disaster like she'd thought... She still didn't like the idea of somebody knowing who she was.

"Al-alright, sir-"

"Please, call me Uroer."

"Alright, Uroer... Would you kindly follow me to the merchandise?"

"Gladly, Miss Lecard."

Voxiche led Uroer to her abode, and opened the door.

"After you, sir."

"Why, thank you."

Uroer ducked down a bit, and entered through the door, followed by the bat, and was assailed by a powerful stench.

"Oh! Oh, my... Is it dead?"

"No... He's alive; he's just a bit gassy."

"Hmm."

"So, uh... Would you follow me downstairs?"

"Yes, ma'am."

The stairs creaked as the pair made their way to the cellar. As they approached the bottom, Uroer's jaw dropped as he saw the "merchandise."

"I've got a German Shepherd that I'd like to sell to you," Voxiche said.

"I... I see that. Can you tell me about... It?"

"He's a bounty hunter that was hunting me; he failed, obviously... So, he became my next victim. I've been feeding him over the past two days..."

"You did this over a matter of days!?" Uroer exclaimed.

"Yes, I did."

"Astounding!"

"Well, anyway, while I was feeding on him, I got a bit 'over-zealous' and took a bit more blood than I should have. He went unconscious- But still alive!- and I decided I was bored with him. I'd like to get a new project, but first I need to get rid of him..."

Voxiche glanced over at the dragon, who was dumbstruck by what he was hearing and seeing. She smirked.

"Er... So, he's got no blood in him?"

"Not much, anyway."

"And... How much does he weigh?"

"I'm not sure, but I figure he weighs somewhere around 11,000 pounds."

"I... I don't think we've ever purchased anything that heavy."

Uroer approached the comatose German Shepherd. "May I... 'Inspect' him?"

"Knock yourself out."

Voxiche watched as the dragon proceeded to poke and prod the dog from various angles. First, Uroer placed his claws on Leonard's enormous belly, kneading it and hefting it. He then slapped the dog's belly to watch it jiggle.

"Ah, yes. Excellent."

He walked around the dog until he came to his fleshy backside.

"There... There seems to be... A vase... Here."

Leonard farted tremendously at that moment, but was muffled by the ceramic wedged in his ass. His body began jiggling and wobbling like gelatin, which seemed to impress Uroer.

"That would be why."

"Ah. It seems... 'Deep.'" Uroer placed a claw on the dog's left buttock, and squeezed. "Soft. Meaty..." He leaned over and opened his mouth, as if to take a bite out of the dog... And stopped, once he caught himself.

Uroer straightened his back, and looked into Voxiche's eyes. "I think you have a sale, Miss Lecard."

Voxiche smiled. "Please, call me Voxiche." Uroer extended his claw, and Voxiche shook it.

"Of course, Voxiche. I'll be back sometime tonight with a few others to bring this leviathin back to the headquarters. You'll follow us there, and we'll discuss payment after we weigh him."

"Sounds like a plan, Uroer."

"Let us keep in touch, Voxiche... I'm sure that the Meal-Wyrms would love to partake of your future handiwork." Uroer grinned.

"That would be wonderful." This was perfect; not only had Voxiche (almost) made a sale and got rid of the smelly mutt, but she'd also made connections with a group that would make her future exploits much easier... "So... What time, exactly, do you have in mind?"

"Midnight would probably be best for all parties involved. I'll see you then." Uroer made his way back up the stairs without Voxiche; she waited until she heard her front door slam before she gave into a fit of girlish giggling.

"Yes! Yes! Hahahahaahahahahaha! Yes!" She danced about, laughing all the while.

"I'll be rid of you, you mangy mongrel, and I hardly had to do a thing!"

She sighed. "Goodbye, Piggy. I'm sure you'll make a fine roast..." Voxiche patted Leonard's belly before she headed back upstairs to remove her robe and adjourn to her bedroom. Before tonight came, she figured she should get a little bit of shut-eye. She sprawled out on her squirrel-fur bedspread and fell asleep, smiling.
155332222221122122.title: Making a Sale...  And Making Connections

choices: Continue towards the hideout, this deal is too good to blow...
Take the Meal-Wyrms on, Uroer would be the perfect project!
1553322222211221221.content:
A stone lay before her, lying atop a blanket to make the target that much easier to focus on.

"Now just remember what I told you to do, and give it your best shot."

She pointed towards the rock, her finger trembling slightly as she tried to recall the word, "Divumnarus..."

Nothing seemed to happen at first, but then the stone trembled, and then lifted slowly towards the sky. It stood there hovering about a foot above the ground for a second before dropping, gravity reclaiming it to the earth.

"Well done my dear! I knew you had promise, I'm sure you won't even need the words soon enough..." The man said as he ruffled her hair with his paw, causing her to smile and look up at him.

She saw him, the bat with a trim goatee and neat but long hair, smiling back at her warmly and with pride.



Voxiche sat up straight in her bed, looking about the dark room as she gasped and panted. She knew it was only a dream, but she still clutched the squirrel-fur to her chest tightly, an odd attempt at calming her nerves. She simply sat there for a while before noticing how dark it had gotten.

"I must have overslept..." She said to nobody in particular before sliding off of the bed and strolling over to her wardrobe.

She pulled out a dark, crimson dress and held it up to her body, attempting to determine if it was suitable. She wanted to appear at least a little bit classy tonight, she was, after all, attending a business meeting of sorts. Yet as she examined the silk dress she realized that it was a bit small.

"Damn! I almost forgot..." She said as she held a paw to her somewhat sagging belly. It had been quite a while since she had fed on Leonard, but his blood was still enough to put some weight on her. She frowned as she felt her softer form, then closed her eyes, a cold, green light emanating from her hand. As she moved it across her body her size began to decrease, fat seemingly shrinking away until she was just as svelte as before.

"Much better," She sighed before changing into her dress.

She hadn't even made her way to the basement before she heard a rapping knock upon the front door. She made her way to it, cracking it open slightly to see Uroer as well as three other dragonoids waiting outside.

She opened the door fully and motioned for them to come inside, which they did swiftly and silently.

"You brought a way to move him, I assume?" Voxiche' asked as she led the reptiles down the creaking steps.

"Yes..." Said Uroer, "We have a cart waiting just outside."

"I meant up the steps."

They gathered around the German Shepherd, the other dragonmen looking him over in awe, a couple even poking and prodding Leonard as Uroer had. One of them was even drooling quite visibly.

"Er... yes, these men are mages, you see, and I believe that together, they should be able to move the dog man... should..." He looked over at the dragon mages as they appreciated the meaty mutt.

"...Alright then, I will wait for you outside if you think you can handle it, good luck!" She said, grinning as she made her way up the stairs.

As she waited by the cart, her cloak once more draped about her shoulders, the bat hummed to herself while picking at her nails. She could have easily helped the mages, yes, but why do all the work when they could for her? Besides, once they had managed to actually move the five ton mongrel up the stairs, through the doorways, and into the cart, they could be happy that they had accomplished something with their inferior magic, and who was she to take that purpose from them?

Her attention was soon drawn to the front door of her temporary abode as it swung open, a mass of furry lard filling its frame. She could make out muffled yells and hissed curses as the flabby dog was slowly forced through the threshold of the doorway until he had finally cleared it, his fleshy body wobbling as soon as it was free of its confines.

Leonard floated through the air like a grotesque parody of the moon in the sky, followed quickly by the three dragon wizards, all of them holding their trembling claws in the air as they struggled to hold the mutt aloft with their magic. Slowly and shakily they maneuvered him towards the cart until he was straight above it, releasing him from their spells and allowing him to unceremoniously fall into the wagon. Leonard wobbled more as he hit the cart, causing the ground to shake from the force of the impact, much to Voxiche's and Uroer's annoyance.

"You morons! You could have woken the entire block!" He hissed at them in quiet rage.

"You know very well none of us had moved something so big Uroer!" One of them panted in return.

Uroer muttered something under his breath before bringing a large, brown sheet over the cart, covering Leonard from view.

"We need to return to the base before anybody comes to investigate... get a move on!" He ordered.

They all began to make their way down the street, Voxiche following right beside Uroer.

"Do they all act with such insolence?" She asked, adding a slight mocking tone to her voice.

"Just... the mages sometimes... They get out of line... think their sorcery gives them superiority sometimes..."

"Mmm... then why don't they mutiny if they don't like to be bossed around?" She looked over the dragonoid's body once more, again noting how skinny, how scrawny he looked, "No offense, but you are quite small for your species..."

Uroer's lip quivered, his teeth showing as he started to growl but just managed to stop himself before he did so, "I may not be... as powerful as them in the arts of magic, nor as strong as some of the others I command... but I am certainly more intelligent, more strategic, more tactful... That is why our leader chose me to act as liaison and informant for our chapter here."

"You are not the leader then..?" The bat inquired, bringing her paw to her chin.

"No... you may understand more fully once we reach the hideout..."

Voxiche remained silent as they continued their journey. Her mind kept returning to the dragonoid beside her. She couldn't stop thinking about how odd his body was, much too small for his kind, even the mages had more muscle. She started to lose herself in one of her fantasies, imagining him as her next project, imagining how grateful he would be for not being such a scrawny whelp once he had some meat on his bones...

She also couldn't help but notice that they were now passing through one of the quieter alleyways of the city. Nobody would be able to see if she decided to take Uroer as her own, and she was quite confident that if the pathetic wizards that accompanied them now could hardly move Leonard, then surely she could handle them all in a fight.

Sure it would ruin a very beneficial alliance, but you didn't get to see dragonmen every day...
1553322222211221221.title: Ladies First, Fatty Dogs Second

choices: Through the second doorway...
15533222222112212211.content:
... But it would ruin a very beneficial alliance, one she'd been wanting since she began taking on her "projects" and had to get rid of the first one. She would not give in to this impulse to sever this connection before it was even made, no matter how wonderful a specimen Uroer would be... No! This was far too important to blow. Voxiche swallowed hard.

"Is something the matter, Voxiche?" Uroer asked, as he eyed the vampire bat, whose "drift" into Fantasy Land had not gone unnoticed.

"Uh... No, nothing's the matter. I just had a little something in my throat..." Voxiche answered, quite aware that her excuse wasn't being bought by the slim dragonoid staring her down.

"Are you sure?" Uroer asked rather pointedly; he still seemed a bit steamed that Voxiche had commented on his size.

"I... I suppose I'm just a little bit nervous about this whole affair. I'm just afraid I'll offend somebody; I want this to work, and I certainly don't want to make any enemies..." Voxiche said, managing to sound somewhat sincere; she was, at least, being half-truthful. She'd been a bit shaken since the dream she'd woken up from, and was in a bit of a different state of mind, different from her usual cold, collected wit and manipulations. She was able to hold her composure, for the most part, but it was still nagging at her, and opening up many feelings she rarely had.

"And I'm sorry that I commented on your size... I see that it hurt you, and I'm very sorry..." she said, as saccharine as she could manage, all while tilting her head forward and giving Uroer the "puppy-dog" eyes, batting her eyelashes as she did so. This was classic Voxiche: She didn't mean what she said, but she certainly sounded like it to all but the most jaded and skeptical.

Uroer softened a bit, looking a bit embarrassed. He stuttered as he tried to find the words that would help him save face as a "big," tough dragon.

"Er... I-I'm sorry if I seemed to be offended..." he said. "I wasn't, really. Really. I was merely exhaling, earlier. It was by no means a stifled growl... Nothing of the sort..." Voxiche wondered how this dragon could have attained a position such as his when he was such a terrible liar. Or perhaps he was just nervous, himself...

"I believe you..."

"In... In any case, I don't think you have much to worry about. The Meal-Wyrms are always looking for new 'business opportunities' such as the one you have to offer. You should be fine, short of trying to assassinate our leader... Or raising a hand against any of our operatives..."

"Right..." The bat winced a bit, albeit very subtly; she wondered how much insight Uroer had into her mind. Perhaps this is why he had the position he had...

"So, nothing to worry about... Ah, we're here." The procession stopped at an iron gate outside of a seemingly-abandoned manor; of course, in a town like this, just about every building looked abandoned. The manor sat at the top of a small hill, in the middle of its estate, which itself looked unkempt. Overgrown grass, nearly a foot and a half long, covered nearly everything, and everything else was covered in scraggly brush and various shrubs. "Home, sweet home... You know, the plants make marvelous cover for the entrances of burrows and the like..." Uroer reached into his coat pocket and pulled out a key, which he promptly slid into the lock. He turned it sideways and was rewarded with a faint *click*, indicating he'd been successful. He pushed the gate open with surprising silence. "Ladies first."

"Why, thank you." Voxiche, indeed, did go first, followed by the three mages pulling the cart, with Uroer bringing up the rear, closing the gate behind them.

"I'll let them lead the way..." They headed halfway up a cobblestone path before veering off to the right, winding their way around the hill... And coming to the back, where they were met by a rather large door, ten feet tall and 8 feet wide, beneath an obscuring archway. "Allow me." Uroer stepped forward, and knocked on the door. "We're here."

"Who's 'we?'" a rather gruff voice growled from behind the door. "I don't know a 'we.'"

Uroer sighed. "It's Uroer, you dolt! We come here with fresh meat..."

"Well, why didn't you say so? Really, that's all you had to say..." the voice lightened up a bit. "Might have been a bit nicer, though."

"OPEN THE DAMN DOOR."

The door opened slowly, revealing a 10-foot-tall blue dragon in traditional "guard" armor. He stepped to the side.

"There we go..." Uroer said, regaining his composure. "Thank you, Iroux."

"... Don't mention it..." Iroux muttered. "Though I do have to say, that's a pretty nice haul you've got there."

"It is, it is... And we have Miss Lecard to thank." Uroer gestured at the bat, who blushed a bit.

Iroux bowed, shallowly. "Thank you, Miss Lecard."

Uroer sighed. "Let's head onward. We need to weigh the beast, and arrange payment..."

They came upon another door, nearly as wide as the previous but only 7 feet tall...
15533222222112212211.title: Journey to the Meal-Wyrm's Hideout

choices: "I'll get you your money, and you can be on your way.  Keep in touch."
"Wouldn't you like to stay a while?  Meet some people, take a tour..?"
155332222221122122111.content:
This one was pushed open rather easily, and the cart was wheeled through to a large chamber housing a rather large scale in the center, one that seemed mostly suited to livestock. "This, of course, is where we weigh our... 'Goods,'" Uroer stated. "The heaviest we usually get is something around 500 pounds; a ton, at most... I'm not sure how well it can handle a supposed five-ton fur, but... Well, we'll just see."

Uroer pulled the sheet from the cart, no longer having to hide its cargo, revealing the same unconscious Leonard that had been plopped into the cart earlier, his expansive body seeping over the sides of the cart like a loaf of bread that had risen out of its pan. The dragon snapped his fingers. "Mages! Levitate!"

The mages did as they were told, lifting the blubbery German Shepherd with nearly as much difficulty as they had earlier, only made easier by the fact that they did not have to wedge the larded brown beast through a 3-foot-wide doorway. After a couple minutes of struggle, they plopped the dog onto the curved metal plate atop the scale, just as violently as they had with the cart. Uroer shot them all a very dirty look; despite the fact that there was no longer the danger of attracting unwanted attention, the scale was a rather expensive instrument that needed to be handled carefully. The mages just shrugged, with the most brash among them shouting, "Just weigh the damn thing!"

Uroer ignored them, instead focusing on calibrating the scale. After some tinkering, he stepped back to allow the scale to do its thing. With much creaking, indicated that it was definitely not used to this much weight, the numbers on its display rolled into place with rapid speed, revealing that the mutt was-

"Wait! I forgot to take the vase out. My apologies, everyone," Uroer said. He walked around the scale to the dog's meaty rear-end and gripped the opening of the white ceramic vase, pulling until it popped free- a very audible pop; it was apparently a rather tight fit- and was promptly rewarded with one of Leonard's tremendous bouts of gas. "Filthy beast!" Uroer cried. "Ahem... So, would you like this back?" Uroer held the disturbingly warm vase out to Voxiche, who politely received it, wincing as it entered her palms. "We can have it cleaned for you..." Uroer offered.

"That sounds... Good..." Voxiche gingerly placed the large ceramic vase on the floor beside her, holding her hands aloft as she refused to let them come back to rest on her sides, as her mouth hung open in disgust.

"Er... I'll have somebody bring you a washbasin..."

A couple hand-washings later, Voxiche was once again calm; the deviant bat had even come out of the experience thinking of a way to adapt the vase into an instrument for boiling tea... Using the body heat of future projects, the same way she'd "used" it on Leonard.

"So! What does the scale say?" Uroer queried. The vase weighed relatively little, and had changed the reading by only a pound or so, but it still had to go if an accurate reading was to be had; as decadent as the Meal-Wyrms could be in their "excursions," they still would try to save money where they could, even if it was only a couple gold.

"Hmmm... The scale seems to say... 11,345 pounds! Quite a bit of meat on the mutt." Uroer turned around. "Now, the matter of payment..."

Voxiche's ears perked at the beautiful word, "payment." This is the moment she'd been waiting for: The finalization of this deal, where she could rid herself of the mangy lard-pile and earn quite a bit at the same time. "Yes, payment."

"Does... 11 gold pieces a pound sound fair?"

"Could you make it 20?"

"Yes, yes, make it a nice, round number... That'd be... 226,900 gold pieces. A bit more than we'd have wanted to spend," Uroer grimaced, "... It's still a fair price to pay for such exotic goods of such... Quality."

Voxiche's eyes twinkled wildly. She didn't actually think they'd have given it to her that easily! She'd be set for quite a while... And if all of her projects were disposed of this way, she'd be able to buy... Just about anything she'd ever wanted... Especially one of those "Pocket Realm" crystals she'd wanted so badly...

"It's a pleasure doing business with you, Voxiche."

"Likewise, Uroer."

"Now, to 'prepare' the beast..."

"Shall I go fetch a roasting pan?" inquired one of the mages, eagerly.

"No, you dolt! This creature wouldn't fit in any of our ovens!" Uroer reached into his pocket and pulled out a knife. "It'll have to be slaughtered. We can roast it bit by bit."

Uroer sighed. "... Yes, I know you're disappointed; I am a bit, too. But, we cannot help it. We'll have to get much larger ovens if we're expecting even larger meals... But this one can't be roasted with the ones we have." Uroer plunged the knife into Leonard's doughy gut, tearing across it like he was opening a sack of flour. He drew a bit of blood, but not much. He cut a bit further, and held the gash open, revealing the mountains of yellow adipose that the German Shepherd's enormous brown belly hid. Uroer dipped his claw inside, and coated his finger with a bit of the dog's grease, inviting the rest to do the same. They stood around the unconscious-but-still-alive dog's body, licking their fingers; Voxiche herself couldn't help but wince.

"Delicious. Well... Let us save the rest for the appropriate personnel to handle, shall we?" Uroer left the knife stuck in Leonard's gut, standing, as he instructed the mages to put the dog back in the cart. They obliged, this time quite readily, their attitudes softened with the very real prospects of what could be the largest meal they'd ever had. They wheeled the condemned mutt into another room, beyond another door, where the bat could spot a rather large, low marble slab, covered in a number of red stains, surrounded by a few burly, hungry-looking dragonoids wielding knives and cleavers. 'Well... This is what the mutt gets for hunting Voxiche Lecard...' she thought to herself, suppressing a small pang of guilt.

"So..."
155332222221122122111.title: Finalizing the Sale

choices: "The food in the kitchen looks good...  And I know you must be hungry..."
"I don't 'do' solid food...  I'll take my meal in the Feeding Chamber."
1553322222211221221112.content:
"Wouldn't you like to stay a while? Meet some people, take a tour..?" Uroer asked.

"What..?" Voxiche replied, still a bit dazed by the prospect of the dog being torn apart. It wasn't that she'd minded if the dog died, no; she's never had too much concern for the ultimate fate of her projects. She really couldn't place why, exactly, it felt so wrong to let somebody else slaughter her "Piggy," especially when she'd considered slaughtering him herself to be a rather undesirable choice... Was that it? "Someone else?" That was it; it broke the intimacy of the process. ... Of course, she knew full-well that this happened to the "projects" she sold most of the time (there was one dragon, non-humanoid, who wanted a fat little vixen Voxiche was selling... as a pet), and when she decided she was done with a project, she didn't care if it died, or even how. It's just that, all of those other times, it felt more "on her terms." ... Bah. Next time, she just wouldn't watch them shove a knife in what she sold them... Or listen to it scream.

Voxiche was brought back to reality by Uroer. "... Voxiche?"

"Hmm?"

"Something wrong?"

"No... Just a little... Tired, is all. ... Maybe a bit hungry, too, but I don't think you can do much about that..."

"Nonsense! I hereby cordially invite you to dine with the Meal-Wyrms tonight!" Uroer realized the folly of his invitation; but rather than take it back, which would have been rude, he merely amended it. "... Or we could swing by the Fattening Chambers, where you can pick something to 'feed' on."

At least Uroer was trying.

"Very well, Uroer. I'll stick around for a tour..."

"Excellent! Follow me..."

He took her through the Slaughter Chamber; Voxiche was none too thrilled with this, though, as they were still dismembering her old project. She even saw one of dragons carrying one of Leonard's legs, buttock and all, away from the rest of him, and disappear down a staircase. Uroer followed the dragon down the stairs to show the vampire bat the Curing and Preservation Chambers, where she got to see the various shanks of anthropomorphic animals hanging from the ceiling, being joined by the half-ton shank of her latest project. She did have to admit to feeling a sense of pride, though; seeing all of the other shanks, dwarfed by the shank of the mammoth Leonard... It was like owning the prize-winning pig at the fair. She was surprised to see, though, that the other shank would not be joining it. What did join it, though, were eight 60-gallon barrels of his lard, a pile of fatty steaks, and various other cuts of meat, all in enormous proportion to what would be the "regular" proportion.

He then took her up the stairs, back through the Slaughter Chamber, where they were still working on the mutt; his other shank was missing, but there was still plenty left of the dog. They also brought in an obese raccoon girl, over 800 pounds... She wasn't unconscious, though. Uroer and Voxiche made their way over to the Kitchens, where Voxiche learned where the other shank had gone to: It was being prepared for dinner. It smelled nice enough, though. They also saw a few fat vixens, all being prepared in various ways. One was being prepared to be roasted whole, kneeling in a pan with an apple in her mouth and her flabby belly sweeping the sides, cringing while a dragonoid chef stuffed whole cloves of garlic up her ample ass. Another, considerably heavier one was lying on her back, being filled with some sort of creme through her backside, to the point where her stomach was visibly distended ("I believe this is 'dessert,'" Uroer explains) and being drizzle with chocolate sauce. Still another was simply being crammed into a larger skunk, which was also being stuffed into a pig ("Ah, Piskunxen; a classic."). There were also a few cuts of meat from other species, but Voxiche couldn't identify them.

She was introduced to much of the cooking crew; she didn't remember any of their names, though, as they were all fairly unmemorable. She met the various "scorers," the only one of which she remembered was Iroux, simply by the virtue of having been the first "other" dragon she met, not counting the mages who, as far as she was concerned, did not have names. She did take care to remember their leader's name, though: Aytrien, a big silver dragonoid, nearly 16 feet tall and 3 tons of muscle and fat. She wondered how he managed to make his way around the hideout, though, what with his height. He looked like he enjoyed his food and was an agreeable-enough fellow, besides running one of the largest and most heinous crime rings in the region... Voxiche didn't mind, though, being that she herself was a wanted criminal.

As soon as everything else worth doing was done, Uroer and Voxiche adjourned to the foyer, where Voxiche was to make her "mealtime decision"...
1553322222211221221112.title: Making Friends With Benefits

15533222222112212211122.content:
Uroer reached into his pocket, pulling out a silk bag brimming with coins of the highest value, gripping it firmly in his gnarled reptilian fingers as he handed it to Voxiche, “Aytrien has approved your payment already Madame, but we do hope that you could perhaps stay for dinner…? We would love to work out future arrangements with you after all.”

Voxiche grinned as she snatched the purse from the dragonoid a bit too quickly, her eyes glinting with delight as she nodded at his words, “I think that would be wonderful Uroer…” She hefted the bag in her paw, estimating it’s weight habitually.

“Just follow me to the dining room then…” Uroer chuckled, turning to leave the room.

The bat’s eyes were drawn from her payment suddenly as she looked towards the dragonman, “Actually… I wasn’t intending to dine with you all…” She suppressed a shudder, feeling another pang of regret and disgust as she thought of Leonard before that too was shoved out of her mind, “In fact… I would much rather have a drink instead… feed in my own way, if you would allow.”

Uroer turned, mouth agape in a bit of confusion before he realized that she wasn’t talking about simply having a glass of wine or a sip of tea, “Ah… yes… I did offer, after all…” He said, licking at his sharp teeth with his long tongue before nodding his head, “I believe that we have a meal… a guest or two about here that you could… feed on. Ones we wouldn’t mind if they lost some… juice.”

He cleared his throat as he pulled his cloak about him and began to walk back the other way, “I will take you back to the feeding chambers then Lady Lecard, we can discuss business there while you have your drink, yes?”

“That sounds wonderful Uroer,” the sorceress said, trying hard not to drool as her thirst for blood was beginning to rise once again.



The Fattening Chambers were down a large hallway that branched away from the meal preparation rooms. Voxiche was still feeling unusually emotional about the fate of her last victim, so she tried to look away as they passed tables where the last of Leonard was being prepared either for dinner or for storage. When the two finally found their way to the end of the long tunnel, Voxiche could see why it was so wide.

While the Meal-Wyrms’ compound so far had many well furnished, even some elaborately decorated rooms within it, the Feeding Rooms seemed more like a dungeon. The tunnel ended in a rather large square room that was at the center of three more large hallways. The floor was covered messily in straw, and along the walls of the square room were many wooden doors, the bottom halves of which were solid while the top halves were comprised of wooden slats, much like the doors in a stable. And then there was the horrible stench that filled the stale air of the room which, along with the considerable distance at which each door was spaced apart from one another, indicated that this indeed was where the Meal-Wyrms kept their “piggies”.

Voxiche stopped at the entrance to the room, gaping as she looked around the large chamber. Normally she might have covered her nose at the stink, but her hunger had been growing considerably on the way here and so the smell indicating that her prey was her instead excited her. She panted lightly as she considered what was contained within these halls: Each cell held an obese victim from which to feed upon, from which to draw delicious fatty blood. She almost felt like a child in a treat shop.

Uroer grinned, his smile unintentionally unsettling as it displayed his rows of sharp teeth, “I see it is… a bit overwhelming, isn’t it…? There are many here you could drink from and they’d probably not even feel it… they are…” He held his hands out to his sides to indicate girth, “That fat…”

“Uh huh…” Voxiche nodded, not entirely there as she thought about all the blood that could be hers. Her painful thoughts about Leonard, her odd emotional flares she had been experiencing recently felt nonexistent as her mind was overcome with hunger, “There are so many here…” She said, unable to keep herself from drooling a little, “How do I decide…?”

The dragonoid chuckled as he looked from the bat at his side to the cells and hallways in front of them, “Well… would you prefer something light… you could say? Or do you want to drink from some of our… heavier… selections?”

Regaining her composure after embarrassing herself in a state of gluttonous euphoria, Voxiche wiped the drool still fresh from her mouth, looked toward the Meal-Wyrms member and answered, "*ahem* Well, um...yes, that would be most pleasuring, Uroer. Bring me the fattest fur you have to spare!"

******

Unlike the Feeding Rooms, the Feasting Chambers were designed to be more like something one would find within a lavished and richly decorated palace, as the vast room was littered with large silk pillows, lavishly rich colored rugs and transparent curtains of various different colors, along with a large and comfy double Queen-Sized bed, made for someone who was consisted of 2 and a half tons of obesity.

But what caught the blood-sucking sorceress's eyes was the 3 ton mound of obese fat that was once a female rabbit. Every single part of the rabbit's body was coated in pure, unadulterated body fat. However, the most concentrated areas were the rabbit's belly, butt, legs, waist, hips, breasts, and arms, as all of that excessive fat rendered the exhausted bunny girl completely and utterly immobile.

As the massively obese rabbit slept from exhaustion, Voxiche couldn't help but drool at how much juicy fatty blood could be inside the massive mound of lard before her, as Uroer noticed Ms. Lecard drooling once more, as he gained her attention once more and said, "The huge obese rabbit before you was once one of the Sultan of Ikzia's own belly-dancers. The Sultan is still one of the Meal-Wyrms' best clients, due to his unique...fetish. Usually Voxiche was able to put up a reasonable facade to those around her, playing every bit the role of aristocrat she fancied herself as. Here however, hidden away from society and amongst those of similar tastes, she wasn't afraid to let herself slip a little. Still though, she should probably be polite to her new "friends", especially if she hoped to foster a useful relationship with them. As such, as soon Uroer was finished speaking, she once more had to wipe her lips and struggled to piece together what little she heard of his pattering, "Yes yes! This is very fine indeed my dear Uroer... It will be a nice change of pace to savor a meal who has at least a little dignity..." She grinned as she sauntered over to the rabbit girl.

         Uroer watched the sorceress as she climbed upon the bed, causing it to creak under the added weight of the slim bat girl, "Oooh, she doesn't even stink! In fact..." She murred, leaning in close to the sleeping bunny's belly, gripping its belly in her paws, and sticking her nose against her fur to take a good, long whiff, "Is this... lavender? Soooo wonderful! You masked her filthy hog-scent just for moi.~ I am flattered Uroer..."

         "Indeed yes, Madame Lecard..." Uroer replied, smiling and flicking his tongue as he bowed before his guest, "The Meal-Wyrms always live to treat their... associates with the, ers... utmost satisfactions. She has been rubbed with some of our stronger oil and perfume in order to make your dinner... and the hospitality of your hosts... memorable and supremely enjoyable."

         A female dragonoid with sapphire scales emerged from the other side of the bunny girl's immense body, climbing down off the bed and carrying a bucket in hands dripping with viscous fragrances, "You're welcomesss..." She hissed at Uroer as she lugged the bucket out, a scowl on her face.

         The male Meal-Wyrm only snorted at her as she passed, "Rude! Not in front of guest foolish whelp!"

         Voxiche ignored the dragoness, even as she slammed the door on her way out, "Hmm, she is quite the prize Uroer... she must have been the envy of the kingdom before she was fed to such size... And even then..." She shivered a little before gripping the sleeping fur's belly more firmly, claws digging to her thick flesh just a bit as she began to climb towards its top. The bat crawled over to the girl's face, knees sinking into the mountain of blubber beneath her as her fingers brushed below one of the bunny's chins, "Yes... and her make-up!" She cooed in delight, noting the deep green eyeshadow and matching lipstick of the former belly dancer. She also couldn't help but notice the girl's many gold piercings, most lining her long, floppy ears and weighing them down to rest against her light blond hair. There wasn't too much distinct about her fur though, besides black-dyed floral designs that encircled her arms on fur that was otherwise a soothing light, creamy yellow, the color of butter, "So exotic... Where did you say she hailed from? Most certainly from across the sea..."

         "Yaessss... the land of Ikzia, as I have sssaid..." Uroer replied, scratching at the scales of his cheek as he recalled specifics, "She was the Sultan's pride, his fattest dancer, and the subject of ferocious desire by him. But when he demanded she join his personal harem, she declined it... She insisted she be his panguian... his queen... instead."

         "I see," Voxiche said, her fingers brushing against the fur of her plump cheeks now before she rubbed it tenderly with her palm, "A woman with ambition... I do so love such things, but I doubt the Sultan was so impressed."

         Uroer nodded, "Quite yes, sadly. The Sultan was infuriated as he still considered her a servant, no matter how much he craved..." Uroer paused, his mouth agape as he fumbled for words, "He... lusted for her curvaceous flesh. And of course the rabbit found no ally in the Queen she sought to replace... So she was sentenced to what the Sultan considered the most fitting punishment for her. He bought as much glutton's leaf as he could, smuggled from the heart of the Walled Lands, and force-fed her large quantities..."

         Voxiche cringed a bit and pulled her hand away for a moment, a strange sensation she hadn't felt often filling her gut. Pity, was it? That may have been it, "Quoi Glutton's leaf, how atrocious!" She gasped. She knew of the herb of course, and the devastating effects it could have on one's appetite and metabolism. Yet despite her outrage, she would honestly have used the plant in her own projects, had it not been so difficult to procure, "The poor girl, it is no wonder she is such a whale!"

         Uroer chuckled a bit, an awkward and slightly unsettling sort of laugh, "That is one way you can describe her I suppose... But yes, after her... I guess 'treatments' with the plant, they no longer needed to forcefeed her. They simply just let her loose at any food within reach and she carried out her punishment herself. The poor dancer... our agents who deal with the Sultan tell me she was quite skilled, able to move her body as gracefully as a ribbon in the breeze...."

         "How cruel..." She sighed, raking her claws lightly under the bunny girl's chins before tapping them to watch them quiver, "Though I can't say the Sultan doesn't have great taste!" She murred, poking the girl's face more firmly before giving her heavy cheeks a few light smacks, "Wake up princess! We need to have a little chat, no?"

         The bunny grumbled groggily, bright blue eyes blinking and nose twitching in sniffles as she struggled to regain consciousness. With a few decidedly firmer smacks from the vampire bat the rabbit girl was soon awake for the most part, eyes listing about the room wearily in confusion, "Where am I....? Huff... huff... who are... mmmph.... Oooh, sooooo huuuuungry....!"

         Voxiche's tall, pointed ears twitched as she heard the rabbit's mammoth stomach gurgle, and she couldn't stop a grin from spreading across her face.

         "It has been a while since the glutton's leaf had been ingested... but the recovery process is quite a lengthy one Madame Voxiche. She is still going in... ahhh... withdrawal, yes."

         For a moment the bat looked back to the sleeping bunny girl's face before turning back to respond to Uroer. She could of course feed from the girl now while she was asleep... yet she could also use the girl's addiction to create an even larger meal for herself.

"So I can see.." She said, trying to keep her excitement, her own hunger, from tinging her voice, "Sweet Uroer, would you kindly bring the girl food then? Withdrawal or no, we should not deny her some pampering, now should we?"

Uroer blinked, and then flicked his tongue and bowed, "Of course, of course, I will return shortly with much food to appease the... guest." He said, before turning around and strolling though the door. Voxiche couldn't help but giggle a little. She was sure Uroer would not disappoint once he brought the food in: The Meal-Wyrm was just as likely eager to fatten their mutual meal up further, if not more so. The bat girl was still grinning as she turned her attentions back towards the rabbit.

"Now my petite, beautiful bunny, don't you worry a bit, my good lizard boy friend will bring you something yummy tout suite.~" She said, slipping her fingers under the highest of the rabbit's chins and lifting it as much as the girl's neckfat would allow to meet her eyes, "Please, in the meantime allow me to introduce myself: My name is Voxiche Lecard... and you?"

"A-Albina... huff ugghhhh... Albina Tuno..." She gasped between breaths. "Pleeeeeaaaaaase... I need fooooood...."

Voxiche still smiled at her, but as she drug her claws down the obese bunny's cheek once more and down to her flabby neck, she pressed them more firmly against her flesh, drawing a few sharper breaths from the bunny as worry filled her eyes, "Oh believe me, I know you poor, poor thing... I'm sure you practically need to breathe cake and tarts, don't you, you disgusting fatass...?" And now Voxiche leaned in closer towards the helpless bunny's face, the rabbit trying to pull away from the bat girl but unable to as the sorceress's warm pants tickled the fur on her chins, "But when Voxiche Lecard is speaking to you, you better listen... no matter how HUNGRY you are..."

Voxiche gripped the bunny girl's right ear before roughly yanking it before her face, causing the fat bunny to let out a husky but brief shriek of fear as the bat hissed into it, "Voxiche Lecard, what did I just say to you!? I do not see any fatclogging up your silly floppy ears, but perhaps I am mistaken?" She let go of the rabbit's ear as she whimpered more loudly, the obese girl squeezing her eyes shut tight to try and fight back the tears, "As for what I want from a fat cow like you... well there is simply so much mon amie... but right now all I'd like is to get to know you a little..." She purred, her grin returning to her face once more.

This did little to ease the rabbit, but she was able to work up the courage to respond anyways, "No... d-don't say things... mmnn... like that... I'm... I'm not f-f-fat! I'm... I'm just so HUNGRY! I'm always so hungr-"

Albina let out another yelp as Voxiche grabbed one of the rabbit's neck rolls and shook the blubber roughly, sending ripples over her corpulent form, "Oh no ma cherie, you are not fat at all, you are OBESE! You are a horrendous mountain of pudge! You cannot fool yourself about that, not when you can't even move!"

Cheeks burning red, the bunny girl began gasping in deep panicked pants, "B-But it's... it's not fair.... huff! I used to be so beautiful, so much... mmnph... thinner... I could have been a queen... and now look at me..."

"Yes yes, I've heard it all you poor dear. You had your chance and you blew it being a greedy piggy!" Voxiche grinned as she let go of the girl's flab and patted her cheek.

Albina couldn't restrain herself any longer as tears began rolling down her chubby cheeks, causing her makeup to run, "I wasn't...! My family... huff... mnnf... was so poor... when I got the chance to dance for the Sultan... I just wanted more... I had to be safe..." She paused a moment before looking up at Voxiche, her eyes meeting the bat's as tears streamed from them freely now, "I just needed to survive!"

As soon as these last words registered within her mind, Voxiche's vicious grin faltered a little as she felt something once more stir within her. "By the gods..." she thought to herself, suddenly feeling uncomfortable, "Am I really feeling sorry for her now?" Such an idea was ridiculous, the bat had heard piles upon piles of sob stories in her lifetime, many of them aimed against her by her meals in attempts to escape their dreaded fates. Then why was this one any different? Why did it affect her so? Why did that one word seem to reach her beyond all else?

Voxiche frowned, grabbing the bunny's chin in her paw once more, "And look at where it got you my dear. A blubbery morsel for a society of carnivorous dragons! Seems as though you've done a great job at 'surviving' so far, no?"

The bunny girl seemed as though she were trying to hold back her tears, but this only caused her to sob harder, "N-No...! You have to help me....! Unngh... huff... Please... I don't want to be eate-!"

Albina's whimpers were stifled by Voxiche as she placed a finger to the girl's plump lips, "Shhh... We can't have you ruining such a pretty plump face with sadness and tears..." The bat murred gently, her paw wiping some of said tears from the rabbit's face as the bat spread her legs wide atop the immobile woman's immense stomach, "Mm, no no no... Besides, there's no need to worry over the future is there? Not when the present is so much more pleasant..."

"I... I don't understand..." the bunny girl whimpered before Voxiche drew closer, grabbing the bunny's cheeks in her paws before pressing her lips to Albina's.

Albina's eyes widened and her breath quickened as the bat woman kissed her, wanting to protest at first but instead found herself doing nothing at all. As she felt the girl's tongue part her lips to deepen the kiss, she moaned huskily, letting go of all her fears and confusion and giving into the passion of the moment just as the sorceress had urged. She caught herself purring into the other girl's mouth as she felt her paw caress up her cheek and run through her hair to rub behind her ear.

Voxiche broke the kiss and pulled back slightly, and Albina felt herself shiver as the bat's breath washed over her face, "See? Not so bad, no? You bitch so much about how you're soooo fat... but you don't realize how much fun you can have, especially when you have an expert to show you how..." She cooed, her paw now brushing down the girl's cheeks and rubbing down to her chest, "Here, let me show you..." The bat said, smiling.

A thick gasp escaped Albina's lips as she felt Voxiche's paw rub over her swollen chest, the woman's touch firm yet smooth as she massaged the rabbit's bare breast. Albina shivered, biting her lip as she waited for the bat to make her next move before she felt the sorcerss giver her tit a squeeze right over one of her plump nipples, causing the rabbit to let out a shocked, heavy moan, "Ohhh...! That... it feels.... so..."

"Good?" Voxiche grinned as she nuzzled her body closer to the rabbit girl's, all while continuing to fondle her teasingly, "No need to be worry my sweet piggy... Just tell me what you want... what you need from me..." She purred, licking at Albina's neck before giving her breast another squeeze.

The bat cackled and slid down the dog’s mountainous belly, landing on the floor with a ground shaking thud. She strolled over to the stairs and turned to face her “guest”, admiring her handwork as she spoke to him once more, “Unfortunately we are all out of food! It looks like somebody ate it all, but don’t fret my helpless darling, Madame Lecard promised you’d never go hungry, and that is a promise I intend to keep…”

The vampire bat began to climb the stairs, speaking over her shoulder, “I’ll just be gone for a short while, but I will return with the most delicious treats from the best this shithole of a village has to offer! I know a nice small bakery that sells the cutest cupcakes, you’ll love them so much, you won’t be able to stop eating them… whether you wanted to or not…” She cackled maliciously and blew the immobile bounty hunter a kiss, “Ta-ta mi amore’! Don’t miss me too much!”

Leonard struggled to bark at his jailer, but despite all of the strain, all he could let out was a loud, wet belch. He grunted even louder now, panting as he watched Voxiche’ disappear up the stairs and out of sight. He hated her, more than any other person he had ever been in contact with, that smug, arrogant bitch. He reflected on how this had happened, how such a seemingly simple bounty had gone so horribly wrong. When he first saw the sorceress’s wanted poster on a board in Little Silverhorne he thought it couldn’t have been any easier, and the gold that the poster promised seemed like far too much for someone like her.

“A murderous vampire bat that fattens up her victims?” the dog thought to himself, he found himself thinking quite a bit ever since he lost his mobility, “How could that have been hard? Just don’t eat anything, don’t let her seduce you into eating anything, stay the hell away from food, and she can’t do a damn thing to you!”

And yet he was reckless.

Leonard remembered it vividly. It was a hot, muggy night, the kind that makes you feel like you were breathing in soup. He had tracked her to a house on the outskirts of some backwater farming town called Plowtonsville thanks to a tip he got off of one of the villagers. He was confident, perhaps too confident that he would bag his mark, but things took a turn for the worse when inside he had found the farmstead’s owner. She was a young vixen, her fur a bright, healthy orange, her hair as yellow and natural as the wheat growing in the fields outside. She would have looked beautiful, except for the fact that she was a mound of wobbling blubber, unable to move, the shredded overalls of a much thinner woman crushed beneath her massive buttocks and stomach. When she looked at him, tears streaming down her bulbous cheeks, blood dripping from an all too familiar bite mark on her thick, flabby neck, he couldn’t stop himself. By the time he had run inside the house he was out cold.

He must have been out for at least a day the bitch hit him in the back of the head, for he woke up where he was now. He had found himself in this very basement, although half a dozen tons lighter, his wrists bound to the floor by iron shackles and chains. That was when she started to feed him, started to make him into the useless pile of blubber he was now. She delighted in every moment, every last morsel she forced past his lips, relishing that she had turned the hunter into the hunted.

But force-feeding the German Shepherd wasn’t enough. She wanted to humiliate him and demean him, make him swallow his pride as well as her sweets and treats. And so she turned to her magic, choosing a wretched curse from an ancient looking tome of foul sorcery, a curse that still wracked his body even now, one of crippling hunger. Ever since she had whispered those words into his ear, dark and mysterious words of power, he was doomed to be a slave not only to her but to his own stomach. With each morsel she fed him he grew hungrier, with each drink she poured down his throat he grew thirstier. His belly never seemed satisfied until every square inch of it was stretched nice and tight, and as he grew wider, that became more and more difficult.

And now, even while she was gone, and he was alone his mind returned to food. Leonard gasped as his belly rumbled and quaked, the flab coating it jiggling violently as it demanded satisfaction. He struggled not to let it distract him, but it became harder and harder with each passing second he was without food. Almost as bad as his desire for sustenance was his desire for rest, for even though he was almost positive he had just woken up an hour or two ago, he was already feeling tired. The beastman was hardly surprised, his lifestyle could only be described as sedentary, and it didn’t help that pounds and pounds of fat laden pastries and sugar packed frosting were currently digesting in his massive gut, dangerously close to lulling him into a food coma. He managed to fight it off though, difficult as it was to for him, he knew that this was his chance.

. Voxiche’ hardly left Leonard alone like this; even her trips to secure food for her victim were rare. The bounty hunter suspected she either bought large quantities and stored it elsewhere, or created some of the more basic edibles with her magic, but if he was going to escape then now was his one opportunity.

His shackles had been removed the day before when his weight finally surpassed his legs’ strength and pinned him to the ground, yet the dog did not lose hope. Even though he was massively obese he still hadn’t had much opportunity to try to move, not like this, and so he gathered his strength and began to focus on shifting his bulk to his feet. He knew deep down that it was a long shot, but it was his only way and so he still had to try. The canine grunted as he strained himself, trying to push his legs down with all his might and muscle, teeth grinding, sweat beginning to roll off his brow.

Yet his feet, surrounded and separated from the ground by the large mounds of fat his legs had become, merely wiggled pathetically in the air. He continued to try though, struggling even harder than before. There were no locks he could see, and he wasn’t being bound by magic nor restraints, only his own massive girth. Hate began to well up in him once more as he realized that it was probably an intentional move on Voxiche’s behalf, her smug way of mocking him and his situation. This thought only made him push himself harder, yet as he still couldn’t feel that he was achieving anything other than pain to himself, his resolve quickly disappeared. Soon after he gave up, sinking back down into his mammoth, mountainous body, his heart racing and pumping hard and tortuously as he gasped and wheeze for breath. The helpless dog quickly became overcome by a deep sense of dread as he realized just how helplessly obese he was and just how bleak his situation was.

“This isn’t fair…” He thought, whimpering loudly as he gasped for breath, “I can’t even lift my arms anymore, how the hell am I going to escape? Even if I could move how could I fit through the door? How could I run fast enough to get away from that bitch of a bat…”

He started to whimper louder, filled with regret over choosing to hunt for Voxiche’ Lecard to begin with, “How bad could it be? Even if I do get fat, how bad could it be? Leonard, you fool…”

Suddenly he heard a noise, as though a wing flapping or a page being turned…

He searched the room desperately for the source of the noise, a task hard enough for a man who couldn’t even turn his head, let alone move his body around. All he could do was look about the room with his eyes and hope it was in his field of vision. He spotted his sword lying on the table against the wall, but it was useless to him in this state, far out of reach, probably put there to mock him. Yet what was this? Next to the sword on the table, almost out of his field of vision was a book, and not just any book but the witch’s spell book!

This was perfect! He could even make out the words on the page, just barely, and while he wasn’t sure what they would do it was his best bet on getting out of this gluttonous hell alive. He had to memorize the words, that’s all he had to do, remember them and wait for Lecard. Yet even something so seemingly simple was complicated by his seemingly ever present hunger and the drowsiness that threatened to overtake him with each passing second.

But he couldn’t let it, if he fell asleep now his opportunity would be gone, as well as any chance at freedom. He just wished he wasn't so distracted by hunger, his straining heart, by her wonderful scent...

1553322222212113.content:
Two days had passed. Two whole days of being filled with pure, raw lard. Two whole days of being stuffed to his limits. Enough time for Leonard to swallow dozens of barrels of the unhealthiest sludge one could think of and turn it into even more fat on his already disgustingly obese frame.

The poor dog couldn't even imagine he could get any fatter before that damnable funnel had been crammed in his maw. Now he hardly needed to imagine. This was what his life had become, this constant, inescapable nightmare, and it was only just getting started.

He whimpered weakly, but it sounded more like a hideous gurgle past the rows of flabby chins, past the constant surge of pork fat filling his throat. He wanted to scream, he wanted to cry, but he could barely manage even that. The torrent of lard would sometimes slow to a trickle; just to let him digest, just to keep his stomach right near the edge of bursting as it was slowly stretched, slowly and painfully trained to pack away more and more. All he could focus on at this point was swallowing. It was either that, or...

"Hhhhrrr... uuurrhhk!"

Lard and spittle spurted past Leonard's fat lips, some of it spilling up his nostrils as he gagged heavily. Tears welled up in his eyes but they vanished as he squeezed them shut, his throat bulging as he struggled to swallow the heavy flow of grease back down his throat instead of choking on it. He was successful, but at the back of his mind he knew this wouldn't be the last time that happened.

Several more hours passed, and more and more weight piled onto his body just as relentlessly as the grease poured into his painfully taut gut. He began to wonder what would kill him first, his stomach finally giving out or drowning in the slick, slimy flood of lard when he suddenly heard footsteps on the stairs.

His heart began to race, faster and faster as he dreaded the approach of his vampiric captor...

Then suddenly, his heart leapt as the doberman came into view, and then sunk as panic seized the obese german shepherd.

"Leonard!" The man gasped, his dark longcoat flapping behind him as he ran towards the other much larger canine, "What did she do to you?!"

Leonard's eyes flicked bulged and his thick, nearly round fingers wiggled as he began to gag once again on the endless flow of lard spilling from the funnel.

The doberman barked in a panic, pausing only a moment to note the tiny, illusory duplicate of Leonard's massive body hovering above his head before scrambling to climb onto his enormous and soft belly. The German shepherd's eyes rolled and he groaned in pain as the lard in the funnel began to bubble and spill both from the top and where it met his overstuffed mouth. The doberman gritted his teeth as he caught sight of the other dog, gritting his teeth in frustration and despair as his boots slipped against Leonard's sweaty, greasy fur, his ears drooping as he heard Leonard's yelp of pain muffled into a thick, wet gurgle.

"No, no, no, no!" He growled, tearing his horrified gaze away from the other canine as he regained his purchase and pulled himself up to Leonard's flabby neck rolls, desperately wiping the sweat from his paws onto his goat before he grasped at the funnel.

Leonard's breathing began to slow, his eyes drooping and face growing purple under his fur as the doberman tugged at the rim of the funnel, finding it stuck between the freakishly obese dog's lips as though they were fused to it. The thin dog's eyes darted up to Leonard's face, panic filling them before he started to tug at the funnel with his left paw while slamming his right fist against Leonard's chest.

"No Leonard! Don't give up! Please! It's Trent! It's me, Leo-"

A bright, purple flash filled the room as two distinct but equally important things happened.

The first was that a surge of magical energy arced around the edges of the funnel and leapt onto Trent's paws. The purple lightning crawled up the dog's arms as he howled with pain and stumbled backwards, rolling down the slope of Leonard's stomach and landing with a thud.

The second thing that happened was that the funnel finally yanked free from the German shepherd's lips, spiraling through the air as it was released from both Trent's paws and the other male's maw. Globs of lard were slung from the funnel as the magical energy dancing around it began to falter, then fizzle, then completely dissipate; both the seal holding it to Leonard's mouth and the enchantment bringing in the seemingly infinite supply of lard vanishing simultaneously.

His mouth finally clear, Leonard began to gag harder, coughing up the lard filling his throat as Trent scrambled to get to his feet.

Except somehow he couldn't. His muscles spasmed as his body twisted on the ground, arcs of electrical energy coursing over the entirety of the canine's body.

"D-Dammit... no..!" He groaned weakly. He tried to turn to face his partner as he heard the other dog continue to gag and gurgle and choke, but it seemed as though every time he moved the pain grew worse, "It was a... a-a..!"

"A trap..?" A feminine voice cooed from above him.

Trent turned just enough to see a familiar visage leering at him from atop Leonard's mountain of a belly. The face of Voxiche Lecard.

"No..." Trent gritted out, his face a rictus of pain as he watched her smile.

"Yes," She purred viciously, her face split by a grin as she licked her fangs, "It would seem I have lucked out with you, have I not bounty hunters?" The bat laughed as she crossed her legs, slapping her paws upon her knees as she cackled, "Two puppies for the price of one! Who knew I was so popular?"

"No..." Was all the paralyzed Doberman could groan out as he looked into the woman's gleeful eyes, and then his gaze shifted to Leonard who was still trying to clear his throat. He reached his arm down for the dagger in his belt, but even that sent a fresh helping of agony bolting through his body as Voxiche cackled again.

"Oh maybe it isn't me who is the popular one, is it?" Voxiche said as she looked back at the obese German shepherd, "And here I thought piggy boy Leonard here was a useless sack of fat, but it would appear he still makes the most excellent bait, no? Well I hope you are hungry, my new friend..." The bat purred, licking her lips once more, "Because it looks like I will be feeding for two now..."

Knowing he didn't have much time before the vampire bat swooped down to collect her latest prey, Trent's heart pounded as he tried to focus on his next course of action.

Inky blackness blanketed the city known only as the Capital. While the richer sections of the city blazed with streetlights and lamplight spilling forth from the various manors and mansions, the poorer distracts were left to succumb to the deep darkness of the moonless night. A few token guards patrolled the shanty towns, but they rarely did anything to stop the rampant crime common to the slums. The few people braving the shadows quickly darted from location to location as quickly as possible, typically from one run down tavern to another. None of the people on the streets ever saw the shadow darting from rooftop to rooftop.

The shadow paused near one of the district walls, quietly observing a pair of guards walking along the base of the barrier. The flickering light from the torch barely illuminated a head peaking over the edge of the dilapidated roof; a hood wrapped around the back of the head and a tight fitting cloth piece was pulled over the muzzle, leaving only the pale eyes and a small strip of tiny midnight blue scales exposed. The guards never looked up to see they were being watched and continued on their way. Once they had safely gone around the corner, the figure continued to wait for a few seconds to make sure there was no one else coming.

Satisfied, the person backed up from the edge of the roof before a running leap carried them across the gap to the wall, where a quick flap of a set of wings hidden beneath the cloak allowed them to dart up and over to the roof of a merchant on the other side. Upon landing, the cloak was pulled back, revealing black form-fitting leather armor around a slender female body. After pulling the cloak back around her body and a quick glance around to confirm her position, the cloaked figure took off across the rooftops again.

She had to be more careful now, being in a brighter section of the city; fortunately, despite the extra light, there were fewer people out on the streets at this time of night in this area. Nearing her destination, the figure paused in the shadow of a chimney and pulled the cloth covering her face down to better smell for any unseen guards or other people. Not smelling anything out of the ordinary, the draconic muzzle pulled into a slight grin before being covered up again. With that, Kana set off with her objective plainly obvious ahead of her.
