A low growl was heard from the chambers of none other than the Lipomancer himself... It became louder and more venomous until finally...

"GRAAH! DAMNIT! HOW could she escape?!" he roared in fury. Earlier that day, a young, Anthropomorphic Fox, Serena, had escaped from the Lipomancer's Keep and made her way to the cave system underneath everything. It was an understatement to say he was livid.

From her seat, Sarah Hayes listened fearfully to her master's ranting. "You, you had *one* job, Miss Hayes!" The Lipomancer shouted, "You saw Serena escape... you could have done SOMETHING, in fact you SHOULD have done something!"

Sarah gulped nervously and began to stutter. "M-M-Master, I," she tried to say as a hand came flying her way, slapping her hard on the muzzle. She whimpered in pain as he spoke again.

"Silence!" he warned, "You will have a lot of work to do to make up for this, my student. There's been a disturbance down at the Temple. I want you to head there immediately and take care of the threat!"

Sarah nodded slowly and replied affirmatively. "Yes, Master..." she whispered pitifully, slowly standing up and walking away, facing the Lipomancer with terror in her eyes. As soon as she left the room, she closed the door behind her and walked down the spiral staircase. She was halfway there when she looked back up, and seeing nothing/nobody, she sat down on the steps and began to cry. How did she let herself get mixed up in all of this insanity? A year ago she was nothing more than an aspiring mage seeking to learn about the world around her. She had an absolutely adorable sense of curiosity and loved to read and write poetry, even if she wasn't the best poet in the world. She was thin, and beautiful. She even had a few of the men in her village begging her father for her hand in marriage, but thankfully he turned them all down.

Sarah buried her head in her arms as she sobbed. Her relatively thick arms. Now as she looks at herself, she believed herself to be merely a husk of what she once was. Now? She was an obese, subordinate plaything for the Lipomancer to manipulate. She spent her time not studying the magic of restoration she so wanted to know more about, but learning how to make innocent people's lives a living Hell as they struggled for freedom or the riches said to be held somewhere in the territory, and then crush their hopes in one fell swoop, enslaving them for eternity. She had already captured 4 hapless adventurers, and every time she did so, a small part of her died inside. She had already mastered a great amount of Lipomancy spells, and could revert herself to normal size, if the Lipomancer weren't watching her like a bloody HAWK.

She closed her eyes and sobbed once more before...

155332222222222222222211.content:
One Year Earlier...

Sarah Hayes stumbled around as she tried to find shelter from the ferocious wind and heavy rain that struck one's skin like a hammer strikes a nail. She had been out exploring the forests around her village when she became lost. In a panic she searched about, wincing as the rain, which frankly felt like hail, beat her scales.

Eventually, she discovered a large cottage centered in a clearing. It seemed suspicious somehow, but, because of her desperation to get out of this weather, Sarah took what she could get. She burst into a run, stopping at the door and twisting the knob, expecting resistance. To her surprise, it flew open with ease! Deciding not to question how easy this seemed to be, Sarah ran straight inside and shut the door. "I'm SO sorry for the intrusion!" she cried out. No response.

Sarah finally calmed down and looked about. No signs of life besides a few candles to light the room... A light grumbling could be heard from the far corner of the cottage, which Sarah investigated. Upon discovering what it was that made that noise, she stumbled back and fell on her rear in shock. This... *thing*. It looked like a sack of something... a leash... no, a tube connected it with a hole in the floor which obviously went down to something in the basement. Sarah narrowed her eyes and crept forwards, staring at the creature. "What... are y-" she attempted to say. She had opened her mouth at just the right moment. The sack-like creature hissed and flew forwards, hugging her face and inserting a tube into her mouth. It's legs tied her muzzle shut and stuck to it. Sarah screamed (although it was muffled) and tried to pry this thing off of her to no avail as a bulge in the base of the tube to their left formed, moving through and to the creature, which sent a sweet liquid cascading into Sarah's mouth. She refused to swallow, but found that was a bad idea as her cheeks bulged painfully. At last, after struggling as much as she could with the device/creature/monster/thing, she finally swallowed the viscous fluid to alleviate her immediate pain. Also a bad idea for her. Still she continued to pry at the beast until she could pull no more. It was stuck, and it was never coming off...

Sarah felt something heavy on her midsection and moved her hands to try to find whatever it was. Something warm, soft, and scaly... she moved her hands back until she felt her own chest. She realized what this meant...

She began screaming at the top of her lungs, only a muffled howl thanks to the creature. She felt her belly, legs, and arms begin to rapidly put on weight as she stepped back and thrashed her head wildly. It did nothing but quicken the flow of liquid.

"Soo.... heavy..." she thought to herself. She yanked one last time with her head, but only lost her balance, landing on her hindquarters. She attempted to stand back up only to find that she was too heavy! With a final whimper, she resigned to her fate, shaking her head gently in disbelief, and placing her hands on the shelf of her belly. She would black out soon after, and only after her body filled almost the entire cottage save for the entryway did the creature relent, detaching and sliding to the ground, limp.

Next Morning...

A sound of a creaking door and footsteps fill the air. Sarah's eyes gently slide open. All she can see is a sea of blue scales... her own scales... Once this information processed, she panicked and began thrashing about once more, sending her belly into waves. "Please! Somebody help me!" she cried, tears flowing down her cheeks. This was no dream. This was a strange, screwed up reality. She felt a hand press against the front of her stomach. "Who's there?" she inquired, trying to see over herself.

"Your new master," a raspy voice replied.

"What?!" Sarah asked angrily.

The voice replied again. "I am the Lipomancer... you are the stupid girl who fell into a trap of mine..."

"I'm not stupid!" Sarah shouted, throwing a little firebolt at the doorway, unsure of what she'd hit.

The voice was silenced for a moment, and Sarah smirked in victory, before her face fell in irritation when the voice started up again.

"Magical ability... interesting... well, I must take back my previous comment about you being stupid. Genuinely stupid people could never understand the Arcane like you and I... let's go with careless instead."

Sarah rolled her eyes. "What do you want from me!?"

"You."

"Me?"

"Let me make this simple: You either pledge your allegiance to me. I can grant you eternal life in exchange for eternal servitude. The riches of my territory will be yours. I treat my slaves rather fairly," the Lipomancer announced, leaning on Sarah's gut.

"And if I say no?" Sarah replied indignantly.

"If you say no... I could reintroduce you to our little friend," the Lipomancer sighed, gesturing to the limp creature from earlier. "I'll tell him to fill you up some more... so much, you could..." he added, growling slightly with these words, imagining the scenario in his head. A sadistic smile spread across his face as his eyes brightened and grew wide. "Pop!" he said in a eerily playful tone, making an explosion gesture with his hands.

Sarah gulped nervously. Her options were die horribly or be a slave to some creep for ETERNITY. She valued her life, and the man mentioned something about the arcane. Her greatest desire was to learn magic and become a Master Mage, and... trapped here? Beggars can't be picky.

"F-Fine... I'll go."
155332222222222222222211.title: Sarah's Origin Story.

choices: Run straight away from the Keep.
Try to rescue some adventurers.
1553322222222222222222111.content:
Sarah's flashback ends as she shakes her head in minor frustration. She'd made up her mind...

It was time to leave.

After a long walk to her dorm, she began packing her things. A copy of the Lipomancer's spellbook, mainly issued to his students, some spare changes of robes, a little food and some canteens of water, and a dagger were among the things she owned currently. With a final sigh she slung her pack onto her shoulder and turned to see another of the Lipomancer's students. His name was Erik. He had come here on his own accord and asked for the Lipomancer, so, he never experienced the traps. Needless to say, he was a Loyalist.

"What are you doing?" he asked, crossing his arms and leaning on the wall. Sarah gulped as her eyes darted back and forth.

"I'm just heading out. Some more travelers got caught in here. Master chose me to go after them!" she explained. A slight lie. She *was* supposed to go after the adventurers, but there was a change of plans when she finally decided she was going to leave this hellish nightmare behind.

Erik stared her down for a full minute before stepping aside. Sarah squeezed by and made haste for the door. Avoiding the suspicious glances and the security prefects on the way out of the Keep, she smiled wide when the sunlight kissed her face. She now had a choice.
1553322222222222222222111.title: *End Flashback*

choices: Four's a Party!
15533222222222222222221112.content:
Sarah thought for a moment. She couldn't just leave. Not without helping as many of the Lipomancer's other slaves as she could. Even if it meant death, she knew that the freedom of others was worth it. Considering there were no escapees to date, nobody knew about the Lipomancer except him and his "kingdom". No doubt Serena would escape and bring an army back. Taking the Lipomancer down the hard way wasn't Sarah's calling.

She decided to turn left at the fork in the road, heading down to the Temple below the mountain. Last she checked, there were some adventurers who were en route to that very location. She had to warn them before they reached the Locks. The Lipomancer had tanks of special liquid attached to the locks to gates on the Temple interior. They had already claimed a Feline rogue. Her druid friend was taken down later by another trap. His stubbornness cost him his life. Sarah was there to see him burst. The Rogue was captured and forced into the labor camp outside the Caves. Never did Sarah want to see another suffer either of their fates.

With one final look back, Sarah took off into a run, using her magic to increase her endurance once she began panting.

At the Temple...

A Human Paladin stood at the main entrance of the Temple. "This is their place-of-worship? Heathens..." he muttered as he turned and asked his squad for explosives. "It's locked down from the inside. Any of you got TNT?" he inquired. An anthropomorphic lion hunter pulled out a single stick of TNT. "This might make a small hole. Good enough to crawl through..." he said as he passed his bomb to the Paladin.

"Excellent. We'll go in through the front. We're here to take what information we can on the recent disappearances and clear the Hell out of here," another Anthropomorphic creature, this time a Bull (Think Tauren). He was a warrior by vocation. This was evident by his giant sword, which rested on his plated shoulder casually.

"Who's going in to take the barricades down?" the Hunter asked. The Paladin shook his head.

"I'll do it... you got a light?" said Paladin inquired. The Bull simply stabbed the ground with his sword and snatched the TNT. He struck his hoof across the blade and cast sparks, which he quickly used to light the fuse.

"FIRE IN THE HOLE!" he roared as he flung the explosive. The fuse was short enough so that it exploded just as it landed, creating a hole in the side of the door. It was big enough for the Human and the Lion, but the Bull would have to wait.

Just as the Paladin began to crouch into the hole, a voice cried out.

"WAIT! STOP!" Sarah shouted, waving her free arm erratically.

The Paladin bumped his head into the top of the hole and hissed. "Agh! Who's there?!"

The Lion readied his rifle to fire when the Bull pulled his arm down. "Let her speak." he warned.

Sarah stopped in front of the group and bent over, breathing heavily. "Please... give me a... second. Whew!" she said, holding her chest where her heart was and panting. The Paladin approached and patted her thick shoulder.

"Impressive. Quite fast for a woman of your..." he said, before biting his tongue and looking away, not wanting to be rude. Sarah blushed in reply and blew her brown hair out of her eyes. Her hair was unusual for a reptilian species. Her entire family had hair on their heads, though.

"It's okay. I know," she replied, smiling as she regained her strength.

"What did you need us for?" the Lion asked.

"Do *not* go in the front. There is a golem just WAITING for you."

The Bull narrowed his eyes. "How would you know this..." he asked, tightening his grip on his sword.

The Paladin raised a brow. "I concur."

Sarah gulped nervously and looked at the trio. "M-My name's Sarah H-Hayes. I am a Student of the master of this territory," she introduced herself, IMMEDIATELY crouching and holding her hands over her head, "Pleasedon'tkillmeorcapturemeordounspeakablethingstomeplease!" she panicked.

The Paladin blinked, looking down at the cowering dragoness. "Why would you think I'd want to kill you? If you were to go against your master's wishes and tell us about a potential threat, you must have repented for your previous sins..."

Sarah shut up instantly, looking upwards into the human's eyes. "Y-you're right, I guess..." she replied shyly. She stood back up and dusted off her robe. "I want to help you get out of here. We should turn back, right now, and go get help."

The Lion sighed and slapped his face with the palm of his hand. "We tried that. The King won't listen to *us*. He knows about disappearances but refuses to engage in combat until we have an idea of what we're facing. Some of the courtmembers though Dragons or demonic entities. We're trying to confirm their fears or deny them the excitement."

Sarah frowned. "So let me guess: You're going in no matter what to retrieve data, and I'm unable to sway you in any way shape or form?"

The Bull chuckled. "Yep. Although I myself have second thoughts about this. If teams of five end up missing, then a team of three is royally #%$!ed."

The blue-scaled dragoness thought on that. "Let me help you. I know my way around the Temple!" she suggested.

THAT'S RIGHT I AM BACK B1TCHES! ~ Magicaster888

The Paladin scratched his thin, brown beard for a moment, ocean blue eyes blinking in contemplation. "It would be an honor for you to join our group. I suppose introductions are in order..." he said.

Sarah smiled an nodded.

"I am Lord John 'Dawnblade' Vost. We call the bull Odin, and the Lion is Raa'shad. No surname for either of them," said the Paladin.

"John Vost? Lord Vost?! You visited my Village!" Sarah replied, bewildered.

"Is that so? Come to think of it I remembered visiting a Dragonkin village on a diplomatic mission at some point... this was a year ago, yes. Saw a young woman, taken by her intellect... thought about dropping by and meeting her father to talk about the possibility of courting her, but I saw that he was rather defensive when it came to his daughter... Some time after I left, heard she had disappeared in a horrid storm... pretty much broke my heart."

Sarah's eyes widened. This was becoming less and less comfortable... "Wh-what did she... look like?" she asked.

John reminisced further before snapping his fingers in remembrance. "Beautiful lass. Brown Hair, blue scales, green eyes, this cute little mark... on... her cheek..." he said, voice lowering as he observed Sarah's features, including her brown hair, blue scales, green eyes, and scar-like blemish on her right cheek. He was silenced as he recognized the dragoness before him. "God... what did they do to you?!" he asked, placing a hand on Sarah's belly.

Raa'shad stood scratching his neck. "Awwwkwwwaaaaaard..." he murmured.

"You wanted to marry me?!" Sarah asked, blushing.

"You wanted to come HERE to study magic?!" came John's reply.

"You wanted to storm this temple for the King?" Odin interjected, gesturing to the dynamite-created hole in the wall of the temple.

That seemed to stop the growing confusion. With a huff, John crawled through the hole.

Within seconds, the door was opened and the other three entered the temple.

"That Golem. Where is it?" Raa'shad inquired.

1553322222222222222222111211.content:
"That Golem. Where is it?" Raa'shad inquired.

Sarah lifted a trembling arm up to the hulking monstrosity and whimpered, "There..." as said monstrosity sprang to life, having detected intruding heat signatures matching up with humanoids.

It began rattling, swaying from side to side as John Vost's eyes narrowed, studying his opponent. Out of nowhere, it started rambling about how "2+2=4 is a 'crock of shit'."

John lifted an eyebrow as he drew his sword, Shadowbreaker. "I'm pretty sure that's what it equals," he commented as the weapon began glowing with a holy energy. The Golem charged forwards, switching topics to his favorite romance novel as John's party rolled out of the way, weapons at the ready.

"Perfect. Thanks to Sarah, we anticipated this," Odin murmured, moving into a defensive stance.

"Speaking of Sarah. Any idea on how to stop this thing?" Raa'shad said as he leapt over the Golem's sweeping hand.

"HE SLOWLY REACHED OUT TO HER, WHISPERING,'LET ME SHOW YOU A WORLD OF UNIMAGINABLE PLEASURES'!" the Golem shouted. Dead silence filled the room. The Golem stopped moving, and all eyes were on it.

"I did not anticipate that, however," Odin added under his breath.

Sarah's eye twitched and she awkwardly cleared her throat. "It's composed entirely of assorted meats and organic tissues, all edible, all cooked. That said, it is highly unstable. Aim for the legs!" she shouted, throwing a bolt of frost magic at the Golem's ankle.

Again, silence. "I'm sorry, what?" Odin replied, barreling over the Golem's foot as it attempted a sweep-kick.

"You heard her! Question it later!" John shouted, charging towards the Golem and swinging his sword, firing off a ray of holy light that seared through the Golem's sausagey legs, cutting the behemoth down and onto its torso. Still it flailed, looking for targets. It then began computing Pi, only making it about 15 digits before looping an obnoxious error message.

Taking note of its pattern, Raa'shad took the brief window of opportunity he had and fired and explosive round into the Golem's head, effectively destroying it. It went completely limp, to the relief of the entire party.

Sarah was first to speak, "That's over. Sadly we have a lot more to do if we want to make it to the end of this temple."

What happens next?

15533222222222222222221112111.content:
"This thing... is literally composed of sausage," Raa'shad said as he plucked a link off of the Golem's arm and lifted it to his mouth to test. Odin smacked him in the back of the head.

"Dumbass. Ask about it before putting it In your MOUTH."

Sarah giggled at this. "He is right. Rule #1 is don't eat anything, including possibly your own rations."

John scratched his head before slipping his helmet on over it. "The reason being...?" He asked.

"That would be the Master's MO. Instead of killing you or ransoming you, he inflates your body or fattens you up. Swings by, threatens you with servitude or death. Takes any race and any gender as long as the sick bastard gets his harem. It's how he got me. Some organic-mechanism filled me to the brim with some sweet liquid and left me a blob for a good 24 hours before my enslavement as a student of his," Sarah explained, nervously shuffling her foot on the tile floor beneath her.

All eyes were on her for a full minute before Raa'shad and Odin walked off in disbelief, leaving only John to stare at her, baffled. "So that would explain the disappearances of you and so many others. This man's soul is already damned. Death hasn't come to collect yet. Let's keep moving." He said, with understanding as he put his hand on Sarah's pudgy shoulder.

Odin was busy observing an ornate door decoration in the shape of a human face, made from Iron. All of a sudden, a voice was heard.

"Welcome, fools, to my lair! The Lair of the Lipomancer! You have come here seeking material gain... And so I shall give it to you! Perhaps you noticed the number on the door, and chose it due to being the smallest one out of the three. Fools that you are, you never realized that the number could stand for a single unit of great quantity! The only way to escape this room is to suck on the lips of the beautiful iron face before you. Doing so shall activate a mechanism that will drain a solution of my own devising from a hidden container in the walls and into your mouth. This container holds enough of my solution to induce a weight gain of one TON! How fortunate for you that there are four of you... Perhaps you can split it! Not that it will make any difference in the long run! And if you choose NOT to drink... Hohohoho... Well. Let's just say that you'll wish you had. If you make it past here, seek me at the highest point of my fortress, that I might give you your 'reward'! Until then! Ahahahahaha!"

Sarah rolled her eyes at the recording. She had a feeling that LM had made more of that damnable solution.

Odin's face was contorted into one of shock. "I am so sorry, but what the FUCK."

Sarah looked down at her belly, which was sizeable enough to block her view of her feet. "He isn't kidding..."

John blinked, clapped his hands together, and turned on his heels. "Who is going to take one for the team?" He asked.

Raa'shad coughed and took out his engineering satchel. "Won't be necessary milord." He took out a dime bag of a squishy material and smeared it on his fingers, spreading it over John's lips. He was too confused to protest. "Give this a minute, and slowly peel it off. Stick it to the iron face and I'll bring out the pipe. One of us can suck the solution out in smaller quantities and not get stuck to the face, then spit the fluid out... or swallow it if you are looking to fill out the armor..." he explained for the human paladin, who nodded in understanding. John followed the directions exactly and Raa'shad brought out a small metal pipe, spare scrap from an earlier project.

"I'll take it from here," Sarah announced.

155332222222222222222211121111.content:
Sarah stepped up to the lock and slipped the pipe into the iron face's mouth. Receiving a thumbs up from her allies she placed her own mouth on the other end of the pipe and gently inhaled through her mouth, bringing the liquid out of the lock, through the pipe, and almost to her mouth before she withdrew to see if she could've simply bugged the lock into pouring the contents out. A little dropped out of the pipe, but hardly enough to warrant that course of action efficient. With a distressed whimper, she realized she was going to have to suck, spit, rinse, repeat.

And she did so. She felt the cool fluid wash over her tongue. It had a unique taste to it. Had the LM added a flavoring? Whatever it was, it tasted of cherries... which were Sarah's favorite fruit. She smiled upon recognizing the taste, and begrudgingly spat the liquid out on the floor. She went back to continue draining the lock, taking more of the cherry flavored formula into her maw. The desire to drink it was... intensifying, to say the least. Was it becoming fizzy? She didn't really care anymore. She kept up the routine, slowly draining the contents of the lock's tank of potion.

"Alright, just a little bit more to go..." Odin said, tapping the glass on a meter measuring the quantity of fluid left.

She shrugged to herself and giggled as she swallowed a sip of the liquid, putting her hand to her pudgy belly as she felt it surge forwards a little bit. Odin and Raa'shad jumped back in shock, and John's eyes widened in dread.

"She wasn't kidding..." Raa'shad muttered under his breath. He added a curse and shook his head.

She only had just a small bit to go, so she decided to drink the half-cup that was remaining. She purred as she felt a warmth wash over her; arms, legs, belly, and breasts expanding slowly, making her robes tighter but not uncomfortable. When she ran out of potion she sighed contentedly and stood back up, before remembering she was being watched. A fierce blush painted her cheek's blue scales purple as she giggle nervously.

Lord John blinked before chuckling and shaking his head. "I take it you're not particularly vengeful regarding what the Lipomancer did to your body hm? You seem to enjoy this sort of thing, unlike some of us here. I'm glad you're with us right now," he remarked, patting Sarah on the back. The door swung open slowly and Raa'shad stepped through, weapon at the ready.

"Ready, milord?" he asked as Odin walked in behind him.

John smiled warmly at Sarah and nodded in Raa'shad's direction. The lion marched on. "Will you be okay?" he inquired.

She paused and thought, "I should be able to reverse the effects once everything's digested. It'll take some mana but I can reset my weight in a pinch, in theory. Until then I say we keep moving as I am now," she replied with a cheerful look on her face.

"Which way?" asked Odin, looking up the flight of stairs. Raa'shad peered down a hole behind the staircase and lit a flare, dropping it down to reveal a soft landing not too far down. It was dark, sure, but a completely survivable drop and probably would serve to avoid whatever traps await at the TOP of the temple. He could see the light pouring out to the left, meaning there was a tunnel system. This could lead to wherever Sarah arrived from, where the Lipomancer is NOW, but it means delving into the heart of his territory and the center of his student training program... all of whom knew how to inflate any living being simply by physical contact and willpower, or enchantment of the mundane object.
However, going up the temple proved equally costly; countless traps and mechanisms designed to, embarrassingly, immobilize our heroes with nonsentient machines. It actually sounded worse to be caught by witless automatons and booby traps than to be bested in a duel by an opponent with great wit, and a pulse.

Also John wasn't too keen on dying in a religious building for a heathen sorceror, especially one of the LM's nature.
But there was a chance that there were slaves to be rescued in the temple somewhere... potential allies to bolster the ranks of the mission at hand...

1553322222222222222222111211112.content:
"I say we head down this hole, see where it leads. It's a bit dark but we'll adapt. Besides I have torches, so that isn't an issue," Raa'shad said, preparing to climb down.

"Are you an idiot? Who knows what's down there!?" Odin boomed.

John intervened, stepping between the two. "Raa'shad, where did you see the flare light go?"

"Sir, to the left, sir!" the hunter-engineer shouted, saluting.

"The Castle Mount is to the left. We can take the tunnel and move up through the mesa to the Lipomancer's castle and fight our way to the inner sanctum. He can't teleport, so he'll be trapped. The only way in is the front door and he's not unstable enough to toss himself out a window should things get tough!" Sarah explained, voting for the tunnel path. John immediately agreed and Odin rolled his eyes indignantly.

"Well then, you two first," the bull said, lightly shoving the two forwards. They yelped briefly, grabbing onto each other as they hit the ground and rolling into the tunnel. John could feel a heavy, soft, warm weight on his chest, likely Sarah. He cleared his throat of any dust he may have taken in and laughed to himself. He couldn't hear a response from Sarah except for her breathing and became worried.

"Sarah?" he whispered, before feeling something make contact with his lips. A hand moved to cradle his cheek briefly before the kiss was broken. John knew exactly who it was, too. He was silenced by the shock, but smiled awkwardly as light filled the tunnel.

Raa'shad and Odin had hopped down into the hole and lit torches, holding them up to illuminate the tunnel. Sarah scrambled to get off of John and lift him off his back before the two had any ideas or asked any questions.

The lion and the bull merely shuffled past the two and continued cautiously down the tunnel. Sarah blushed again and rubbed her arm, looking away and shuffling her right foot in a small circle. John grinned and took her hand, leading her down the tunnel after Raa'shad and Odin.

"How long does this damn tunnel go on for?" Raa'shad spat. As time went on, their torches began to dim ever so threateningly slowly. As the torches' lives waned, the pace quickened.

"We're almost there. There are no traps in the tunnels, but... I think there MIGHT be one at the exit, I'm not so sure."

"Of what sort? Spikes? Poison? Pitfall?" asked John, gripping his sword with his free hand.

"Inflating poison darts," Sarah replied, and both Odin and Raa'shad froze in place.

"...what?" they said in unison, processing that before turning to face each other, and step back, backs to the walls, and they bowed and let Sarah pass through with John.

Sarah rolled her eyes, "such gentlemen..." she sarcastically stated.

They neared the end of the tunnel when they came across a tiled floor, each tile raised up, like pressure panels. "A certain sequence of tiles don't activate any dart launchers... I... damn it I can't remember which!" she panicked, putting a foot forwards to test the first tile before her. As expected, it triggered four dart launchers, two on each side of the tunnel, which shot their payload into the walls across from each other's launcher.

Luckily she had pulled her leg away before she could be hit by any darts, but it didn't comfort her any

"Can't you step on it again?" John asked, drawing his sword in an act of defensive reflex.

"No. The launchers are LOADED. Their ammo supply is overstock ahead of time because refilling them every day is tedious. Trust me, I once had to fill the launcher's magazines," Sarah replied, whimpering. She took a seat in front of the tiled floor and huffed, trying viciously to remember the right pattern.

John sat next to her, "We can afford to wait, right?"

Odin shook his head, "I don't like the look of this, and I feel like I am being watched."

"It's fine, we'll keep moving. I just have to remember the damn pattern..." the dragoness sighed, rubbing her forehead, stressed.

"How potent is one dart?" asked the Paladin.

"If I were skinny, and hit with one... probably enough to look nine months pregnant."

"Then scratch the 'fuck it and run like a maniac' plan..."

"I think I have some recollection of the right path..." Sarah murmured, standing and walking onto the tiles. One... two... three... she was on a roll! Fourth tile... just eleven to go for a total of 15 pressure plates in the sequence on a 15x7 grid. Five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten...

*click*

Sarah's eyes widened in horror as she felt a sharp, stabbing pain in her sides as four darts entered her. She was quick to pluck them out, but whimpered as her belly began to swell with air. She was now forced into a waddle as her robes grew tighter. She was having trouble seeing the floor under her at this point, and her torso was growing on all sides. If she failed, she'd become a sphere!

"Pray you have a spare set of clothing, milady," Odin snickered, only to be punched in the arm by a pissed off John.

"If she can reverse this and be careful next time around, I have a robe I can spare in my bag..." he growled.

Sarah was feeling... lighter. She managed to make it across two more tiles, at 13 tiles before tripping the 14th and 15th ones, stumbling. She was struck with just about every one of them. She yelped as she made it through the open door into a wide open, circular chamber. The team ran across the tiles, careful to memorize and repeat the proper pattern so they wouldn't be victimized by this trap.

They entered the chamber to see Sarah's torso pushing against her robes, small tears forming on her equator. Her hands frantically glided around her belly and breasts as she tried to clear her mind and focus on her magic, but she couldn't keep her mind from racing.

John's watching me, what is he thinking? Damn it, this is humilating! she thought. She sighed and submit to her fate, arms resting at her sides and gently being pushed up by her torso. Her limbs were being engulfed by her own belly. She failed to stifle a moan as her body broke out of her robes, leaving her nude before her party. She blushed, giggled in sheer nervousness, and patted her belly as the growth slowed to a halt. The inflation, in its final hurrah, dragged her arms and legs back as they were engulfed; she groped her gut one last time as her hands were stuck out to the sides.
Hell even her tail was swallowed up. She still had her footing, thankfully, but she dared not move.

All three of her new friends stared, two of them in a mixture of disgust, pity, and confusion, and John himself had a different expression about his face. Confused? Yes. Disturbed and/or bothered? Not at all, actually. In fact, looking at her there, smiling so adorably, even though she was likely hiding her embarrassment, actually appealed to John in a way. Oh he was definitely still questioning the LM's M.O. and mental state, but he was hardly put off by Sarah's appearance as of now.

...dare he say she was actually kind of cute this way, moreso than she was already, and he wanted to marry her last time they met.

"I'm so sorry..." Sarah said, trying to hide her eyes with her hair.

"Odin, Raa'shad, have a look around, check the shelves and adjacent rooms. I need a moment with Sarah," John ordered, approaching Sarah and placing his hands on her, slowly rolling her into a smaller room; a bedroom with two beds and a small cooking fire, likely for students posted to guard this chamber. Nobody was here though...

Finally alone, John took a seat on a bed and looked Sarah in the eyes, "There is no need to apologize. You've been taking more for the team than any of us could ask of you."

Sarah whimpered again, "I meant, I am sorry that you guys even have to be involved in all of this shit, that you have to witness THIS happen to me, that you're even challenging this bastard at all..." she rambled, and John stood and wrapped his arms around Sarah's neck, leaning in to close the distance.

"I said, there is no need to apologize. You, are the bravest, smartest, most gorgeous lass I have had the honor of meeting and I love you for these traits and more," John replied, sternly. "Seeing you like this? Doesn't bother me at all, if you mean that I am bothered by you. What bothers me is your ex-Master doing any of this to not only you, but a vast group of people! Sarah, we've known each other a short time and already I feel things around you that I've never felt. You know that after I left your town, I'd been saving myself for you?"

Sarah blinked, blushing heavily, "You... what?"

"Potential spouses left and right, thrown at me and glorified by my serfs and knights. Sarah, I turned down the King's daughter at one point, because I didn't want anyone else but YOU."

"The Princess?! You turned down the throne!" Sarah cried, shocked and awed to no end by this decision that would be viewed as horrendously foolish or insane by anybody else.

"Indeed. You're my one and only, Sarah. My one, and only. Now that I know you are alive, that you are here with me, we're going to get through this together, we're going to dismantle this demon's kingdom, and we're going to have our happily ever after," John said, tears beginning to stream from his eyes. "I don't care, that these strange events have happened. I don't care, that you picked up some unorthodox magic. I don't care, that you look like this right now if anything I actually like it!"

Sarah shook her head, moving her brown hair out of her face, and she smiled wide at John. "You are the sweetest, most faithful man I've ever met," she sighed, giggling as John planted a deep kiss on her lips, cupping her cheeks in his hands. The two of them moaned softly as they shared this long-lasting moment together.

Meanwhile...
1553322222222222222222111211112.title: Operation: Takedown

choices: Forget the Vows (NSFW Romance)
Remain chaste. You may still kiss and caress (Less NSFW Romance)
15533222222222222222221112111121.content:
Odin and Raa'shad were diligently searching the chamber for usable items when Odin took notice of a misplaced floorboard. Cracking it open and discarding the remains, he found three satchels. In each bag, there was a neatly folded Plus Sized robe, containers of food, and flasks of liquid. Signalling for Raa'shad, they eagerly looted the satchels and returned to John and Sarah, who were locked into a kiss.

...Awkward enough for ya?

John broke the kiss finally when Odin cleared his throat, blushing fiercely and stepping away from Sarah to speak with the muscular bull.

"Hopefully that which we have interrupted may resume shortly, though we found some supplies. Potions, food, and robes," Raa'shad whispered, handing John a robe to give to Sarah. He also put a flask in his hand for Sarah to identify.

The Paladin walked to Sarah and held up the flask, and her eyes lit up. "Whoever worked here packed a countermeasure for the dart's venom!" she cheered, and John popped the cork, and brought the flask to her lips.

After a few minutes of deflating, Odin and Raa'shad had left John alone with Sarah, who deflated down to a size reminiscent of her shape before the Lipomancer ever got involved in her life. She threw on a robe and cheered, throwing her arms around John and pinning him to the bed. "Oh I feel so light!" she cried as John returned the hug. "It... it felt so normal, being that fat. I can't really remember my life before being the LM's slave..."

"It'll all be over soon enough. You can control your weight, yes?" John asked, wary of the traps that may lie ahead.

"Oh, of course. It doesn't cost a lot of mana to lose or gain weight, probably one unit for every minute I spend growing or shrinking... why do you ask?"

John blinked. "Well... there *are* traps ahead which may prove a pain to handle..."

Sarah gave him a smug glance. "Oh? Or do you just prefer me all big and soft?" she crooned, nuzzling his cheek. "Because I can waste some mana for you, darling."

She was giving him a choice? Well... this required some thought... after all, he fell in love with the thin Sarah, but... then he fell for her again when he remembered who she was outside the temple.

"Sh-should we keep moving?" John asked, and Sarah looked up at a clock set on the wall above the door frame.

"5:45 PM... normally somebody starts patrolling the dungeons just outside of these chambers. They never come in here, though, so we should be safe if we stay here," she explained.

So it's said, if you fall in love with two people, choose the second; if you loved the first, you wouldn't have fallen for the second, so John had once heard.
But still, she seemed so happy right now... on the other hand she said she'd be perfectly fine if she were to waste a little mana for him.

John looked over to see that the door was closed. He smiled... "You sure you'd be happy to gain again?"

"Anything for you..." Sarah said, slipping her robe off, glowing very faintly as her belly began to bulge against John's silvery armor, which Sara helped to remove.

John sat up and leaned against the back wall, with Sarah sitting in his lap as she grew. She wrapped her arms around him as her belly squished against his, her bosom expanding as well. He rubbed her back, kissing her neck as her legs and arms began to grow. Eventually, he was sliding back down onto his back, with Sarah pinning him to the bed, her warmth radiating off of her weighty body and onto John's skin. He wanted her. Now.

But they were not married. To take her as his now would shatter his vows as a Paladin of the human One-God. He would likely lose his power and be defenseless outside of his sword and shield.

Everyone, this is masterstalin. You may know some of my other chapters further back in the story, but I feel like contributing my own ideas, instead of working off others. Do not fear adding your own characters, for this is not a message saying not to add, this story is for everyone; you just happen to be working off from one of my major contributions to the story. so feel free to add and message me with any questions that you may have. So enjoy the following.

Calta-Nosteronk

What makes this place special? Well, it's special because of one reason: It is the City of Everything! It's even in the name; Calta means City, with Nosteronk means Everything.

But it is not the city itself that is special, no, it is the people within the city that make it special. Here, everyone of every race, every creed, every occupation, may have resided here, or visited here, or continues to live here. This city has a very interesting history and way of life.

Calta-Nosteronk is not divided into districts, like many other city-states, but since the size of the city is so massive, it is split into 2 cities: the Upper City, where the most prestigious of the prestige resides, and the Lower City, where most of everyday life takes place. The Upper and Lower Cities are then divided into City Districts.

Within the Upper City, the city districts are as follow:
The Holy District, where the highly respected religions are worshiped with giant Churches, cathedrals, and temples
The Luxury District, where the wealth resides in mansion sized houses
The Representative District, where the members of the city's government conducts its business
And the Academic District, where the schools for education in both the Intellectual and Arcane Studies are housed

Within the Lower City, the civilians live and shop in it's many markets and stores. The Lower City makes up a majority of Calta-Nosteronk, and has more city districts than the Upper City. Out of the many city districts that make up the Lower City, these are the major districts:

The Bazaar, one of the most largest market in Calta-Nosteronk, many work in this open area flea market, selling exotic merchandise.
The Gates, one of the residential areas of Calta-Nosteronk that houses the large main-gate that leads into the wild wilderness of the mainland.
The Docks, another residential/business district where ships dock to unload their cargo for the city.
The Quarters District, the most largest district within Calta-Nosteronk, where neighborhoods of different races live.
The Guild District, where many guilds and organizations conduct their businesses.
And the most infamous of all, The Lawless District, a city all it own. This is where the most vile creatures of society resides and works. Here, one can escape from law and find members of the lowest of the low, featuring: cutthroats, scoundrels, pirates, gangs, thugs, mercenaries, brothels, etc. The Lawless District borders the Docks and takes up 1/4 of the piers on the waterfront.

So that is the basic rundown of this massive city-state.

And everyone here has a story that either starts or end here.

1553322222222222222222221.content:
The Bazaar District is known for its enormous stocks of wares from vendors across the realms, merchants setting up stalls and attempting to outsell each other with the finest goods and ingredients one could possibly want and or find inside the city. It is a bustling commune, with noon and early afternoon being busy to the point of nearly packing the main streets full of marketgoers trying to be thrifty and haggling endlessly for their vaunted goods. It is often a place to see beggars and grifters as well, so one must be careful of the smaller stands the not-so-visible stalls that might be hidden in the corners.

The Guild District is home for all those who want work and to find an apprenticeship. It has inns, offices, and even stores fit with goods that are paid for by the guilds, and only members or those with large amounts of coin can actually pay for the cost of equipment and goods associated with the organizations. On the surface, there seems to be a hierarchy of which guilds have the biggest influence on what goes on in the city, as well as the largest section of the guild district with the best facilities. However, there are always shadowy goings-on happening behind closed doors, and sometimes the most influential force may not necessarily be what is the biggest and best...

The Docks is, of course, the port for all goods that come into Calta-Nosteronk from the sea. A great deal of trade is connected from over the grand blue to the massive megacity, with much of its cargo distributed across all city fronts. It's a bit damp, but most of the time it is a very well-kept area, save for the docks and warehouses close to the Lawless district. Those are oftentimes full of the seedy folk that dominate the lowest and darkest of all the district, and as such most of the area is unkempt, rife with corners where ne'er-do-wells can easily stalk their victims from permanent shadows. This is not to mention some of the thievery that goes on with the porting ships themselves, with cargo occasionally going missing depending on the hit.
1553322222222222222222221.title: Docks District/Bazaar District/Guild District

The Bazaar is home not only to merchants, but oftentimes to adventurers, archaeologists, traders, and the occasional graverobber or savvy, legal 'thief' who sell some of the most unusual artifacts to grace the market fronts. Gems of unusual power, ancient texts only the most experienced of mages could read, weapons of great mystique and other trinkets and unusual curios which would attract the attention of most collectors could be found here. These wares often go for excessive amounts, but for the price of finding them, it's usually worth it. One other interesting attraction is the number of gypsies and minor carnival members often patrolling parts of the district, trying to hawk fortunes or scryings, or performing great illusions for the common masses.

The Guild district is often treated as a home of prestige, worth, and the working individual who dedicates his life to a craft, but some portions of the guilds are often very cutthroat, especially when it comes to brand new contracts and requests tacked up on the board. The place is overflowing with full organizations, conglomerates, small factioned guilds, and even a monopoly or two despite the city council's best efforts to curb it. The competition, despite the outward appearance, is nearly as bad as the lawless back alleys and lowest sections of the entirety of the city, and duels are not uncommon for perceived sleights. That being said, it is altogether nicer to shop for help here, though the contracting fees can be gouging on occasion.

155332222222222222222222111.content:
A small crowd was gathered near an open stand in the bazaar today, murmuring and milling about while the rest of the masses surged onward, attempting to seek out the objects of their wants from the many merchants which populated the marketplace. This crowd, however, was gathered as a result of a flyer that had been distributed by a local newsboy and placed on the ad board for all to see. It was an advertisement for a new act in town which had just arrived on the last caravan from the next city over, a traveling jester so to speak who was looking to make more of a name for herself.

Except, she wasn't quite any normal jester.

The kids, moved to the front by the performer in question so they could see without the interference of adults crowding the little space she had prepared for herself, oohed and aahed with fits of applause in between as she currently twirled about on a single large rubber ball, her dexterity on display with every pirouette and sweep of her lithe body. Rolling it underneath her with nary a missed step, her balance was yet to be interrupted as she leaned down while on top of the ball, pulling a tulip seemingly from nowhere before presenting it to a child at the front of the crowd.

Standing straight up before rolling the ball back to the center of the stage, she hopped off of it before picking it up, balancing it on top of another ball of similar size with not much more than a nudge, accompanied by a deep bow.

"Thank you all, and I sincerely hope you enjoyed the performance! I'll be here all day, so please, if you were tickled by my act, don't be shy and stop on by once more~!" She cheered before placing a small top hat on the ground in front of her, looking mostly for donations for a room at the nearest inn rather than grubbing for money. With her sincerity and genuine tricks rather than sleight of hand to steal the hard-earned and treasured belongings of the parents and other marketgoers that had decided to stop by her little performance space, much of the crowd was happy enough to give her a few pieces of gold, some even giving their kids a small handful to dump with glee into the hat. Clapping her gloved hands happily and thanking each one who donated, she watched as the crowd dispersed for the time being, her next showing not for another thirty minutes.

Normally, a clown, jester, or harlequin would take this time to adjust her makeup or costume, but she needed no such thing. Her skin was alabaster, and not a speck of it were paint or powder. Rosy cheeks and her reddened nose were probably the only thing truly painted, but unlike temporary paint, the coats were made to last and shone with a lacquered charm as if they had been applied and sealed with the utmost care. Her auburn hair was perfect, almost too perfect, and kept into two large pigtails with black ribbons which were tied neatly into little bows. One of the things she had the hardest time dealing with was the fear over her eyes, which were a brilliant, deep and penetrating emerald, and to others shone with an intelligence that belied her young appearance.

She straightened up the ruffled white dress shirt and her yellow bowtie, smoothing out the fabric of her blouse and making sure she was dressed proper. Adjusting the cream-colored stockings she wore, as well as the frilled cuffs, the clown girl flinched as she heard a soft ticking coming from her left elbow, the joint sticking firmly for a second and causing her to huff just a little. "Aw, why now? I think I needed to take that mage up on his offer to scrub my insides with a good cleaning spell. That port act toasted me with the salt water..."

Reaching over with her good hand, she picked up a small vessel which was filled with oil, putting the long, thin spout over a visible gap in her arm right where the elbow connected her upper and lower arms before pressing the lever and letting the paddle open, a small dribble of oil dripping into the socket area and causing her to sigh in relief. Placing the vessel down, she grabbed her stiff arm with her right hand before pulling it to the extended position ever so gently, the joint and socket returning to normal function with a soft series of clicks. "Much better...the oil quality is great here! At least no one asks what I use it for."

This jester's name was Bebe, and she was a true rarity among artifacts: she was a living automaton doll, given the breath of life by arcane magic powerful enough to last several lifetimes.

So far as she could remember, she was the lifework of a dollmaker who spent his entire existence crafting dolls and mechanical automatons of wondrous quality, and was famed in his age for the intricacy and life he seemed to give his creations. But at one point, with no children and no family left, he grew lonely, and so tried to construct his final work which was a life-sized doll in the shape of a young woman, someone to at least remember his time on the mortal plane. The final piece of this, however, was to try and give life to the doll, and as such required spells that were far out of his reach. Nonetheless, he managed to pay for a great archmage to bless his doll, and so for weeks he waited to see the signs of life he so desperately wanted. Due to his advanced age, however, and the length of time the spell actually required to integrate life force and animate such an object, he passed away in his sleep with his head on her lap, mere hours before she finally awoke.

The loss of who she considered her father saddened her greatly, and so she collected as much information as she could to remember him by. Deciding to try and do something with her newly minted existence to bring joy, just as he had wanted out of simply having contact with someone who loved him unconditionally, she became a student of illusionists, acrobats and thespians, submitting herself to a roaming troupe and being taught all of the basics before being allowed to perform with the rest of the acts. Within a few years, she had felt she had outgrown the troupe, and wanted instead to travel the world and spread her new ability to give smiles to people's faces without the connotation of being a 'lying charlatan' as they were sometimes called.

Picking up the top hat full of gold coins, she smiled widely before dumping her funds into a small chest she had recently acquired, slipping a peculiar round lock over the front and twisting the different segments of its face several times to seal it shut. "I'm glad it went well today, though-this is enough to buy me a decent room and a ride to the next town!"

Bebe packed and prepped her stage area for another show, hoping that the sinking sun would provide people with better incentive to check out the bazaar and its many sights.
155332222222222222222222111.title: A jester of sorts

choices: Silverhorne! With such a hub of activity, she'd be sure to get publicity!
Silverhorne seems a bit worrisome, what about Orrenshire or Bilford?
1553322222222222222222221111.content:
Her swift fingers twisted and twirled the torches with practiced ease, the benefit of an automaton body being the unnatural dexterity which comes with mechanical precision. The crowd gasped as she juggled four torches at once with one hand while lighting more of the rag-topped sticks with her right, tossing them into her juggling routine before returning with a full seven flaming torches to woo the audience with. Their trails burned brightly, the ash fluttering around her in a whirlwind of her art, kicked up by the speed of her hands and the enthusiasm which beheld her body.

Bebe didn't pack up her performance space disappointed that night. The last show she pulled before the bazaar closed in its entirety had netted her enough money to get a few things from the marketplace, as well as a room at the inn and enough fee for two or three more trips! Rubbing her hands in delight, she rolled the trunk on its wheels behind her, moving to a well-to-do inn in the Gates district.

Despite the influx of travelers that day looking to see the city in its fullest capacity, the inn she had chosen called the Rosewick had plenty of rooms to offer for her, and especially with the gold she had, was more than eager to offer her the room. Taking the price as she could get it, she stored all of her luggage before heading down for a bit of light reading and exploring before turning in the for the night. She didn't need to sleep, but closing one's eyes and letting the mind wander felt like a relief from the hustle and busybody of the world. On occasion, she wondered if people felt the same way, or if sleep would be an annoyance or a hindrance to someone with enough drive.

"Hmmm..." Bebe pondered the question in her head as she laid out a map of the region she had purchased a week or so ago when she first arrived. The city took up a good portion of the center, but that was to be expected; it was a colossal monstrosity after all. She was moving north now, having come all this way from the east coast where her last act had taken place. There were a couple choices of where to go now, but she knew very little of the area around the giant city. Her curious expression must've caught one of the innkeepers, a heavyset but kind mountain lion, who thudded his way over to her. Hearing his footsteps, she perked up, looking into the smiling face of an old and grizzled cougar. "Oh! Sorry, should I not be down here now?"

He laughed deeply, scratching his rounder middle gently before moving up to his thick neck, looking at her with amber eyes, "No no no, you are perfectly entitled to read as late into the night as you want. I was just about to turn in m'self. You seem a bit lost, though; need a little help choosing your next stop?"

"Ah, yes! You can tell I'm a traveling performer, so I thought it was time I moved on from here and to different places. I don't know the area so well here..." She petered off, furrowing her brow and tapping her fingers against the wooden table. In the meantime, he drew out a pair of large spectacles, popping them on the bridge of his nose and coughing a little before examining the map and inspecting it with a large paw.

"Then let me help you! North a ways is a placed called Orrenshire, a very lovely town that's known for its mead as well as its summer festivals. Lots of great folk out that way come through here every now and again, and it's always a pleasure. A little ways westerly is Bilford, a bit of a dank place as it sits near a swamp if you ask me, but it's fairly large and would have more for you to do. To the nor'east is a place called Silverhorne. Now...I'm not sure about it, as there have been many rumors, but so far as the temperament of the people there, they're...well, rather like me. Big and jolly, most of 'em. So far as I know, they don't seem keen on too many outsiders to be honest, but you're kind enough. I'm sure you'd be able to fit in just fine. It is a big adventuring hotspot though; somethin' about the catacombs and a lotta temples 'round the place attracts them like flies to honey. The other good thing about it is it's a major transport hub. Lots o' caravans in and out. Just be wary of those going past that estate outside the city limits. Heard some seedy things about it..."

Bebe grinned widely and put her hands together, now armed with a full knowledge of what to expect. She looked up at the mountain lion and beamed her widest smile at him, giggling just a tad, "Thank you very much! I, er, would you like a bit more of a tip or something-"

"Aw, you don't have to do that. Just promise me you'll stop by again soon. Lot of my patrons today said they loved yer show. I'd love to take a gander someday when I can get the barkeeps and the maids to help me watch the place," he chuckled back before wandering towards the counter and his quarters again, waving goodnight to his jester guest. "Good night when you get to it. And maybe I'll see you in the morn 'fore you go."

The smile never left her face as he disappeared and her emerald eyes turned to the map, the gears in her head churning as she plotted her next course.

Where should she go next?

15533222222222222222222211111.content:
The clown-painted doll smiled softly to herself and folded up the map, pushing her seat in as she got up and dimming the lamp. She was the only one up that late into the morning, but as the innkeep said, no one really minded. Bebe was looking quite forward to this new locale, even if the friendly advice was against her going. If she ran into trouble, her mechanical body was more than enough of a match for most rogues and highwaymen, but she was betting her speed would get her out of trouble more than brute force. Climbing up the stairs and entering her room, the automaton pulled back the covers and rolled onto the fluffy, cotton mattress, breathing softly as she felt the cradling embrace of the bed. I never did give myself an answer to that question, did I, she queried in her head, but I suppose it doesn't matter.

Bebe closed her eyes, her clockwork brain ticking softly in the night like a lullaby.

= = = = = = = = =

The next morning, Bebe was packed and ready right at eight, and with the fare paid, all she had to do was wait for the rest of the passengers to be on their way towards Silverhorne and beyond. Some gave her odd looks, but others either ignored her or waved at the jester-dressed performer, the automaton doll greeting them all jovially in return before the carriage started moving down the main road out of Calta-Nosteronk. The ride was to be a few hours long, so Bebe decided to pass it by practicing small tricks, such as illusory rings and card tricks, enough so that they wouldn't disturb the rest of the nice folk on the ride over.

About midway through the trip, there was a nice jostle as the carriage hit a large rock in the road, causing some of the patrons to curse or yelp at the driver for not paying attention. A man who had sat next to her, swaddled in a dark robe which covered his face knocked into her, the auburn-haired doll moving her arms out to catch him gently while his wrapped around her shoulder. Sitting him back up after the vehicle had settled, she smiled a little, "Are you okay, sir?"

"Hmbrbrm! Ugh! Hoo...why yes, thank you, young lady. Sorry for that, I suppose the bump must've jostled my insides!" the older gentleman chortled before straightening up, leaning back against the wall of the caravan for his nap. She watched him for a moment before he began to snore ever so lightly, the automaton pulling out her little bag of pocket illusions to practice them again. Her shoulder felt a little funny though; it wasn't her skeleton or her internal parts, but it felt like something had been imprinted on her skin. Every time she moved her hand back to check, there was nothing there.

For a clown girl automaton, she had a lot of human qualities, her slender palm moving to her middle as she felt something off there as well. "I wonder if it's the sea salt again..."

= = = = = = = = =

Little Silverhorne should not have been called Little at all. There was nothing little in any sense of the word. The residents, anthromorphic and human, were all outrageously large, ranging from hefty chubs to hulking balls of flesh that tried to mill about the town square on daily business. That wasn't the least of it: everyone was eating something. Mothers with children snacking on sweets as they moved from stall to stall, patrolmen grabbing morning pastries to stuff into their maws, shopkeeps sampling their own goods to show off how tasty they were, or eating in between customers to fill out the rest of the day. Everywhere there wasn't a restaurant or an inn, people were still stuffing their faces.

The weirdest part was she could almost see them growing before her eyes. Certainly, her better hearing caught the sound of millions of threads of fabric screeching in distress, moaning and howling as bellies lurched towards the floor and thighs grew too large for dresses, arms blowing out of sleeves and armor buckles whimpering before they snapped at the masses of flesh they tried to contain. A couple others got off with the automaton at the hire stand, a burly barbarian of a coyote while his bobcat friend, an archer, followed after him towards the nearest inn for information but that was about it so far as other travelers. Still, she could see the streets were filled with folk, the enlarged storefronts, roads, entryways and even seats and tables home to all kinds including adventurers and explorers. The innkeeper hadn't been kidding.

A thickness lay across the air however, and being a magic-infused entity, she could sense it far better than anyone else save an experienced mage. The air was suffuse with a light miasma, she could feel, which seemed to be in everything. Thoughts popped into her head about how it could be related to why everyone was eating and how they were all pretty happy and bustling, but she dismissed it. Moving both hands down to her middle, she pressed into the artificial skin before grabbing her luggage. "Stop that! I don't know what's wrong with you, though...the atmosphere is kind of weird..."

Bebe began the short walk to the nearest inn, hoping to get some information and to see whether she'd need a permit or not to actually perform. Her free hand reached back to scratch the spot on her shoulder, but again, there was nothing there. She hoped to undress that night and see if something had snagged in her costume that was causing her such irritation...
15533222222222222222222211111.title: To Silverhorne!

The Gates District houses many of the guards and patrolmen who man the walls and gates of the city. This is their home along with the usual attendants and citizens who operate the functionality of the gates for commerce. Here you live your life forever in the shadows of the towering gates, always wondering just what lies beyond. Perhaps some day you will see the outside world for yourself.

The Quarters District houses most of the city's civilians, and the boundaries near the Lawless District can be a rough place to live. For most it is a quaint and peaceful life but not without its own struggles. Poverty is not an epidemic, but those near the Lawless District tend to be worse off than most. Your life here is mundane. Nothing exciting ever happens as you simply work to get by every day. Your family is all you have to tie you down, and you secretly wish your life was more exciting. As they say... be careful what you wish for.

The Lawless District may sound like a chaotic place to live, but even this hive of scum and villainy has its own rules. Men (and even women) of power rule their small crime syndicates with iron fists. There are times when some internal power struggles spill out into public knowledge, but many of these crime lords and ladies keep their business under wraps. 1553322222222222222222222121.content:
Calta-Nosteronk, The City of Many Faces as some liked to call it, for this important civilization had many uses: it was a seaport, a supplier in times of war, a common trading place for merchants, and it's rulers governed not only the metropolis but a huge part of the lands that lied beyond it.

It had major market places, blacksmiths, inns, brothels, bathhouses, churches devoted to almost every religion. It had its gorgeous sides, such as the splendid view if the ocean in the Upper City, and its poverty-stricken sides, such as the infamous Lawless District.

It was quite the sight for sore travelers, especially if those travelers spent months in rural areas, fighting off monsters, living off nothing but dried fruits and meat, and sleeping on cold, hard ground.

Such was the case for Kina, a barbarian wolfess, who was dressed in the typical garb for her kind: boiled leather with bits of armor, and a wicked looking axe on her back.

In her late twenties, this wolf was well-built, a strong, independent anthro that feared no one. Her fur running down her belly and part of her thighs were as white as snow, and the rest of her fur was as dark as a heavy storm cloud.

The weary sword-for-hire surveyed the busy street, watching as smallfolk went about their last few hours of daily business, not even sparing a glance at her.

"Finally!" she thought to herself, breathing in, "Someplace I could rest for a while."

It was late in noon, and the sun was hanging low in the West, turning the sky a bright orange.

She patted the bag of gold that was attached to her belt, both to reassure herself that it was still there, and to enjoy the feeling of the hard gold inside.

Her last mission had brought a great amount of income for her (at least one hundred gold coins!), and she could not wait to spend it on a nice Inn where she could order a decent room with a feather-stuffed bed and a good meal to fill her empty, growling belly.

Kina didn't fear that her money would be stolen as she strolled down the street, for she was very close to the gates where the City Guards often patrolled, meaning that crime was little to non-existent here.

It was also here that most of the inns were, greeting travelers as they entered Calta-Nosteronk, their colorful signs naming the establishment, swaying gently in the gusty wind.

The Kneeling Servant was a large, popular, three-story Inn, which was packed this time of day with costumers eating food, drinking beer, or doing both.

"I'll also have one room," Kina said to the waiter, a human, while he was still hovering beside her.

The wolf was currently busy munching on her third dish of mutton, served with a few potatoes.

"That I'll be five ten gold coins," he said.

The price was preposterous, but Kina did not argue. She had to admit that the place was quite fancy, and when she arrived at her room she saw that it could almost befit a noble: it had a large double bed with clean sheets, a balcony, a spacious room that had enough space for furniture, and a bathroom that had actual running water.

Calta-Nosteronk was one of the few cities that could clout having proper plumbing, and some buildings, if the owners were wealthy enough, could have it installed.

Kina was delighted that she could have a bath to wash away the dirt off her muscular figure, but she never showed it openly, only saying to the human that escorted her: "Thanks."

The wolf closed the door behind her when he left, took the bag of coins off her belt, and began to search through the money for one specific object.

Gold was not the only thing she was rewarded for her service to a shady wizard. The sorcerer also gave her a peculiar, but beautiful, silver necklace.

When she finally dug it out, Kina studied the piece with interest: it had a large, purple crystal attached to the silver chain, which glittered and flashed in the sunlight.

Smiling faintly, the wolf placed it around her neck. It had a slight weight to it, like all valuable metals had, but, for some unknown reason, Kina could feel a bizarre, dark aura floating around it, like it had some serious black magic on it.

Shrugging the feeling away, Kina went to the bathroom, opened the water, allowing it to flow into a marble bathtub, and undressed herself.

While waiting for the hot water to fill the tub, Kina studied her nude body in the mirror: like it was said earlier the wolf was muscular, typical for her kind, with bulging arm muscles, legs, and abdominal, but she was still rather curvy, with large breasts dotted with inverted, coin sized, pink nipples, and thick thighs and large rump.

Kina was often told that she had childbearing-hips, a characteristic that was seen as something special in the clan she grew up in, for it meant that she could give birth to more pups with fewer problems.

Her mother had that same hips too, and she went off to marry one of the chief's sons, resulting in her birth a few months later. The same would have happened to Kina if she did not decide to go off and become a sword-for-hire.

The wolf climbed into the steaming bathtub, giving a audible sigh of pleasure. After washing off the dirt, causing the water to get a brown tint, she soaked a little longer until the water began to cool down.

She did not favor wearing her travel-worn clothing again, so, she took one of the robes that was conveniently placed over a chair next to the tub.

But when she left the bathroom she noticed something: her crystal necklace was still around her neck. Kina raised it in her paw, eying it suspiciously. She could have sworn that she took it off before she climbed into the bathtub.

Perhaps she did, perhaps she did not.

It didn't matter, though, for Kina was rather tired and wanted nothing more but to jump on that comfortable, large bed and fall asleep.

Even though the sun was only beginning to set over the mountains in the distance, Kina was sprawled on the bed, her legs wide open, exposing her neither regions, sleeping soundly.

But as she snored on, the crystal around her neck began to glow faintly...

155332222222222222222222212231.content:
Standing in the doorway of his little house on the countryside, Luke watched the storm approach from the west with satisfaction, the towering cumulonimbus dark and pregnant with rain, flashes of light visible in the clouds.

Taking a deep breath of the clean air, he could smell the scent of rain, a scent that every farmer loved to smell, especially if there was a drought and the crops were dying.

The region surrounding Calta-Nosteronk had not seen a drop of water in weeks, and not only farmers but the rulers of these lands feared that they would have a food shortage this year, but the gods heard their prayers and decided to give them some much needed rain.

Luke had an itch and he scratched his cheek that was covered in the hairs of his black beard. He turned around and went back into his home, calling to his wife: "Martha, I'm going out for a walk!"

His wife, Martha, a small but sturdy women, wearing a dull yellow dress and a apron, looked at him strangely when he came into the kitchen and said this.

"My dear," she said, "There is a storm coming. Why do you want to go out?"

"It would be a quick walk. I promise that I'll be back home long before it breaks," he replied.

"Can I come, too, father?" asked Timothy, the youngest of Luke's children, a ten-year old boy, who was sitting at the table.

Luke shook his head. "I'm sorry, Tim, but you can't come. I want to be alone for a while."

The child whined, but he didn't protest any further against his father. And so Luke strolled down the path that ran up the little hill to where his house was built on. It connected later to the main road, a wide dirt road that was often used by travelers and merchants alike, which ran south until it reached Calta-Nosteronk.

To be honest, Luke himself did not know why he decided to take this walk. Even though he was a farmer, a man who knew what hard work was like, Luke was more of the well-off peasants, and he had the the firm, bouncing, beach-ball size gut to prove it, which also meant that he disliked exercise.

Besides, there was a storm coming. At this very moment gusts of wind was rushing over the land, causing tree branches to sway and dust to kick up. The dull roar of thunder sounded in the distance, announcing that the storm was coming, and it was coming fast.

But Luke was compelled to take this walk, almost like he was ordered to do this.

"I'm just going to take the hunter's trail through the forest and head back home," he thought to himself.

But as he entered the forest, the deep green pine trees sighing and bending in the gusty wind, the first few fat drops of water began to fall from the sky.

It then began to rain hard.
155332222222222222222222212231.title: The beginning of Luke's odd day.

1553322222222222222222222122311.content:
The rain was heavy and wind-driven, soaking Luke to the bone as he dashed across the muddy path, pulling his faded blue shirt close to his body in a vain attempt to keep warm.

Due to the amount rain falling from the sky, it was almost impossible to see a few feet ahead, and Luke took a few wrong turns down the Hunter's trail, ending up completely lost.

But as he tried to backtrack he soon came upon what looked like a cottage in the middle of the woods. Relieved that he had finally found some shelter, Luke ran up the porch and knocked on the door.

It opened rather unexpectedly, and he peered inside gingerly. It was dark and Luke could scarcely make out the outlines of the furniture inside.

"Hello, is anyone home?" he called, stepping inside.

Silence.

"I'm sorry to intrude on your property, but I was caught in the storm and I desperately needed shelter!"

Still silence.

"No one must be home," he concluded.

It was wrong, he knew, to enter into someone's home without their permission, but he would be damed if he had to stay outside in the pouring rain.

As Luke sat down on the nearest chair, his first thoughts were of his family. His wife was probably worried sick about him, but, as much as it pained him, he had to wait for the storm to pass.

The water drummed on the roof and a chilly wind blew through the open door. Shivering, he closed the door and decided to light a fire in the hearth for some heat and light.

He found some wood, conveniently placed next to the fireplace, and soon had the fire going. Now that the room was lit in a orange glow, he could study the interior of this cabin more closely now.

It was one of those typical one room cabins where no walls separated anything; the bedroom was connected to the living room, and the living room was connected to the kitchen.

Ten spite its cheap style of building, Luke saw that it was decorated with lavish furniture: rich oil paintings hung on the walls, a expensive, shaggy carpet was on the floor of the living room, surrounded by beautiful chairs, and a bookshelf stood next to a queen-sized bed.

It was a place that would have befitted that of a wealthy merchant. Luke wondered why anyone would leave his or her house like this unlocked.

While sitting on one of the chairs, pondering this, the door of the cabin suddenly opened, and someone stepped inside.

But who was it?
